Quick Walkthrough: Return to Caius in Balmora for your orders. Meet with the informants in Vivec. Huleeya Informant Meet with Huleeya at the Black Shalk Cornerclub in the Foreign Quarter. Calm the locals and escort Huleeya to Jobasha's Bookshop to receive his notes. Addhiranirr Informant Meet with Addhiranirr in the Underworks of the St. Olms Canton. Find and tell the excise agent Duvianus Platorius that Addhiranirr has left for the mainland. Receive the information from Addhiranirr. Meet Mehra Milo Meet with Mehra Milo at the Library of Vivec in the Temple Canton. Steal or buy the book Progress of Truth. Return to Caius in Balmora.
Detailed Walkthrough: Huleeya Addhiranirr Mehra Milo Orders from Caius[edit] After the last errand, Caius tells you to train for a while and come back to him later. Specifically, your character needs to be at least level 3 before Caius will give you the next assignment. At that point, he sends you on a fact-finding mission to the city of Vivec. Your mission is to track down and rendezvous with three people: Addhiranirr, a Khajiit Thieves Guild member in St. Olms, Huleeya, an Argonian Morag Tong assassin at the Black Shalk Cornerclub in the Foreign Quarter, and Mehra Milo, a Tribunal Temple priestess in the Hall of Wisdom of the Temple Canton. Caius is once again looking for any Sixth House or Nerevarine Cult information and he gives you 200 gold for expenses. The quickest way is to take the Silt Strider or the Mages Guild Guide, but feel free to take the scenic route. Huleeya Informant[edit] Huleeya is in the Black Shalk Cornerclub, in the Foreign Quarter Lower Waistworks. He should be easy to find, as he is the only Argonian in the room. Unfortunately, Huleeya seems to be having trouble with the locals, who will not let him pass. Talk with the Dark Elf, Ethys Savil, or one of his two friends, and persuade him to leave the Argonian alone. Raising his disposition a bit will work, but so will homicide. If you try to leave with Huleeya without talking to one of the thugs, they will attack and you will have to protect Huleeya. Attacking the thugs first will result in Huleeya refusing to talk to you. Once you've solved this, you may escort Huleeya unhindered to Jobasha's Rare Books. Jobasha's bookshop is on the same level as the cornerclub, in the Foreign Quarter Lower Waistworks, just on the opposite side. Once you're inside the bookshop with Huleeya, you will receive one Reputation point for your help and he will give you some notes to take to Caius. Also while at the bookshop, pick up the book Progress of Truth on the second floor far left bookcase as you will be needing it later in this quest. You can steal it when the Ordinator patrols elsewhere, or just buy it. Addhiranirr Informant[edit] Addhiranirr is the next closest contact in the St. Olms Canton, southeast of the Foreign Quarter (past the Redoran and next to the St. Delyn cantons). It turns out Addhiranirr is difficult to find as almost no one in St. Olms knows where she is. With enough exploration and questions, you do eventually find her all alone in the northeast Underworks, hiding from a Census and Excise agent. In order to get anything out of her, the agent must be taken care of. The agent in question is Duvianus Platorius, who can be found in St. Olms Waistworks. As usual, you can either kill him or persuade him that Addhiranirr has fled. Note that if you happen to accidentally tell him where Addhiranirr is, you can still get the information Caius wants by raising Addhiranirr's disposition until she will talk to you. Also, if you tell Duvianus Platorius where Addhiranirr is and come back later to talk about the topic 'Addhiranirr', he will give you the response normally given if you had chosen to lie to him. Anyway, once the agent is out of the way, Addhiranirr will let you know that the Sixth House is into smuggling, but no one knows what due to intense secrecy. Meet Mehra Milo[edit] The last of the contacts is Mehra Milo. She may be found in the Library of Vivec, located in the Hall of Wisdom in the Temple Canton at the southern end of Vivec. Once you find her and follow her to the back of the library, she will tell you what she knows about the Nerevarine cult. She'll also suggest that you obtain a copy of the book Progress of Truth for Caius. Although the library has a copy of the book, it is under guard, so she suggests trying the local bookshops, even though the book is officially banned by the Tribunal Temple. The copy in the library is the tall book on top of the bookshelf in the southwest corner. Alternatively, you can just buy a copy from Jobasha's Rare Books in the Lower Waistworks of the Foreign Quarter for 150 gold. Other copies can be found at: Tel Uvirith, Arelas' House Vivec, Hall of Justice Secret Library Vivec, Telvanni Tower Return to Caius[edit] Return the information to Caius, who will promote you to Journeyman and suggest you take more time to train and do some other guild work to keep your cover up. Come back for the next part of the quest in a few days.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk with people in the House to be directed to Crassius Curio for sponsoring. Speak to Crassius Curio to learn his request. Unequip all your items. Speak to Crassius Curio again to be sponsored.
Detailed Walkthrough: You Need a Sponsor[edit] Once you reach the rank of Lawman in the House, you'll need a sponsor in order to be promoted further. Talking with people in the House, you will be directed to Crassius Curio in his manor on the Hlaalu Plaza in Vivec. Crassius Curio[edit] If you haven't met Curio before, he's a strange one to say the least. In order to be sponsored, all you need to do is take your clothes off... all of them. Once you've removed everything, just speak with him to be sponsored. However, this entire quest can be skipped if you have already been named Hortator of House Hlaalu, just talk to Duke Vedam Dren in Ebonheart about the "Camonna Tong". He will then "name you Grandmaster of House Hlaalu", in reality this simply raises your rank in House Hlaalu twice, which should make you House Cousin of House Hlaalu. After that Curio will send you to Odral Helvi and the questline continues normally. Spying on Odral Helvi[edit] Curio will then direct you to Odral Helvi for more quests. It seems like he suspects Helvi of corruption and he wants you to keep him informed of Helvi's moves.

Quick Walkthrough: Find Aeta Wave-Breaker in the West Gash region, east of Caldera, and tell her that you will help recover her stolen jewels. Find the thieves' hideout: the cave Shushishi, northeast of Aeta. Make your way through the cave until you find the Khajiit Dro'Zhirr. Either kill Dro-zhirr, or "convince" him to give you the jewels. Bring the jewels back to Aeta to receive the 300 gold.
Detailed Walkthrough: Finding Aeta[edit] Aeta can be found in the West Gash region, directly east of Caldera, looking wistfully across the hills to the east. If you don't see her there, find the armorer's shop, and look for the stone wall opposite his entrance. Go around the northern end of the wall and head southeast for a few steps; she should be easy to spot. Speak to her about "some notorious thieves" and agree to retrieve her jewels. Finding Shushishi[edit] The cave of Shushishi, where Dro'Zhirr and his fellow bandits are hiding, is northeast of Aeta, roughly east of the Caldera Governor's Hall. If you are able to use a levitate spell (or have a similar way of getting across high obstacles), get to the top of the hills northeast of Aeta. (Otherwise, you'll have to head south and take the long walk around the hills.) You should see a ravine that runs north-to-south on the other side; the entrance to Shushishi is right at the southern end of the ravine. If you have reasonable climbing skills, you can also climb the cleft in the hills just southeast of the Indalen Ancestral tomb, northeast of Caldera. You will end up just above the Abaelun Mine. It is then just a short walk east and south to Shushishi. Inside the Cave[edit] When you enter Shushishi, prepare to be attacked by an Orc carrying a random magic axe. As you progress through the cave, you'll encounter several other bandits as well as four slaves. Dro'Zhirr himself won't attack, so you can either persuade him to give you the jewels or take them by force. Collecting the Reward[edit] When you've obtained the two pieces of simple jewelry (an expensive amulet and ring), make your way back to Aeta. Speak to her, and she'll give you 300 gold for her family heirlooms.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk with the Wise Woman Sinnammu Mirpal in the Ahemmusa Camp. Secure the Ald Daedroth shrine (north of the camp) for Sinnammu (easiest method is to kill everyone). Return to Sinnammu and escort her to the Inner Shrine to be named Nerevarine.
Detailed Walkthrough: Ahemmusa Camp[edit] If you haven't found out the location of the Ahemmusa Camp yet, ask the Ashlanders in the other camps. The Ahemmusa Tribe can be found on the far northeast corner of the main island (check your in-game map once you talk to her about it). It's a long walk, but you can grab a boat to Tel Mora and then to Vos, and then travel a short distance north to the camp. Sinnammu Mirpal needs your help Sinnammu Mirpal[edit] Once you reach the Ahemmusa Camp, talk to any of the Ashlanders, who will tell you that you should show courtesy to the Gulakhans before speaking to the wise woman. The Ahemmusa Gulakhans are Kausi, Dutadalk, and Yenammu. Kausi can be found in his Yurt, and Dutadalk and Yenammu in Dutadalk's Yurt. Speak with any of the three about the Nerevarine and they will permit you to speak to the wise woman, Sinnammu Mirpal. Mention that you wish her to name you the Nerevarine. She will agree, but on one condition: that you secure a safe place for the Ahemmusa in Ald Daedroth, an ancient Daedric Shrine north of the camp (check your in-game map). In the past, the shrine was a traditional refuge for the tribe in times of trouble, but now it has been overtaken by cultists. Once you make Ald Daedroth safe, you will have to escort her there to prove it. Ald Daedroth[edit] Ald Daedroth is directly north of the camp, though it's quite a swim (or walk if you have a Water Walking spell handy). When you arrive, it will become apparent that things are a bit more complicated than Mirpal made out. The shrine is currently being assaulted by Ordinators. Initially, the Ordinators outside will not be hostile towards you. If you speak to one of them, they will ask you who you are. If you tell them that you are a cultist, or that you are the Nerevarine, they will attack you. If you tell them you are merely there to loot the shrine, they will ignore you. Many of the cultists are quite dangerous and wield enchanted weapons, so it may be best to let them fight the Ordinators rather than getting their attention. If you do not intervene, the Ordinators will still win most of the fights. To make the shrine safe, you need to reach the Antechamber, which is accessible via the Inner Shrine. When you enter the shrine, go down the stairs and to the door straight across the large hall. You do not need to clear out the Left Wing or the Right Wing areas. In the Antechamber, you will encounter the priestess Hlireni Indavel, who is initially not hostile towards you. If you raise her disposition to 90 or above, or if your Speechcraft is 50 or above, you can persuade her to take pity on the Ahemmusa. If your level or reputation is 20 or higher, you can threaten to kill her and she will submit. Otherwise, you will need to kill her. However, making an arrangement with Hlireni or killing the cultists does not have any effect, and Sinnammu will be satisfied that the shrine is safe even if you do not speak with her at all. It is not necessary to kill any of the Ordinators in order to make the shrine safe. Escorting Sinnammu[edit] However you decide to go about it, once you've made the shrine safe, return to Mirpal and escort her to the shrine. She has a water walking ability, so despite her warnings, she is actually safe from attack by Slaughterfish if you use that method to get there. Bring her to the Inner Shrine's statue and she will recognize you as the Nerevarine and give you the Madstone of the Ahemmusa to identify yourself as such. You'll receive one point of Reputation when you bring her to the shrine, and another when she acknowledges you as Nerevarine.

Quick Walkthrough: Meet Ahnassi in the Halfway Tavern in Pelagiad and let her admire your smooth moves. Give Ahnassi the gift of friendship by acting on her tip about a special belt. Share a care with Ahnassi to learn that a Camonna Tong thug, Daren Adryn, has frightened her. Travel to Gnaar Mok and take care of him, which ever way you choose. Return to have Ahnassi clear your criminal record. Hear about a key to the Redoran Treasury in Vivec and plunder the vaults. Ahnassi's old friend has turned to Skooma; convince him to let go of that habit. (Optional) Visit Ahnassi's friend, the Acrobatics Master trainer Senyndie, for better prices and a skill book. Bring Ahnassi two flowers, a Coda Flower and a Gold Kanet, as a token of your love. Steal a Flamemirror Robe from a Telvanni wizard in return for 20 ebony throwing stars. Pick up the Elvul's Black Blindfold (a glove actually) from the Imperial Commission inside Castle Ebonheart.
Detailed Walkthrough: Ahnassi, a Special Friend[edit] If you are a male character, visit the Khajiit Ahnassi in the Halfway Tavern in Pelagiad. Raise her disposition to 50 and she'll open up to you. Choose topic Thieves Guild to receive Honor Among Thieves (it will only be obtainable from her if the quest isn't started yet, a player isn't a member of Thieves Guild, a player has >= 50 Agility and her disposition >= 50). After that, choose the smooth moves and her profession dialogue topics and then Give Ahnassi the gift of friendship. She'll then plead with you to come and visit her often, which opens up a string of quests with her. A New Belt[edit] Once you and Ahnassi are properly acquainted, she'll reveal to you that the guest Hrordis, upstairs, has a magic belt and worships Mehrunes Dagon. The belt is actually the Belt of Sanguine Fleetness which is needed for the involved Threads of the Webspinner quest of the Morag Tong, so hang on to it if you decide to whack Hrordis. However, Hrordis won't talk to you, so either have a crime rating already, or go without clothes so you will be able to taunt her, or use Frenzy Humanoid (and let her or her summon strike first), among other tactics; see her article for numerous strategies to avoid a tavern-wide brawl and a murder bounty. If you speak to Ahnassi about the new friend topic, you'll open up the share a gift option which will allow her to give you a quality potion of feather. Pressure from the Camonna Tong[edit] Share a care with Ahnassi to learn that a Camonna Tong thug, Daren Adryn, has frightened her by trying to force her to join the guild (which doesn't sound right, since the Camonna Tong doesn't like outlanders or non-Dunmer at all!). Someone bothering your girlfriend just won't do, so go and pay Daren a surprise visit in Nadene Rotheran's shack in the town of Gnaar Mok. You can talk to him about Ahnassi, but it will only serve to delay the inevitable fight with him and, unfortunately, the other three Camonna Tong members in the shack. The other three NPCs in the shack can be spared by exiting the building immediately after killing Daren Adryn, casting a Chameleon spell on yourself, then entering the shack again and casting a Calm Humanoid spell on the three NPCs before looting Daren's corpse. Return to Ahnassi, who will be so pleased that she will clear your entire current criminal record. She will also give you some new gifts including an extravagant shirt and pants and the Short Blade skill book The 36 Lessons of Vivec, Sermon 30. The Redoran Vaults[edit] Once you've taken care of Daren, Ahnassi will tell you that the Redoran noble Beldrose Dralor has a key to two small chests in the Redoran Treasury in Vivec, in his wife's chest of clothes. The Dralor Manor is located in the Redoran Plaza in Vivec and the key can be found in an unlocked chest of drawers in the top bedroom. It's better than she says, and leads to one of the greatest loot hauls in the entire game: the key actually unlocks the entire Lower Vault of the Redoran Treasury (and two chests within it, which are only a small bit of the booty to be found here). Just watch out for the guards who will attack if they see you take anything (the key words here being "see you"). See Redoran Vaults § Robbing the Redoran Treasury for details. The Third Wheel[edit] If you explore her share a care dialogue topic, it turns out that your girlfriend has a former mate, J'Dhannar, about whom she still cares, and who is in some trouble. J'Dhannar is a Skooma addict who lives in the St. Olms canton in Vivec, and Ahnassi wants you to try to persuade him to quit the drug, though common wisdom about Skooma is "once an addict, always an addict". You'll find him on the lower level of the Canalworks section of St. Olms. He will become quite irate when you try and get him off the Skooma.  He'll also insist that he and Ahnassi are not former mates, but current ones. If you speak with a Savant (such as Ladia Flarugrius upstairs in the Halfway Tavern in Pelagiad where Ahnassi is, or Crazy-Legs Arantamo in Vivec's Foreign Quarter) about Skooma addiction, the book Confessions of a Skooma-Eater will be recommended.  Valued at 25 gold, it can be had at Jobasha's Rare Books (as one would probably expect) in Vivec's Foreign Quarter, and at the shop of Codus Callonus in Ald'ruhn, among other places. Return to J'Dhannar with the book and, with a disposition of 50+, he will agree to read the book and give up Skooma. He will also release Ahnassi from their marital bond. Return to Ahnassi with the news. Note: If you have the book in your inventory already, you can get him to quit Skooma the first time you talk to him.  While this will skip his dialogue about still being Ahnassi's mate, it will not disrupt his releasing her from that arrangement. Become a Very Special Friend[edit] Once this is done, return to Ahnassi and you'll hear that J'Dhannar has indeed quit the skooma and has returned home to Elsweyr. Ahnassi now considers you her very special friend and invites you to visit her home in town, supplying you with a key. You can basically consider yourself as close to married as you'll get within the game, and you can use her house as your own. Ahnassi will now be found in her/your house from this point on. She Knows This Acrobat ...[edit] Once you and Ahnassi move in together, you have the chance to meet with Ahnassi's friend, Senyndie, at the Arena Fighters Quarters in Vivec. She just happens to be the Master Trainer of Acrobatics (meaning that you can train with her all the way up to skill level 100). Mention Ahnassi to Senyndie and the latter's Disposition will soar, meaning lower training prices, as well as a free copy of The Black Arrow, Part I, an Acrobatics skill book. Flowers for the Lady[edit] Speak with Ahnassi again using the share a gift topic to learn that she wants two flowers, a Coda Flower and a Gold Kanet. Sounds simple enough, and the gold kanet is indeed hard to miss in most places (look at the crossroads west of Pelagiad for instance). The coda is more difficult to find, and is actually the flower of the Draggle-Tail plants found along the Bitter Coast region. The best place to find them is between the town of Seyda Neen and the stronghold of Hlormaren far to the northwest. You can also buy a coda from Peragon at Moonmoth Legion Fort. Return the flowers to Ahnassi for her profuse thanks. The Wizard's Robe[edit] Once you give her the flowers, Ahnassi will ask you to steal a Flamemirror Robe from the wizard Mavon Drenim's lair in Vivec, Telvanni Plaza. Drenim is a powerful opponent and will most likely know when you've entered before you do. Either face the wizard and kill him if you can, or take the stealthy / runaway approach and take the robe from the closet (you can actually manage to squeeze yourself behind the closet, thus blocking you from view and allowing you to freely take the robe without being spotted). Keep it for yourself by thanking her for the tip or gift it to Ahnassi for 20 ebony throwing stars in return. Keep in mind that you may get a writ for Drenim as a Morag Tong quest, so you may be able to complete both at once (or do the Morag Tong one first and simply hold on to the robe). However, if you do this part of Ahnassi's quest prior to being given the writ from the Morag Tong, you will not receive any reward from the Tong because you killed him without a writ. (You can actually give Ahnassi any Flamemirror Robe, such as the one you might legally receive for completing the quest, "For the Love of a Bosmer".) Blinded by Love[edit] In the last quest from Ahnassi, revealed again by her share a gift topic, you have to retrieve Elvul's Black Blindfold (a glove actually) from the Imperial Commission inside Ebonheart's Grand Council Chambers. Ahnassi will tell you that it is well guarded, and inform you of a secret entrance located underwater just outside of Ebonheart. If you take her advice, you may be attacked in the secret entrance by Furius Acilius wearing Lord's Mail, one of the best cuirasses in the game (but only if you talk to him).  He's tougher than the average fight, but the cuirass is well worth it. (If you are in the Imperial Legion, you may wish to postpone this fight for the armor artifact, because it is part of a major Legion quest.) After progressing through the passages, you will have to get by two locked doors (level 95), which can be tricky if your Security skill is low or your Open spellcasting not high enough, although the Worn Imperial Key found in one of the crates in the passage will open one of them, and a Scroll of Ekash's Lock Splitter can be used for the other. The alternative route is simply to enter the Imperial Commission through the front door. The glove is behind the level 50 locked door. If you are not a member of the Imperial Legion, feel free to open the door via spell/lockpick, or pickpocket the key from Rufinus Alleius (who is in the Imperial Commission, too). If you are a Legion member, you will be expelled. Oddly, the Guards don't react to you at all in your attempts in unlocking the door. (You'll also find that you can steal with impunity from some other rooms in Ebonheart and its ambassadorial missions because many contain NPCs whose Alarm is all set to zero. They verbally protest but do nothing, and you get no Bounty.  It requires trial and error to determine the safe rooms, so save first.) To complete the quest, snatch the glove from the chest of drawers, and return with it to Ahnassi to talk about share a gift again. She'll let you keep the item. (It should be used with caution, as it has a permanent Damage Marksman effect, sufficient to reduce any character's skill to 0; you would probably not want to accidentally harm a follower NPC with it, especially one you intend to keep around, such as Fjorgeir.) This is all there is to Ahnassi's quests, though you will find that in her/your house, the two containers of food and drink will refill themselves after a while.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Nileno Dorvayn about duties. Steal a copy of Aurane Frernis' secret alchemy formulas. Return it to Nileno for an increase in faction reputation.
Detailed Walkthrough: Hlaalu Alchemy[edit] Nileno Dorvayn at the Hlaalu Council Manor in Balmora will ask you to steal a formula from an alchemist who has been taking business from a loyal Hlaalu alchemist in Vivec. The alchemist in question is Aurane Frernis in the Foreign Quarter's lower waistworks. Confusingly, her shop is indicated as Apothecary, not Alchemist, while there is another, unrelated Alchemist shop nearby, and the Foreign Quarter canton is called the "Market Canton" in the game's dialogue (no such canton actually exists). Aurane's Secret Formula[edit] Locations of the Scrolls You can find Aurane Frernis in the Foreign Quarter's lower waistworks. It may be very difficult to steal a recipe scroll without any magic. In all, there's one on the table, one in a chest at the foot of the bed, and one on Aurane herself. The chest is locked (40) and trapped, so non-thieves should avoid this one; the same goes for the one on Aurane. The easiest would be the one on the table; it's a small room, so there's little to hide behind when stealing the scroll. A chameleon spell or item would be useful since you can't hide anywhere in the room while stealing it. The lamp above Aurane Frernis' bed is enough to break line of sight to the alchemist and allow the recipe scroll on the table to be picked up using the Telekinesis spell. Once you've acquired the formula, return it to Nileno in Balmora with the recipe to complete the quest and receive a five point boost in faction reputation. An easy way to do this (especially early in the game) is to grab the scroll on the table and turn around immediately to leave the room (before she manages to do anything other than shout at you). You will have to pay a bounty of 100 (remember to drop all the stuff you've stolen, including the recipe scroll, if you choose to do the quest this way), but other than that all will be as before - she won't even be angry when you come back.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Lorbumol gro-Aglakh at the Guild of Fighters in Vivec for your orders. Travel to Ebonheart to collect a bounty on Rufinus Alleius. Find the magistrate at the Grand Council and kill him. Return to Lorbumol to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders[edit] Lorbumol gro-Aglakh in the Vivec Guild of Fighters asks you to collect yet another bounty on a magistrate (judge) in the Grand Council of Ebonheart, Rufinus Alleius. Alleius' Bounty[edit] Take a boat to Ebonheart and seek out the magistrate in the Grand Council Chambers. Asking around will reveal that he is actually in the Imperial Commission. Kill him and return to Lorbumol for your 1,000 gold bounty. You could try taunting before attacking; after five successful taunts or so at 0/100 disposition Rufinus Alleius starts attacking you.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Iulus Truptor at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart for a new almoner mission. Visit the Argonian Mission to collect some alms. Persuade Im-Kilaya to donate some gold. Return to Iulus to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Almoner Mission[edit] Iulus Truptor at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart will ask you to perform a collection of donations from the Argonian Mission in town. Alms from the Argonian Mission[edit] If Im-Kilaya's disposition towards you is at least 50, he'll give you the whole 100 gold. However, if you find the slave On-Wan behind a locked (25) door, you can persuade Im-Kilaya to donate even more by asking about the "Runaway slave" before asking about "Alms for the poor". Finding the slave also causes Im-Kilaya's disposition to jump by 40 points. Alternatively, with high enough Speechcraft (and perhaps also if you have already returned Rabinna and/or Reeh-Jah here), you need not use blackmail. If his disposition is 80 or higher, Im-Kilaya will tell you this: "The Imperial Cult has our respect. We are disappointed that the Imperial Cult does not speak out against the inhumane practices of slavery in Morrowind. But perhaps you are right. It is by demonstrating our superior commitment to civilization and humanity that we best disprove the Dunmer's barbaric insistence that we are no more than animals. Please accept this donation to the Imperial Cult on behalf of the province of Argonia." after which he donates 200 gold. Approaching others in the Mission is fruitless; they apologize politely and direct you to speak to Im-Kilaya as their leader. Return to Iulus. If you raised only 100 gold, you will receive a five point disposition bump, five points of faction reputation and two Exclusive Fortify Luck Potions. At 200 gold you receive a ten point disposition bump, ten faction reputation points, and the magical Zenithar's Frock.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Iulus Truptor at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart for a new almoner mission. Visit the Skyrim Mission to collect some alms. Persuade the members of the Mission to donate some gold. Return to Iulus to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Almoner Mission[edit] Iulus Truptor at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart will ask you to collect alms from the Skyrim Mission in Ebonheart. Alms from the Skyrim Mission[edit] Be careful when asking for donations as you receive only one chance. Raise their Disposition before asking in order to receive a higher donation.  To be safe, you should raise it to at least 70 to get the most out of them (some only need to be raised to 60).  Heidmir alone will give up to 200 gold if he likes you enough -- 100 for his country, and 100 for himself. Here is a list of the people in the Skyrim Mission along with how much they will donate: Name Disp. Gold  Disp. Gold   Bedraflod 50-69 5  70+ 10   Briring 40-59 5  60+ 10   Eiruki Hearth-Healer 30-59 20  60+ 40   Heidmir 50-69 100  70+ 200   Ingokning 50-69 5  70+ 20   Total - 135  - 280 Once you have the money, head back to Iulus for your reward. If you raised only 100 gold you'll receive a five point disposition bump with Iulus, five points of faction reputation, and two Bargain Fortify Personality Potions. However if you tell him you've "DOUBLED it!" he will be very pleased with you and gives you the Shoes of Conviction as well as ten points of faction reputation and disposition. Anything over 200 gold you get to keep, so it pays to try and get a good disposition with the NPCs first.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Eydis Fire-Eye in the Balmora Guild of Fighters for orders. Talk to Alof the Easterner at his farmhouse for more information about some Orcs in a Daedric shrine. Head over to Ashunartes and kill Burub gra-Bamog. Return to Eydis Fire-Eye for reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders[edit] Eydis Fire-Eye in the Balmora Guild of Fighters will ask you to investigate some Orcs at a Daedric ruin for the Duke Vedam Dren himself. And that you should talk to Alof the Easterner, a local farmer for more information. Alof's Farmhouse[edit] Alof's Farmhouse is northeast of Pelagiad and north of the Arvel Plantation (a small hut on the north shore of Lake Amaya), just east of the Fields of Kummu. Alof tells you that the Orcs come from Ashunartes, a Daedric ruin northeast of there. He says that if you kill their leader, Burub gra-Bamog, the rest of the Orcs should leave the farmers in peace. Ashunartes[edit] The shrine is indeed towards the northeast of Alof's farm, just across the hills (though it's a little more north than east). There are two entrances to the shrine, with three Orcs in the bottom level, and Burub herself in the upper. You don't need to take care of the three Orcs on the bottom, but some of them have Orcish armor and other loot which can sell for a pretty penny, and they will still continue to attack you even after Burub is dead, so there's no particular reason to avoid killing them. Return to Eydis for your 500 drakes reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Edd Theman at the Telvanni Council Chamber. Get five Standard Potions of Invisibility. Wait five days. Return to Eddie to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Once you recruit Fast Eddie and he arrives at the Telvanni Council Chamber in Sadrith Mora, he will ask you to give him five Standard Potions of Invisibility (home-made potions won't do) in order for him to retrieve a magical amulet from the mainland. There aren't any restocking merchants who sell the potion; however you can find a single bottle at many places. You can get one from Anis Seloth, the main alchemist in Sadrith Mora, Arangaer the alchemist with the stall outside Fara's Hole in the Wall also in Sadrith Mora, Nalcarya of White Haven at Balmora, Gils Drelas at Tel Branora, Jolda and Daynali Dren in Tel Mora. Lastly, you can find the potion with the Alchemists in the Mages Guild in Balmora, Vivec, Caldera and Ald'ruhn. Amulet of Unity[edit] Get five invisibility potions from a store or elsewhere. Once you bring him the potions, wait until you receive a journal entry in five days when he has returned. Visit Eddie again to receive the Amulet of Unity, a +5 faction boost and a point of reputation.

Quick Walkthrough: Meet Tinos Drothan just to the north of the Telvanni Canton. Travel to the cave Beshara. For maximum reward, kill Alvur Hleran and Dondir. Return the ten pieces of Raw Glass to the trader.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Angry Trader[edit] Tinos Drothan can be found just north of Vivec's Telvanni Canton. Drothan is reluctant to yield anything useful at first, but raise his disposition to 50 and he'll tell you that his two "escorts" have stolen his shipment of Raw Glass. Of course, he asks you if you'd like to help and retrieve it. Find the Thieves[edit] The two escorts, Alvur Hleran and Dondir, ran southeast towards the cave Beshara. The cave actually houses a number of people of ill repute, including the two in question. Retrieve the Contraband[edit] The glass itself can be found in a locked chest at the very end of the cave. Pick the lock or get the key from Alvur (by any means necessary). When you return to Drothan with the 10 pieces of glass, you'll receive a bonus to your Mercantile skill. If you kill both thieves, you will get a 5-point bonus.  Killing only one of them nets you 3 points, and if you don't kill either of them, you'll only get a 2-point bonus.  Note that you can't cheat and give him 10 pieces of Raw Glass from somewhere else.  Only the 10 in the chest in the cave will do, as they have a unique ID: ingred_raw_glass_tinos.

Quick Walkthrough: Ask Caius Cosades in Balmora for orders. Talk with Hasphat Antabolis in the Fighters Guild. Bring Hasphat a Dwemer puzzle box from the Dwemer ruins of Arkngthand northeast of Moonmoth Legion Fort. Receive the notes for Caius from Hasphat upon returning the puzzle box. Return to Caius Cosades. (Optional) Speak with Hasphat again to get the key which opens the lower levels of Arkngthand.
Detailed Walkthrough: Hasphat Antabolis[edit] Your first task from Caius is to talk to Hasphat Antabolis about the Nerevarine and Sixth House cults. Antabolis can be found in the training room on the lower floor of the Balmora Fighters Guild in the center of town. However, he wants a favor before he gives you the information. All you have to do is obtain a Dwemer puzzle box from a local ruin called Arkngthand. Travel to Arkngthand[edit] Leave Balmora from the southern entrance, and head east. You will reach a fork in the road around Moonmoth Legion Fort, which has three roads to choose from. Head northeast towards Molag Mar. If you have chosen the correct path, you will soon approach an ancient Dwemer bridge crossing Foyada Mamaea. Snowy Granius, a bandit, waylays travelers on the bridge. Shortly after the end of the bridge, you will see a Dwemer ruin on your right. This is Arkngthand. Turn the crank handle, and proceed inside. Ruins of Arkngthand[edit] At the bottom level of the ruins are two bandits, Frink Ruuz and Surus Velvus. To find the puzzle box, face west, toward the three doors leading to Weepingbell Hall. Above those doors is a ledge, made accessible by a ramp made of rocks. Climb the ramp and enter the door to the Cells of Hollow Hand, on your left. The puzzle box is on the shelves, which is on the left when you enter the room. However, the boss of the bandits, Boss Crito, is also in there.  Once you have taken the puzzle box, you can return to Hasphat. You can also continue to explore the ruins but it has no bearing on the quest. Return to Hasphat[edit] Returning the puzzle box to Hasphat will get you the information that Caius requested. Hasphat says that Sharn gra-Muzgob would be a good person to talk to for more information. Return to Caius and deliver the information to him. Key to Arkngthand

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Domalen and receive a leaflet. Take the leaflet to Aurane Frernis. Confront Domalen. Talk to either Aurane or Galuro Belan about the Slander.
Detailed Walkthrough: Slander[edit] You'll find Domalen in the Foreign Quarter Plaza handing out inflammatory leaflets claiming some nasty things about the alchemist Aurane Frernis, who has a store on the Lower Waistworks level. Take a leaflet and visit with Aurane who will say that it's merely slander, and will ask you to investigate the source of it. Detective Work[edit] Speak with Domalen and claim that the leaflet contents are lies to get him to admit that he was asked by Galuro Belan to distribute them. Return to Frernis with this information for your 100 gold reward. Alternatively, go and have a chat with Belan who owns an apothecary shop on the Waistworks level of Telvanni Canton. She should readily admit to being the source of the leaflets and offer you 100 gold to keep the entire matter a secret.

Quick Walkthrough: Peacefully: Talk to Skink-in-Tree's-Shade in the Wolverine Hall Mage's Guild for duties. Travel to Vivec to deliver the Letter from Ocato to Trebonius Artorius. Give the letter to Trebonius in the Foreign Quarter Guild of Mages and be promoted to Arch-Mage. Duel to the death: Either talk to Edwinna Elbert in the Ald'ruhn Guild of Mages to be directed to Trebonius or talk directly to Trebonius about becoming the Arch-Mage. Trebonius will challenge you to a duel to the death in the Arena. Defeat Trebonius to become Arch-Mage.
Detailed Walkthrough: Becoming Arch-Mage[edit] In order to achieve your last guild rank of Arch-Mage you must replace Trebonius Artorius in the Vivec Guild of Mages as the guildmaster. This isn't much of a surprise if you're familiar with Trebonius; he seems a bit light headed to be head of the Guild. There are two ways of doing this: peacefully or by a duel to the death. Rising to Arch-Mage Peacefully[edit] Once you've finished the Galur Rithari's Papers quest for Skink-in-Tree's-Shade (in the Wolverine Hall Mage's Guild), and reached the rank of Master Wizard, talk with Skink to be given a letter from Ocato (spelled correctly this time) that amounts to Trebonius's pink slip (he's being fired by the Empire). In it, Ocato asks Trebonius to promote you to Arch-Mage. Trebonius will, but he won't step down; you end up both being Arch-Mages, and you get +2 Reputation bonus. The downside is the only way you can get his equipment is by doing the Dwemer and Telvanni quests he sets for you. Because of how the journal script progresses, once you have the letter, you won't be able to challenge him to a duel unless you have previously done so. If you do deliver the letter from Ocato and peacefully become Arch-Mage, you can still turn in Trebonius's quest Mystery of the Dwarves and receive his point of reputation reward. After which there is no additional value in keeping Trebonius alive. Using Taunt or Frenzy he can be fought and killed inside the Vivec Mage's Guild. This gives access to his equipment AND the maximum Reputation gain. Other NPCs and quests reference his death as if you had fought in the arena except you gain the 3 reputation points from the Mystery of the Dwarves and delivering Ocato's letter without having to sacrifice the valuable Necromancer's Amulet or killing the Telvanni Councilors. Duel With Trebonius[edit] Similarly, if you have finished the Bethamez quest for Edwinna Elbert (in the Ald'ruhn Guild of Mages), and reached the rank of Master Wizard, talk to Edwinna about duties and be directed to Trebonius in the Vivec Guild of Mages. He will greet you with a challenge to a duel to the death in the Vivec Arena. Alternatively, if you have reached the rank of Wizard in the Guild, you can talk directly to Trebonius about becoming the Arch-Mage. He will again challenge you to a duel to the death in the Arena. Either way, if you can manage to defeat him, you'll become the new Arch-Mage. You'll also get to keep his great equipment, but don't get any reputation points.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Master Aryon in the Upper Tower in Tel Vos for chores. Raise to the rank of Magister to declare your intentions of becoming Archmagister. Defeat Gothren to become Archmagister. Return to Aryon to be named Archmagister.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Talk to Master Aryon in the Upper Tower in Tel Vos about chores or Advancement to learn that he can grant you the rank of Master now, which will give you an equal place on the Telvanni Council, but if you aspire to a higher claim, he can also grant you the title of Magister. By accepting the title of Magister, you are announcing that you deserve the title of Archmagister more than Gothren, who currently holds that rank. Becoming Master[edit] If you choose to become Master, you won't be able to ascend to Archmagister of House Telvanni. However, if you change your mind later, you can ask Aryon to name you Magister. Becoming Archmagister[edit] If you choose to become Magister, Aryon will tell you that you have the support of the Telvanni Council, but you still have to dispose of Archmagister Gothren, who you will have to kill before taking his place (at this point you get +10 Disposition, +10 Faction Reputation and +2 Reputation, but only if you raised from the rank of Wizard). Gothren can be found in Tel Aruhn. Return to Aryon when Gothren is dead and be promoted to Archmagister and receive an extra +10 Faction Reputation and +2 Reputation.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Tuveso Beleth at her store in the Redoran Council Hall in Ald'ruhn for duties. Travel to Molag Mar to collect some debts owed by Giras Indaram. Ask around the city and discover that Giras does nothing unless his brothers bugs him. Speak with Tidros Indaram, Giras's brother. Talk to Giras Indaram and defeat him in a duel. Get the money from Giras. Report back to Tuveso Beleth.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Tuveso Beleth at the Redoran Council Hall in Ald'ruhn will ask you to collect some debts owed by Giras Indaram. Collecting the Debt[edit] Giras can be found at the Armigers Stronghold (downstairs) in Molag Mar and will refuse to pay his debt (his brothers are among the best of the Buoyant Armigers, which is probably why he refuses and why you probably shouldn't just kill him outright). Ask around Molag Mar to learn that his brothers have to bug him to get him to do anything. Find one of his brothers, Tidros Indaram, again in the Armigers Stronghold (upstairs), and he'll tell you to speak with Giras again and tell him that Tidros said to pay the debt. Giras will agree this time on one condition, that you must duel him to 'prove' that he owes the money. Once Giras is dead, knocked out, or takes enough damage, the duel will end (though try not to kill him as his brothers will not like it). Once you win the duel, speak to Giras again to collect the debt. Return to Beleth in Ald'ruhn with the debt money to complete the quest.  She will reward you with a glass frostsword.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Lloros Sarano for duties. Ask Varvur Sarethi about the Suspicious Ash Statue. Speak with and kill Galtis Guvron. Report back to Sarano and be directed to Hanarai Assutlanipal. Talk with and kill Hanarai. Return to Lloros Sarano.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Once you complete Athyn Sarethi's quest to clear Varvur Sarethi's name, Lloros Sarano in the Ald'ruhn Tribunal Temple will ask you to find out where Varvur Sarethi got the Suspicious Ash Statue. Galtis Guvron[edit] Talk with Varvur and learn that he received it from Galtis Guvron at The Rat in the Pot Cornerclub in town (hint: if you ask around the inn before talking with Lloros, he's the one who denies all knowledge). Guvron will attack you as soon as you mention the statue and you'll be forced to kill him. On his corpse you'll find a note signed Hanarai. Hanarai Assutlanipal[edit] Talk with Sarano about the note and he'll say he thinks it refers to Hanarai Assutlanipal who has a  house in Ald'ruhn. He gives you four Quality Restore Health potions, one Cure Blight Disease potion, and one Cure Common Disease potion, in case Hanarai turns out to be as violent as Guvron. Go in and Hanarai will attack you as soon as you mention the statue. Once she is dead, search her house, and you'll note that her cellar is a Sixth House shrine. The reddish glow around the heavily locked door is a giveaway. Report back to Sarano to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Theldyn Virith for duties. Travel to the Ashimanu Egg Mine along the road between Gnisis and Ald'ruhn. Kill a diseased shalk. Return to Theldyn Virith.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Once you've finished Neminda's Founder's Helm quest and taken care of Old Blue Fin, Theldyn Virith in the outpost at Ald Velothi will ask you to kill the infected shalk in the Ashimanu Egg Mine. In the Mine[edit] The mine is along the road between Gnisis and Ald'ruhn. Simply take the road south to Gnisis (or use a Almsivi Intervention spell), and then head towards Ald'ruhn. Once you get to the mine, your task is quite simple, since you only need to kill one infected shalk. The shalk itself should be easy to locate, as it is the only one in the mine, and is in the Queen's Lair. Once the shalk is dead, simply report back to Theldyn Virith in Ald Velothi to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Edryno Arethi for business. Travel to the Zainab Camp to persuade them to trade solely with House Hlaalu. Convince Gulakhan Ashibaal. Return to Edryno Arethi.
Detailed Walkthrough: Business[edit] Edryno Arethi  in her house on the Hlaalu Waistworks in Vivec will ask you to persuade the Zainab Camp to trade its ebony solely with House Hlaalu. Practicing Politics[edit] The camp is southwest from Tel Vos on the mainland. Once you reach the camp you will be directed by its residents to the yurt of Gulakhan Ashibaal. If you tell him The Zainab are now strong enough to sell ebony, his disposition will increase by 10.  If you tell him I want you to sell ebony to House Hlaalu, his disposition will drop by 10.  Both choices will give the options to say either If we both sell ebony the price drops or We do not have enough ebony.  The first choice will get Ashibaal's agreement.  The second choice will make Ashibaal say goodbye. Return to Vivec[edit] Return to Arethi in Vivec to complete the quest and receive 1000 gold.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Mistress Therana at the Upper Tower in Tel Branora for chores once you are a Mouth in House Telvanni. Travel to Ghostgate to get Auriel's Bow from Ralyn Othravel. Either: kill him for the bow, or pickpocket him to get it. Return to Therana to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Once you reach the rank of Mouth in the House, Councilor Therana in the Upper Tower in Tel Branora will talk to you about Auriel's Bow, which she says "smells faintly of Ash Yams". Therana doesn't give any exact location, but says that the smell is strongest in Ghostgate, near Ralyn Othravel. Auriel's Bow[edit] Travel to Ghostgate and find Ralyn in the Tower of Dawn, who is indeed carrying the bow, though you'll have to kill him or, if you're good at sneaking, pickpocket him to get it. Return to Therana in Tel Branora with the bow to be offered a Daedric cuirass and greaves, both enchanted with 50 points of constant-effect Feather. If you refuse that reward, she'll give you 11,111 gold. The armor is worth more than the gold, so it is the better choice even if you sell it later.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Azura's statue to activate the quest. Travel to an island in the Sheogorad region. Slay the Golden Saint Staada. Return Sheogorath's Signet Ring to Azura as proof.
Detailed Walkthrough: Azura's request[edit] Activate the statue inside the Shrine of Azura to talk with Azura. You will find out that she has a bet with Sheogorath riding on a priestess apprentice living in seclusion in a hut in the Sheogorad Region, and that Sheogorath has sent some Daedra to disturb the priestess in attempt to secure the bet. Azura wants you to thwart his plans. Travel to the remote island[edit] Azura says that the island is north of Dagon Fel, but it is more accurately to the northwest. From Dagon Fel, travel west along the coastline until you encounter a large island. Slay the offending Daedra[edit] You find the island occupied by a number of various Daedra, including some Ogrim, Atronachs, and Hungers. Kill as many or as few of the Daedra as you like; you really only have to kill the Golden Saint named Staada near the priestess' shack, who also carries Sheogorath's Signet Ring. Take it from her corpse as proof that Sheogorath has been meddling. DO NOT enter the priestess' shack, as this will anger Azura and you will fail the quest. Claim your reward[edit] Travel back to the shrine to receive your reward: Azura's Star, an extremely useful, reusable soul gem. You also get to keep Sheogorath's ring.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Miun-Gei about an Annoying Fool. Talk to Marcel Maurard. (Optional) Listen to rumors about a New Play. Talk to Crassius Curio in the Curio Manor. Return to Marcel and then Miun-Gei.
Detailed Walkthrough: An annoyed Enchanter[edit] Miun-Gei, an enchanter in Vivec's Foreign Quarter Lower Waistworks, is having trouble with an annoying fool loitering outside his shop: "Welcome, %PCRace. It is good to see a customer in the store. That annoying fool outside chases them away." annoying fool "Did you not see him as you entered? It is that Marcel Maurard. Outside my shop he stands all day, selling ridiculous wares. Get rid of him I would like to, but the law says he is within his rights. Perhaps you might find a way?" I will try and make him leave. "You think you can? I would like that. Make him go away, and I will have rewards for you!" The Bad Actor[edit] The fool, Marcel Maurard, just outside Miun-Gei's shop, will tell you that he is an actor looking for work and merely selling things to make ends meet. You can attempt to persuade or threaten him to leave, but he won't budge (short of killing him, which rewards only 250 gold and provides a smaller disposition increase). Maurard does mention that he would leave if only he could find a theater troupe. The Playwright[edit] If you ask around town about a troupe, you'll soon find out that Crassius Curio has just written a (questionable) new play and is looking to form a troupe. Curio can be found in the Curio manor in the Hlaalu Plaza in Vivec. Deliver the good News[edit] Chat with the interesting Curio for a bit to find out some basic information about the play as well as receive an unfinished copy and then return to Maurard with the news. Once Maurard is taken care of, return to Miun-Gei for an Iron Shardskewer. His disposition jumps by 15 points, which should result in slightly lower prices.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Master Aryon in the Upper Tower in Tel Vos for chores. Travel to Gnisis to convince Baladas Demnevanni to join the Council. Collect three Dwemer books for Baladas to have him agree. Return to Aryon to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Councilor Aryon in the Upper Tower of Tel Vos will ask you to go and speak with Baladas Demnevanni and convince him to join the Council. Three Books for Baladas Demnevanni[edit] Go and visit Baladas at Arvs-Drelen in Gnisis. If you've already collected the three books for Baladas, you'll be basically finished as Baladas will immediately agree to Aryon's request. If not, perform the Dwemer Books quest to have him agree. Return to Aryon to complete the quest. You will be promoted to Aryon's Mouth, regardless of whether you have reached the regular Attribute and Skill requirements, and receive a Silver Staff of Peace. You may also notice that Baladas now has a Mouth in the Telvanni Council House, Enar Releth, while Aryon's former mouth Galos Mathendis has presumably retired from Telvanni politics to devote himself to magical studies, as he said he would, as he is nowhere to be found.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Percius Mercius for orders. Travel to Suran and speak to Serjo Avon Oran in Oran Manor. Go to Saturan and kill Daldur Sarys. Return to Avon to collect the bounty.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Orders[edit] Percius Mercius in the Ald'ruhn Guild of Fighters asks you go to Serjo Avon Oran in Suran and help take care of some bandits for him. Serjo Avon Oran[edit] Serjo Avon Oran can be found in Oran Manor in the south side of Suran. He tells you that the bandits have been attacking from the Saturan caverns, northeast of the town on the other side of the hills. He asks you to kill their leader, Daldur Sarys, and report back to him when you have done so. Bandits in Saturan[edit] Travel to Saturan, either by ascending or levitating over the hills or by heading around the hills to the south. A total of seven bandits may be found throughout the mine. Only Daldur Sarys needs to be killed in order to complete the quest and receive the rewards, but there are no consequences either way if you choose to kill the rest of the bandits as well. There are also some slaves here you can free if you wish. Don't forget to look around for some extra loot. Once you've killed Daldur Sarys, return to Avon for the 1,000 gold bounty and the reputation and disposition gains.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Edryno Arethi for business. Go to the Hlaalu Treasury to deliver a sealed report. Give the report to Baren Alen. Return to Edryno Arethi.
Detailed Walkthrough: Business[edit] Edryno Arethi in her house in the Hlaalu Waistworks in Vivec will ask to deliver a sealed report to Baren Alen at the Hlaalu Vaults within the Treasury just across the waistworks. The Delivery[edit] It is just a simple job of going there and giving it to him. The Treasury can be found across the waistworks, on the same level as Arethi's house. Once the report is delivered, return to Arethi to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Hrundi in the Wolverine Hall Fighter's Guild for your orders. Travel to Nchurdamz. Speak to Larienna Macrina to learn how you can be of help. Help her hunt down the daedroth Hrelvesuu. Return to Hrundi.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Orders[edit] Hrundi in the Wolverine Hall Fighter's Guild asks you to travel to the Dwemer ruins of Nchurdamz to help Larienna Macrina explore the ruins in search of a great beast (the position should be marked on your map, far south of Sadrith Mora). At Nchurdamz[edit] When you find the ruins, Larienna should be waiting by a campsite just outside the entrance. Approach Nchurdamz from the north, on the mountaintop, not from the west and the water (the campfire near there is a trio of hostile Ashlanders). Talk with her, and she'll tell you she is hunting a wounded Daedroth named Hrelvesuu. The ruins are small and filled with a variety of robots to take care of. If you make it to the lava room, you should find a key to the locked (60) and trapped doors to the west. Behind the doors you should find the Daedroth that must be killed and, once it is dead, Larienna will stop following you. You can be healed a little by her if you talk to her after she joins you. Return to Hrundi for your 500 gold reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Maurrie Aurmine about a bandit nearby. Bring her glove to Nelos Onmar. Bring her a note in return. Travel to Tel Aruhn or Tel Branora for a reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Beauty[edit] On the road to Balmora from Seyda Neen, about halfway between Balmora and  Pelagiad, you will find Maurrie Aurmine. She tells you she was robbed by a handsome man by the name of Nelos Onmar. She asks you to deliver one of her gloves to him in Pelagiad as a token of her love. The Bandit[edit] Nelos may be found at the Halfway Tavern up the hill in Pelagiad. He seems touched by the news and gives you a note to deliver back to Maurrie. If you return to Maurrie she will be overjoyed and will actually attempt to set you up with someone else. If you are male, it will be Emusette Bracques at the Plot and Plaster in Tel Aruhn, or if you are female it will be Barnand Erelie at Sethan's Tradehouse in Tel Branora. See the appropriate one for a reward of three Exclusive Restore Health potions and a 20 point disposition boost.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Eno Hlaalu at the Morag Tong headquarters in the Hidden Area of the Vivec Arena for special duties. Travel to Pelagiad to retrieve the Belt of Sanguine Fleetness, currently owned by Hrordis. Find Hrordis in the Halfway Tavern and kill her to get the belt. Return to Eno to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Special Duties[edit] The second of Eno Hlaalu's special duties is to bring back the Belt of Sanguine Fleetness, currently owned by Hrordis in Pelagiad, who is a Dark Brotherhood member. Belt of Sanguine Fleetness[edit] Hrordis can be found in an upper room of Pelagiad's Halfway Tavern. Unfortunately, there isn't a writ for Hrordis and she is a non-hostile character who will neither fight nor even talk to you. This makes it impossible to Taunt, Bribe or Intimidate her under normal circumstances. You can pass this by using other methods. Another way to avoid a accumulating a bounty is to sneak up on Hrordis and kill her in one hit. If you cannot murder her in one hit, you'll be reported, and the people in tavern will attack you. Return to Eno once you have the belt to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Percius Mercius to for orders. Travel to Maar Gan and talk to people to find out where Sargon is. Travel to Sargon. Kill Nerer Beneran. Return to Percius for payment.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Orders[edit] Percius Mercius in the Ald'ruhn Guild of Fighters asks you to collect the bounty on the outlaw Nerer Beneran by killing him. Nerer is in Sargon, north of Maar Gan, apparently a well hidden island. You might have to ask around Maar Gan (just north of Ald'ruhn) for directions. Asking for Directions[edit] Talk with anyone in Maar Gan and they'll direct you to Bugdurash gra-Gashel in the Tradehouse or Nuleno Tedas in the Outpost. From either of them you'll find out that Sargon is on an island far north of Maar Gan, west of Dagon Fel (and southwest of Vas, which you visited during Percius' previous quest). Beneran's Bounty[edit] Nerer evidently has lots of friends and they're all in Sargon waiting for you. Fortunately, they are mostly spread out and you can usually safely attack each one at a time. Nerer is in a large room by himself though he is heavily armored and takes a bit of a beating to kill. There's an underwater passage to the right as a shortcut that leads directly to Nerer. The underwater passageway also contains a chest that is guarded by a skeleton and contains gold. See Sargon for more details. Return to Percius, who will reward you with 500 gold.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Crassius Curio to learn your next assignment. Travel to the Haunted Manor in St. Olms Canton and pick the lock. Speak to Dram Bero to learn his conditions for his support. Defeat Garding the Bold. Talk to Dram Bero for his support. Return to Crassius Curio.
Detailed Walkthrough: Business[edit] Crassius Curio in his manor in Vivec will ask you to get the support of another Hlaalu councilor, Dram Bero. Unfortunately, Dram is hard to find, though Curio suggests to start looking in Vivec. The Elusive Councilor[edit] If you ask around, you'll eventually be directed to the St. Olms Plaza. A simple search of the level will reveal nothing, except possibly a well locked door in the Haunted Manor. Inside you'll find Bero and you can get his support by talking with him, though you'll need to take out his champion, Garding the Bold, first (he doesn't want you to kill him, so either use Hand-to-hand, a Drain Fatigue spell, or wait until Garding concedes when he is low on health). Once you defeat Garding return to Bero to gain his support and complete the quest. If you kill Garding, Bero will still support your nomination but will be disappointed at the death of his champion causing his disposition to drop rather than increase ten points. Return to Curio[edit] Return to Crassius for the next quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Hrundi in the Wolverine Hall Fighter's Guild for your orders. Travel to Tel Mora. Find Berwen's shop, and kill the Corprus Stalker inside. Return to Hrundi.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Orders[edit] Hrundi in the Wolverine Hall Fighter's Guild asks you to kill a Corprus Stalker trapped in Berwen's shop in Tel Mora (he also tells you to take care of Rels Tenim's Bounty while you're at it). Berwen's Stalker[edit] Berwen's shop is in the center of Tel Mora (northeast of the docks if you arrive by boat, which is the fastest route from Sadrith Mora). Speak with Berwen if you wish, but the stalker is just on the upper level (talk with Berwen after you kill the stalker to get a big increase in Disposition with her). Return to Hrundi for your 500 gold reward (note that Hrundi says the reward is only 200 when you get the quest).

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Edwinna at the Guild of Mages in Ald'ruhn for duties. Travel to Gnisis to examine the recently discovered Dwemer ruin. Go to the egg mine at the top of the hill on the northeast side of the village. Get the key to the mine from the guard, Vatollia Apo. Make your way to the bottom of the mine, and find the doorway to the ruin Bethamez. Retrieve the Dwemer Airship Plans, and return to Edwinna Elbert.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Edwinna at the Guild of Mages in Ald'ruhn finds out that miners have discovered a Dwemer ruin at the bottom of the Gnisis Eggmine. She instructs you to go there and see what they've found, as she believes that there may be plans similar to the ones you just brought her. Retrieve the Plans for Edwinna[edit] (If you have the Blood Moon expansion, see the Notes below for a "shortcut." If not, or if you want to continue the way the game had intended, continue reading.) Ask one of the citizens about Gnisis to unlock the egg mine subject. Then head for the mine on the east side of town on the hill and speak to the guard, Vatollia Apo, to get a key. If you're part of the Imperial Legion or in possession of a miner's pick he will let you in (if you don't have one, there is a pick on the ground in front of the pushcart next to him); otherwise persuade him, bribe him or sneak up to the door and pick the lock. Once you are in, the entrance to Bethamez can be found on the lower level. After defeating or invisibly sneaking past Lugrub gro-Ogdum, the Orc that guards the entry to the lower level, make your way past the Kwama Warriors taking the left path. The first door on your right is the door to Bethamez. Inside Bethamez, you may find the Dwemer Airship Plans on a table to the left of the entrance. Except the book Divine Metaphysics..., which is beneath the same table, there is nothing else of value in this ruin. Deliver the Plans to Edwinna[edit] After getting the plans, return to Edwinna and give the blueprints to her. You will be rewarded with an increase in Disposition, Faction Reputation, and a Reputation point.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Gentleman Jim Stacey at Simine Fralinie's Bookshop in Vivec's Foreign Quarter for a new job. Travel to Ald Redaynia to obtain the Bittercup. Recover the Bittercup. Travel to the Guild of Fighters in Balmora and talk to Eydis Fire-Eye. Return to Gentleman Jim Stacey in Vivec.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] Gentleman Jim Stacey at Simine Fralinie's Bookshop in Vivec, Foreign Quarter Canalworks, asks you to persuade Eydis Fire-Eye in Balmora to join the Thieves Guild's cause against the Camonna Tong. He suggests that Eydis might betray the Camonna Tong if you offer her the Bittercup, an artifact sacred to the followers of Clavicus Vile. The artifact can be found in the ruins of Ald Redaynia, on the islands north of the Urshilaku Camp (it should be marked on your map). Recovering the Bittercup[edit] The outside of Ald Redaynia is guarded by two Skeleton Archers. The door to the right-hand side after entering (level 75 lock) leads to the Bittercup. The key to this door is in the lower area of the cave, on top of some crates (the key also opens the submerged chest in the same area where it is found). Open the locked door that leads to the Bittercup and defeat the four monsters. A Skeleton War-Wizard will appear after defeating these monsters. Loot the Skeleton War-Wizard's corpse for a Vampiric Ring. Examine the Bittercup on the central altar, and choose whether to drink from it or pick it up. The Bittercup will disappear forever after selecting the option to drink from it, but adds 20 pts to the highest attribute and subtracts 20 from the lowest attribute (the Bittercup is needed to finish the quest). Bribing Eydis[edit] Travel back to Balmora and offer the Bittercup to Eydis Fire-Eye in the Guild of Fighters to get her to pledge allegiance to the Thieves Guild. Return to Gentleman Jim Stacey to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Raven Omayn in the Telvanni Council House in Sadrith Mora for chores. Ask around town to learn that the Black Jinx is in the hands of the Morag Tong. Find the Morag Tong guild in town and speak with Alven Salas. Obtain the ring by killing him, knocking him out or defeating him in a duel. Return to Raven with the ring to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Raven Omayn in the Telvanni Council House in Sadrith Mora will ask you to find and retrieve a ring named Black Jinx for Councilor Dratha. The ring is apparently somewhere in Sadrith Mora but no further details are given. The Black Jinx Ring[edit] Ask around town and you'll soon learn that the ring is in the hands of the Morag Tong. Find the Morag Tong guild in town and speak with Alven Salas there, who has the ring. Unfortunately he is wearing it and so you cannot steal it. You can kill (or just knock out) Alven to get the ring, though if you raise his disposition above 60 you can get him to initiate a duel (or you can taunt him instead). Alternatively, if you are of rank Master or above in the Morag Tong, Alven will just give you the ring right away. The ring casts Absorb Luck (10 to 50) and Burden (25 to 100) at a touched target for 120 seconds. Return to Raven with the ring to complete the quest and be taught the Demoralize Humanoid and Creature spells.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Raven Omayn at the Council House in Sadrith Mora. Retrieve a potion of Quarra blood. Return to Omayn.
Detailed Walkthrough: A bloody request[edit] Speak with Raven Omayn, the Mouth for Councilor Dratha at the Telvanni Council House in Sadrith Mora, to receive her next quest. Blood for Mistress Dratha[edit] Omayn will ask you to steal a potion of Quarra blood. If you've completed the related quest for Raxle Berne previously, you will know that Raxle will have the potion. Otherwise, the potion is still in a locked keg at the bottom of the Quarra headquarters in Druscashti, east of Khuul. Get your bloody reward[edit] Return to Omayn with the potion to receive a Flawed Dwemer Jinksword.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Raxle Berne in Galom Daeus. Travel to Druscashti. Retrieve the Blood of the Quarra potion. Return to Raxle.
Detailed Walkthrough: Raxle has use for you, after all[edit] The Berne Clan leader, Raxle Berne, in the Dwemer Observatory Galom Daeus, will ask you to retrieve for him a potion of Quarra vampire blood, which the clan leader Volrina Quarra draws her power from. The Blood of the Quarra[edit] Volrina can be found in the Dwemer ruins of Druscashti, east of Khuul in the mountains. Unless you are quite powerful, you may not be able to fight the powerful vampires in the Quarra lair, so resort to sneaking if required. The blood potion can be found in a locked keg (Volrina has the key if you cannot pick the lock). Return to your lair[edit] Return to Raxle with the potion to receive access to two of the Clan's vendors in the ruins, Arenara and Germia.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Dhaunayne Aundae in Ashmelech. Travel to Wolverine Hall and talk to Tusamircil. Take the potion he gives you to Sinyaramen at the Gateway Inn. Return to Dhaunayne Aundae. Travel to Druscashti and slay the vampire Kjeld. Once again return to Aundae to receive access to the clan's services.
Detailed Walkthrough: A concerned Mother[edit] The Aundae Clan leader, Dhaunayne Aundae, at the bottom of Ashmelech (a Levitate spell comes handy here), will ask you to find out what happened to her son which she had before she became a vampire. She gives you a signet ring with her family crest to aid you in your search, and tells you that you should start in Sadrith Mora. Detective work[edit] Head to the Mage's Guild at Wolverine Hall and talk to Tusamircil. He will recognize the ring as the same one worn by Sinyaramen. Tusamircil suggests that you deliver a potion that he ordered to help getting him to talk to you. Though Tusamircil doesn't actually know the location of Sinyaramen, Iniel inside the Mages Guild does, telling you that she has seen the crested ring at the Gateway Inn in town. Someone with answers[edit] Sinyaramen can be found on the second floor of the inn and won't talk to you without the potion you are delivering to him. Speak to him about the crest, 'killed by your kind', and 'Vilandon'. It turns out that Vilandon, Aundae's son, was Sinyaramen's grandfather. Vilandon was a vampire hunter and was eventually killed by the vampire Kjeld. Bring the good news to Dhaunayne[edit] Return to Dhaunayne with this information and she will promptly order the death of Kjeld. Slay Kjeld to set things right[edit] Kjeld is a Quarra vampire found on the upper level of the clan's headquarters in Druscashti, east of Khuul. Return to Dhaunayne when Kjeld is dead to receive access to the Clan's services (Mororurg and Gladroon vendors).

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to the head of Boethiah at his sunken shrine northwest of Hla Oad, or to M'Aiq the Liar. Travel to Caldera and recruit the Orc Duma gro-Lag as a sculptor. Acquire the Book Boethiah's Glory and 2000 gold for Duma. Travel to the completed statue at Khartag Point after 21 days and receive Goldbrand.
Detailed Walkthrough: Boethiah's glory restored Boethiah's Request[edit] One of the Daedra, Boethiah, has a shrine that's more than a bit tricky to find. Why? Because it sank to the ocean floor. M'Aiq the Liar will tell you about this place if you meet him on his island in the Sheogorad region. Northwest of Hla Oad, on an island, there's a Daedric ruin called Ashurnibibi. If you check out the ocean a short distance west-northwest of the island, you'll find ruined Daedric buildings on the ocean's floor. Among them is the shattered Shrine of Boethiah. You can activate Boethiah's head, located a short distance from the rest of the statue, and initiate the quest. Activate the crumbled statue and Boethiah will speak to you: "What do you want with me, mortal? My shrine is in ruins, my priests have forgotten me. Will you rebuild my shrine, mortal? Restore it in all its glory? Accomplish this, and I will reward you. You will be the bearer of Goldbrand, my sword of legend. There is one who can help you do this for me. Listen.... Rough hands to smooth stone, Carving rock instead of bone, In Caldera an artist waits, His masterpiece to create. Find the one who may shape the rock. Go." Finding a Sculptor[edit] He wants his shrine rebuilt, and sends you to Caldera to find a sculptor. Ask around and you'll be directed to a shopkeeper named Verick Gemain, who in turn directs you to an Orc in Ghorak Manor across the street from his shop. The Orc, Duma gro-Lag, is on the third floor of the manor and requires 2000 gold and a copy of a book on the shrine (Boethiah's Glory, available in Jobasha's Rare Books in Vivec) to begin work. He tells you that it will take him several weeks to complete. After 21 days the shrine will be finished, although you get no journal entry saying it is done. Boethiah in all his Glory[edit] At that time, head to the rebuilt shrine—located at Khartag Point—and activate the statue. A word of caution, though: the statue has to be totally built in order for you to activate it, so venturing two days after the sculptor gets there will be pointless. The Daedric Prince will speak to you: "You have done well. This shrine is a worthy one, and my power will again be felt. Take this, mortal. Wield the Goldbrand with a strong hand, and let all know that my Shrine has risen!" You will be rewarded with Goldbrand, a one-handed longsword with impressive base damage and good fire damage.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Jim Stacey about Bal Molagmer. Steal four books from Odral Helvi's quarters in Caldera. Deliver the books to Vala Catraso in Ald'ruhn. Return to Jim Stacey to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] For the sixth quest in this series, Jim Stacey wants you to steal Odral's History of the Empire 1, 2, 3, & 4 from Odral Helvi in Caldera and donate them to Vala Catraso in the Guild of Mages in Ald'ruhn. Books for Vala[edit] Odral Helvi can be found upstairs in the Governor's Hall in Caldera. The four books are found in his bedroom inside a locked (40) chest next to the bed. Travel to the Guild of Mages in Ald'ruhn and donate the books to Vala Catraso in the name of the Bal Molagmer. Return to Jim Stacey in Vivec for his congratulations.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Lalatia Varian at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart for an Oracle's quest. Travel to Berandas to recover the Boots of the Apostle. Find the boots on the corpse of a fallen hero in the Underground. (Optional) Talk to Ama Nin and give her a Scroll of Divine Intervention for her escape. Return to Lalatia to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Oracle's Quest[edit] Lalatia Varian at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart will ask you to recover the Boots of the Apostle. Varian is considerably less cryptic in her prophecy this time, and actually names the ruins of Berandas, the stronghold on the west coast, southeast of Gnisis. It's on your paper map. Winged Twilights block the way Boots of the Apostle[edit] Go to Berandas with a good supply of Scrolls of Divine Intervention (you can buy as many as you want from the enchanter in Vivec's Mages Guild). Like most strongholds, Berandas is large and hard to miss from the outside, and has several levels inside. On the first level there is a corpse with two Daedric arrows sticking out of it. You shouldn't encounter anything too tough until you get to Berandas Underground, which has the body of the fallen hero with the boots. The corpse is in the room with two Winged Twilights. Mara's Manifestation[edit] Use the boots' levitate ability to find a few hidden places in the stronghold, including another god manifestation, this time of Mara (under the name of Ama Nin). She's in the same room with the boots.  She wants a scroll of Divine Intervention, and rewards you with Mara's Blouse and Mara's Skirt plus a point of Reputation. Return to Lalatia Varian with the boots, which you get to keep. You also receive ten points of Imperial Cult faction reputation, an extra point of Reputation and a ten point disposition bump with Lalatia.

Quick Walkthrough: (Optional) Talk to Trerayna Dalen at the entrance to Tel Branora. (Optional) Talk to Councilor Therana in the tower. Talk to Mollimo of Cloudrest who offers 1000 gold for their demise. Kill Dalen and her supporters. Return to Mollimo for the bounty.
Detailed Walkthrough: A peculiar Band of Protesters[edit] If you've visited the Telvanni Tower of Tel Branora in your travels, you may have wondered about the group of people gathered just outside of it to the southwest. Attempting to speak with any of them, including the apparent leader, Trerayna Dalen, gets you nowhere, though you do learn that it relates to a dispute with Councilor Therana in the tower. Speak with the very eccentric Therana at the top of Tel Branora to learn that she doesn't consider Dalen worthy enough to leave the tower for. A Bounty for Trerayna Dalen[edit] One of her guards, however, Mollimo of Cloudrest, who patrols the ramp up to the Upper Tower entrance will offer you 1000 gold to deal with Dalen and her gang. Taking care of Business, Telvanni Style[edit] Dalen and her friends look more impressive than they really are, and any accomplished adventurer should have little trouble dealing with them. The most dangerous of the bunch is the Wood Elf named Cun, who wields a Dwarven Crossbow, so you may wish to target Cun first. When attacking, the group usually bunches up, so area-effect spells are useful. Return to Mollimo for the reward and his thanks.

Quick Walkthrough: Hear Rumors about a boy that wants to become a vampire. Talk to the boy's mother, Fathasa in the Llethri Manor Bedrooms. Convince Sanvyn Llethri that vampires aren't all that great. Return to Fathasa for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Rumors[edit] If you ask around Ald'ruhn for rumors (such as in the Mages Guild) you'll learn that Sanvyn Llethri, in the Llethri Manor Bedrooms in the Manor District, wishes to become a vampire. Make sure, however, not to speak with Movis Darys, since he is not a member of the Mages Guild and thus will attack you if you speak to him. The Boy Who Would Be Undead[edit] First, speak to Sanvyn's mother, Fathasa, who will be one of the few regular people that will tolerate speaking with you. Fathasa will say that her son thinks that vampirism is the way to achieve power and respect and that she wishes for you to tell him otherwise. Convince the boy that he is foolish[edit] Speak with Sanvyn, just down the hall, using the topic "submit myself". Choose the responses "You are a foolish boy", "You are a ridiculous young man", "Stupid child", "You are too weak to be a vampire", and "You know nothing". Each insult will lower his disposition and increase his option to fight, so by the last insult he will most likely attack you. If you are so charming that he does not attack, just taunt him until he does. At this point, you should remember his mother's words and actually let the boy win ... yes, this will be hard and contrary to most people's instinct, but don't fight back. (If you're a powerful warrior, it's quite easy to kill him in one blow. Also, it is advisable for powerful warriors to unequip their armor since his dagger may break before the fight is over.) Once your health has been halved, Sanvyn will declare himself the winner, deciding that his opinion about vampires was indeed wrong. Claim your useful reward[edit] Return to Fathasa to receive her enchanted ring (protects against fire).

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Jim Stacey about Bal Molagmer. Travel to Sadrith Mora to steal Brallion's Ring. Find Brallion downstairs in Fara's Hole in the Wall and steal or buy the ring from him. Deliver the ring to Ilmeni Dren in Vivec's St. Delyn Canton. Return to Jim to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] For the fifth quest in this series, Jim Stacey asks you to steal Brallion's Ring (from Brallion no less, a right slave trader) and give it to Ilmeni Dren, a secret abolitionist. Brallion can be found in Fara's Hole in the Wall in Sadrith Mora and Ilmeni can be found in Vivec's St. Delyn Canton. Brallion's Ring[edit] Travel to Sadrith Mora and find Brallion downstairs in Fara's Hole in the Wall (he's normally found outside of an alchemist's shop if you're not doing the quest). You can either buy the ring from him or steal it (if you kill him without buying the ring from him first, you cannot complete the quest). When buying the ring, Brallion initially demands 1000 drakes. You can haggle this down to 800 or to 500 (disposition must be above 70). Once you have the ring, return it to Ilmeni in the name of the Bal Molagmer.
