She has an apartment in St. Delyn Canalworks, South-One, located downstairs on the outside (don't enter the waistworks, just go around the canton and you'll find her apartment on the south side). Return to Jim in Vivec for his congratulations.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Iulus Truptor at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart for a new almoner mission. Travel to Balmora to collect five bottles of Cyrodiilic Brandy. Persuade Benunius Agrudilius, Dulnea Ralaal, Bacola Closcius and Banor Seran to donate a bottle each. Steal or buy the last bottle of Brandy. Return to Iulus to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Almoner Mission[edit] Iulus Truptor at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart asks you to collect five bottles of Cyrodiilic Brandy from the citizens of Balmora. Brandy for the Fundraising Dinner[edit] Checking around the various taverns in town will only yield you up to four bottles, and you'll have to buy or 'find' the last one. Benunius Agrudilius, at the Lucky Lockup and Dulnea Ralaal at the Eight Plates will donate a bottle each if their disposition to you is 70 or higher. Bacola Closcius at the South Wall Cornerclub will also give you a bottle when asked (if his disposition is 30+) and tells you that Banor Seran, at the Council Club, has just received a shipment of brandy. He even tells you where he stores it and suggests you steal some, as the club is just a front for those Camonna Tong gangsters. If you go there and talk to Banor Seran, he will eventually agree to donate you a bottle (90+ disposition), which makes four. Well, it's time to teach them a lesson in manners by robbing their storeroom! Head to the back room. Go in and shut the door behind you to ensure privacy, then look in the chests until you find the bottles you need. If you want to be honest, you can simply buy the bottles from Banor Seran. He starts with five, and three bottles respawn each time you re-open his inventory. Name Disp. Bottles   Bacola Closcius 30+ 1   Benunius Agrudilius 70+ 1   Dulnea Ralaal 70+ 1   Banor Seran 90+ 1+   Total - 4+ Head on back to Iulus and hand over the bottles. He'll only take five regardless of how many you collected, so the rest are yours to keep. In return you get the Left and Right Hands of Zenithar.

Quick Walkthrough: (optional) Talk to Radd Hard-Heart about Orders. Travel to just north of Gnaar Mok. Kill the Bull and Betty Netch. Return to Radd.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders[edit] You may receive this quest from Radd Hard-Heart at Moonmoth Legion Fort or take the initiative after townspeople tell you about a pair of netch harassing Gnaar Mok. Find the Beasts[edit] You may find both netch together on an island just north of Gnaar Mok. There is a small footbridge to the island if you look carefully; it's very unobtrusive and made only of a few planks. You can kill both Netch without even starting the quest. Kill the Breeding Netch[edit] Find a bull and a betty - kill them to complete the quest. When killed, the game gives you the message: "You have killed a breeding Netch." Return to Radd.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Jim Stacey at Simine Fralinie's Bookshop in Vivec, Foreign Quarter for a new job. Travel to the Dren Plantation to eliminate Navil and Ranes Ienith. Find the brothers downstairs in Dren's Villa and kill them. Return to Jim in Vivec.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] Once you reach the rank of Mastermind, Jim Stacey, at Simine Fralinie's Bookshop in Vivec's Foreign Quarter Canalworks, asks you to kill two of the Camonna Tong's best enforcers, Navil and Ranes Ienith at the Dren Plantation (ask him about it to have it marked on your map, north of Vivec). The Brothers Ienith[edit] Navil can be found downstairs in Dren's Villa behind two locked (60) and trapped doors (the key is on the desk in front of the stairs by Orvas Dren). Be very careful when you decide to attack for as soon as you do, Ranes will appear behind you. There is also a guard in the house, wielding a Daedric katana. The brothers are a tough target, especially with their magic blades (one that paralyzes and one that poisons), so be prepared. Return to Jim once they are dead for a reward of a Ring of Shadow Form (Chameleon 6-15%).

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Iulus Truptor at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart for a new almoner mission. Travel to Ald'ruhn to collect some alms for the Buckmoth fund. Persuade the people in town to donate some gold. Return to Iulus to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Almoner Mission[edit] Iulus Truptor at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart will ask you to collect donations from citizens in Ald'ruhn for the Buckmoth fund. Buckmoth Alms[edit] You'll find the people in the town a little tougher than your previous donation runs. In general, all of the Dark Elves will completely ignore any attempts to get them to donate. Even the non-Dark Elf citizens will not donate as much and you may be hard pressed to collect the full 200 gold. To receive any donation, you will have to raise the subject's Disposition to at least 30.  To get a larger donation, you'll need to raise it to 70.  The Rat in the Pot seems to be the best place to go for donations. Being a member of the Thieves Guild will help you a lot here.  This is a list of people who will donate money: Name Location Donation   Disp 30 Disp 70   Aengoth the Jeweler The Rat in the Pot 30 60   Baradras Guild of Fighters 10 20   Cienne Sintieve Cienne Sintieve: Alchemist 10 20   Codus Callonus Codus Callonus: Bookseller 10 20   Dular gro-Buzga The Rat in the Pot 1 5   Edwinna Elbert Guild of Mages 10 20   Erranil Guild of Mages 1 5   Estoril The Rat in the Pot 1 5   Galthragoth Galthragoth's House 5 10   Hoki Morag Tong Guildhall 5 10   Lirielle Stoine The Rat in the Pot 5 10   Malpenix Blonia Malpenix Blonia: Trader 10 20   Merthierry Laelippe Ald-Skar Inn 1 5   Percius Mercius Guild of Fighters 10 20   Tauryon (wandering outside) 1 5   Tongue-Toad The Rat in the Pot 1 5   Yak gro-Skandar The Rat in the Pot 1 5   Totals 111 245 Return to Iulus with the donation proceeds. If you raised only 100 gold, you will receive a Scroll of Fphyggi's Gem-Feeder and a Scroll of Didala's Knack as well as five Imperial Cult reputation points and a five point disposition bump. At 200 gold, you also receive a copy of The Buying Game, a Mercantile skill book plus ten points of faction reputation and disposition.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Odral Helvi to learn your next assignment. Ask around the town about some stolen documents. Speak to Irgola and Elmussa Damori. Confront Elmussa. Either kill Elmussa or let her escape. Return to Odral Helvi.
Detailed Walkthrough: Business[edit] Odral Helvi in the Governor's Hall in Caldera will ask you to recover some stolen Caldera Mining Contracts from the Caldera Mine and find the thief. The Thief[edit] Asking around town about "Caldera mining contracts" will point you to the two newest people in town: Irgola and Elmussa Damori. Irgola denies any involvement, but Elmussa is somewhat less convincing. If you raise Damori's disposition to around 80 she will admit to the theft and give you the documents. A Plea for Mercy[edit] Although you are supposed to kill her, Damori will plead with you not to tell Helvi it was her and to spare her life. She is in the Thieves Guild and will also say that killing her will make you lose standing and just give you a key to get into the chest on the window. Grab the contract from the chest. Crassius Curio will also recommend letting her go free. The choice is up to you. Return to Helvi[edit] Return to Helvi to complete the quest. If you killed Elmussa he will be pleased, and reward you. If you let Elmussa escape, you can either lie to Helvi about the identity of the thief or tell him the truth. If you tell him the truth, he tells you that he will arrange to have Elmussa arrested - and she disappears from the game - and give you a reward. To lie successfully, Helvi must have a disposition towards you of at least 70. He will be disappointed and give you a smaller reward. If his disposition is below 70, he will not believe your lie and simply ask you again until you tell the truth. Rewards[edit] If you kill Elmussa: 1000 Drakes 2 Scrolls of Golnara's Eye-Maze 2 Scrolls of The Fourth Barrier + 20 Disposition, +5 Hlaalu Faction Reputation, +1 Reputation. If you let Elmussa escape then tell the truth: 1000 Drakes + 10 Disposition, +10 Hlaalu Faction Reputation, +1 Reputation. If you let Elmussa escape, first consulting Crassius Curio and telling him the truth, then lying to Odral (requires 70+ disposition): 1000 Drakes +5 Disposition, +10 Hlaalu Faction Reputation, +1 Reputation. If you let Elmussa escape then lie (requires 70+ disposition): 500 Drakes +5 Disposition, +10 Hlaalu Faction Reputation, +1 Reputation.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Ranis Athrys in the Balmora Guild of Mages for duties. Travel to all the Mages Guild branches and ask about spies. Acquire Tiram Gadar's credentials. Return to Ranis Athrys.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Ranis Athrys in the Balmora Guild of Mages believes that the Guild has been infiltrated by a Telvanni spy. You are to visit the Guild halls in Ald'ruhn, Vivec, and Sadrith Mora in order to find the spy and report back to Ranis. Finding the Spy[edit] Of course, the logical thing would be to just grab the Guild Guide, otherwise that's a lot of walking to do. In the Ald'ruhn and Balmora guild, nobody seems to have any idea about the spy. In Sadrith Mora, Skink-in-Tree's-Shade does suspect there is a spy but suggests that you check in Vivec where the Guild decisions are actually made. In Vivec, Trebonius Artorius denies the existence of spies, saying that his advisor Tiram Gadar keeps an eye out for that sort of thing. If you inquire further, Trebonius will give you Tiram's credentials which appear to be forged (Ocato's name is spelled wrong). Tiram will deny any accusation if you ask about the authenticity of the credentials, and every time you bring the topic his disposition towards you will drop by 5. You may tell Trebonius that Tiram Gadar is the Telvanni spy (who is very likely to be the actual spy); however, since Tiram is Trebonius' most trusted advisor, Trebonius will deny the truth and ignore your accusation, and your disposition with Trebonius will go down by 5 if Tiram Gadar is still alive. Upon returning to Ranis with the phony credentials, you are rewarded with an increase in Disposition, a Reputation point, two Scrolls of Summon Golden Saint, and Soul Drinker, an enchanted Daedric Dagger. Getting Ranis Athrys in Trouble[edit] There's an alternate ending to the quest if you let Itermerel and Tashpi live (during the Escort Itermerel and Kill Necromancer Tashpi Ashibael quests, respectively). When you talk to Trebonius, lie to him and report that Ranis Athrys is the spy and she will be kicked out of the Guild, with you still getting credit for completing the quest. You will still receive a Reputation point this way, in addition to some Faction Reputation, but you'll miss out on the scrolls and dagger that Ranis would have given you.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk with Ajira about duties. Find or buy a ceramic bowl. Return to Ajira for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Find a Ceramic Bowl[edit] Once you've obtained the flower samples for Ajira in the Balmora Guild of Mages, she will ask you to fetch a ceramic bowl. Ajira will provide 10 gold to cover the purchase cost, and suggests to try Ra'Virr, a trader next door to the Guild; but any ceramic bowl will do. Return to Ajira[edit] Once you return to Ajira, she will immediately bring up the next quest, without prompting you to complete this one. If you remember to chat with Ajira on the subject of "Ceramic Bowl", your disposition with Ajira raises slightly and you will be that much closer to another promotion in the Guild.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Edwinna Elbert about duties, then Chronicles of Nchuleft. Locate and obtain the book in question. Return to Edwinna to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Talk with Edwinna Elbert in the Ald'ruhn Guild of Mages about duties, and you'll find she is looking for a rare Dwemer book Chronicles of Nchuleft. None of the Guild halls have a copy, so she gives you 250 septims to go out and buy one, suggesting you try a bookseller. (The book's value is exactly 250 septims, and unless you've mastered your Mercantile skill, there will be a markup, so you'll have to spend some of your own cash on this.) Acquiring Chronicles of Nchuleft[edit] If you check the local bookshop in Ald'ruhn, Codus Callonus, the owner, suggests trying to find a copy in Vivec. Indeed, you can find a copy of the Chronicles of Nchuleft in Jobasha's Rare Books in Vivec, Foreign Quarter Lower Waistworks (a light green book).  Copies of the book can also be found at the following: Vivec: Redoran Records, Redoran Canton (have to steal, but is in a room with no one to see you take it) Office of the Watch, Temple Canton (have to steal) Library of Vivec, Temple Canton (have to steal) Hall of Justice Secret Library, Temple Canton (have to steal) Dorisa Darvel, Bookseller, Balmora (for purchase) Holamayan Monastery (have to steal) Vasesius Viciulus, Trader, Molag Mar (for purchase) Llarar Bereloth's place in Sulipund (have to steal or take as part of plundering Sulipund after another Mages Guild quest) Nchuleft (free for the taking) Tureynulal (free for the taking, but very dangerous) For those with the Tribunal expansion installed, this book is also located on the top shelf of the office of an Elder in Almalexia's Temple behind the Royal Palace where you arrive after being teleported from Ebonheart. It is difficult to steal from this location without a Chameleon spell as there are 3-4 people in that room at all times. For those with the Bloodmoon expansion installed, this book can also be found in the Imperial Cult Shrine in Fort Frostmoth in the room where Antonius Nuncius is located. Deliver the Book to Edwinna[edit] Return to Edwinna and give her the book, and you'll be rewarded with an increase in disposition. If you already had the book in your inventory, she compliments you on your scholarship and efficiency, but won't give you the 250 gold.

Quick Walkthrough: Enter the Ghostgate (east of Caldera and Ald'ruhn), get a map and explore the area. (Optional) Assault the seven Citadels of the Sixth House and kill the seven Ash Vampires, taking the magic items that each carries. Enter the Citadel of Vemynal, defeat Dagoth Vemyn to retrieve Sunder. Enter the Citadel of Odrosal, defeat Dagoth Odros to retrieve Keening. Enter Dagoth Ur in the crater of Red Mountain and confront Dagoth Ur in the Facility Cavern. Attack the Heart of Lorkhan with Wraithguard, Sunder, and Keening to destroy Dagoth Ur. Return to the Dagoth Ur Facility Caverns to meet Azura, view a cut scene, and receive a reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Vivec outlined a five-step plan to eliminate Dagoth Ur: Raids inside the Ghostfence, Raids upon Ash Vampire Citadels, Assault on Gate Citadel Vemynal, Assault on Gate Citadel Odrosal, and Assault on Citadel Dagoth. Phase 1: Raids inside the Ghostfence[edit] Enter either tower at the Ghostgate and ask a Buoyant Armiger for a Map of Red Mountain using the topic "inside the Ghostfence" (must be a Buoyant Armiger and not an Ordinator). Scout the Red Mountain region inside the Ghostfence to become familiar with the area's locations and monsters. Phase 2: Raids upon Ash Vampire Citadels[edit] This phase is optional. However, the following artifacts can be obtained by defeating the seven Ash Vampires: Belt of Heartfire, Amulet of Heartthrum, Amulet of Heartrime, Amulet of Heartheal, Amulet of Heartfire, Soul Ring, and Blood Ring. The artifacts are not required to beat Dagoth Ur, but can be of great use against his magic attacks. Ruins of Kogoruhn[edit] Kogoruhn, one of the Ash Vampire Citadels Main article: Kogoruhn The weakest Ash Vampire, Dagoth Uthol, is in Kogoruhn. Other than the main entrance to the ruins, there is also a doorway inside the northwest area of the Ghostfence. Dagoth Uthol can be found in the Charma's Breath area, and holds the Belt of Heartfire. If Dagoth Uthol was previously defeated during The Path of the Incarnate quest, then the journal stage will not be recorded. Citadel Vemynal[edit] See the Dagoth Vemyn and the Sunder Artifact section. Citadel Endusal[edit] Main article: Endusal Dagoth Endus is in Endusal, located to the northwest of the Ghostgate. He holds the Amulet of Heartrime. Citadel Odrosal[edit] Odrosal See the Dagoth Odros and the Keening Artifact section. Citadel Tureynulal[edit] Main article: Tureynulal Dagoth Tureynul is in Tureynulal, located to the northeast of Dagoth Ur. He can be found in Kagrenac's Library, and holds the Amulet of Heartthrum. If Dagoth Tureynul was previously defeated during the Tribunal Temple quest Cleaver of St. Felms, then the journal stage will not be recorded. Citadel Dagoth[edit] See the Dagoth Gilvoth section. Mamaea[edit] Main article: Mamaea Dagoth Araynys is in Mamaea, located to the southeast of Gnisis. He can be found in the Sanctum of Black Hope, and holds the Soul Ring. There is also some unique loot in the Shrine of Pitted Dreams bell chamber, including the Daedric Face of Inspiration and the Fang of Haynekhtnamet. Phase 3: Assault on Gate Citadel Vemynal[edit] Vemynal is located to the northwest of Dagoth Ur. Vivec marks the location of this citadel on the map after talking to him about the plan to defeat Dagoth Ur. Dagoth Vemyn and the Sunder Artifact[edit] Sunder Dagoth Vemyn can be found in the Hall of Torque (lower level), and holds the Amulet of Heartheal and Sunder artifacts. Phase 4: Assault on Gate Citadel Odrosal[edit] Odrosal is located to the southeast of Dagoth Ur. Vivec marks the location of this citadel on the map after talking to him about the plan to defeat Dagoth Ur. Dagoth Odros and the Keening Artifact[edit] Keening Dagoth Odros can be found in the Dwemer Training Academy (Level 2), and holds the Amulet of Heartfire and Dagoth Odros's Key. The Keening artifact can be found in the Tower area of Odrosal. The door to the Tower can be unlocked with Dagoth Odros's Key. Phase 5: Assault on Citadel Dagoth[edit] Dagoth Ur Citadel The Dagoth Ur Facility is located in the center of Red Mountain. Before assaulting the facility, three Dwemer artifacts are required: Wraithguard (gauntlet received from Vivec), Sunder (warhammer obtained in Citadel Vemynal), and Keening (short blade obtained in Citadel Odrosal). The easiest path to the citadel is to the southeast, and runs between Odrosal and the Yanemus Mine. The Outer Facilities entrance is blocked by a spherical door that can be opened with a hand crank found on a pipe to the south of the entrance. Dagoth Gilvoth[edit] Dagoth Gilvoth can be found in the Lower Facility of Dagoth Ur, and holds the Blood Ring. Dagoth Ur[edit] Dagoth Ur can be found in the Facility Cavern. He will not be hostile at first, and says it is up to you to make the first blow (although he may still attack first after a short period of time). Talk with him for a bit to gain some information, then attack when ready. There's no secret tactic to killing him the first time; just hit/cast hard and he should fall shortly. He will eventually disappear, leaving the Heart Ring near the entrance to Akulakhan's Chamber. Akulakhan[edit] The Heart of Lorkhan Once you enter Akulakhan's Chamber, you cannot leave by any means until the Heart of Lorkhan is destroyed, so make sure you are prepared. Heal up and equip Wraithguard, then Sunder. Dagoth Ur and his minions will attack immediately after entering the chamber. Dagoth Ur is effectively invincible at this stage, so you should ignore him and focus on reaching the Heart, which is found in the center of the great Dwemer golem, Akulakhan. It is possible to get Dagoth Ur out of the way temporarily by luring him off the cliff into the lava with Levitate. It's best to use Levitate or Slowfall to reach Akulakhan. Be aware that Dagoth Ur will teleport onto the bridge the first time you approach the heart. Strike the Heart of Lorkhan once with Sunder, then five times with Keening to destroy it. As soon at the Heart is destroyed, Akulakhan begins to collapse, so quickly run back across the bridge or get away by other means or you may be sent plummeting into the lava below. Dagoth Ur is now mortal, although you do not need to kill him yourself and he may fall into the lava and die as Akulakhan collapses on top of him. In any case, the destruction of Akulakhan ends his reign of terror. Azura's Reward[edit] Dagoth Ur after the blight Destroying the Heart unseals the door through which you entered the chamber, which can be re-opened by a crank on the pipes in front of it. Follow the ledge back around to the top (or fly up) and open the door. As you leave the cavern where you first met Dagoth Ur, Azura will appear before you and a cutscene will begin, outlining your accomplishments and revealing that with Dagoth Ur's death the blight plaguing the land is gone. She will leave the Ring of Azura on the ground, which will disappear after leaving the area. When the ring is picked up, a misnamed spell called Hand of Dagoth (with ID hand of azura) will be cast on you. This spell is a 100 pts Restore Attributes spell (restores all attributes except Personality and Intelligence). There will be no more blight or ash storms, though some creatures may still be affected. Any remaining Ash Vampires will perish in their lairs, leaving behind their unique artifacts. Sleepers in towns will also wake from their nightmare. Congratulations! You have finished Morrowind's Main Quest!

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Athyn Sarethi for duties. Find a Suspicious Ash Statue in Varvur Sarethi's room. Talk to Varvur about the statue. Speak to Athyn Sarethi to learn what to do with the statue. Take the statue to Lloros Sarano. Return to Athyn Sarethi.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Athyn Sarethi in his manor in Ald'ruhn will ask you to clear his son's name in the murder of Bralen Carvaren and find out what actually happened. Athyn will tell you that he is innocent of the crime and that Bralen was a friend. Keep talking to him to learn that he thinks that his son Varvur may be under a spell, after which he will ask you to check his room in the Sarethi Guard Quarters. An Ash Statue[edit] As you search Varvur's room, you will come across a Suspicious Ash Statue, which seems quite odd because nobody mentioned that Varvur was a Sixth House cultist. Talk to Varvur about the statue to learn that he has been having strange dreams since he received the statue, and he will ask you to take it. Getting Rid of the Statue[edit] Talk to Athyn Sarethi again about the statue and he'll direct you to Lloros Sarano at the Tribunal Temple in Ald'ruhn. Give him the statue and talk about the murder of Bralen. Sarano will instruct you to talk to Athyn Sarethi to arrange a meeting. Travel back to the Sarethi manor and inform Athyn Sarethi to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Uvoo Llaren at the Temple in Ghostgate for your duties. Travel to Tureynulal to recover the Cleaver of St. Felms. Find the body of Mendel Eves in the Bladder of Clovis and get the axe. Return to Uvoo to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Uvoo Llaren in the Ghostgate Tribunal Temple asks you to recover another artifact, the Cleaver of St. Felms in the Ash Vampire lair of Tureynulal, on the slopes of Red Mountain. Cleaver of St. Felms[edit] Tureynulal (also known as Kagrenac's Library) is inside the Ghostfence region, northeast of the volcano crater. The cleaver can be found on the body of Mendel Eves in the lower level (Bladder of Clovis). Watch out, though, as there are many ash creatures in these ruins, including the ash vampire Dagoth Tureynul. Return to Uvoo Llaren with the axe for her congratulations.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Bolrin about Further Assistance and Information gathering. Get the list from Audenian Valius, beware of the summoned Hunger.
Detailed Walkthrough: Prerequsites[edit] To get this quest you must have previously completed the note delivery for Llaalam Dredil in Castle Ebonheart, as well as The Enchanter's Rats quest for Audenian Valius in the Telvanni Canton in Vivec. Further Assistance[edit] Once these two are done, talk to Bolrin in the East Empire Company Hall mentioning Further assistance and Information gathering. Bolrin will ask you to retrieve a list from Valius in order to learn exactly what he has been selling and to whom. Getting the List[edit] The list is in Valius' back room on a shelf in plain sight. The catch is that the clever Valius has enchanted the note to summon a Hunger if anyone but himself picks up the note. Obtain the list by any means necessary and return it to Bolrin for a 700 gold reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Eydis Fire-Eye about orders. Retrieve the code book from Sottilde. Return to Eydis Fire-Eye for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Code Book[edit] Eydis Fire-Eye in the Balmora Guild of Fighters asks you to retrieve a code book currently held by Sottilde at the South Wall Cornerclub in Balmora. If you check with Percius Mercius he'll tell you that the mission seems okay but that you should try to avoid killing Sottilde. He calls her a "pushover" and suggests you talk her into handing it over. Confronting Sottilde[edit] Sottilde is just inside the Cornerclub entrance.  Her response to your inquiry about the code book -- as well as your choices on how to acquire it -- will depend upon the factions that you belong to: If you are not a member of the Thieves Guild, Sottilde will refuse to give you the code book right away.  In fact, she may deny even having it. You have two choices: Increase her disposition above 70, and she should give you the book. Taunt her until she attacks you.  You can kill her, grab the code book, and get away without incurring a bounty. If you are a member of the Thieves Guild, she will refuse to hand it over regardless of her disposition (raising it to 100 or lowering it to zero does not matter). Again, you have two choices: Kill her. You can use Taunt or Frenzy to trigger her into attacking you so you don't get a bounty, or you can just plain kill her, but you will be expelled from the Thieves Guild and gain a bounty.  If you can kill her without being detected, you will not be expelled and can loot it from her body. Steal the book.  Find a spot where the other characters can't see you picking her pocket.  Using  Chameleon will help avoid being caught while doing so. Return the Book to Eydis[edit] Once you have the book, return to Eydis for an increase in faction reputation, and 50 drakes.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Galos Mathendis at the Telvanni Council House in Sadrith Mora for chores. Travel to Tel Fyr to deliver a coded message to Divayth Fyr. Get Divayth's response. Return to Galos to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Galos Mathendis in the Telvanni Council House in Sadrith Mora will ask you to deliver a coded message to Divayth Fyr. Deliver a Coded Message[edit] Divayth Fyr can be found in his tower, Tel Fyr, in the islands southwest of Sadrith Mora. Simply deliver the message to the wizard at the top of his tower and receive his response. To help you get there, Galos gives you seven potions of healing, four potions of water walking and four potions of swift swim. He does not, however, give you any Levitation potions, and once you are inside the tower you will need to Levitate in order to reach Fyr's room at the top. Don't worry if you lack a Levitate spell or enchantment; you can buy Rising Force Potions from Anis Seloth and Arangaer in town. Return to Galos with Fyr's reply to complete the quest and receive 500 drakes.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Tuls Valen in the Ald'ruhn Tribunal Temple for your duties. (Optional) Learn the spell Rilm's Gift (or a similar Cure Blight Disease spell). Travel to Maelkashishi to show compassion and cure Bulfim gra-Shugarz. Find Bulfim just inside the entrance and cure her. Return to Tuls to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Tuls Valen in the Ald'ruhn Tribunal Temple asks you to show compassion and cure Bulfim gra-Shugarz, a Sheogorath worshipper in Maelkashishi. You are given a Potion of Cure Blight Disease, but Tuls suggests you learn the spell Rilm's Gift (or a similar Cure Blight Disease spell) and return the expensive potion. Rilm's Gift can be bought from Folvys Andalor upstairs in the Temple. An Act of Compassion[edit] Maelkashishi can be found roughly northeast of Gnisis (southeast of Khuul) along the hill and mountain line. It is a Daedric shrine, so it is easy to spot. Bulfim can be found just inside the entrance and should not attack you on sight, though you may be attacked if you go further into the shrine. Cast a Cure Blight spell or give her the potion to cure her. Return to Tuls for your reward: a copy of The Four Suitors of Benitah, a Restoration skill book, and further praise if you return the potion as well.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Eno Hlaalu at the Morag Tong headquarters in the Hidden Area of the Vivec Arena for special duties. Go to the Foreign Quarter to contact the Dark Brotherhood. Talk to Miun-Gei in the Lower Waistworks and find out about Tsrazami. (Optional) Talk to Tsrazami on the Plaza and persuade her to meet with Eno Hlaalu. Return to Eno to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Special Duties[edit] Once you reach the rank of Thrall, you can ask Eno Hlaalu in the Vivec Morag Tong about special duties. The first mission is to contact the Dark Brotherhood, an old offshoot of the Morag Tong and currently deadly enemies. You are to contact them through the Vivec enchanter, Miun-Gei in the Lower Waistworks section of the Foreign Quarter. A Contact in the Dark Brotherhood[edit] If you raise Miun-Gei's disposition enough, he'll tell you that his contact is a Khajiit named Tsrazami on the Plaza. You can also find this out by searching Miun-Gei's bedroom downstairs; a letter from Tsrazami is in his chest of drawers secured with a level 80 lock. It can be unlocked with a key he carries. At this point, you can return to Eno with the information about the Dark Brotherhood contact, or act on your own initiative and persuade Tsrazami herself to meet with Eno Hlaalu (you may need to raise Tsrazami's disposition to 90 or above). There is no reward unless you persuade Tsrazami, in which case Eno will give you two Scrolls of Inasi's Mystic Finger and two Scrolls of Invisibility. Return to Eno with the information about the Dark Brotherhood contact to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Duke Vedam Dren to learn your next assignment. Travel to the High Fane and speak with Archcanon Tholer Saryoni. Go to Assemanu and find the Robe of St. Roris. Return the robe to Archcanon Tholer Saryoni. Report back to Duke Vedam Dren.
Detailed Walkthrough: Business[edit] Once you reach the rank of House Father, Duke Vedam Dren in the Grand Council Chamber in Ebonheart will ask you to help control Berel Sala's Ordinators, and tells you to speak with Archcanon Tholer Saryoni on the matter. Archcanon Saryoni's Deal[edit] The Archcanon can be found in the High Fane in Vivec and will agree to control the Ordinators if you recover the Robe of St. Roris from the shrine of Assemanu, a holy artifact the Ordinators have failed to recover. Retrieving the Robe[edit] Assemanu is on a small island southeast of Seyda Neen, and west of Vivec's Hlaalu Canton. There is a key on a dead Ordinator's body before you enter into the shrine area that lets you in. The robe is in a well hidden chest at the end of the shrine, where you encounter Dagoth Hlevul, on a ledge which can only be accessed with a Levitate spell, Jump, Telekinesis, or a high Acrobatics skill and Strength attribute by jumping on the big rock to the left. Controlling the Ordinators[edit] Return to Saryoni with the robe and give it to him in return for him agreeing to speak to Berel Sala about the Ordinators. Return to Duke Vedam in Ebonheart to complete the quest and get promoted to Councilman.

Quick Walkthrough: Return to Caius in Balmora and talk with him to learn of a possible Corprus cure. Travel to Tel Fyr, give Divayth Fyr the Dwemer artifact, and talk with him. Retrieve the Dwemer Boots of Flying from Yagrum Bagarn deep within the Corprusarium. Receive the cure from Divayth.
Detailed Walkthrough: Finding Divayth Fyr[edit] During the last quest to destroy the Sixth House base near Gnaar Mok, you contracted the apparently incurable Corprus Disease. While you have Corprus, the disposition of anyone you talk to will drop significantly, so it's a good idea to return to Caius as soon as possible. Back in Balmora, Caius is shocked to hear of your condition, but believes there may be hope. He has learned from Fast Eddie, a local Telvanni expert, that a Telvanni wizard named Divayth Fyr runs a Corprusarium deep beneath his tower in Tel Fyr, dedicated to the study of Corprus disease, and is your best chance for a cure. Apparently, Fyr is a collector of Dwemer artifacts, and Caius provides you with a Dwemer Coherer to help raise Divayth's disposition. You will also receive 1000 gold to pay for your expenses and a few levitation potions for use in the tower. The artifact weighs 40 pounds, so be sure you're able to carry that much. Tel Fyr is on an island in the eastern archipelago of Vvardenfell, in the Azura's Coast Region. Caius will mark it on your map if you ask him about it, and suggests you speak with Sondryn Irathi at the Sadrith Mora Fighters Guild for detailed directions. The fastest way to get there is to take a Guild Guide over to Sadrith Mora; alternatively, you can take a boat to Sadrith Mora from Ebonheart. Meet with Divayth Fyr[edit] Once inside Tel Fyr, Onyx Hall, you should talk to Beyte Fyr, a Dark Elf woman, across from the entrance to find out that Divayth is in his study, accessible by the main fly well. The fly well is upstairs in the Hall of Fyr, inside and to the right of the entrance. If you need more Levitation or Invisibility potions, you can steal them from a shelf in the bedroom on the main floor of the Hall of Fyr. Levitate up and find Divayth, dressed in Daedric armor and standing in front of a purple crystal. Give him the Dwemer artifact and ask him about corprus disease. You may have to additionally raise his Disposition through persuasion or other means in order to get him to talk to you. Divayth has plenty to say about the disease, but mention that you may fulfill the Nerevarine Prophecies and he will quickly offer you an experimental and possibly fatal cure for Corprus. However, before he agrees to give you the cure, he will ask you to fetch a pair of enchanted boots from Yagrum Bagarn in the Corprusarium below and return them to him. On the face of it, this is a menial chore, but Fyr's real intention is for you to see the place in which you will spend the rest of your life if the cure doesn't work. If you have angered Divayth previously by killing some of the members of the Corprusarium, you may be able to persuade him to assist you, either with conversation or magic, but if you have killed the warden, he and his daughters will attack you when you talk to them. Sometimes Divayth is extremely mad about what you have done, and presents you with no conversation options except "Goodbye". Fortifying your personality may fix this issue, changing his greeting dialogue to allow you to speak with him. The best way to achieve this is by using several Telvanni Bug Musk potions, which can be bought from Cienne Sintieve. If all else fails, you can use the console to advance the quest by entering SetJournalIndex A2_3_CorprusKiller 30. The Corprusarium[edit] Yagrum Bagarn The Corprusarium is downstairs, through the Onyx Hall. Before you enter, you will encounter the warden Vistha-Kai who will tell you not to harm the inmates, though they certainly have no qualms about hurting you. This is a good place for Invisibility or Chameleon if you have it, or a good Sneak skill. If you have Drain Fatigue or Damage Fatigue magic, you can use that (or the Hand-to-hand skill) to knock out the Corprus Stalkers and Lame Corpruses in the area, without triggering any alarm on the part of the Fyrs or Vistha-Kai (even if you injure the Corprus creatures a bit while knocked out, as long as you kill none of them and hit them with no weapons or damaging spells). The easiest strategy may be to simply run past the Corprus victims and head straight for the Corprusarium Bowels while ignoring any attacks. Fortunately, once you enter the Corprusarium Bowels, none of the inmates you encounter will be hostile towards you. Yagrum is in the central cave, and is hard to miss. He will give you the Dwemer Boots of Flying and has some interesting comments on the disappearance of the Dwemer. Once you have the boots, there is a trick to getting the Corprus victims not to attack you on the way out. Uupse Fyr, who may be found near Yagrum, will tell you that she can calm the victims with soothing drum rhythms if you find and bring her a guarskin drum which the inmates are prone to walk off with. Any guarskin drum will do, but unless you happen to have brought one with you you'll need to find the one in the Corprusarium. Return it to Uupse, and you will be able to leave the Corprusarium unmolested. Alternatively, you can use the same tactics you used on the way in to return straight to the Corprusarium entrance. The Cure?[edit] Return to Divayth, give him the boots, and accept the potion. It turns out that the potion doesn't actually cure you, but just removes the negative effects of the disease. Therefore, you have the complete disease resistance that Corprus gives, but no loss of attributes. Note that most of the 1000 gold Caius gave you wasn't needed (depending on how you got to Tel Fyr), meaning you're a bit richer too. You can now return to Caius in Balmora for the next stage of the main quest. If you return to Fyr at a later point in the game, he will tell you that the potion doesn't seem to work on the rest of his cases and that he killed two of his most desperate patients while testing it. Apparently you are an exceptional case, though as you may have found out, the Nerevarine is supposedly protected from death by prophecy.

Quick Walkthrough: Discover Ernil's body beneath a large stone arch north of Balmora. Search his body to find a note and skooma pipe. Return both to Tsiya in Balmora to receive 50 gold and 10 Moon Sugar.
Detailed Walkthrough: Ernil Omoran[edit] Walking out of Balmora's northern gate, towards Caldera, past the bridge at the intersection of the road to Pelagiad you will soon see a large stone arch on the right just off the trail. Under this arch you can find the body of Ernil Omoran. Search his body to find a note to Tsiya and a skooma pipe, both of which you should take. Tsiya[edit] Travel back to Balmora and find Tsiya's home facing the Odai River on the west side. Tsiya is in her house, and her door is locked (50 points). Once inside, speak to Tsiya about Ernil's note by using the topic "Someone in Particular," and you'll be able to exchange it for 50 gold and 10 samples of moon sugar.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Frald the White at Hawkmoth Legion Garrison in Ebonheart about orders and courtesy. (Optional) Visit Codus Callonus, the bookseller in Ald'ruhn and ask about The Red Book of Riddles. Go to Ghostgate and enter the Tower of Dusk Lower Levels and talk to Salyn Sarethi about courtesy. Return to Frald the White to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders[edit] Frald the White at the Hawkmoth Legion Garrison in Ebonheart tells you to meet with the Buoyant Armiger Salyn Sarethi in a contest of wit, poetry and honor. Defend the Honor of the Legion[edit] Apparently Salyn has been saying that the Legion has no courtesy and it's up to you to defend its honor. When you meet with Salyn on the lower level of the Tower of Dusk in Ghostgate, he clarifies that he thinks the Imperial Legion has no courtesy, wit, poetry or honor. Ask about the riddle to learn more about the contest, which is a series of three riddles you must answer in rhyme. If your Intelligence is less than 50, however, Salyn will first recommend you pick up a copy of The Red Book of Riddles from the Ald'ruhn bookstore. At the bookstore Codus Callonus will give you a copy when you ask him about it. Alternatively, you can find copies of this book in many other places. The riddles are not particularly difficult and the correct answer is always the third choice. However, you must either have an Intelligence of at least 50 or have The Red Book of Riddles in your possession, or you will not be able to give the correct answers. Report back to Frald[edit] Report back to Frald for a copy of 2920, Second Seed, a Speechcraft skill book as well as a nice Faction, Reputation and Disposition increase. If you failed the riddle contest, you don't get the book, though the quest is still completed (just don't kill Salyn).

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Uvoo Llaren at the Temple in Ghostgate for your duties. Travel to Dagoth Ur to recover the Crosier of St. Llothis. Find the body of Voruse Bethrimo in the Inner Tower and get the staff. Return to Uvoo to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Uvoo Llaren in the Ghostgate Tribunal Temple asks you recover yet another artifact, the Crosier of St. Llothis in the crater of Red Mountain in Dagoth Ur's own stronghold. Crosier of St. Llothis the Pious[edit] From the Ghostgate, follow the path straight up the mountain, though you may need a Levitate spell to get past the last part and into the crater. The staff can be found beside the body of Voruse Bethrimo (who has a set of glass armor) in the Inner Tower accessed through the Inner Facility of the ruins. Be cautious of the powerful creatures you will encounter in the ruins. Return to Llaren with the crosier for her congratulations.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Volrina Quarra in Druscashti. Travel to Ginith Ancestral Tomb near Ald Velothi. Slay the vampire Irarak and his Followers. Return to Quarra.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Cult of Lord Irarak[edit] The Quarra Clan leader, Volrina Quarra, at the bottom of Druscashti, will ask you to kill the vampire Irarak who has set himself up as a god. Slaying the fiend[edit] Irarak can be found in the Ginith Ancestral Tomb, southwest from Ald Velothi. The tomb is small and you should quickly find Irarak inside. You won't actually be attacked immediately and can chat with Irarak and five of his 'followers'. You now have a choice whether to kill him or let him bribe you. If you follow the bribe route, you'll be 1000 gold richer but once you return to Volrina, her disposition drops 30 points and you are kicked out of the Clan, so this is obviously not the recommended route. You can however take the bribe and kill everyone anyway and you won't be kicked out of the clan. Return to Volrina once Irarak is dead to receive access to the Clan's services (Areas and Kjeld). If you already killed Irarak, Volrina still gives you the choice of whether or not to take the quest, but lets you straight into the clan if you accept.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Galos Mathendis at the Telvanni Council House in Sadrith Mora for chores. Obtain three potions of Cure Blight Disease to deliver them to Andil in Tel Vos: Either get them from Pierlette Rostorard in town. Or pick them up somewhere else. Travel to Tel Vos and give the potions to Andil in the Services Tower. Return to Galos to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Galos Mathendis in the Telvanni Council House in Sadrith Mora will ask you to deliver three potions of Cure Blight Disease to Andil in the alchemy shop in Tel Vos who is in need of them. Cure Blight Potions[edit] Unfortunately, he neglects to actually give you the potions so you'll need to pick three up from Pierlette Rostorard in town. If you raise her Disposition above 90, she will give them to you for free. Otherwise you'll have to pay for them or pick them up somewhere else. There are actually two potions you can pick up within the Council House itself. Another (less legal) choice is to go to the alchemist in Tel Mora, who has 5 crates with 4 cure blight potions each along with an interesting note on the nearby chest.  Note that only purchased or found potions will do.  Potions you make yourself via Alchemy will not be accepted. Deliver the Potions[edit] Once you have the potions, take a boat to Tel Mora and then to Vos. You'll find Andil at his shop in the Services Tower. Return to Galos once you've delivered the potions to complete the quest and receive 500 gold.

Quick Walkthrough: (Optional) Find the book Vampires of Vvardenfell, v II. (Optional) Find a rare document, The Private Papers of Galur Rithari, Buoyant Armiger. Travel to Bal Ur and speak to the statue of Molag Bal. Travel to Dubdilla and slay his daughter, Molag Grunda, and her atronach consort, Nomeg Gwai. Return to Molag Bal's statue to receive the cure.
Detailed Walkthrough: Getting a clue[edit] You can talk with many people across Vvardenfell on the topic of vampirism, and vampirism cure to receive a wide variety of advice. Mages and sorcerers will suggest you read the rare book Vampires of Vvardenfell, v II, which you may have come across in your travels or through a number of quests. This volume has actually been banned by the Tribunal Temple, explaining its rarity. If you don't have the book, seek out Skink-in-Tree's-Shade in the Mages Guild at the Wolverine Hall or any bookseller to learn more about it and be directed to Jobasha's Rare Books. Retrieving the book is actually a task that Skink will give you as part of the Mages Guild quests. The few copies that do exist can be found at: Jobasha's Rare Books, Foreign Quarters Waistworks in Vivec (look for it on the top level, large red book). Hall of Justice Secret Library in Vivec. Mawia, a wizard's lair southeast of Molag Mar. Odirniran, east of Molag Mar. Vas, far west of Dagon Fel. Tel Vos' Central Tower. Galom Daeus, west of Tel Uvirith (in the Observatory-levitation needed). Tureynulal, Kagrenac's Library, west of Dagoth Ur. Even more clues[edit] Even though this book contains some clues as to what to do to cure yourself of vampirism, this quest is not really activated until you also find a much rarer document, The Private Papers of Galur Rithari, Buoyant Armiger, which can only be found in Galom Daeus, Tureynulal, and the Hall of Justice Secret Library (hidden under a book near the Ordinator). Maybe Molag Bal will help?[edit] Either source should spell out the steps required to be cured of the disease. You must first travel to the Daedric shrine at Bal Ur, north of Suran. Enter the shrine and inside speak with Derar Hlervu who will tell you to speak with the statue.   But first, help a concerned father out[edit] The statue, Molag Bal, will ask you to travel to the cave Dubdilla and kill his daughter, Molag Grunda, and her atronach consort, Nomeg Gwai (levitation is important). Molag Bal is apparently displeased about the company his daughter has been keeping.  A Cure for Vampirism[edit] Return to the shrine once the pair are dead and your Vampirism will be permanently cured. You will lose all the skills and attributes gained when you became a vampire and the amulet you got from your clan will no longer teleport you to your clan's hideout. Your character cannot become a vampire again (you can still contract Porphyric Hemophilia, you just won't turn into a vampire three days later).  Notes[edit] Molag Bal erroneously states that Dubdilla is below Mt. Assarnibibi. This error is further made apparent with ESO, with Dubdil Alar Tower built on top of where Dubdilla would later be. If you do not plan on becoming a vampire to complete this quest, you can "finish" it by using the Journal Console Command (Journal MS_VampireCure 50). You will not be able to become a vampire again and the path to Molag Grunda in the cavern Dubdilla will be blocked by rocks. Quest Stages[edit] The following Journal ID and Index codes can be used with the Journal console command to manually update the quest to a certain point.   A Cure for Vampirism (MS_VampireCure)  Index Finishes Quest Journal Entry 10I have found a [sic] some papers by a Buoyant Armiger, Galur Rithari. In them, he gives hints as to how vampirism may be cured. It suggests that the cure may be obtained with the help of a Daedra Prince, perhaps Molag Bal. 20In Molag Bal's shrine in Bal Ur, I spoke with Derar Hlervu. She has told me that she knows of no cure for vampirism, and that only the Daedra Lord himself will be able to help me. 30I have spoken to Molag Bal through his statue in the shrine at Bal Ur. He tells me that he does not have the cure for my vampirism, but he will get it for me if I do him a favor. His daughter, Molag Grunda, has been consorting with a Frost Atronach named Nomeg Gwai. If I can kill the two of them, returning their souls to a realm where Molag Bal may punish them, Molag Bal will give me the cure. They live now in the cave Dubdilla, south of Vos. 40I have succeeded in killing Molag Grunda and her paramour, Nomeg Gwai. 50Finishes questI've returned to the Shrine of Molag Bal and spoken with the Daedra Lord. He was pleased with my efforts, and has retrieved the cure from the Daedra Vaermina.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Tharer Rotheloth at the Temple in Molag Mar for your duties. Travel to Tel Mora to cure Lette. Find Lette wandering outside just north of Tel Mora and cure her with a potion or spell. Return to Tharer to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Tharer Rotheloth in the Molag Mar Tribunal Temple asks you to cure a villager in Tel Mora called Lette, who has swamp fever and has nowhere to go to be healed. You will need either a Potion of Cure Common Disease or a Cure Common Disease type spell or scroll. Cure Lette[edit] The quickest route to Tel Mora is to grab a boat from Molag Mar to Tel Branora, Sadrith Mora, and finally Tel Mora. Lette can be found wandering outside just north of Tel Mora. If you cure Lette with a spell or scroll you will gain +25 Disposition with her. If you give her a potion, it will be +20.  Note that home-brew potions will not work.  You must purchase or find an existing Potion of Cure Common Disease. Return to Tharer once you cure Lette for a reward of 2920, Rain's Hand (a Restoration skill book) and a Disposition boost.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Uvoo Llaren at the Temple in Ghostgate for your duties. Go south of the Ghostgate to cure Assantus Hansar. Find Assantus in an Ashlander camp and cure him with a potion or spell. Return to Uvoo to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Uvoo Llaren in the Ghostgate Tribunal Temple asks you to cure Assantus Hansar in Ahinanapal, an Ashlander camp just south of the Ghostgate. You will need either a Potion of Cure Common Disease or a similar spell. Cure the Ailing Ashlander[edit] Assantus and his two friends are just south of the Ghostgate, within sight. Cure Assantus but be wary of his friends who might attack you on sight. A Calm Humanoid spell might be of use here. You will receive the +20 disposition with Assantus only if you give him a potion. Note that home-brew potions will not work. You must purchase or find an existing Potion of Cure Common Disease. Return to Llaren for a reward of three Potions of Cure Common Disease.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Galos Mathendis at the Telvanni Council House in Sadrith Mora for chores. Find some Daedra skin to deliver to Master Aryon. Give the skin to Master Aryon in Tel Vos to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Galos Mathendis in the Telvanni Council House in Sadrith Mora will ask you to find some Daedra skin to deliver to Master Aryon in Tel Vos. Daedra Skin[edit] Daedra skin is not actually found on any Daedra (see bugs), with the exception of one quest-specific daedroth, Menta Na. Your best bet is to find a vendor that stocks it. See Daedra Skin for a list of locations where you can find it. Take the Daedra skin to Master Aryon in Tel Vos to complete the quest and receive 300 drakes and the Paralysis spell.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Baladas Demnevanni at Arvs-Drelen in Gnisis for chores. Travel to the Dwemer village of Bthungthumz to retrieve the Ring of Dahrk Mezalf. Get the ring from Mezalf's corpse. Return to Baladas to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Once you reach the rank of Mouth, Baladas Demnevanni at Arvs-Drelen in Gnisis will ask you to find an ancient summoning ring belonging to Dahrk Mezalf who worked as a smith under the great Dwemer inventor Kagrenac (whom you may have heard of already). Baladas believes that the ring can be found in the Dwemer village of Bthungthumz. Dahrk Mezalf[edit] Bthungthumz is located northwest of Maar Gan and southwest of the Urshilaku Camp. The ruins inside are quite small and you should quickly find Mezalf's Spirit haunting the place. Return to Baladas with the ring for a reward of a Shock Centurion guard (unless you killed it before) and a Ring of Lightning Storm. The guard will follow you around for the rest of the game, or until it dies. Use recall or intervention to escape if you don't want the guard to follow you.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Tuls Valen in the Ald'ruhn Tribunal Temple for your duties. Travel to Hassour to wipe out a dark cult residing in the cavern. Kill Dagoth Fovon in the shrine. Return to Tuls to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Once you reach the rank of Disciple, Tuls Valen in the Ald'ruhn Tribunal Temple will ask you to wipe out a dark cult residing in the cavern of Hassour, southwest of the Moonmoth Legion Fort at the end of the Foyada Mamaea. Dark Cult in Hassour[edit] The cavern has the usual assortment of creatures for a Sixth House base, Dreamers, Ash Slaves, and Ghouls, and Dagoth Fovon in the shrine. There is also a Greater Bonewalker, so be sure to have Restore Strength and Endurance spells or potions handy. There's lots of good loot, so be sure to look around. Return to Tuls for your reward of two Potions of Cure Blight Disease and two Scrolls of Daerir's Blessing. This is the last quest you receive from Tuls.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Aengoth the Jeweler at The Rat In the Pot in Ald'ruhn for a new job. Go to Llethri Manor to steal some Darts of Judgement from Eindel. Find the darts on her bed, in the Guard Quarters. Return to Aengoth to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] Aengoth the Jeweler at The Rat In the Pot in Ald'ruhn will ask you to steal some Darts of Judgement from Eindel in the Llethri Manor in Ald'ruhn. The Darts of Judgement[edit] The Llethri Manor is just to the left of the Council Chambers in the Manor District. Eindel can be found just to the right of the entrance inside the Manor, but she will tell you nothing of the darts (and doesn't have them on her; time to find out where she sleeps). Eindel keeps the darts lying on her bed in the Guard Quarters (west from the Entrance Hall). There are four darts on her bed (last one on the left side from walking in) and watch out for the guards when you steal them. When you return to Aengoth with the darts, he gives you the choice of keeping them or selling them to the Guild. If you sell them, you'll get 500 gold per dart. He will also remove any bounty you may have incurred during the quest. This is Aengoth's last quest. Reward[edit] Your reward depends on how many darts you decide to turn in.  If you keep them all, you can still complete the quest, but you won't get any reward for it. Darts Gold Disp. Rep.   0 0 0 0   1 500 5 2   2 1000 7 3   3 1500 10 4   4 2000 15 5

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Duke Vedam Dren to learn the steps to become Grandmaster. Travel to the Dren Plantation to win control of the Camonna Tong. Either persuade Orvas Dren, blackmail him, or kill him. Report back to Duke Vedam Dren.
Detailed Walkthrough: Business[edit] In order to become Grandmaster of House Hlaalu, Duke Vedam Dren in the Grand Council Chamber in Ebonheart will tell you that you must win control of the Camonna Tong from his brother, Orvas Dren, in the Dren Plantation north of Vivec.  An alternative is to kill Orvas, thus removing the Camonna Tong's influence from House Hlaalu: but Vedam will obviously not be pleased at this, since Orvas is his brother (although he will do no more than indicate his displeasure, and still give you the Grandmastership). Persuading Orvas Dren[edit] There are a number of ways to accomplish this, including killing him (which is possibly most difficult, as he is a high-level character). If you are persuasive enough, you can get Orvas to agree to give control of the syndicate to you - in this case his disposition towards you increases by ten. Alternatively, you can find an incriminating note in his basement and blackmail him into giving you control. Grandmaster[edit] Return to Duke Vedam Dren in Ebonheart to complete the quest and be named Grandmaster of House Hlaalu.

Quick Walkthrough: Chat with people about latest rumors to find out about the missing tax collector, Processus Vitellius. Find the body of Processus Vitellius in the wilderness northwest of town and collect the tax record from it. Inform Socucius Ergalla in the Census and Excise Office. Chat with people about Murder of Processus Vitellius. Locate Vitellius' girlfriend, Thavere Vedrano. Find the murderer and collect a reward. Return Processus Vitellius' Ring to Thavere for an additional thank-you.
Detailed Walkthrough: Missing Tax Collector[edit] When you're conversing with folks around town, you'll discover that the local tax collector, Processus Vitellius, has not been seen for a few days. If you wander through the wilderness near the water a short distance (within sight) northwest of town, you will come across his body lying among a cluster of rocks and trees. Alternatively, you can head due west from Fargoth's house. Collect the tax record, 200 gold, and some common clothes from his corpse and return to town. Go to Socucius Ergalla in the Census and Excise Office (the gentleman who let you pick your class) and talk to him about the man you found dead. If you return the gold you recovered from the corpse, Socucius will ask you to find the killer of the tax man. The Grieving Girlfriend[edit] Ask around town, and you'll learn that Processus had a girlfriend who resides in the lighthouse. Go and talk with Thavere Vedrano and learn that Processus recently had an argument with Foryn Gilnith. Furthermore, an examination of the tax records found on Processus will reveal that Foryn happens to have the largest unpaid tax amount. The Killer[edit] Find Foryn Gilnith in town. Gilnith will admit to the murder and tell you that he believed that Vitellius was corrupt and was raising the taxes so that he could keep the extra gold for himself. It is up to you whether you spare Gilnith from the guards or turn him in. If you choose to spare him he will thank you and out of sympathy he will give you Processus Vitellius' Ring for you to return to Thavere Vedrano. Vedrano will then give you two Restore Health potions for returning the ring. On the other hand if you tell Gilnith that you will turn him in to the guards, he will become hostile, forcing you to kill him. If you kill Gilnith you will receive 500 gold from the Census and Excise office. You can also take Vitellius' ring from Gilnith's corpse and return it to Vedrano in exchange for two Standard Restore Health Potions.

Quick Walkthrough: Chat with Nileno Dorvayn about business and Ralen Hlaalo. (Optional) Ask around town about Ralen Hlaalo, and you'll hear rumors that Nine-Toes the Argonian killed him. (Optional) Chat with Nine-Toes, who will deny killing Ralen Hlaalo. Take the key you received from Nileno Dorvayn and enter Hlaalo Manor; chat with Ralen's servant, Uryne Nirith. Ask around Balmora about the murderer's description, and you'll be informed that Thanelen Velas meets the description. Kill the offender, and report back to Nileno Dorvayn to complete the quest and receive your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Death of Ralen Hlaalo[edit] Nileno Dorvayn at Balmora's Hlaalu Council Manor will ask you to find the murderer of House noble Ralen Hlaalo in town and kill him. If you are a member of House Hlaalu, she will also give you a key to the manor. If you ask around town, you'll receive conflicting information. Ralen Hlaalo: [Hlaalu] "Why not ask Ralyn Hlaalo's servant? She's probably still in Hlaalo Manor. I don't think she has anywhere else to go." [Altmer] "I heard an Argonian murdered Ralen Hlaalo." [Dunmer] "I heard that Nine-Toes the Argonian killed him." [Argonian] "I have heard only false rumours. Nine-Toes cannot be the murderer." [Imperial] "I heard that a red-haired Dunmer was seen leaving Hlaalo Manor the day that Ralen Hlaalo was murdered." [Khajiit] "%Name has heard nothing of the murder. %Name minds %Name's business" [Breton] "Yes, it's just terrible." [Redguard/Bosmer/Nord/Orc] "Who?" Talk to Ralen's Servant (Optional)[edit] If you investigate Hlaalo Manor, you can find a witness to the crime: Uryne Nirith, Ralen's servant. Once you locate Uryne, who's sequestered in a small bedroom on the second floor of Hlaalo Manor, chat with her and she informs you that she witnessed the murder. She gives you a description of the murderer, whom she identifies as a young Dunmer with red hair, bonemold armor, and a Dwarven War Axe. With this information, you can ask around town again and you'll be pointed towards Thanelen Velas (of the Camonna Tong) in the Balmora Council Club: murderer's description [Non-Dunmer] "I don't know anyone like that." [Dunmer] "That could be Thanelen Velas at the Council Club over by the Silt Strider." Confronting Nine-Toes (optional)[edit] Nine-Toes is in his house in town and will deny any involvement in the crime.  You can choose to kill Nine-Toes and report back to Nileno Dorvayn to complete the quest, or you can choose to give him the benefit of the doubt and investigate further. If you choose to kill Nine-Toes, just take note that he is a member of the Blades, which means that you may get expelled from the Blades, thus making it harder to finish the Main Quest. Confronting Thanelen Velas (optional)[edit] Thanelen Velas is on the first floor of the Balmora Council Club. If confronted about Ralen Hlaalo, he says that you are mistaken, and that Nine-Toes is the murderer. If confronted with the description of the murderer, he'll say it's just coincidence, and reiterate that Nine-Toes is at fault. Bringing a Murderer to Justice[edit] At this point, you have a couple of options. You can kill either Velas or Nine-Toes, or both if you want to make sure. Nileno will accept either or both deaths as sufficient vengeance. Return to Nileno in Balmora to finish the quest and receive your reward of 1,000 gold septims, and a House Hlaalu faction reputation increase of +10.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Neminda in the Redoran Council Hall in Ald'ruhn for duties. Travel to Ald Velothi to deliver a potion. Hand the Cure Disease potion to Theldyn Virith. Return to Ald'ruhn.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] After taking care of Drulene Falen's mudcrab problem, Neminda asks you to deliver a Cure Disease potion to Theldyn Virith at the outpost in Ald Velothi. Getting to Ald Velothi[edit] The task itself is quite straightforward, but getting to Ald Velothi can be an adventure. There are two simple ways to reach the village. The first is to take the Silt Strider to Gnisis and then travel north to Ald Velothi. The other is to take the Silt Strider to Khuul; from there, take the road or follow the coast southwest until you reach Ald Velothi. Delivering the Potion[edit] Once you arrive, find Theldyn Virith and simply give him the potion. He can usually be found in the outpost tower. Report back to Neminda in Ald'ruhn to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Chat with Nileno Dorvayn about business and Bivale Teneran. Travel to Ald'ruhn and locate Bivale Teneran's clothing shop in Ald'ruhn-under-Skar. Deliver the scroll with the orders to Bivale Teneran. Return to Nileno to complete the quest and receive your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders for Bivale Teneran[edit] Nileno Dorvayn at the Balmora Hlaalu Council Manor will ask you to deliver orders to House spy, Bivale Teneran, in the Ald'ruhn Manor District, which is under Skar. Bivale keeps an eye on things in Ald'ruhn for House Hlaalu. Travel to Ald'ruhn and Deliver the Orders[edit] Travel to Ald'ruhn; the quickest routes are via Mages Guild Guide or Silt Strider. Bivale is a wealthy clothes merchant, and her shop can be found in the Ald'ruhn Manor District, under Skar, on the lower left side. Chat with Bivale about scroll and you'll give her the orders; in return she'll give you a free outfit, some extravagant pants and an exquisite shirt. Completing the Quest[edit] Return to Nileno in Balmora to finish the quest. You receive another 500 gold.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Eydis Fire-Eye in the Balmora Guild of Fighters about orders and debt money. Visit Helviane Desele in Suran and ask about debt money. Collect the debt money. Return to Eydis Fire-Eye for more orders, payment, and possible advancement.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders[edit] Eydis Fire-Eye in the Balmora Guild of Fighters asks you to collect 200 gold of debt money from Helviane Desele, who runs a cornerclub in Suran (northeast of Vivec). She apparently owes a client of the Guild, Manos Othreleth on the Dren Plantation. Collecting the Debt[edit] Helviane is found behind the counter at Desele's House of Earthly Delights in Suran, and at first refuses to pay the debt money. If you raise her Disposition high enough (75), she will eventually agree to pay and give you the money. You can also try to pickpocket her. Otherwise, kill her and loot the money from her corpse. Once you have the debt money, return to Eydis for an increase in faction reputation, and half the debt, 100 gold.

Quick Walkthrough: Chat with Sugar-Lips Habasi about jobs and diamonds. Steal a diamond from Nalcarya of White Haven or acquire one in any way. Return to Sugar-Lips with the diamond to complete the quest and receive your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] Chat with Sugar-Lips Habasi in the South Wall Cornerclub in Balmora about jobs and she will ask you to steal a diamond for a friend. Sugar-Lips will suggest that you steal the diamond from Nalcarya of White Haven, the local alchemist. To complete the quest, you don't have to steal it from Nalcarya, you can buy one or acquire one in any way. Stealing the Diamond[edit] Should you decide to follow Sugar-Lips' suggestion, Nalcarya has a total of six diamonds. There are three diamonds in a locked (20) chest upstairs above her bed, two diamonds on the shelves next to her, and one in her inventory. Sugar-Lips only needs one diamond. You can keep the extra. Return to Sugar-Lips Habasi for a reward of an exclusive invisibility potion, and a 10-point increase in disposition.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Endryn Llethan at the High Fane in the Vivec, Temple Canton for your duties. Go to the Arena Canton to convince Tanusea Veloth to leave the city. Find Tanusea in the pit and convince her to leave. Return to Endryn to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Endryn Llethan in the High Fane of the Vivec's Temple Canton asks you to convince Tanusea Veloth to leave the city, since she has contracted Corprus and may spread the incurable disease to others. Endryn suggests that since she is a devout pilgrim, she may be impressed if you show your devotion to the Temple's teachings. Llethan only knows that she is somewhere in the Arena Canton. Tanusea's Exile[edit] Make your way north to the Arena and find Tanusea in the pit (you should be able to ask people where she is, but you have to talk to Llethan again to get any dialogue topics for her; check the northeast corner). Talk with her, and if your disposition is at least 80, you can convince her to leave Vivec as a favor to you. Alternatively, if you have a copy of Saryoni's Sermons on hand, you can quote from that, and she will leave. Return to Endryn for your reward of two Potions of Cure Blight Disease.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Nileno Dorvayn about business and say that again; Nileno will task you with intercepting orders for a dead Redoran. Nileno will give you a helmet to disguise your face when you approach Neminda. Find Neminda in the Redoran Council Hall under-Skar in Ald'ruhn. Wear the helmet when you use the code words Orphan of Arnesia. Retrieve the orders, and return them to Nileno for your reward of 500 gold and the helmet she gave you.
Detailed Walkthrough: First Order of Business[edit] For your first task as a House Hlaalu member, Nileno Dorvayn at the Balmora council manor instructs you to intercept the orders of a dead Redoran from Neminda in the Council Hall under-Skar in Ald'ruhn. Conveniently, your voice seems to match that of the Redoran. If you are male, the dead Redoran's name is Felsen Sethandus; if female, the dead Redoran is Relmerea Saram. Nileno informs you that the dead Redoran was disfigured in battle, and therefore always wore their Redoran helm in public. Intercept Orders[edit] Nileno will give a Native Gah-Julan Bonemold Helm, similar to those commonly worn by House Redoran, and you are to wear it at all times when around Neminda. Note that while it may look just like any other bonemold helm, even in name, Neminda can tell the difference somehow, so you must use the specific helm you're given. No other bonemold helm will do. Travel to the Redoran Council Hall under-Skar in Ald'ruhn, and locate the Redoran quest-giver Neminda, who should be just inside the front door. The two quickest pathways to Ald'ruhn are through the Mages Guild Guild Guide, or the Silt Strider. Wear the helmet when chatting with Neminda. Once you meet Neminda, you are to use the code phrase Orphan of Arnesia to identify yourself and collect the parcel. Neminda seems none the wiser, and gives the parcel to you for delivery. Completing the Quest[edit] Though Neminda tells you to take the parcel to Maar Gan, you are to instead return it to Nileno in Balmora. She will congratulate you and reward you with 500 gold. She says you can keep the helmet she gave you too.

The Orders[edit] Hrundi in the Wolverine Hall Fighter's Guild asks you to check into some problems at the Dissapla Mine for the client Novor Drethan. The mine is northeast of the Dunmer stronghold Falensarano on the mainland, west of Tel Aruhn (ask him about Falensarano to have it marked on your map). The Problems[edit] Novor is found just inside with a few miners and tells you that they have had problems with Nix-Hounds attacking the miners and have lost their healer, Teres Arothan. You are to go down into the mine and bring back Teres if he's still alive. Rescuing Teres[edit] Teres can be found down the mine, along with a few Nix-Hounds of course. Talk to him in order to escort him back to Novor. Once you reach Novor, Teres will stop following you, and if you speak with Novor you will receive four pieces of raw glass as a reward. Return to Hrundi for your 250 gold reward.

Divided by Nix Hounds[edit] Just west of Ald'ruhn, on the road past the Silt Strider port, you will find Falanu Indaren standing alone. Speak to her to learn that she was separated from her husband when they were attacked by several nix-hounds. Falanu believes that her husband, Drerel fled west. Eliminate the Threat[edit] Kill several hounds in the area west-northwest of the wife. Drerel is hiding behind some boulders further northwest, not too far from Falanu. If you are having trouble finding him, look for a three way junction in the road and then travel north. Speak to him and lead him back to his wife to receive a copy of A Dance in Fire, Chapter 2, a Block skill book. If you happen to find Drerel before Falanu, you should be able to complete the quest as well (in that case, you start the quest by speaking with Drerel and Falanu won't have any unique dialogue).

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Iulus Truptor at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart for a new almoner mission. Travel to Caldera to collect a promised pledge of 500 gold from Cunius Pelelius. Blackmail Cunius into fulfilling his pledge. Confront Cunius with the evidence to receive three pieces of Raw Ebony, which you may be able to sell for more than 500 gold. Return to Iulus to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Almoner Mission[edit] Iulus Truptor at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart will ask you to collect a promised pledge of 500 gold from Cunius Pelelius, owner of the Caldera Mine. Donation from Cunius Pelelius[edit] Cunius can be found just inside the door to the Governor's Hall. You can talk to him, and persuade him all you want, but you'll find he won't agree to give anything to you. There are two ways of blackmailing him into donating the pledge: Of all the people in the Hall, only Olumba gro-Boglar in the South Hall upstairs will be of any assistance. Olumba will tell you that Cunius is solving his money troubles by skimming from the ebony mine and smuggling ebony. If you visit the mine to the southwest of Caldera and speak with the slaves, this rumor will be verified (you may need to persuade the slaves to talk). Return to Cunius with this information. If you go through the door to your right (if standing behind his desk) and go up the stairs, you'll come to Odral Helvi's bedroom. You can go through the door on the left and up the stairs also, you end up in Odral Helvi's office, just continue on to the next room. You need a pretty good Security skill, but there is a chest with a ledger in it for the mine. Take the book back to Cunius and use the option "show him the book". Both ways will squeeze three pieces of Raw Ebony from him, which you should be able to sell for more than 500 gold (depending on your Mercantile skill). Return to Iulus with the money to receive the following scrolls: Scroll of Black Despair, Scroll of Elevram's Sty, Scroll of Lord Mhas' Vengeance, Scroll of Savage Might, Scroll of The Gambler's Prayer, Scroll of Alvusia's Warping.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Master Neloth at the Upper Tower in Tel Naga in Sadrith Mora for chores. Travel to Tel Aruhn to get the Robe of the Drake's Pride from Senise Thindo. Talk to the people there to learn that Thindo is in the tower's living quarters. Kill Thindo to get the robe. Return to Neloth to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Councilor Neloth in the Upper Tower in Tel Naga in Sadrith Mora will ask you to retrieve for him the Robe of the Drake's Pride. The robe is currently in the possession of Senise Thindo, a servant of Archmagister Gothren. The Robe of the Drake's Pride[edit] Travel to Tel Aruhn and talk to people there to find out that Thindo is in the tower's living quarters. Unfortunately, you must kill her to retrieve the robe. Taunting her is a good way to kill her without getting expelled. Return the robe to Neloth to receive some disposition and 10 gold. Note: The robe has very useful enchantments, so you may want to keep it instead of returning it.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Urshamusa Rapli. Follow the directions to the White Guar. Retrieve the Amulet and return it to Rapli.
Detailed Walkthrough: Dreams[edit] Speak with Urshamusa Rapli in the Ahemmusa Camp to learn that she has been dreaming of a White Guar which she believes has been sent to help her tribe, and she wants you to find it for her. Find the White Guar[edit] The guar's general location is northwest of Tel Vos. Rapli suggests that you start looking somewhere near a fork in the path, like she saw in her dream, in an area with stone fingers. Head out on the path to the west of the camp and keep following west and south. Past the Sinamusa egg mine, you'll find a T in the road with five stone fingers. The guar should be nearby, though it may have wandered a short distance away. Retrieve the Clan's Amulet[edit] Once you approach it, the guar should begin to move west. Follow it and once it stops explore the area to find the corpse of Ashamanu. On the corpse you'll discover the Amulet of Ashamanu (a minor Restore Health and Cure Blight Disease item). Return the amulet to Rapli to receive the Shield of the Undaunted, a light armor shield with a minor Restore Fatigue Cast When Used enchantment. Though the amulet may be more useful if you don't feel bad about keeping it.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Llaalam Dredil in Ebonheart to receive a task to deliver a Letter From Llaalam Dredil to J'Zhirr. Give the letter to J'Zhirr and receive a Letter From J'Zhirr. Return the letter to Llaalam Dredil to receive your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Errands[edit] Talk to Llaalam Dredil on the second floor of Castle Ebonheart and receive the task of delivering a letter to J'Zhirr in Ebonheart's East Empire Company Hall. Find J'Zhirr in the East Empire Company Hall and talk to him about the delivery for Llaalam Dredil. J'Zhirr will take the letter and give you one in return to deliver back to Llaalam Dredil. Deliver J'Zhirr's letter to Llaalam Dredil and receive a 75 gold payment. Feel free to read the letters; though they may not make immediate sense at the moment, they will come into play in other quests.

Quick Walkthrough: Lorbumol gro-Aglakh asks you to kill a Khajiit named Dro'Sakhar, who has a bounty on his head. Go to St. Olms Canton and ask around about Dro'Sakhar. Find Dro'Sakhar in the southern canals of St. Olms. Kill him and return to Lorbumol for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Your New Orders[edit] Lorbumol gro-Aglakh at the Guild of Fighters in Vivec will tell you about a bounty on the Khajiit Dro'Sakhar, but he doesn't know where he is, other than he may be in St. Olms. St. Olms Canton[edit] Asking around in St. Olms you will notice that nobody seems to know this Khajiit in particular, but they will tell you about a shady Khajiit character living in one of the homes off the south-side canal. Dro'Sakhar[edit] Dro'Sakhar lives in Canal South-Two. He is a very weak thief, so you shouldn't have a problem killing him. You will also not incur a bounty under any circumstances. There are no interesting items in his room, only a few alchemical ingredients and some clutter. After returning and talking to Lorbumol, you will get a 500 gold reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Daric Bielle at Desele's House of Earthly Delights in Suran. (Optional) Talk to people in town. Talk to Dranas Sarathram to learn that Haj-Ei is Argonian for Hides-His-Eyes. Make a choice on whom to aid.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Drunken Bounty Hunter[edit] Stop by Desele's House of Earthly Delights in Suran and speak with the bounty hunter at the bar, Daric Bielle. Bielle has been hunting for a particular slave, the Argonian Haj-Ei, and hasn't been having much luck, even though he has hired a guide by the name of Hides His Eyes to aid him. Detective Work[edit] Ask people around town about both Haj-Ei and Hides-His-Eyes, though you might have to increase their disposition to high levels to get them to talk. On the Haj-Ei topic, you will be directed to the slave trader Dranas Sarathram in town. If you have an intelligence of 70 or above, his mention of the Argonian language will trigger you to realize that Hides-His-Eyes is just a direct translation of the Argonian name Haj-Ei. Otherwise, you must raise his disposition above 60 for him to spell out the connection to you. Decisions, Decisions[edit] You can then tell Bielle immediately.
