He won't believe you but you will get the 150 gold reward anyway. Or find Haj-Ei / Hides-His-Eyes on the top floor of the Suran Tradehouse. He will ask you to keep his secret. If you decide to keep his true identity a secret, you will receive a +5 faction bonus with the Twin Lamps guild. If you want to turn him in, you get a -5 faction penalty instead, and Haj-Ei will attack you. Return to Bielle when he is dead for the 150 gold reward. If you double-cross Haj-Ei by agreeing to keep his secret but then tell Bielle anyway, Haj-Ei will attack you if you speak to him again. Note that if you are an Argonian with an intelligence higher than or equal to 50, or have an intelligence greater than 90, you'll get the dialogue option to complete the quest with Bielle right away.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Faral Retheran for duties. Find Rothis at the Flowers of Gold cornerclub in the Redoran Canton. Bring Rothis 10 Standard Restore Health Potions, and raise his Disposition above 50. Watch the duel in the Vivec Arena. Report back to Faral.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Faral Retheran in the Redoran Treasury in Vivec's Redoran canton will ask you to convince Rothis Nethan to fight a duel that he has chickened out of. Rothis is found at the Flowers of Gold cornerclub, also in the Redoran Canton. You will need to talk to Retheran about duel before the option to talk about it appears on Rothis. Rothis Nethan[edit] When you speak with Rothis Nethan, he will beg to not duel with his opponent, Brethas Deras, who is a well known fighter. In order to persuade Rothis, you'll have to bring him 10 standard restore health potions as well as raise his Disposition above 50. You can buy the potions from various merchants in the city, as homemade potions won't work. Rothis will suggest that you get the potions from Relms Gilvilo at the Redoran Temple Shrine, located on the bottom floor of the Redoran Waistworks. Give the potions to Rothis and he will ask you to go to the Arena and watch the duel. Return to Retheran once the duel is finished to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Athyn Sarethi for duties. Go to Venim Manor and challenge Bolvyn Venim to a duel in the Vivec Arena. Travel to the Arena and defeat Bolvyn in the duel. Once Bolvyn is dead, you become the new Archmaster.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Athyn Sarethi in his manor in Ald'ruhn will tell you Archmaster Bolvyn Venim will never allow an outlander to become Archmaster of House Redoran and that the only way to win the leadership of the House is to challenge Bolvyn Venim to a duel. The Duel[edit] Go to Venim Manor and talk to Bolvyn Venim to challenge him to a duel. He will greet you by challenging you to duel to the death in the Vivec Arena. Take a Guild Guide or Silt Strider over to Vivec, and enter the Arena to find Bolvyn. He is a tough opponent if you attack him one-on-one as he is heavily armored (ebony) and has a Daedric Dai-katana. Of course, he has no ranged weapons or spells so feel free to take him out from a distance as your honor won't be ruined. Healing potions and scrolls are helpful of course. Once Bolvyn is dead, you automatically become the new Archmaster. You may take what you want of his possessions, but some Redorans consider this dishonorable.

Quick Walkthrough: (Optional) Speak with Sirilonwe. Find three portions of vampire dust. Return to Sirilonwe.
Detailed Walkthrough: More research[edit] Speak with Sirilonwe at the Mages Guild in Vivec's Foreign Quarter Plaza once Shashev is dead to receive her next quest. She will ask you to retrieve three portions of vampire dust to aid her in her research. Finding the Dust[edit] The dust can be commonly found on dead vampires, or the occasional alchemy shop that has it in stock (Ald'ruhn Mages Guild, Sadrith Mora, Balmora and Tel Aruhn all have alchemists that carry it, although they may not want to deal with you if you're a vampire). Return for your reward[edit] Return to Sirilonwe with the three portions of vampire dust to receive the Amulet of Gem Feeding as a reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Imsin the Dreamer in Buckmoth Legion Fort about Orders. Travel to Ald'ruhn, and search Drinar Varyon's house. Grab the Dwemer Tube hidden among the red pots on the table. Return to Imsin the Dreamer and report your findings.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders[edit] Imsin the Dreamer in the Buckmoth Legion Fort will ask you to find proof that Drinar Varyon is smuggling artifacts through Ald'ruhn. Find Evidence of Smuggling[edit] If you've done some of the Hlaalu faction quests, you might already know that Drinar is a smuggler. At any rate, you'll need to enter Drinar's house and have a look around (his house can be found on the west side of Ald'ruhn, by the Ald Skar Inn). The door is unlocked, and Drinar is home. If you take a careful look around, you will find a single Dwemer Tube among the red pots on the large table near Drinar, who doesn't mind if you take it. Return to Imsin[edit] Return to Imsin with the evidence (the Dwemer Tube) to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Baladas Demnevanni at Arvs-Drelen in Gnisis for chores. Acquire the books: Nchunak's Fire and Faith, Chronicles of Nchuleft, and Antecedants of Dwemer Law: Either buy them from Dorisa Darvel in Balmora and Jobasha's Rare Books in the Foreign Quarter in Vivec; or steal them from the Tribunal Temple's secret library in Vivec, or from Holamayan Monastery. Return to Baladas to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Baladas Demnevanni at Arvs-Drelen in Gnisis will ask you to find three books: Nchunak's Fire and Faith, Chronicles of Nchuleft, and Antecedants of Dwemer Law. Fortunately, though the books are rare, they are not terribly difficult to find. Buying the Books[edit] If you have the money, the easiest method is to simply buy the books from Dorisa Darvel in Balmora (who has both Chronicles of Nchuleft and Nchunak's Fire and Faith), and Jobasha's Rare Books in the Foreign Quarter in Vivec (who has both Chronicles of Nchuleft and Antecedants of Dwemer Law). If you have some spare gold, Ethes Evos at Arobar Manor in Ald'ruhn will sell you a copy of Antecedants of Dwemer Law for 300 gold.  While he claims it's much less than the book is worth, the actual base value of the book is 25 gold, and while you won't get it for that price unless you're a real master of Mercantile, it will still be much less than the non-negotiable 300 he will charge for it. Stealing the Books[edit] All three books can be found in the Tribunal Temple's secret library in Vivec; and in the Holamayan Monastery. The Tribunal Temple's Secret Library in Vivec is a difficult route. It is well hidden, cracking its locks will be a crime if observed, and once inside you'll have to watch out for the Ordinator guards when you steal the books. Holamayan Monastery is found on a large but distant and obscure island on the east of the map, far north of the Shrine of Azura. You may have already found it as a part of the Main Quest (you can also reach it via a boat from Ebonheart's docks, but only after having advanced fairly far in the Main Quest). Unfortunately its entrance is only available at the hours of dawn and dusk.  The books are guarded by monks, whom you are supposed to have as allies (eventually if not yet), so stealing from them needs stealth, as at the Secret Library. The Temple in Gnisis also conveniently has two copies of Antecedants of Dwemer Law. See the individual book links for more locations. Delivering the Books[edit] Return to Baladas with the three books to complete the quest and receive a number of his 'trinkets' as a reward. This includes: Ondusi's Key, Amulet of Admonition, Second Barrier Belt, and the Surefeet shoes.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Jim Stacey about Bal Molagmer. Go to the Hall of Justice to steal a Large Dwemer Goblet from Berel Sala's office. Get the goblet, which is sitting on the desk in front of Sala's nose. Donate the goblet to Danso Indules, who is outside near the High Fane. Return to Jim to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] For the seventh (and last) quest in this series, Jim asks you to steal a Large Dwemer Goblet from Berel Sala's office in the Hall of Justice, Vivec, Temple Canton. Once you have the goblet, donate it to Danso Indules, who is outside the High Fane. The Dwemer Goblet[edit] Sala can be found in one of the Justice Offices, and he has the Large Dwemer Goblet on the desk in front of him (rather a challenge). Indules should be found in the tunnel outside in the center of the Temple Canton and once again, give the goblet to her in the name of the Bal Molagmer. Return to Jim  for his congratulations.

Quick Walkthrough: Chat with Edwinna Elbert about duties. Travel to Arkngthunch-Sturdumz in search of a Dwemer Tube. Find a tube in the ruins. Return to Edwinna for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Edwinna Elbert in the Ald'ruhn Guild of Mages wishes you to travel to Arkngthunch-Sturdumz to find a Dwemer Tube for her research. Finding a Dwemer Tube[edit] The ruins are northwest of Gnisis but you can also get there by traveling to Ald Velothi and following the coast to the west. If you happen to have a Dwemer Tube already, you can give that to Edwinna, as any Dwemer tube will do. You can find them in many Dwemer ruins; check the crates, chests, and barrels. Upon returning to Edwinna with the tube you are rewarded with an additional ten increase in disposition, to go with the five you already received when you accepted the mission.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Balen Andrano in the Trader shop in the Redoran Canton. Plant a Dwarven Bone close to Jeanne. Return to Balen for your reward of a Sleep Amulet. (Optional) You can get another reward if you get rid of the menace for Jeanne.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Dwemer's Bone[edit] Speak to Balen Andrano in the Redoran Trader shop in the Waistworks level of the Redoran Canton in Vivec. Apparently his business has been doing poorly lately, a trend that he attributes to the trader Jeanne on the Foreign Quarter Canalworks level. Voodoo[edit] He asks you to plant a magic item, a Dwarven Bone, in a chest near her bed in an attempt to lower her sales. You can find the chest in Jeanne's locked back room, so the trick here is to unlock that door without Jeanne seeing you. If she sees you, then you will get Journal entry 55 and will be unable to finish the quest. You can either count on your own Sneak skill, use a helpful Chameleon spell or item, or get the key on the table in the left corner of the shop (which also requires sneaking). The chest inside is also locked but with the door closed, Jeanne will be none the wiser. Return to Balen once you've planted the bone to receive a Sleep Amulet as a reward. But Wait, There's More![edit] If you travel back and speak with Jeanne, you'll find that lately her customers have been scared off by a Dwarven Spectre haunting the premises, and she even asks you for your help. You can either kill the ghost, which is in her bedroom, or remove the cursed bone from the chest. If you do not even want to open the bedroom door and deal with the ghost, you can simply buy the bone from her. (It appears in her inventory upon placing it in the chest.) Speak with Jeanne again afterwards to receive a Steel Shardmauler. Talk about working both sides...

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Archcanon Tholer Saryoni for your duties. Travel to Mount Assarnibibi to visit the shrine there. Find the shrine at the top of the mountain in a ring of seven large stones and activate it to receive the Ebony Mail. Return to Tholer to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Once you have completed the Pilgrimages of the Four Corners and achieved Master rank, find Archcanon Tholer Saryoni in his quarters in the High Fane in the Vivec's Temple Canton. He will send you to Mount Assarnibibi and visit the shrine there. Mount Assarnibibi[edit] Mount Assarnibibi is in the Molag Amur region of southeastern Vvardenfell, northeast of Mount Kand (which is north of Molag Mar). The shrine is at the top of the mountain in a ring of seven large stones. Activate the shrine to receive the Ebony Mail. Return to Saryoni in Vivec to receive his acknowledgment of the pilgrimage (you get to keep the mail) and a promotion to Patriarch of the Tribunal Temple.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Eydis Fire-Eye for orders. Travel to Shulk Egg Mine and talk to the miners about some poachers. Enter the mine and find the Queen's Lair. Enter the Queen's Lair and kill the two egg-poachers. Return to Eydis for payment and possible advancement.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders[edit] Eydis Fire-Eye in the Balmora Guild of Fighters asks you to take care of two egg poachers in the local Shulk Egg Mine, just south of town, for its owner Dram Bero. The mine is located along the Odai River south-southwest of Balmora. Acquiring Information on the Poachers[edit] Chat with two egg miners outside the mine to learn the identities of the suspected poachers.  Two former egg miners, Sevilo Othan and Daynila Valas, are the suspected poachers. Proceed into the mine and find the Queen's Lair (there are two entrances) where the Kwama Queen is located. The Egg Poachers[edit] The poachers will attack as soon as you enter the Queen's Lair.  Once they have been defeated, you can return to Eydis Fire-Eye to complete your assignment.  You will receive 100 gold and four Quality Restore Fatigue Potions.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Jim Stacey about Bal Molagmer. Travel to Ghostgate to return the blade Enamor which was wrongfully stolen from Salyn Sarethi. Place the blade and the Note to Salyn Sarethi in Salyn Sarethi's chest in the Tower of Dusk. Return to Jim to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] For the fourth quest in this series, Jim Stacey asks you to return the blade Enamor, which was wrongfully stolen from Salyn Sarethi. The blade was a gift from Vivec himself and the Guild does not want to be blamed for its theft. Return the blade and a note to Salyn Sarethi's chest in the Tower of Dusk in Ghostgate. Enamor[edit] The Ghostgate, if you haven't traveled to it yet, is in the center of the island at the south of Red Mountain, roughly northeast from Caldera and east-southeast from Ald'ruhn. Salyn can be found in the Lower Levels of the Tower of Dusk, and his unlocked chest is nearby (it is labeled with his name, so there should be no confusion). If you talk to Salyn, he admits he was ashamed to report Enamor was stolen. Return to Jim in Vivec for his congratulations.

Quick Walkthrough: Hear Latest Rumors about a rat problem. Talk to Audenian Valius at the Telvanni Enchanter shop in the Telvanni Canton. Kill the two rats in his bedroom. Kill ten rats in the Underworks. Return to Audenian for a reward of a Grand Soul Gem.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Enchanter's Rats[edit] Ask around for the latest rumors in Vivec's Telvanni Canton and you'll hear about a rat problem that Audenian Valius has been having on the Waistworks level in his enchanter shop. Talk to Audenian Valius and you'll find that he wants you to kill some rats (which are actually Telvanni sewer rats) and that he's got two holed up in his bedroom. Even more Rats[edit] After dispatching the two rats in his shop, he claims that he wanted ALL of the rats killed and points out that he believes they are crawling up from the Underworks (sewers) of the Canton. Investigate the Telvanni Underworks to find 10 more rats that need to be killed. The rats should not appear before the quest is active, and you should receive a journal update when you kill the last one. Some of the rats may be in the water, even possibly swimming along the bottom and never coming up to attack you. Return to Audenian for a reward of a Grand Soul Gem.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Hrundi at the Fighter's Guild in Wolverine Hall for your orders. Go to Tel Naga Great Hall, Upper Tower in town and find the outlaw Engaer. Kill him. Return to Hrundi.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Orders[edit] Hrundi in the Wolverine Hall Fighter's Guild asks you to kill Engaer, an outlaw in Tel Naga in Sadrith Mora. Hrundi suggests to avoid the guards as he doesn't need further trouble with the Telvanni. Killing Engaer[edit] Tel Naga Great Hall is just north of Wolverine Hall. There are two entrances into the Upper Tower, one high up from outside and one from inside the Lower Tower. You will need some form of levitation to reach either entrance. Engaer can be found in the northwest room of three trapped and locked (20) doors in the Upper Tower. The area is guarded by a single guard who is very close by, doesn't wander and stares you down continuously. You can taunt the guard into attacking if your sneak skill isn't high enough to untrap and unlock the door(s) undetected.  Several residents hold a Key to Tel Naga, which will open this door. Once you get in the room you should be able to finish Engaer off without interruptions. The easiest way is to taunt him into attacking. If you use a Chameleon spell you should be able to sneak behind him and attack without alerting the entire tower; a high level of Sneak can be used to similar effect, especially if you kill him in a single blow. A low-effort exploit that will ensure his demise (without much risking your own) is simply to attack once to get him to chase you, then run and jump over the hole leading to the lower floors of the tower. NPCs' AI is too rudimentary for them to jump or cast Levitate/Slowfall, so he'll simply run right in and fall to his death. Return to Hrundi for your 1,000 gold reward (half of the bounty).

Quick Walkthrough: (Optional) Buy a mazte for Ennbjof at the tavern in Telvanni Canton. (Optional) Listen to his story and receive an old key. Travel to Marvani Ancestral Tomb. Explore the tomb until you find the entrance to Tukushapal, Sepulcher. Enjoy the treasures.
Detailed Walkthrough: A Drink and a Chat[edit] Grab some mazte and have a chat with Ennbjof at The Lizard's Head Tavern on the Telvanni Canton's Waistworks level in Vivec.  In order for him to tell you the secret, you'll need to give him the mazte.  Once done, he'll give you an old key and a story about an old burial chamber on a small island off the west coast of the peninsula between the Daedric Shrine of Zaintiraris and Tel Branora. He then goes home to Skyrim to die of mazte poisoning, never to be seen again. Unfortunately, these directions are rather vague and could refer to any number of tombs within the area. Within the Tomb[edit] The tomb in question, however, is the Marvani Ancestral Tomb and it is north of Tel Branora and slightly west of Zaintiraris/Molag Mar (northeast of the Prelude Shipwreck). If you head west-northwest from Tel Branora you should be able to find the entrance on the southern shore of a small island. If you have sufficient Security skill to open the 80 point lock in the back, you can explore the tomb without speaking to Ennbjof. Olmgerd's Buried Ship[edit] Once inside, you'll quickly realize that this is no ordinary tomb. Once down the long flight of stairs, you are faced with a small maze of sorts. One end of the maze ends with a door with the name of Tukushapal, Sepulcher (levitation comes in handy if you don't like mazes, even simple ones). Inside is the burial chamber of Olmgerd the Outlaw, the illegitimate son of a Nordic king, who was laid to rest in a ship. There's all sorts of loot including a Daedric helm and warhammer sitting beside a chest far above the ship (which will require levitation to reach), and some Raw Ebony deposits in the water beneath the ship (but watch out for the Dreugh).

Quick Walkthrough: Chat with Nileno Dorvayn about business and ebony trade. (Option 1) Travel to Ebonheart and chat with Canctunian Ponius; convince him to buy ebony from House Hlaalu. (Option 2) Travel to the Sudanit Mine and kill Darns Tedalen. Return to Nileno in Balmora to complete the quest and receive your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Ebony Trade for House Hlaalu[edit] Nileno Dorvayn at Balmora's Hlaalu Council Manor will inform you that Canctunian Ponius at the East Empire Company in Ebonheart has threatened to buy ebony from House Redoran unless House Hlaalu lowers its ebony prices. Nileno asks you to either convince Canctunian Ponius to continue buying ebony from House Hlaalu, or shut down the Redoran Sudanit Mine by killing the head of mining operations, Darns Tedalen. Option 1: Convince Canctunian Ponius[edit] Travel to Ebonheart and talk to Canctunian Ponius; he is in a back room at the East Empire Company Hall, down near the docks in Ebonheart. The people of Ebonheart will direct you to him if you ask them: Canctunian Ponius "He's in the East Empire Company Offices. The large building down by the docks." Canctunian's disposition only needs to be at 75 to convince him, and he'll agree to contract with House Hlaalu for another year. Option 2: Shut down Sudanit Mine[edit] Travel to Sudanit Mine, southeast of the Buckmoth Legion Fort. Once there, find Darns Tedalen in a chamber at the back of the mine and dispose of him. There are a number of Redoran guards along the way: plenty of witnesses to report an unprovoked murder. You can avoid getting a bounty by either taunting him or casting Frenzy Humanoid. Alternatively, you could climb onto the stone ramp going to the upper ebony deposit where he is standing and carefully stick to the walls; you'll reach a point where you can shoot at him with a ranged weapon. Doing this keeps you inaccessible, safe and undetected as the guards will not raise an alarm. However, it requires good timing; saves at the right points are advisable. Resume attacking only when Darns and his men run to attack you. Consider using Resist Shock in your fight against Darns. He will start with strong area-of-effect shock spells, before switching to melee combat with a dagger. If you're a ranged fighter, attack him until he runs out of magicka, then continue hitting him while maintaining your distance. The mine is a sloped tunnel, so if you have high enough speed, you can force him to chase you uphill while you keep attacking him. Just be careful not to hit any of the other people in the mine or you'll have quite the mess on your hands! Completing the Quest[edit] Return to Nileno in Balmora to complete the quest and receive your reward of 1,000 gold. You also get a point of Reputation, ten points of Hlaalu faction reputation and Nileno's disposition rises 20 points. If you perform both tasks, Nileno will also reward you with a pair of glass boots, glass greaves and a glass cuirass, plus you get an extra point of reputation, five more points of Hlaalu reputation, and five extra points of disposition. This is the last piece of House Hlaalu business that Nileno will have for you; she will now refer you to Crassius Curio in Curio Manor, Hlaalu Canton in Vivec, or Edryno Arethi in the Hlaalu Canton Waistworks in Vivec, for further instructions.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Manirai in the Wise Woman's Yurt at the Erabenimsun Camp. Kill Ulath-Pal and his supporters, Ahaz, Ranabi, and Ashu-Ahhe. Talk to Manirai and Gulakhan Han-Ammu. Give (or show) Han-Ammu the War Axe of Airan Ammu, Sanit-Kil's Heart of Fire, and the Robe of Erur-Dan the Wise; and convince him to become Ashkhan. Be named Nerevarine of the Erabenimsun Tribe.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Erabenimsun Camp[edit] If you haven't found out the location of the Erabenimsun Camp yet, return to the Urshilaku Camp and find out from the Ashlanders. The camp is located a little southwest of the village of Tel Fyr, south of Tel Aruhn. The quickest way would be to grab a boat to Tel Aruhn or a Guild Guide to Wolverine Hall (Sadrith Mora) and then head southwest to the camp. Internal Disagreement[edit] Speaking with either resident of the Ashkhan's yurt results in a brief response and a disposition drop when mentioning the Nerevarine or prophecies. Go and talk to the Wise Woman, Manirai, in her yurt. Make sure you ask her about Nerevarine prophecies. She explains that Ulath-Pal and his allies hate all outlanders and will never agree to call you Nerevarine. She suggests a simple course of action. Kill Ulath-Pal and His Supporters[edit] In order to be named Nerevarine of the Erabenimsun, you must first kill Ashkhan Ulath-Pal and his supporters, Ahaz, Ranabi, and Ashu-Ahhe. Ulath-Pal and Ahaz are both in Ulath-Pal's Yurt. They are the strongest of the four, and both cast spells. Ulath-Pal drops the War Axe of Airan Ammu and Ahaz drops Sanit-Kil's Heart of Fire. Ranabi is in his Yurt and should be defeated quickly to prevent him from casting spells. He drops the Robe of Erur-Dan the Wise. Ashu-Ahhe is next door in his Yurt, and deals a moderate amount of damage. Persuading Gulakhan Han-Ammu[edit] Visit Manirai after dealing with Ulath-Pal and his supporters to find out that Gulakhan Han-Ammu must be persuaded to name you Nerevarine of the Erabenimsun. She warns that it may be difficult to convince him. Go and speak with Han-Ammu. He explains that he doesn't want the title of Ashkhan because he lacks three basic attributes of a warrior: strength, courage and wisdom. To make up for his lack of attributes, he wants the magic items that belonged to his now deceased tribe members: the War Axe of Airan Ammu, Sanit-Kil's Heart of Fire, and the Robe of Erur-Dan the Wise. Choose to offer him the magic items or show them to him. There are three possible outcomes: if his disposition and your Speechcraft are 50 or higher, show him an item and you'll convince him after some dialogue, if his disposition is 90 or higher and your Speechcraft is lower than 50, you'll have to give him all three items, but you get to keep the last one discussed (it is possible to place the desired item on the ground before speaking to him and then pick it up after handing over the other two items), or give him all three items. Named as Nerevarine[edit] With the magic items sorted out, Han-Ammu will accept his responsibilities as Ashkhan and name you Nerevarine of the Erabenimsun. Visit Manirai to receive the tribe's enchanted symbol, The Seizing of the Erabenimsun. If all three Great Houses have pronounced you as Hortator and all four Ashlander Tribes have named you Nerevarine, head over to the Temple Canton in Vivec for the next part of the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Odral Helvi to learn your next assignment. Travel to Vivec with the fake land deed. Either steal the real deed and replace it or speak to Crassius Curio or Rovone Arvel. If you speak to Rovone or Crassius, speak to Baren Alen to get a copy of the real deed. Return to Odral Helvi.
Detailed Walkthrough: Business[edit] Odral Helvi in the Governor's Hall in Caldera will ask you to replace some "erroneous" land deeds for the Ascadian Isles he has found in the Hlaalu Records in Vivec. The deed he gives you is obviously fake. There is now a choice between three paths: you can either steal the real deed from the records, report it to Crassius Curio, or bring it to the attention of the seller, Rovone Arvel. Option #1: Reporting to Curio[edit] If you talk to Curio about the matter and give him the fake deed, he'll reward you with an Amulet of Domination. You can then talk to Baren Alen in the Hlaalu Treasury Vaults about "erroneous documents" and he will sell you a copy of the real deed Helvi requested for ten gold. Helvi will believe you replaced the fake deed. Curio's disposition towards you increases by ten points if you take this option. Option #2: Reporting to Arvel[edit] Another option is to take the deed to Rovone Arvel, at his plantation north of Vivec. He will be very appreciative of your efforts and reward you with a Murdrum Ring. You can then talk to Baren Alen about making a copy of the real deed as above. Arvel's disposition jumps by 15 if you do this. Option #3: Stealing the Deed[edit] Stealing the deed isn't too difficult. It can be found in the Hlaalu Records office in the Hlaalu Canton in Vivec. Go through the Hlaalu Treasury in the waistworks to access the Records office, either directly or through the Hlaalu Vaults. The deed is in a small chest on the middle shelf of one of the bookcases. Valvosa Maryon will likely be nearby, so it requires a few skills in Sneak (Chameleon works great too). Take out the Ascadian Isles Land Deed and (if actually complying with Odral Helvi's shady mission for you) put in Odral's Land Deed. Ending the Quest[edit] Return to Helvi with the real or copied land deed to complete the quest. You will receive six scrolls (2 Scroll of Uth's Hand of Heaven, 2 Scroll of The Black Storm, 2 Scroll of Tranasa's Spelltwist) for completing the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Ranis Athrys at the Guild of Mages in Balmora for duties. Go to the Eight Plates in town. Meet Itermerel and get his notes. You have three options: Steal the notes. Kill Itermerel to get the notes. Agree to escort him to the Halfway Tavern in Pelagiad in exchange for the notes. Return to Athrys.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Ranis Athrys at the Guild of Mages in Balmora will ask you to get Itermerel's notes. To this end, she sends you to escort him to the Halfway Tavern in Pelagiad (northwest of Vivec, just north of Seyda Neen), but she makes it clear that the notes are all that actually matter. Itermerel's Notes[edit] This quest has several possible outcomes. If you're feeling lazy and you have a high Sneak skill, you can simply pickpocket the notes while Itermerel is still in the Eight Plates. This way saves you the trouble of escorting him all the way to Pelagiad. Another alternative is to agree to escort the High Elf and start on the road to Pelagiad. Once you're safely out of Balmora and away from the guards that patrol the streets there, you can kill Itermerel without penalty. Just strip his corpse of his notes and head back to Ranis. Of course, there is always the option of escorting him all the way to Pelagiad. Travelling together to Seyda Neen by a silt strider can save a lot of time and trouble. Once you reach the Halfway Tavern, he will gladly hand over the notes. The reward doesn't depend on the way you achieve your goal, so act however you want.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Edryno Arethi for business. Meet Tarvyn Faren on the road, near the Silt Strider. Escort Faren to the Halfway Tavern in Pelagiad. Return to Edryno Arethi.
Detailed Walkthrough: Business[edit] Talk to Edryno Arethi in her house on the Hlaalu Waistworks in Vivec. She will ask you to escort the merchant Tarvyn Faren to Pelagiad due to bandits on the road. The Escort[edit] Edryno will tell you to meet Tarvyn Faren on the road to Pelagiad, near the Silt Strider just north of Vivec. You will have to travel slowly so that the merchant isn’t left behind. Once you reach Pelegiad, escort Tarvyn into the Halfway Tavern to update the quest, then return to Arethi in Vivec to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Chat with Skink-in-Tree's-Shade about duties and Tenyeminwe. Go to Dirty Muriel's Cornerclub just outside Wolverine Hall in Sadrith Mora and chat with Tenyeminwe. Travel with Tenyeminwe to the ship docks. Chat with Tenyeminwe to receive your reward. Return to Skink-in-Tree's Shade to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: An Assignment from Skink[edit] Go to the Mage's Guild in Wolverine Hall and talk to Skink-in-Tree's-Shade about duties. He will ask you to escort the scholar Tenyeminwe to the ship docks in town. It seems that Tenyeminwe had a conflict with a Telvanni the previous night and is afraid to travel unaccompanied. She's waiting for your escort at Dirty Muriel's Cornerclub just across the bridge leading from Wolverine Hall to Sadrith Mora. A Scholar in Need[edit] Go to Dirty Muriel's Cornerclub, across the bridge right outside Wolverine Hall. Tenyeminwe is waiting inside, by the door on the first floor. Chat with her about travel together and tell her to come with you; she'll follow you until you instruct her to stop or you reach your destination. Proceed to the docks, on the northwestern side of Sadrith Mora. At the Docks[edit] When you arrive at your destination, you'll receive a journal message indicating that Tenyeminwe has made it to the Elf-Skerring safely. Chat with Tenyeminwe before departing to receive her gratitude, and a Scroll of Summon Flame Atronach and another Scroll of Summon Frost Atronach. Return to Skink-in-Tree's-Shade to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Tuveso Beleth at her store in the Redoran Council Hall in Ald'ruhn for duties. Travel to Koal Cave with Deval Beleth. Report back to Tuveso Beleth.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Tuveso Beleth at the Redoran Council Hall in Ald'ruhn will ask you to escort her son, Deval, along the pilgrimage to the Koal Cave (south of Gnisis). The Pilgrim's Escort[edit] Talk to Deval Beleth, right beside his mom, and he'll agree for you to escort him to the cave. Getting to Koal Cave is relatively simple if you take the silt strider to Gnisis. From there, simply cross the river and take the road that's on the other side west to the cave. Deval will leave you at the end of the long trip when you approach the cave. Return to Beleth in Ald'ruhn to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Meet Paur Maston south of Suran. Escort Maston to Molag Mar. Reunite the pair.
Detailed Walkthrough: An Escort to Molag Mar[edit] Vanjirra waiting anxiously Just south of Suran (across the water and close to Dirara's Farmhouse) you'll find Paur Maston wandering around. When you first speak to him he should mention something about meeting a business partner and travelling on to Molag Mar. Inquire further to learn that his partner, Vanjirra, never showed up for their trip. Keep talking and agree to escort Paur to Molag Mar, just to the east. Protect Maston[edit] The trip shouldn't be too difficult, but keep a close eye on your companion to ensure he doesn't get into trouble. You can also lead him back to the Vivec or Suran Silt Strider port and ride with him to Molag Mar to save a lot of hassle. Meet his partner[edit] Vanjirra is located on the western bridge outside of Molag Mar. Paur will stop following you when he gets near to Vanjirra. Speak to Vanjirra who will offer you a reward for escorting Paur to her (a Light Amulet). Note that if Paur died for any reason you can still get 50 gold as a reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Garisa Llethri in his manor in Ald'ruhn for duties. Travel to the Caldera Mine to find evidence of corruption. Talk to the slaves to find out where the evidence is. Get the Secret Caldera Ledger from Odral Helvi's chest on the second floor of the Governor's Hall. Return to Llethri with the ledger to complete the quest.

Talk to Eno Hlaalu at the Morag Tong headquarters in the Hidden Area of the Vivec Arena for special duties. Travel to Assernerairan to execute Durus Marius. Find Durus in the shrine and kill him. Return to Eno to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Special Duties[edit] Once you reach the rank of Master, Eno Hlaalu in the Vivec Morag Tong hall will ask you to kill a Dark Brotherhood member, Durus Marius, in the shrine of Assernerairan in the Underworks of the St. Olms Canton in Vivec. Execute Durus Marius[edit] There are a number of enemies in the shrine and the close quarters might make the fight rather tricky. Return to Eno once Durus is dead for his congratulations and a 2,000 gold reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Eno Hlaalu at the Morag Tong headquarters in the Hidden Area of the Vivec Arena for special duties. Travel to Ald Sotha to execute Severa Magia. Find Severa in the Lower Level of the shrine and kill her. Return to Eno to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Special Duties[edit] Eno Hlaalu in the Vivec Morag Tong hall will ask you to kill the local Night Mother of the Dark Brotherhood, Severa Magia, found within the shrine of Ald Sotha. Execute Severa Magia[edit] Ald Sotha is east by northeast of Vivec and Severa can be found in the Lower Level, under heavy guard (both NPCs and Daedra). Fight your way to her and execute her. Return to Eno once Severa is dead for his congratulations and receive the Black Hands Dagger.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Eydis Fire-Eye in the Balmora Guild of Fighters about orders and cave rats. Visit Drarayne Thelas in Balmora and ask about cave rats. Kill the rats in her bedroom and upstairs storage. Return to Drarayne for payment. Return to Eydis Fire-Eye to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders[edit] Eydis Fire-Eye in the Balmora Guild of Fighters will give you this quest to exterminate a few cave rats in Drarayne Thelas' house, just across the Odai River in town. Meet Drarayne[edit] The house is located on the east riverbank, in the center of town. Enter the house and have a conversation with Drarayne Thelas about cave rats. She will inform you that she has one rat closed up in the bedroom and two rats upstairs in her locked storage room, giving you a key to the storage room door. Take out the three rats and return to Drarayne to receive an increase in Disposition and 100 drakes. Return to Eydis[edit] Return to Eydis Fire-Eye to let her know you've completed your task. Ask about an advancement to receive a possible promotion. Ask about orders if you're ready for your next assignment from her.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Edryno Arethi for business. Travel to St. Olms to help Yngling Half-Troll with some diseased rats. Kill or cure the diseased rats among his prized game rats. Return to Edryno Arethi.
Detailed Walkthrough: Business[edit] Edryno Arethi  in her house on the Hlaalu Waistworks in Vivec will ask you to kill some diseased rats which have been planted among Yngling Half-Troll's prized game rats in Yngling Manor, St. Olms Plaza in Vivec. Killing the Rats[edit] The rats are in the basement of the manor and are all mingling closely together, so be careful not to accidentally kill any regular game rats, just the diseased ones (you can still complete the quest if you kill only one good rat though). Fortunately, the diseased rats should attack you, while the regular game rats will not. Therefore, you may be able to lead the diseased rats away, to avoid accidentally striking any of the others. You can also heal the blighted game rats, with a Cure Blight Disease on Target spell or scroll. Return for your Reward[edit] Return to Arethi in Hlaalu canton to complete the quest. If you kill more than one game rat, your reward is greatly reduced (only 1 gold instead of 1000 gold).

Quick Walkthrough: Chat with Ajira to find out about her bet. Place a Fake Soul Gem in Galbedir's desk. Return to Ajira for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: A "Friendly" Wager[edit] It appears that the dear Ajira in the Balmora Guild of Mages has made a bet with Galbedir over which one will get promoted to the level of Journeyman first. Ajira wants you to sabotage Galbedir's project by placing a Fake Soul Gem in Galbedir's desk, at the top floor of the guild, without Galbedir knowing. Wandering Galbedir[edit] Galbedir will come down shortly to talk with Marayn Dren. Before she returns, go upstairs and place the fake soul gem in Galbedir's desk. You must put the gem inside the desk, not on top of it; activate it like a regular container. Return to Ajira[edit] Report back to Ajira when you've completed your task.  Your disposition with Ajira raises by +10, and if you meet the requirements you can be promoted to the rank of Journeyman.

Quick Walkthrough: Follow the north path out of Seyda Neen. When you hear the scream, look up to see the falling wizard. Read his journal, and loot his corpse.
Detailed Walkthrough: Flying can be hazardous to your health. Tarhiel's exact location is (-16747, -58568). Follow the path northwest out of Seyda Neen to Hla Oad, and you will soon hear a strange scream coming out of nowhere. Suddenly, a Wood Elf by the name of Tarhiel in wizard's garments plummets out of the sky to his death. If you approach him and read his journal, you will find that he had completed a spell he thought gave him the power of flight. Three of these scrolls can be found on his corpse.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Tuls Valen in the Ald'ruhn Tribunal Temple for your duties. Travel to Suran to investigate Elvil Vidron, who claims to be the Nerevarine. Convince him that he is not the Incarnate that he thinks he is, or kill him. Return to Tuls to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Tuls Valen in the Ald'ruhn Tribunal Temple asks you to investigate Elvil Vidron in Suran, who claims to be the Nerevarine. Tuls is certain that Elvil is not 'divine' and you must convince him of this or kill him. False Incarnate[edit] You can arrive in Suran quickly via the Silt Strider routes and find Elvil hanging around outside Desele's House of Earthly Delights.  Your options depend on how far you have progressed in the Main Quest: Whether or not you have seen any disturbing dream, you can convince him he is not the Incarnate of the dreams, if his disposition with you is at least 65. If you have the Moon-and-Star ring, you can show it to him to prove that you are the Nerevarine. However, this does nothing due to a bug (see below). Otherwise, your only choice is to kill him outright. Return to Tuls for your reward of three Exclusive Restore Health Potions – unless you killed Elvil, in which case you will get no reward, although you will still receive the reputation and disposition boosts. You are likely to be prosecuted for the killing of Elvil, even though it was ordered by the Temple. Be prepared to pay a fine of at least 2,000 gold.  No amount of stealth seems to be sufficient to avoid detection – for example, killing with chameleon of over 100%. This can be worked around by getting him to strike first, with either Frenzy Humanoid, or Taunt.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk with Arrille at Arrille's Tradehouse to find out about Hrisskar Flat-Foot's money troubles. Talk with Hrisskar about finding Fargoth's hiding place. Observe Fargoth at night and locate his hidden stash. Return to Hrisskar for a petty reward. Alternatively, you may simply keep the 300 gold by not returning to Hrisskar.
Detailed Walkthrough: A Nord's Money Troubles[edit] In the town of Seyda Neen, you can find out from Arrille that Hrisskar Flat-Foot has been having money troubles lately. Hrisskar, in the bar upstairs, will reveal that he believes Fargoth, whom he regularly bullies for money, has been holding out on him and he asks you to help find Fargoth's hidden stash. Lighthouse Lookout[edit] If you wait at the top of the lighthouse until at least 10pm, you can watch Fargoth sneak to his secret hiding spot in the hollow treestump in the mud pool behind Teruise Girvayne's house. Climb down and check out Fargoth's hiding place; the tree stump will contain a journeyman's lockpick, 300 gold, and Fargoth's Engraved Ring of Healing, but only if you gave it back to him in the Fargoth's Ring quest. Return to Hrisskar[edit] Return to Hrisskar to complete the quest. He will take the 300 gold and give you back 100 for your troubles.

Quick Walkthrough: Take the Engraved Ring of Healing from the barrel outside the inner Census and Excise office building (you will be unable to progress any further in the game until you do this). Talk to Fargoth about his ring. Return the ring to Fargoth.
Detailed Walkthrough: Look What I've Found[edit] During character creation, after exiting the first Census and Excise building and upon activating the door to the next building, you will be instructed to Check the barrel to your left, and get the ring inside. You must possess the Engraved Ring of Healing before you are allowed to proceed to the captain's office. Imperial Shakedown[edit] After you finish in the Census office and exit to Seyda Neen, you should be able to find a blond Wood Elf man by the name of Fargoth wandering around just outside. Speak with him about his ring, and he'll share his experiences with the Imperial Guards in town, and his belief that they have taken his ring. Return and Reward[edit] You can tell Fargoth that you found his ring, or feign ignorance on the subject.  If you tell him that you found it, you are given the option to give it to him or keep it. Giving him the ring will result in an improved disposition with Fargoth.  In addition, Fargoth will put in a good word with Arrille, at the local tradehouse, which means a higher disposition and an increased bargaining ability for goods and services with Arrille when you first start, a definite advantage for early characters.

Quick Walkthrough: Find Bugrol gro-Bagul behind a tree on the road northwest of Caldera. Take his Note from Bugrol to Bashuk gra-Bat in Caldera. Take her Note from Bashuk back to Bugrol gro-Bagul to collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Favors for Orcs[edit] You will find Bugrol gro-Bagul hiding from the Caldera authorities behind a rock northwest of town, near the first fork in the road. He will ask you to deliver a note to his friend, Bashuk gra-Bat, in Caldera. Bashuk is in her house in town and will give you another note to return to Bugrol. A Useless Rock?[edit] Return to Bugrol who will try to short-change you by giving you a useless rock (which is actually a not-so-useless diamond). Aside from this, you can actually find out what the Orcs are up to by reading some notes in Bashuk's and Valvius Mevureius' houses in town.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Big Helende in Dirty Muriel's Cornerclub in Sadrith Mora for a new job. Travel to Tel Branora to steal Felen Maryon's ebony staff. Find the staff in Therana's Chamber and steal it. Return to Helende to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] Big Helende at Dirty Muriel's Cornerclub in Wolverine Hall asks if you would like to steal Felen Maryon's ebony staff from his tower in Tel Branora. She doesn't expect anybody will be up for the challenge, and you can refuse the quest without penalty as this is Helende's last quest for you. Since Maryon's home is a Telvanni tower, Helende is kind enough to provide three Quality Rising Force potions. Felen's Ebony Staff[edit] Tel Branora is at the far southeast corner of the map and is easiest to reach by boat. Felen can be found up in Therana's Chamber, accessed through the Upper Tower, east of the docks. He sells some powerful Conjuration spells, including some spells that can be purchased nowhere else (such as Summon Golden Saint), so you may wish to spare him if you can avoid it. His staff is leaning against the bookcase behind him, so anything you can do to increase your sneak effectiveness (such as Chameleon) is helpful, or you can try to walk around the back of the bookcase and take the staff from there. When you return to Helende with the staff, she'll give you the choice of keeping it or a cut of the profits from selling it (250 gold). Either way, she also gives you a Ring of Far Reaching and removes your bounty.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Lloros Sarano for duties. Travel to Maar Gan and talk with Tralas Rendas. Go to the Mila-Nipal camp and speak with Manat Shimmabadas Either: Pay the ransom. Kill the Ashlanders. Return to Lloros Sarano.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Lloros Sarano in the Ald'ruhn Tribunal Temple will ask you to find another pilgrim, Beden Giladren, who has disappeared while on the way to Maar Gan. What Happened to Giladren?[edit] Travel to Maar Gan and ask around town to be directed to Tralas Rendas at the shrine. Rendas will tell you that he remembers an Ashlander recently visited town demanding ransom for a noble with a similar-sounding name. The Ransom[edit] Go to the Mila-Nipal camp nearby and talk to Manat Shimmabadas, who will tell you that Giladren is a famous noble and demands 5,000 gold to release him. You can pay the ransom, kill the Ashlanders, or you can persuade Manat that Giladren is not a famous noble (you will need to get Giladren to admit he's not famous or a noble as well). This will reduce the ransom tremendously, down to 5 gold. Report back to Sarano in Ald'ruhn when you've freed Giladren to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Gentleman Jim Stacey at Simine Fralinie's bookshop in Vivec, Foreign Quarter for a new job. Go to the Hlaalu Canton and ask about Nads Tharen in Elven Nations Cornerclub. Talk to Sovali Uvayn to find out that Arvama Rathri spoke with Nads the last time he was there. Talk to Gadela Andus to find out that Nads lives in St. Delyn Canalworks, South-Two. Go there to find Nad's corpse on the floor and take his key. (Optional) Kill Arvama as punishment for the assassination of Nads. Return to Jim to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Finding Gentleman Jim Stacey[edit] Gentleman Jim Stacey, the current head of the Thieves Guild, can be found in Simine Fralinie's bookshop in Vivec, Foreign Quarter Canalworks, east section, behind a well-locked (65) door at the back of the shop. He will start giving you Thieves Guild quests once you reach the rank of Captain or higher in the Guild, though he will assign you Bal Molagmer quests at a much lower rank. Job[edit] Jim's first job for you is to find a fellow guild member Nads Tharen who used to hang out at the Elven Nations Cornerclub in the Hlaalu Canton here in Vivec. If it turns out that he is dead, you are to return his key to Jim. Asking Around[edit] The Hlaalu Canton is just southwest of the Foreign Quarter; the Cornerclub is on the Plaza and Waistworks levels. Most people in the bar don't know anything about Nads, but Sovali Uvayn knows a few things. Apparently, Arvama Rathri spoke with Nads the last time he was in here, though Sovali isn't sure where Nads can be found (though she says Gadela Andus might be able to help you). Though Gadela (behind the bar) won't tell you anything about Arvama, she will tell you that Nads lives in St. Delyn Canalworks (if she has a disposition of at least 90 towards you), South-Two when you ask about him (you may need to persuade her a bit to get this information). Find Brother Nads[edit] St. Delyn is just southeast of the Hlaalu Canton; South-Two Canal is on the bottom of the south side. Inside you'll find Nads' corpse in the middle of a wrecked home. Take his key from his corpse and anything else you might take a liking to. (optional) Kill Arvama Rathri[edit] After finding Brother Nads' dead body, go back to the Elven Nations Cornerclub and speak to Arvama Rathri about Nads Tharen. Telling her that you believe she killed Nads makes her attack you; kill her for an additional reward of 500 gold. Return to Jim with the key for a reward of 500 gold, or 1,000 gold if you killed Arvama in revenge.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Lloros Sarano for duties. Go to Koal Cave. Travel northeast until you find Fedris Tharen. Talk with Tharen and cure him of his disease. Report back to Lloros Sarano.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Lloros Sarano in the Ald'ruhn Tribunal Temple will ask you to find a lost pilgrim, Fedris Tharen, who was heading for the Koal Cave shrine but hasn't been seen since. Finding the Lost Pilgrim[edit] Travel to Gnisis using the silt strider. Head to the cave, which is to the south of Gnisis along the coast. Once there, go northeast along a path until you find Tharen. Curing Tharen[edit] Apparently, Tharen is sick and cannot make the journey back to Gnisis. He asks that you report his location so he can be cured. At this point, you can cure him using a spell or a potion. If you don't have a potion, you can return to Lloros Sarano, who will give you one and send you back to Fedris Tharen. Once Tharen is cured, report back to Sarano in Ald'ruhn to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Neminda in the Redoran Council Hall in Ald'ruhn for duties. Travel to Gnisis and Maar Gan to find a missing trader. Ask the locals in both towns if they have seen Mathis Dalobar. Head to the Rothan Ancestral Tomb outside of Maar Gan. Escort Mathis Dalobar back to Maar Gan. Return to Neminda.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Neminda in the Redoran Council Hall in Ald'ruhn will now ask you to find the missing trader, Dalobar. He passed through Ald'ruhn but hasn't shown up at either Maar Gan or Gnisis. Looking for Mathis Dalobar[edit] Start by traveling to either location (the Ald'ruhn Silt Strider goes to both) and asking around town. Though no one at Gnisis will know anything, the villagers in Maar Gan have a different story. They will tell you that an ash storm delayed the trader, and some in the Andus Tradehouse will report seeing him near the Rothan Ancestral Tomb just west of town. Escorting the Trader to Safety[edit] You'll find Dalobar inside the tomb, near the entrance, and you can escort him back to Maar Gan and into the shrine there. Report back to Neminda to finish the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Larrius Varro, ask him about latest rumors and careless travelers. Travel to north of Hla Oad. Kill Fjol. Return to Varro for the bounty.
Detailed Walkthrough: Fjol the Outlaw[edit] If you have a high enough disposition with Larrius Varro (30), ask him about latest rumors, and he will reveal that a Nord has been attacking careless travelers near Hla Oad. Confronting the Road Agent[edit] Head over to the town and find Fjol near the bridge north of town. Speak to him about murderous outlaws and he will demand that you give him 100 gold, basically confirming that indeed he is (if your disposition is higher than 40, he'll ask more politely). If you give him the gold you can return to Varro and report Fjol's position, but you will not receive any reward. If you refuse to give Fjol the 100 gold, he will attack and you will be forced to kill him. Be careful when choosing this option, however, as he can easily one-shot low-level players. If you encounter him early on (which most players will) it might be wise to avoid talking to him altogether until you have gained a few levels and can safely return to kill him. Note that you don't have to talk to him at all in order to progress the quest and can instead attack him at will, making things easier for ranged characters/spellcasters. Once he's dead, return to Varro for a 100 gold reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Mistress Dratha at the Upper Tower in Tel Mora for chores. Travel to Sadrith Mora to get the Amulet of Flesh Made Whole from Neloth's captain archer. Talk to the guards in Tel Naga to learn that his name is Berengeval and he is in the tower's General Quarters. Kill Berengeval to get the amulet. Return to Dratha to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Councilor Dratha in the Upper Tower in Tel Mora will ask you to retrieve the Amulet of Flesh Made Whole, which is currently in the possession of Neloth's captain archer in Tel Naga in Sadrith Mora. Retrieving the Amulet[edit] Travel to Sadrith Mora and talk to the guards in Tel Naga to learn that the captain's name is Berengeval. If you persuade them sufficiently (disposition 60) you'll also learn that he is in the tower's General Quarters. You'll have to find and kill Berengeval to get the amulet. You should enter from the Upper Tower rather than the Great Hall, as he is hiding on a higher platform. You may wish to taunt Berengeval in order to avoid the murder charges. Return to Dratha with the amulet to complete the quest and receive an Amulet of Spell Absorption as a reward. If you are female, you'll also receive four Scrolls of Summon Golden Saint.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Percius Mercius for orders. Travel to Elith-Pal Mine. Give Dangor the flin. Return to Percius for payment.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Orders[edit] Percius Mercius in the Ald'ruhn Guild of Fighters asks you to deliver a load of twenty Flin to Dangor in the Elith-Pal Mine on the base of the Red Mountain just west of the Zainab Camp (ask him about the camp to have it marked on your map). Directions[edit] The quickest route is to take a Silt Strider up to Khuul, a ship to Dagon Fel, then on to Tel Mora and Vos before trekking southwest to the mine (it is indeed directly west of the Zainab Camp in the mountains). If, however, you've already obtained the Master Index, simply teleport to Caldera Mage's Guild (via Guild Guide) and speak to Folms Mirel to teleport to Falensarano, heading North towards Zainab camp. Using the Zainab Camp as a reference point, take the path north away from camp and it will immediately turn west. Follow the path toward Red Mountain and you will come across an entrance to the range, flanked by rock spires. Go straight down this valley and you will see the mine on the left. Flin for Elith-Pal[edit] Dangor is in the depths of the ebony mine. To reach him go straight ahead as you enter the mine and follow the tunnels around until you reach an area with two lava pits. The only hostile creatures are a few rats. Dangor will gladly accept the flin. If you're careful, you can steal some Raw Ebony, but if anyone sees you take it they will attack you. Return to Percius for your 500 gold reward, and a bottle of Cyrodiilic Brandy if you join him in a drink.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Uvoo Llaren at the Temple in Ghostgate for your duties. Travel to Shuran Island to deliver some food and drink to the hermit Sendus Sathis. Find Sendus Sathis near his camp at the center of the island, just west of the Rotheran stronghold, and give him the food and drink. Return to Uvoo to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Uvoo Llaren in the Ghostgate Tribunal Temple asks you deliver some food (four small Kwama eggs) and some drink (four mazte) to the hermit Sendus Sathis on Shuran Island. Food and Drink for the Hermit[edit] Shuran Island is just west of the Rotheran stronghold, in the far north of the map. Sendus can be found near his camp at the center of the island. Return to Llaren for her congratulations.

Quick Walkthrough: Find a love letter in the southern planter on the Hlaalu Canton Plaza. Talk to Gadayn Andarys. Talk to Eraldil. Decide how to handle the situation; Trick, or True Love? Return after ten days for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: For the Love of a Bosmer[edit] If you are thorough or lucky, you might find a love letter in the southern planter (among some mushrooms, closest to the No Name Club) on the Hlaalu Canton Plaza. The letter is from Gadayn Andarys to Eraldil and serves as a good example of how not to write a love letter. Detective Work[edit] You can find Andarys nearby in his General Goods shop on the same level. Although eloquent, Andarys struggles to express his feelings to Eraldil and asks you to act on his behalf. Eraldil can be found walking around the Hlaalu Canton Waistworks level, where she outright rejects Andarys' profession of love, suggesting he marry her cousin instead. Return to Andarys with the bad news; he takes it surprisingly well and suggests using a love potion to win Eraldil over. Play Cupid[edit] You can either agree to use the potion or suggest her cousin, Glathel. If you mention Glathel, Andarys will change his mind and agree that she would be a good choice. If you return to Andarys after ten days have passed, he and Glathel will be happily married, and he will reward you with a Flamemirror Robe and discounted prices at his store. Buyer Beware[edit] If you choose to use the potion, bring it to Eraldil, pretending it's an apology from Andarys. She accepts it with her usual rudeness. Return to Andarys, who remains optimistic and rewards you with a Light Ring. If you check back after ten days, they will be married, but Gadayn's mood will have soured, and he will blame you for it, raising his prices as a result.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Endryn Llethan at the High Fane in the Vivec, Temple Canton for your duties. Go to the St. Delyn Canton to eliminate a foul cult that has been meeting in a place called Ihinipalit. Find Ihinipalit in the Underworks of St. Delyn. Kill the leader, Bjadmund. Return to Endryn to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] After you retrieve the Shoes of St. Rilms, Endryn Llethan at the High Fane in the Vivec, Temple Canton asks you to eliminate a foul cult that has been meeting in a place called Ihinipalit, somewhere in the St. Delyn Canton. You are to find the place, and bring 'the Temple's justice' to the leader, Bjadmund. Llethan gives you several scrolls to help you out. Ihinipalit[edit] Ihinipalit can be found in the Underworks of St. Delyn and you will probably be attacked by everyone inside and outside (one person guarding outside and three inside). You only have to kill the leader, Bjadmund, though all three inside will most likely attack you at once, so be prepared before you enter. Return to Endryn for a reward of an Ancestral Wisdom Staff. This is the last quest you receive from Llethan.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Neminda in the Redoran Council Hall in Ald'ruhn for duties. Travel to Balmora to recover a stolen Founder's Helm. Obtain the helm from Alvis Teri. Return to Ald'ruhn.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Now that Mathis Dalobar is safely in Maar Gan, Neminda wants you to retrieve a Founder's Helm, which was stolen by Alvis Teri. Apparently Alvis is bold (or stupid), and he's been bragging about the theft. The rogue has even started wearing the helm around at the Eight Plates in Balmora. While the quest seems rather straightforward, you must maintain House Redoran's honor and refrain from murdering Alvis Teri. Recovering the Stolen Helm[edit] Use the Guild Guide or Silt Strider to go to Balmora. The Eight Plates is located on the right side of the street between the Fighters Guild and the Tribunal Temple in Balmora. There are two ways of obtaining the helmet without getting a bounty: persuade him enough for him to give you the helm (75 disposition required), or taunt him into attacking you so you can kill him and take the helm from his body. Once the helm is in your possession, return to Neminda.

Quick Walkthrough: Chat with Ajira about duties and flowers. Obtain samples of the requested flowers. Return to Ajira for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Another Errand for Ajira[edit] Chat with Ajira in the Balmora Guild of Mages about duties, and she'll send you on an errand much like her previous mushroom quest.  Ajira asks you to collect four different local flower specimens, Gold Kanet, Stoneflower Petals, Willow Anther, and Heather. Amateur Botanist[edit] All of these can be found on the shores of Lake Amaya, which is southeast of Balmora. Name Image Description Item ID   Gold Kanet    Grows near rocks, has yellow flowers and broad, dark-green leaves.  ingred_gold_kanet_01   Stoneflower Petals    Dark blue and stems bend towards the ground.  ingred_stoneflower_petals_01   Willow Anther    Reddish and tall but does not bend to the ground like the Stoneflower.  ingred_willow_anther_01   Heather    Has needles, grows near the ground, and has pink flowers.  ingred_heather_01 Indeed, just wander around the wild across the bridge southeast of Balmora and you can collect the samples very quickly. Bouquets for Ajira[edit] Once you collect all four samples and return to Ajira, you receive six Cheap Restore Magicka Potions as a reward, a +10 increase in disposition, and a potential promotion.

Quick Walkthrough: Chat with Ajira about duties, then about mushrooms. Gather one sample of each of the requested mushrooms. Return to Ajira for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] This is the first quest offered by Ajira at the Guild of Mages in Balmora when you join the Mages Guild. Chat with Ajira about duties, and she'll request that you help her. In order for Ajira to become a Journeyman in the Guild, she must study some local mushrooms. In particular, she needs four different samples -- one each of Luminous Russula, Violet Coprinus, Bungler's Bane, and Hypha Facia, all commonly available on the Bitter Coast. The best place, she says, is southwest of Balmora. You can further ask her about each type of mushroom and she will happily describe what they look like. Name Image Description Item ID   Luminous Russula    A short, smelly, toadstool which is brown on top.  ingred_russula_01   Violet Coprinus    Long stem toadstools that glow blue at night.  ingred_coprinus_01   Bungler's Bane    Grows on trees and looks like brown shelves.  ingred_bc_bungler's_bane   Hypha Facia    Looks like Bungler's Bane and grows on trees.  ingred_bc_hypha_facia Gathering the Tasty "Truffles"[edit] Indeed, just wander around the swamps across the hills southwest of Balmora and you can collect samples of the four mushrooms very quickly. Once you collect all four samples, return to Ajira. Another alternative is to take the Silt Strider to Seyda Neen and collect the mushrooms in that area: two of them, Bungler's Bane and Hypha Facia can be found on the tree outside of the Census and Excise office. The other two seem to only be a stone's throw away from the town. If you've completed the quest Death of a Taxman, you'll find the remaining two mushrooms in the vicinity of the corpse of Processus Vitellius. If you like to be prepared, you could also collect these mushrooms from Seyda Neen before you head to Balmora. If you don't feel like traveling around the countryside in search of mushrooms, you can stop by the Temple in Balmora to buy Bungler's Bane and Hypha Facia from Dralval Andrano, and you can travel to Caldera Guild of Mages using the guild guide to buy Luminous Russula and Violet Coprinus from Ernand Thierry. Pleasing the Khajiit[edit] Return to Ajira after your hunting-and-gathering trip, and she'll reward you with four Cheap Restore Health Potions, a 10 point increase in disposition toward you, and a potential increase in ranking in the Mages Guild.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Ilmeni Dren in Vivec for your next assignment. Travel to the Dren Plantation to free Hides-His-Foot. Sneak Hides-His-Foot to Sterdecan's Farm. Return to Ilmeni.
Detailed Walkthrough: A Slave at the Dren Plantation[edit] After her previous quest to rescue J'Saddha, Ilmeni Dren in Vivec will ask you to free an Argonian slave, Hides-His-Foot, from the Dren Plantation north of Vivec and escort him to Sterdecan's Farm. Free Hides-His-Foot[edit] You'll find the slave outside in the plantation, though if the guards see you free him they will attack you. You can try luring the guards away before freeing him. Use a Command Humanoid spell to bring them to the easternmost wall, or taunt them into attacking you, force them to chase you to the eastern wall then cast Calm Humanoid. Once all the guards are out of the way, you can free Hides-His-Foot without being challenged. Alternatively, you can use a Command spell on Hides-His-Foot to move him away from danger, or simply kill the guards first. Escort the slave to the Sterdecan's Farm to the northeast of the plantation and have the farmer take him (he must be taken to the door of the farmhouse for your journal to be updated). Return to Ilmeni in Vivec to complete the quest. This is her last quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Sugar-Lips Habasi about jobs and New-Shoes Bragor. Travel to Pelagiad and visit Mebestian Ence to obtain a Dwemer Coherer. Confront Shadbak gra-Burbug and convince her to release New-Shoes Bragor. Speak with New-Shoes Bragor in the Pelagiad Fort Prison. Return to Sugar-Lips Habasi for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] Sugar-Lips Habasi in Balmora at the South Wall Cornerclub asks you to free New-Shoes Bragor, a fellow Thieves Guild member who is being held in the Imperial Legion prison in Fort Pelagiad. Sugar-Lips suggests that this can be accomplished by blackmailing Shadbak gra-Burbug, a female Orc and member of the Imperial Legion in Pelagiad, with proof that she's involved in smuggling Dwemer artifacts, an activity that is illegal in Vvardenfell. Travel to Pelagiad[edit] The quickest way to reach Pelagiad from Balmora is by taking the silt strider to Seyda Neen and then casting Divine Intervention to end up at Fort Pelagiad. Alternatives include following the path to the east from Seyda Neen, checking all roadsigns to Pelagiad, or proceeding east-southeast out of Balmora past the Moonmoth Legion Fort, crossing the Foyada Mamaea into the Ascadian Isles region, following the signs to Pelagiad. Locate Mebestian Ence[edit] Shadbak gra-Burbug can be bought... Mebestian Ence is a trader in Pelagiad whose shop is located across the street from the Halfway Tavern. Mebestian Ence smuggles Dwemer goods and Shadbak gra-Burbug takes bribes from Ence to overlook his activities. Once in Ence's shop you can find a Dwemer coherer in a small locked (50) chest on a shelf upstairs, or it may be purchased from him for around 60 gold. The coherer is fairly heavy (40), so a feather potion may be necessary depending on your carry weight. Confronting Shadbak gra-Burbug[edit] Shadbak gra-Burbug can be found just inside Fort Pelagiad, up the street from Mebestian's shop. Confront Shadbak about the artifact and convince her to release New-Shoes. If you stole the artifact from Mebestian, don't admit to it. She will incriminate herself; once she does, force her to release New-Shoes. Completing the Quest[edit] After confronting Shadbak, go through the "South Wall"  door to the cells downstairs. You will find New-Shoes in one of the cells close to the evidence chest awaiting the final paperwork, and you can speak to him through the door. He will give you his pair of new exquisite shoes, as they've been nothing but trouble for him. Return to Balmora, and speak with Sugar-Lips Habasi for a reward of 1,000 gold.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Alusaron in his shop on the Plaza of the Foreign Quarter. Steal a contract from Ralen Tilvur. Return to Alusaron for the reward, a Firebite War Axe.
Detailed Walkthrough: A Friend in Deed[edit] Talk to Alusaron in Vivec, Foreign Quarter Plaza. He will complain about the amount of competition he's facing and especially about losing a good deal of business to Ralen Tilvur. Alusaron has heard that Ralen Tilvur has recently received a contract for a large weapons shipment. He asks you to steal the contract from Ralen Tilvur. The Contract[edit] The contract can be found in Ralen Tilvur's private quarters (Foreign Quarter Plaza) and is protected by nothing more than a door with a lock level of thirty. If you are having difficulty picking the lock without Ralen Tilvur seeing you, you can position yourself in front of the shelf closest to the door to block his view, or use magic to open the door instead. Bring back the contract to Alusaron and he will reward you with a Firebite War Axe.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Skink-in-Tree's-Shade at the Mage's Guild in Wolverine Hall for duties. Travel to Vivec, Galom Daeus or Tureynulal to acquire a copy of Galur Rithari's Papers. Get the book. Return to Skink-in-Tree's-Shade.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Skink-in-Tree's-Shade in the Wolverine Hall Mage's Guild wants you to find a book on Vampires, Galur Rithari's Papers. The book allegedly describes how a Buoyant Armiger became a Vampire and was cured. Skink suggests to talk to booksellers (such as Jobasha in Vivec, Foreign Quarter) to get an idea on where to find a copy. Acquiring the Book[edit] There are several copies of the book available: in the Hall of Justice secret Library in Vivec, Galom Daeus, and Tureynulal, Kagrenac's Library (Red Mountain, within the Ghostfence). The Secret Library in the Hall of Justice might seem the simplest but it is locked (75) and well-guarded; you need to be an accomplished thief or don't mind a few fights and a bad record. Another way into the secret library is via the Office of the Watch which has a simpler trapped lock (50), although it is also well guarded. The Library is entered via a half-hidden, locked trapdoor on the floor in one of the Justice Offices or Office of the Watch. Once inside, the book is a small, dark red book at the end of the middle shelf, closest to the Justice Offices entrance. Tureynulal is difficult to get to, being just northeast of the Red Mountain crater . In Galom Daeus, the book is found on the ledge overhanging the telescope in the observatory portion of the ruin. Returning to Skink with any of the copies, you are rewarded the usual increase in Disposition and his Amulet. Skink's Amulet is not magical but is worth 1,000 gold (60 enchant points). You also gain +1 Reputation.

Quick Walkthrough: (Optional) Hear rumors about the Gateway Inn being haunted by a ghost. Talk to Angaredhel at the Gateway Inn in Sadrith Mora. Talk to Arara Uvulas about the topic. Talk to Uleni Heleran at the Mage's Guild in Wolverine Hall. Return to Angaredhel and decide which story to tell him. Receive a ring of choice.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Gateway Ghost[edit] In Sadrith Mora, you'll learn that a ghost is haunting the South Turret bedchamber at the South Wing of Gateway Inn. When someone drives it out, it comes right back. It's ruining business at Gateway and Angaredhel, the Prefect, is unhappy. Go to Gateway Inn and talk to Angaredhel. He'll give you the directions to the haunted room. He will also tell you that Mage-Mistress Arara Uvulas inspected the room but does not know why the ghost reappears or how to stop it. Detective Work[edit] Angaredhel advises you to speak to Arara Uvulas at the Telvanni Council House. You can kill the ghost (as many times as you want), but you cannot solve the quest in this manner. The Council House is a big sphere located north of the docks. Speak to Arara Uvulas there about the Gateway Haunting and she will tell you that she can find no evidence of a restless spirit or ancestral influences. She suspects that a conjuration expert is involved. Ask anyone at the Council House about a conjuration expert and you'll be told that Uleni Heleran at the Mage's Guild teaches Conjuration, though she will not teach it to you. Finding the Prankster[edit] Go to Wolverine Hall and speak to anyone there. You'll learn that Uleni Heleran is mischievous and that she has bad feelings about Angaredhel and the Gateway Inn. Confront Uleni Heleran about the Gateway Haunting. She'll admit that it was a joke she played. She agrees to stop the haunting and gives you a note to take to Angaredhel. Return to Angaredhel, select Work from the list of dialogue options, and you will be given three choices, two of which have the same consequences: Explain what happened, but withhold Uleni's name Explain what happened, and include Uleni's name Explain what happened, and deliver Uleni's Papers If you withhold Uleni's name, Angaredhel's Disposition will be lowered by 20 points.  Otherwise, if you choose either of the other two options, Angaredhel's disposition will be raised by 30 points.  Alternatively, if you killed Uleni, you will also get a 30 point Disposition boost.  Whichever option you choose, he will reward you with a choice of one of three rings: a Fighter Ring, a Mage Ring, or a Thief Ring.  You will also receive one Reputation point however you choose to complete this quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Synnolian Tunifus at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart for a new task. Travel to the Arvel Plantation to get some Corkbulb Root. Harvest five pieces of corkbulb. Return to Synnolian to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Task[edit] Synnolian Tunifus at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart will ask you to run another errand to fetch five pieces of Corkbulb Root. Tunifus tells you to visit the Arvel Plantation to get the ingredient and teaches you the Swimmer's Blessing spell, so that you can take a more direct route to the farm. Gathering Corkbulb Root[edit] You can find the Arvel Plantation east of Pelagiad, on the Ascadian Isles. You can find some corkbulb root just west of the Suran silt strider (near the Ules manor slave shacks). There are also some growing along the road between the Arvel and Ules manors. If you cannot find all five units of the root there, try checking at the Llovyn farm, southwest of the Dren Plantation (though any corkbulb will work). Return to Tunifus with the corkbulb to receive a Potion of Cure Common Disease and a Standard Restore Health Potion.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Synnolian Tunifus at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart for a new task. Visit Balur Salvu in the Ascadian Isles to get five pieces of Marshmerrow. Find Balur in his farm along Lake Hairan a little southeast of Pelagiad, and give him the Quality Fortify Strength Potion as a gift. Return to Synnolian to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Task[edit] Synnolian Tunifus at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart will ask you to run an errand to fetch five pieces of Marshmerrow. He suggests that you visit the farmer Balur Salvu near Pelagiad to get it, and gives you a Quality Fortify Strength Potion to use as a gift. Gathering Marshmerrow[edit] You can get the marshmerrow anywhere, including Alchemist shops and in the wild (in which case you get to keep the potion). If you do visit Balur, you can get a copy of The Cake and the Diamond, an Alchemy skill book, in addition to the marshmerrow. Balur's Farmhouse can be found along Lake Hairan a little southeast of Pelagiad, on the north side of the road. Do not disturb the Bull Netch and Betty Netch in the area, and they will most likely leave you alone. (There are a few netch-herders about who will tell you this if you speak to them.) If you give Balur the strength potion, his disposition towards you jumps by thirty; if not, it rises by only ten. Return to Tunifus with the marshmerrow to receive a Standard Restore Health Potion in addition to an apprentice's mortar and pestle. You might also be eligible for a rank advancement.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Synnolian Tunifus at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart for a new task. Travel to Gnisis to deliver four bargain restore health potions and harvest five pieces of muck. Deliver the potions to Chaplain Ogrul in the chapel at the bottom level of Fort Darius. Harvest five pieces of muck from Abishpulu Shand's hut. Return to Synnolian to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Task[edit] Synnolian Tunifus at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart will ask you to run another errand to fetch five pieces of muck while delivering four bargain restore health potions to Chaplain Ogrul at Fort Darius in Gnisis. As Tunifus tells you, the best method of traveling to Gnisis is probably taking the boat from Ebonheart to Vivec, then travelling the rest of the way to Gnisis by silt strider. Tunifus will give you the restore health potions and 80 drakes for travelling expenses, and tell you that a farmer there, Abishpulu Shand, has a muckspunge patch near his hut, and the Chaplain has a deal with Shand to gather muck there for free. Delivering the Potions[edit] The potions are to be delivered to Chaplain Ogrul in Gnisis (a few Silt Strider journeys away), in the chapel at the bottom level of Fort Darius. Upon delivery, the chaplain offers to teach you one of the following spells: Ogrul's Lucky-Again   - Restore Luck 10 pts on Self Ogrul's Quick-Again   - Restore Speed 10 pts on Self Ogrul's Staunch-Again   - Restore Willpower 10 pts on Self Ogrul's Strong-Again   - Restore Strength 10 pts on Self You can also respectfully decline the chaplain's offer. Gathering Muck[edit] The muck can be found in a patch between Abishpulu Shand's hut and the Legion barracks (northwest of Fort Darius). You can also buy the muck or harvest it from another place if you so desire. Muck can be found in muckspunges all over Vvardenfell. Return to Tunifus with the five pieces of muck to receive a Potion of Cure Common Disease, an Apprentice's Retort, and a copy of The Alchemists Formulary (a book with 10 alchemy recipes).
