Mercius will tell you that he will be waiting for you, but unlike his two lieutenants in the last quest, he will not attack you on sight, nor does he have any dialogue which initiates combat. If you do not close the door first, you will have to taunt him to avoid everyone else in the guild hall becoming hostile. Before you do so, ask him about "orders", and then "Thieves Guild Bosses". He will give you the Remove the Heads of the Thieves Guild quest, and 5,000 drakes to deal with any bounty problems that may result from killing the three bosses. Return to Percius when you've finished to be named the Master of the Guild.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Gentleman Jim Stacey at Simine Fralinie's Bookshop, in Vivec's Foreign Quarter Canalworks, for a new job. Travel to Vivec's Guild of Fighters and eliminate Sjoring Hard-Heart to remove the influence of the Camonna Tong from the Fighters Guild. Return to Gentleman Jim Stacey to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] Gentleman Jim Stacey at Simine Fralinie's Bookshop, in Vivec's Foreign Quarter Canalworks, wants you to kill Sjoring Hard-Heart in the Vivec Guild of Fighters to remove the influence of the Camonna Tong from the Fighters Guild. Kill Hard-Heart[edit] Sjoring Hard-Heart can be found in the basement of Vivec's Guild of Fighters in the Foreign Quarter Plaza. Despite being Master of the Fighters Guild, he is an average opponent. Frenzy Humanoid or Taunt can be used to force him to strike first, in order to avoid any negative consequences when killing him. Command Humanoid or Charm spells can be used to lead him to an isolated area before attacking. Once the job is done, return to Gentleman Jim Stacey to be rewarded with The Skeleton Key, as well as a promotion to Master Thief. Jim Stacey will disappear from the game after this quest, so finish up any remaining quests with him first.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Ranis Athrys in the Balmora Guild of Mages for duties. Travel to Maar Gan. Confront Tashpi Ashibael about being a necromancer. Either kill Tashpi or let her escape. Return to Athrys.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Ranis Athrys in the Balmora Guild of Mages is accusing  Tashpi Ashibael in Maar Gan of practicing necromancy and wants her dead. Tashpi Ashibael[edit] Maar Gan is far to the north, past Ald'ruhn. Ask the locals there about Tashpi to learn that she lives in the last house on the right before the shrine, and that she is a well-liked town healer. When you confront Tashpi about being a necromancer, she seems rather surprised, though once you mention Ranis she seems to understand. According to her, she refused to join the Mages Guild and Ranis has held a grudge against her ever since. Tashpi suggests that you let her leave Vvardenfell and tell Ranis that she is dead. Otherwise, the only other solution is to kill Tashpi. Upon returning to Ranis you are rewarded with an increase in Disposition/Reputation. If Tashpi was not already dead before starting this quest, you will also receive two Scrolls of Elemental Burst:Fire and two Scrolls of The Fourth Barrier. Your Disposition and Faction Reputation bonuses depend on the manner in which you complete this quest. As you can see from the following chart, actually killing Tashpi will get you a higher Disposition boost with Ranis Athrys, but a lower Faction Reputation bonus. Letting her escape is thus more beneficial, since it effectively increases your Disposition with all Mages Guild members (including Ranis). Method Disp. Fac. Rep.   Kill Tashpi 20 5   Let Tashpi escape and lie to Ranis 15 10   Tashpi already dead before you start 10 5

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Skink-in-Tree's-Shade at the Mage's Guild in Wolverine Hall for duties. Travel to Shal to take care of a necromancer. Kill Telura Ulver. Return to Skink-in-Tree's-Shade.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Skink-in-Tree's-Shade in the Wolverine Hall Mage's Guild asks you take care of a former guild member that has turned to using necromancy, tarnishing the 'good name' of the Guild. Telura Ulver can be found in Shal, north of Hla Oad on the west coast, just north of the Daedric ruin. Necromancy is not Allowed[edit] Shal is a small cave with an assortment of undead before you reach the main chamber with Telura, who will attack you on sight. She's a powerful mage, but once her spells are used up she's not too tough. Once she is dead, you can loot her chamber for various items, including a full set of Master quality alchemy tools and a number of books and potions. Returning to Skink you are rewarded the usual increase in Disposition.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Master Aryon for chores. Travel to Rethan Manor and kill Raynasa Rethan. Return to Aryon to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Once you reach the rank of Wizard and have built the first stage of your stronghold, Councilor Aryon will ask you to kill Raynasa Rethan, master of the Hlaalu stronghold Rethan Manor. Kill Raynasa Rethan[edit] Rethan Manor is located on the Odai Plateau, south along the Odai River from Balmora. Raynasa Rethan is on the top floor. Unlike the other residents, she is automatically hostile towards you. Don't worry about watching your back, as they won't join the fight unless you attack them. Once Rethan is dead, return to Aryon to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Crassius Curio to learn your next assignment. Travel to Tel Uvirith and kill Reynel Uvirith. Return to Crassius Curio.
Detailed Walkthrough: Business[edit] Evidently this quest is of some importance to Crassius Curio as he requires you to be a House Father and have a stronghold that has reached at least level two before he will give it to you. Talk to Curio in his manor in Vivec and he will ask you to kill the Telvanni sorcerer Reynel Uvirith in the stronghold at Tel Uvirith, in the Molag Amur region west of Tel Fyr. Do The Deed[edit] Reynel Uvirith can be found in the Tower Lower area of the stronghold, and should not prove too much of a challenge for a character that has reached this stage. Return to Vivec[edit] Return to Crassius when Uvirith is dead to complete the quest and receive 1000 drakes as reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Sjoring Hard-Heart for orders. Kill Gentleman Jim Stacey at Simine Fralinie's bookstore in the Foreign Quarter Canalworks. Return to a hostile Sjoring Hard-Heart and kill him to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Orders[edit] Sjoring Hard-Heart in the Vivec Guild of Fighters wants you to kill the Master Thief of the Thieves Guild. Kill the Master Thief[edit] Gentleman Jim Stacey can be found at Simine Fralinie's bookstore in the Vivec Foreign Quarter Canalworks. He is behind the locked (65) door in the back of the bookshop. Frenzy Humanoid or Taunt can be used to force him to strike first, in order to avoid any negative consequences when killing him. Attacking him outright will incur a Bounty on your head and cause Crazy-Legs Arantamo to become hostile. When you return to Sjoring Hard-Heart, he will immediately attack, arguing that you are a threat to his position. Defeat him to become Master of the Fighters Guild.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Trebonius Artorius at the Guild of Mages in Vivec for duties. Kill all the Telvanni councilors: Master Aryon in Tel Vos (Upper Chamber). Mistress Dratha in the Upper Tower in Tel Mora. Mistress Therana in the Upper Tower of Tel Branora. Master Neloth in Tel Naga (Sadrith Mora). Arch-Magister Gothren in the Upper Tower of Tel Aruhn. Return to Trebonius Artorius.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Trebonius Artorius in the Vivec Guild of Mages will give you this quest only if you have solved the Mystery of the Dwarves and finished the Main Quest. The request is strange, but simple, requiring you to merely kill all of the Telvanni councilors (since you've done the Main Quest you should know where they all are). Members of House Telvanni should note that killing Master Aryon will prevent you from becoming Arch Magister of House Telvanni, if you have not already done so. The Telvanni Councilors[edit] The councilors, in brief, are: Master Aryon in Tel Vos (Upper Chamber) Mistress Dratha in the Upper Tower in Tel Mora Mistress Therana in the Upper Tower of Tel Branora Master Neloth in Tel Naga (Sadrith Mora) Arch-Magister Gothren in the Upper Tower of Tel Aruhn (probably already dead) Of course these are all powerful mages and many of them well guarded, so it's not an easy task, but one that you're probably up to at this point. If you complete his request and return to Trebonius, he will reward you with his staff and the Necromancer's Amulet.

Quick Walkthrough: Once you have become a Clanfriend of the Ashlanders, speak with the Urshilaku trader Kurapli. (Optional) Ask around in Dagon Fel to learn the location of Aharasaplit Camp. Travel to Aharasaplit Camp and kill Zallay. Return to Kurapli for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Kurapli Seeks Justice[edit] Once you have become the Ashlander Clanfriend, speak with the Urshilaku trader Kurapli to receive this quest. Kurapli will tell you that the outcast Zallay Subaddamael killed her husband. She asks you to find and kill Zallay, and in return she will give you Airan-Ahhe's Spirit Spear. Finding Zallay[edit] If you ask about "discuss", Kurapli tells you that Zallay has taken refuge at Aharasaplit Camp, somewhere on the island of Sheogorad. She suggests that you ask the inhabitants of Dagon Fel for the precise location of the camp. Either travel to Dagon Fel and ask anybody about Zallay Subaddamael to get the location or find the place on your own. Aharasaplit Camp lies on the southwest coast of the island. Killing Zallay[edit] Travel to Aharasaplit Camp, where you will find Zallay waiting for you in his yurt. He wields an iron claymore, but is unarmored. Kill him, and return to Kurapli to receive her late husband's enchanted spear.

Quick Walkthrough: Meet Synette Jeline on the road southwest of Ald Velothi. Retrieve her ring in the pond. Defeat Synette and her friend to gain the Amulet of Shadows.
Detailed Walkthrough: A Damsel in Distress?[edit] The ring is hard to see Southwest of Ald Velothi, along the road, you will run into a lady named Synette Jeline. She complains that her ring has fallen into a nearby pond and wants you to get it. If you are playing a male character, her request is accompanied by some significant flirting as well. The Lady's Ring[edit] The ring is in a shallow pool of water just north of Jeline. Since the water is so murky and the ring is so tiny, you may have a great deal of trouble locating it. A Night Eye spell may be of use here. The ring can be found lying next to the second plant from the south edge of the pool. If you dip your head just below the water, you can see through the surface without causing your vision to become murky or starting the breath timer. It's a Trap![edit] Unfortunately, once you grab the ring, Jeline and her near-invisible friend, Tavynu Tedran will attack you. Kill them and take their loot of gold and magic weapons as a reward (the ring itself is relatively worthless). Tavynu Tedran has the Amulet of Shadows, a very nice item to have.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Jim Stacey about Bal Molagmer. Go to the Library of Vivec to steal a forged land deed of sale for Indrele Rathryon's land. Return the deed to Indrele in Seyda Neen. Return to Jim to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] For the third quest in this series, Jim asks you to stop Velanda Omani from stealing Indrele Rathryon's land via a forged land deed placed in the Library of Vivec. You must steal the deed from the library and return it to Indrele in Seyda Neen. Stealing the Land Deed[edit] The Library can be found in the Halls of Wisdom in the Temple Canton in the south of Vivec. The deed is half hidden on the bottom shelf in the north end of the library (third shelf from the right while facing north and watch out for the guards). Travel to Seyda Neen (the town where the game starts), find Indrele near her shack in the west of town and return the deed to her: forged land deed "Just leave me alone. I already told you. I never signed any land deed. I'm not selling my land, and I'm not moving back to Cyrodiil." Give her the land deed "What? This looks like the land deed... Why are you giving me this?" I stole it.: "Well, I won't argue with you, but I still don't understand why you did this." This deed belongs in your hands. "I thank you. I have my land deed, and Velanda Omani doesn't." OR "Thank you very much. I can't tell you what this means. And...your gloves...they seem somehow familiar...stories I heard as a child. Anyway, I thank you." If you're wearing the gloves of Bal Molagmer she'll seem familiar with them. Return to Jim in Vivec for his congratulations.

Quick Walkthrough: Overhear the latest rumors or ask someone about a little secret to discover that Larrius Varro wishes to speak with you. Meet Varro in Moonmoth Legion Fort, and he suggests that you should take care of the "Bad People" in Balmora. Ask around the Thieves Guild about the "Bad People". Go to the Council Club. Kill all the "Bad People", and make your way back to Larrius Varro to claim your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: A Rumor[edit] If you ask about the latest rumors in Balmora, you might discover that the local magistrate, Nolus Atrius (a character who doesn't exist in the game), is corrupt and that Larrius Varro has sworn to stop the corruption. Alternatively, people in town might tell you a little secret, which is that Varro has been looking to have a chat with you. In either case, Varro is the Champion at Moonmoth Legion Fort (just east of town) so you should head there and talk to him. Larrius Varro[edit] Larrius is in the back of the main fort, past all the vendor tables. At first, Larrius speaks very carefully and actually asks you to do nothing (which is his intent), but if you question him further he will tell you that he wants someone to wipe out five members of the Camonna Tong in Balmora. Though he doesn't know where they are, or even their names, he knows their professions: scout, pawnbroker, savant, thief, and smith. The Bad People[edit] Return to Balmora and ask around about the Bad People and you will be directed to the Thieves Guild in the South Wall Cornerclub (disposition of 50 or higher is needed). Ask around in the club and, if you are persuasive enough, you will learn that all of the Bad People are in the Camonna Tong, and they hang out at the Council Club in town.  Their names are: Madrale Thirith, Marasa Aren, Sovor Trandel, Thanelen Velas, and Vadusa Sathryon. The barkeep, Banor Seran, is the only other person in the building. In the Council Club, you'll find 3 of the members in the tavern (you don't have to kill the Barkeep), one is downstairs, and one upstairs. Taking on all 5 at once (and sometimes the barkeep), can be very tough. You may wish to stock up on scrolls and potions beforehand. The two loners may be assassinated or taunted into fighting without alerting the others. Taunting any of the three members in the barroom, however, will likely cause the other two to attack you as well, so be prepared. A Frenzy spell may also work well. If not, moving onto the staircase or the bedroom corridor may limit those in attack range to one or two. Madrale and Marasa are somewhat hostile by default, thus easy to taunt. If you're planning to join the Thieves Guild or are already a member but haven't yet completed the Nerano Manor Key quest, make sure to get the key Sovor is carrying from his corpse before you leave. Return to Varro[edit] Unfortunately, unless you attacked them in self defense, you will become wanted by the guards. If you can make it back to Moonmoth Legion Fort without being apprehended, Varro will remove the price on your head in return for helping him out. The easiest way to get back to Varro is to use a Divine Intervention or Recall spell. Alternatively, you can use invisibility or chameleon to avoid being noticed by the guards, or simply sneak out of town, if your skill is high enough. You will receive a nice Ring of Surroundings as a reward. If you managed to kill all of the bad people without obtaining a bounty, or were able to clear your name before speaking with Varro, the captain will be happy at your discretion and give you a copy of Biography of the Wolf Queen as well. One way to remove your bounty is at the nearby South Wall Cornerclub, the hangout of the Thieves Guild in Balmora. This can be done in between killings to maintain a bounty below 5000 gold, which will prevent the bug (mentioned below) where guards will continually attack you even after Larrius Varro's absolution of the bounty. An easy escape path is to exit the Cornerclub building and cross the street to the Silt Strider and exit the town. Run East towards Moonmoth Fort, and at the fork take a left (North on the map) to run around the back of the Fort. Approaching from the Northeast, you can jump onto the wall of the Fort and run along the wall towards the central keep, where there is a trap door that leads you directly in front of Larrius Varro.  This requires at most a few seconds of invisibility while approaching the trap door and possibly none at all. The same concept can also be used to approach the South Wall Cornerclub from behind, unseen by guards, if you're looking to clear your bounty that way.

Quick Walkthrough: Meet Fonus Rathryon along the road, west of Maar Gan. Escort him to the Koal Cave.
Detailed Walkthrough: Meet the Pilgrim[edit] West of Maar Gan you will find the pilgrim Fonus Rathryon along the road who will ask you to escort him to the Koal Cave south of Gnisis. Lead the Pilgrim to Koal Cave[edit] The quickest route is to simply head back to Maar Gan and take a Silt Strider up to Gnisis and then head south to the cave. If you take too long to escort the pilgrim, he will leave on his own. Once you reach the cave Fonus will reward you with 150 gold.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Alarvyne Indalas in the Glassworker's Hall on the Plaza level of the St. Delyn Canton. Obtain five Limeware Cups and five Limeware Bowls. Give the limeware to Alarvyne Indalas or (for a smaller reward) to Bolrin at the East Empire Company offices in Ebonheart.
Detailed Walkthrough: Liberate the Limeware[edit] Speak to Alarvyne Indalas in the Glassworker's Hall in Vivec's St. Delyn Canton. The Hall has entrances on both the Waistworks and Plaza levels; Alarvyne can be found on the upstairs level. She will complain that Dwemer items are becoming more difficult to obtain, possibly due to manipulation by Bolrin at the East Empire Company offices in Ebonheart. She knows that a shipment of Dwemer limeware can currently be found in the ship Chun-Ook at the docks at Ebonheart and asks you to steal the limeware for her.  Specifically, she wants five Limeware Cups and five Limeware Bowls. The Chun-Ook[edit] Go to the dock on the east side of Ebonheart. Nevosi Hlan, the shipmaster, stands on deck near the locked (25) trap door to the upper level of the ship's interior. There is no key, so you'll have to break in. Two guards patrol inside the upper level. They don't seem to mind if you take anything in this room, but if they see you attempt to open the locked (30) trap door to the lower level, they'll attack and say "You can't be in here, %PCRace. And I'm afraid I can't let you leave. The Company wouldn't like that at all." It's fairly easy to break in undetected, however, by standing behind part of the wall near the trap door, out of sight. You'll find no guards in the lower level. The second crate on the left (near the barrel with candles on top) contains the limeware you need: five cups and five bowls. Options[edit] You can return the items to Alarvyne back in Vivec for 1500 gold.  Alternatively, you can return them to Bolrin in Ebonheart for 500 gold (for pointing out the lack of security in the operation).

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Lorbumol gro-Aglakh at the Guild of Fighters in Vivec for your orders. Travel to Ald'ruhn to collect a debt from Lirielle Stoine in The Rat in the Pot. Lirielle will tell you it was her brother who owed the money, but he's been killed in Mallapi. (Optional) Travel to Mallapi to loot the place and make up the gold for the debt. Return to Lorbumol and pay the debt yourself to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders[edit] Lorbumol gro-Aglakh in the Vivec Guild of Fighters asks you to return 2,000 septims of debt money from Lirielle Stoine in Ald'ruhn in The Rat in the Pot. Lirielle's Debt[edit] If you talk with Percius Mercius in the Ald'ruhn Guild of Fighters, he will tell you: "It was not Lirielle Stoine who owed money, but her brother Ranus [sic] Stoine. Ranus [sic] was murdered, and I don't think Lirielle has 2000 septims. You'lll have to either find the gold Ranus [sic] had or pay the 2000 septims yourself." This is the same story that Lirielle will give you, though she knows that Ruran was killed in Mallapi, northeast of Gnaar Mok, where he went to seek his fortune. If you didn't already confirm this quest by discussing debt money with Lorbumol, you have the option to back out of it, even after discussing debt money with Percius, who will suggest that the contract isn't legitimate.  As a result, Lirielle won't offer the debt money topic unless you go back to Vivec and confirm it.  Meanwhile, Lorbumol has other quests for you to do, which may be accessed by discussing Rufinus Alleius with him, and you may still discuss debt money with Lorbumol later, (or simultaneously), if you wish. If you confirm the quest with 2,000 gold to spare, you may give it to Lorbumol before going to Ald'ruhn, but if you do, Lirielle will be so glad the matter is settled that she won't even talk about Ruran or Mallapi. Mallapi[edit] Though you don't have to go to Mallapi, it may be worth your while, especially if you can't afford to part with the 2,000 gold yourself (well, only 1,000 gold since you get to keep half of the debt). Mallapi is on the hills just northeast of Gnaar Mok as Lirielle mentioned. Ruran's corpse is inside, in a dead end right branch under some water. With the loot from his corpse and the remaining treasure in the caves, you should easily be able to make up the 1,000 gold for the debt. Return to Lorbumol for your 1,000 gold reward (half of the debt money).

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Ilmeni Dren for business. Acquire the books ABCs for Barbarians and The Annotated Anuad for a literacy campaign. Give the books to Vala Catraso in the school in the Ald'ruhn Mages Guild. Return to Ilmeni to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Business[edit] You can start performing the few quests for Ilmeni Dren once you reach the rank of Kinsman in the House. You can find Ilmeni in her apartment in Vivec, St. Delyn Canal South-One. For the first quest, talk to her about people cannot read. Ilmeni complains that not enough people know how to read and says that often the teachers in the Mages Guild do not have enough books. Literacy Campaign[edit] You must find two books, ABCs for Barbarians and The Annotated Anuad for the school in the Ald'ruhn Mages Guild. Most bookstores stock the books; the easiest is probably the bookstore in Ald'ruhn. Then deliver them to the priest, Vala Catraso, of the Ald'ruhn Mages Guild, who can be found at the altar downstairs. Return to Ilmeni in Vivec to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Aengoth the Jeweler at The Rat In the Pot in Ald'ruhn about your new job. Go to the Guild of Mages in town to steal Anarenen's Devil Tanto. Take care of the guard and steal the tanto. (Optional, not required but highly recommended) Steal the copy of Withershins. Return to Aengoth to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Manis Virmaulese gives the last full measure of devotion Job[edit] Aengoth the Jeweler at The Rat In the Pot in Ald'ruhn will ask you to steal Anarenen's Devil Tanto in the Ald'ruhn Guild of Mages, as it is apparently unguarded. Stealing Anarenen's Devil Tanto[edit] You will quickly find that the guildhall isn't completely unguarded; there is one guard in the entrance, Manis Virmaulese, who immediately engages in combat with you as soon as you enter the guild, forcing you to kill him or simply ignore him. If your Sneak skill is high enough, or you make use of Invisibility or Chameleon spells, you can easily avoid dealing with him. He'll still challenge you when you enter, but if he can't see you, he can't fight you. The tanto is in a small locked chest downstairs to the right in the alchemist's corner on the top shelf. Return to Aengoth for a reward of, well, nothing. You can, of course, sell anything else you loot from the guildhall.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Varus Vantinius. Enter the caves through the hidden door in the shrine or the underwater entrance. Defeat Furius Acilius in battle. Return the Lord's Mail to Varus. Travel to Sadrith Mora and ask around town about Draramu Hloran. Go to Abanabi. Kill Draramu Hloran. Return Chrysamere to Varus.
Detailed Walkthrough: Lord's Mail[edit] Once you've reached the rank of Knight Protector in the Legion, you can perform this quest for the Knight of the Imperial Dragon, Varus Vantinius, found in the Grand Council Chamber in the Duke's Castle in Ebonheart. Varus informs you that in order to become a Knight of the Garland you must retrieve two missing artifacts. The first is the Lord's Mail, which disappeared from the Imperial Commission on the ground floor and to which you are given a key. To start your investigation, talk to the Imperial Magistrate Rufinus Alleius, who suspects the banished legionnaire Furius Acilius, who was talking about the armor and the caves below the castle before he left. A closer inspection reveals how the thief got in, via a well-hidden and locked (95) door located in the Imperial Shrine itself (Someone forgot to wipe their feet).  If you are a skilled enough thief, this should pose no problem to you, but you can also find the Worn Imperial Key in Acilius' room, in the southwest portion of Imperial Guard Garrison, underneath his pillow. The secret door leads to a small cave where Acilius is trying on the missing armor. After a short talk, he will attack you; kill him in a tougher-than-average fight and retrieve the armor. There is more loot in the cave; see the notes. Return the armor to Vantinius (don't worry, you'll get it back soon). If you would rather not risk getting caught, you can walk from the main entrance of Ebonheart along the path. When the path turns right, continue over the hill on the left. This should bring you to a sandy area. Swim through the water to the tip of the peninsula. Under the water, you should reach a door leading to the underground caves. When you enter, kill all of the rats, then kill Furius, and you can leave out the way you came. If you still want to get into the room with the secret door, swim through the pool of water by his camp, and you will see a floating crate. Inside is the key to the secret wall door. If you refuse to give Varus the armor twice, he will get offended and attack you. This will not have any legal consequences or expel you from the Legion, but it will prevent you from dueling him later for the last rank. After you give Varus the Lord's Mail, he will give you the Duke's Guard Silver Cuirass he was originally wearing. Chrysamere[edit] The second artifact to recover is the legendary sword, Chrysamere, which was stolen by another knight. Spies have learned that the sword is in the possession of the sorceress Draramu Hloran near Sadrith Mora. If you travel to Sadrith Mora and ask around town, you'll quickly learn that everyone is scared to death of Hloran and won't speak a word of her to you. You'll have to boost an NPC's disposition to at least 75 in order to get one to spill the beans. Hloran can be found in the cave Abanabi, southwest of town on a large island. Hloran, among other things in the cave, can be found in a slightly concealed side corridor. Note that there are many leveled Daedra of random sorts in the cave. Once you kill her, return the sword to Vantinius. If you refuse to give him Chrysamere, he will attack you.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Wulf at the Tower of Dusk in Ghostgate. Accept his Old Man's Lucky Coin. Talk to Lalatia Varian at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart, who will explain this event.
Detailed Walkthrough: Meet Wulf[edit] Though not really a quest per-se, once you obtain Wraithguard from Vivec in the course of the Main Quest, the Imperial warrior Wulf will appear in Ghostgate's Tower of Dusk. Speak to him and he will ask you to carry an Old Man's Lucky Coin to Red Mountain as a favor. If you ask anyone in Ghostgate about Wulf, they will not know him or that he is there. After you leave the temple, he will disappear for good. A Lucky Coin[edit] The coin isn't anything special in itself, but when you accept it you gain a new power: Luck of the Emperor   - Fortify Luck 20 pts for 2 mins on Self. It turns out that Wulf was actually the manifestation of the god Tiber Septim. If you talk to Lalatia Varian at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart, she will explain this event and you'll gain two Reputation points. You'll also be able to hear about it through the rumor mill, as any Imperial Guard will be impressed that you saw Tiber Septim in the flesh. Wulf doesn't yield any special items if you kill him, but interestingly he carries a decent amount of moon sugar.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Athyn Sarethi for duties. (Optional) Travel to the Grand Council Chambers in Ebonheart and speak to Llerar Mandas. (Optional) Travel to Tel Fyr and rescue Delyna Mandas. Travel to Milk and speak with or kill Arethan Mandas. Return to Athyn Sarethi to complete the quest. (Optional) Return to Llerar for a bonus reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Athyn Sarethi in his manor in Ald'ruhn will ask you to deal with a former Redoran Noble, Arethan Mandas, who has gone mad. Arethan is in a cave known as Milk and is harassing travelers by demanding tribute. Milk is found a bit to the west of Ald'ruhn. Athyn Sarethi wants this matter solved, but he doesn't want his old friend killed if it can be avoided. He suggests talking to Arethan's father, Llerar Mandas, in Ebonheart. Arethan's Madness[edit] You can visit Arethan Mandas anytime. He is not hostile, but you have to get past his hostile guards. Arethan will talk to you, but all you will get is some mad talk. He mentions Delyna and Tel Fyr. The simplest and quickest method is to just kill Arethan, though there is another solution. Sarethi mentions that Arethan's father, Llerar Mandas, can be found in the Grand Council Chambers in Ebonheart, and that you might want to talk to him before traveling to Milk. Llerar will tell you that his son went mad after Divayth Fyr kidnapped Arethan's daughter, Delyna, and believes that the return of Delyna just might cure Arethan's madness. Rescuing Arethan's Daughter[edit] Tel Fyr is located a small distance southwest of Sadrith Mora. There are no travel services, so swimming is required. Delyna Mandas can be found in the Onyx Hall of Tel Fyr, behind a locked (60) and trapped door. The door can be opened with Divayth's 1008th Key, or alternatively you can pick the lock or cast an Open spell. Nobody in Tel Fyr seems to care if you rescue her, Divayth himself cannot be concerned with such petty matters. Escort Delyna outside. Once there, she will give you an amulet which you can show to Arethan as proof that she is alive. Curing Arethan[edit] Travel to Milk and show Arethan the amulet and he will become slightly more sane and promise to stop demanding tribute. His guards will become friendly, if you haven't disposed of them on your way in. Report back to Sarethi in Ald'ruhn to complete the quest and receive a noticeable increase in disposition with all Redoran members. If you tell Llerar Mandas in Ebonheart the good news you receive an Ebony Closed Helm as well.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Master Aryon in the Upper Tower in Tel Vos for chores. Travel to Ald'ruhn to convince three Redoran Councilors to lift the Mages Guild monopoly. Talk to Athyn Sarethi in his manor to have him agree and tell you who else will give his support. Talk to two more councilors for their support, except Bolvyn Venim. Return to Aryon to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Councilor Aryon in the Upper Tower of Tel Vos will ask you to help him overturn the Mages Guild monopoly on magic services (e.g. training, spellmaking, enchanting, etc.). According to one interpretation of the Armistice, only the Mages Guild can officially offer spells and training to non-members. He asks you to speak with the House Redoran Councilors in Ald'ruhn. If you can convince at least three councilors, the Telvanni will have enough support in the Grand Council to end the monopoly. He also suggests that you start with Athyn Sarethi, as he seems to be the most open-minded. Lifting the Monopoly[edit] Go and visit Athyn Sarethi in his manor in Ald'ruhn. Athyn will agree if you raise his Disposition above 50. He will also tell you that the other councilors may agree to overturn the monopoly if you make an 'appeal to fairness.' He will also advise you that one councilor, Bolvyn Venim, will certainly not support the change. The other four councilors are Miner Arobar, Garisa Llethri, Hlaren Ramoran and Brara Morvayn. The first three can be found in their respective manors, which can be accessed from the main hub under-Skar. Brara Morvayn can be found in her quarters within the Redoran Council Hall. They will each agree to support the ending of the monopoly only if you use the conversation topic 'appeal to fairness' and their disposition is above 40. They will not agree if you simply mention the monopoly directly. You must therefore talk to Sarethi first to get the 'appeal to fairness' topic before you can convince the other councilors. Don't bother talking to Venim: he will not agree no matter what you do. Once you have the support of at least three councilors, return to Aryon to complete the quest and receive Aryon's Dominator (a magic glove that casts Command Human and Creature). If you happened to 'accidentally' kill any Redoran councilors along the way (this does not count Bolvyn Venim dying in a duel if you are doing the Redoran Hortator quest at the same time as this one), you can complete the quest but will not receive the magic glove or the disposition and reputation boosts.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Imsin the Dreamer in Buckmoth Legion Fort about Orders. Travel to Assumanu, and recover Ilmeni's glove from Varona Nelas. (Optional) Return the glove to Ilmeni Dren in Vivec. Go back to Imsin the Dreamer and report your success.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders[edit] Imsin the Dreamer in the Buckmoth Legion Fort will ask you to recover an embroidered glove that is being used by a Telvanni outcast to blackmail a Buoyant Armiger. This Armiger is apparently the lover of a noble Dunmer lady whom Imsin does not name. Imsin asks you to recover this glove at all costs. Retrieve the Glove[edit] The Telvanni is Varona Nelas, in the cave of Assumanu on the south shore of the long island, northeast of Khuul. You'll find two other sorcerers hiding out in the cave, who can summon several creatures. You can avoid them by making a right when the cave splits. You can either kill or persuade Varona to give you the glove, she will not attack you first. Killing Allimir on the way in however will cause Varona to attack you should you ask for the maiden's token - and discover that it is called "Ilmeni's glove", a fairly obvious hint as to the identity of the Buoyant Armiger's lover. Return the Glove[edit] You can return the glove to the maiden, Ilmeni Dren in Vivec's St. Delyn Canton, Canal South-One, or you can simply return the glove to Imsin. You receive the disposition boost with Ilmeni only if you return the glove to her. Either way, return to Imsin to receive her congratulations. This is the last quest you receive from Imsin the Dreamer.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Endryn Llethan‎ and receive the key to the Archcanon's office. Talk to Archcanon Tholer Saryoni in his office for your duties. Get four daedra's hearts to visit the Statue of Malacath as part of the Pilgrimages of the Four Corners. Travel to Sheogorad and find the statue southwest of Dagon Fel. Activate the shrine with your four hearts to receive the poem Four Corners of the House of Troubles and the Blessings of the First Corner.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Once you reach the rank of Diviner, Endryn Llethan‎ at the High Fane in the Vivec's Temple Canton will tell you that Archcanon Tholer Saryoni wishes to speak with you. He will give you the key to the Archcanon's quarters in the Crosier of the High Fane. Go speak with the Archcanon and he  will ask you to perform yet more pilgrimages, this time the Pilgrimages of the Four Corners. You must visit and activate four shrines related to the four 'bad' Daedra Lords (Four Corners of the House of Troubles). The shrines must be visited the correct order for you to be able to complete the pilgrimages. Visit Saryoni after you complete each portion to get more information on the next part. Archcanon Saryoni then tells you that the First Corner of the House of Troubles is Malacath. Visit his shrine southwest of Dagon Fel (west of Mzuleft, nestled in some hills) with four Daedra's Hearts and recite the poem Four Corners of the House of Troubles. Malacath of the House of Troubles[edit] If you've been fighting any Daedra, chances are you have a good supply of hearts already, but if not, a good number of alchemist shops also sell them (Nalcarya of White Haven in Balmora for example). Once you have your hearts, find the shrine, which is simply a large Statue of Malacath surrounded by a number of Orc worshippers. Approach the shrine and activate it with four hearts in your inventory to receive the poem (which you don't really have to recite) and the Blessings of the First Corner   - Fortify Strength 10-20 pts for 48 mins on Touch. Return to Archcanon Saryoni in Vivec for instructions on the next Corner of the House of Troubles.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Malacath's Statue at the shrine of Assurdirapal. Travel to Gnaar Mok and slay Farvyn Oreyn. Return to Malacath's Statue and receive Helm of Oreyn Bearclaw as your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Malacath's Request[edit] The shrine is located in Assurdirapal in the Sheogorad region on the long island west of Dagon Fel (just west of the Sanctus Shrine island). Talk to Malacath and he will tell you a story about an elven hero by the name of Oreyn Bearclaw. Actually, he is no hero at all but was falsely credited with the deeds done by his friend, an Orc named Kharag gro-Khar. Malacath wants you to destroy Bearclaw's legend by killing the last of his bloodline. If you do, you will receive the Helm of Oreyn Bearclaw as your reward. Killing the False Hero[edit] Farvyn Oreyn and his bodyguards Head toward Vivec as suggested by Malacath to begin your search for the descendant. You should be able to find out that the last of Bearclaw's line is Farvyn Oreyn and that you can find him near Gnaar Mok. Ask some townsfolk to find out where he is, south of town. You will find him clad in Dwemer armor and in the company of two bodyguards. If you talk to him, he will freely admit that the legend of Oreyn Bearclaw is a falsehood. Telling him you have come from Malacath, or promising to keep the truth a secret will result in him and his guards attacking you. Farvyn is fairly easy to kill, but his two bodyguards are not, so be careful. Once you have killed him, return to the shrine to pick up your reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Meet Teris Raledran north of Vivec. Escort him and his guar to a safe spot. Escort Teris to Agrippina Herennia's Clothing Shop.
Detailed Walkthrough: A Man and His Guar[edit] North of Vivec, along the road north of the Gro-Bagrat Plantation, you will come across Teris Raledran and his guar Rollie. Teris and company are in need of an escort to Agrippina Herennia's clothing shop in Vivec's Foreign Quarter, Canalworks level. A Safe Spot For Rollie[edit] The catch here is that you don't need to actually escort both Teris and the guar the entire way. For some reason, guar are not permitted inside Vivec's city limits. Instead of trying to cross the bridge west into Vivec, head further south and Teris should pipe up, commenting that here would be a good spot to leave Rollie. Entering the City[edit] You can now head into the city and on to Agrippina's without trouble. Once you reach the shop's front door, Teris will reward you with 200 gold (or just 100 gold if you accidentally or intentionally killed his guar).

Quick Walkthrough: Meet Din on the road north of Gnisis. Cast Cure Common Disease on him or escort him to Gnisis Temple.
Detailed Walkthrough: You can find the rambling Din north of Gnisis, wearing some Imperial Legion armor. Unfortunately, conversation with Din is difficult as you will quickly discover. Choose the dialogue options of catch some slaughterfish followed by muddled to receive the option to cure him. Curing Din requires some form of Cure Common Disease, though if you don't have any handy you can get Din to follow you to Mehra Drora, the healer in the basement of the Gnisis Temple. If you do make the journey (or cure him with magic) you'll receive a small gold reward as well as a faction increase with the Imperial Legion.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Ranis Athrys in the Balmora Guild of Mages for duties. Travel to Punabi, and find Manwe. Collect Manwe's dues or kill her. Return to Balmora.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] This is one of the first quests offered by Ranis Athrys in the Balmora Guild of Mages once you reach the rank of Journeyman. This and the quest Recruit or Kill Llarar Bereloth are offered at the same time, but are considered separate and will each raise your standing within the Guild. Ranis will ask you to collect a debt from Manwe, who has failed to pay her dues for several years, and now owes over 2000 septims. Allegedly she is researching something in Punabi, near Llarar Bereloth in Sulipund. If you can convince Manwe to pay the dues, Ranis will split them with you. Otherwise, kill her. Traveling to Punabi[edit] Ranis tells you that Punabi is north of the Dunmer stronghold Marandus, and she marks Marandus on the map. This still leaves you with the decision on how to get to Marandus. The overland route doesn't really have a clear path due to mountains, which complicate travel. Without levitation, the trip can be difficult and is a far distance away. The other option is to take a Silt Strider to Suran, and then swim up the river that runs beside the town to Lake Nabia. Besides the occasional slaughterfish coming from the deep and the occasional cliff racer coming from above, there shouldn't be that much of a problem with creatures. Once you arrive at the lake, just get out on the shore and you'll be very close to Marandus. Now just follow Ranis' directions to get to Punabi. Manwe[edit] Once you get to Punabi, briefly follow the cave until you find Manwe. Use either Speechcraft or bribes to get her Disposition up to 60, and she will fork over 2000 gold, the required sum (half of which is kept as a reward). If you kill her, you do not get such a large monetary reward, as she has far less money on her corpse, and your disposition reward is only five, rather than fifteen.  However, if you get her to give you the 2000 gold, THEN kill her, you can keep all 2000 gold for yourself (minus 10 disposition), as Ranis assumes Manwe did not give you the money. A final alternative is just to pay Ranis yourself, but you must travel to Punabi and speak to Manwe before you are given this option.

Quick Walkthrough: Find Marsus Tullius. Go to the Erabenimsun Camp and talk to some of the Ashlanders. Speak to Tinti and Hairan and either obtain the hides through force, being an adopted Ashlander, or allow them to keep the hides. Return to Marsus Tullius. If you brought back the hides, go to Stentus Tullius in Tel Aruhn for a reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Stolen Hides[edit] Find Marsus Tullius northwest of the Erabenimsun Camp and northeast of Uvirith's Grave. He has been robbed by two Ashlanders who stole some guar hides from him, and asks you to find the thieves and return the hides. Return to the camp and ask around to learn the Ashlanders responsible are actually the respected warriors Hairan and Tinti, who were probably offended in some manner by Marsus. Speak to the warriors in the camp to confirm the story that Marsus was stealing hides from the camp's herds, and they merely took back what was rightfully theirs. If you've already completed the quest Meet Sul-Matuul (part of the main quest), the two warriors will simply give you the hides. Allowing the Ashlanders to keep the Hides[edit] If you refuse to take them you'll receive a Herder's Belt. When you return to Marsus Tullius he will apologize, saying that he had no idea the hides were from guars belonging to the Erabenimsun Camp. He goes on to say that his father will not be able to pay you a reward since it relied on delivery of the hides. If you talk to Stentus next time you are in Tel Aruhn he will also thank you and express his regret that he cannot reward you. Returning the hides to Marsus[edit] If you are not yet an Ashlander or if you take the hides from the Ashlanders, you must either kill the two warriors or pick their pockets to get the hides. Once you return the hides to Tullius, he will refer you to his father Stentus in Tel Aruhn for a reward. Visit Stentus walking around Tel Aruhn for a 200 gold reward. Unfortunately for this quest, you cannot return just any guar hides to Marsus.

Quick Walkthrough: Chat with Sugar-Lips Habasi about jobs and Altmer. Ask around town until you find the Master of Security that Habasi is seeking. Convince Hecerinde to help secure the South Wall Cornerclub. Return to Habasi to finish the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] Sugar-Lips Habasi in the South Wall Cornerclub in Balmora asks you to help her by locating a fellow Thieves Guild master of Security who is living in town so that he may help secure the South Wall Cornerclub. All that she knows is that he is an Altmer (High Elf), and suggests that you ask around since there are only a few Altmer living in Balmora. Inquiries About Altmer in Town[edit] Just about anyone in Balmora will be able to identify the six Altmer in town: Altmer "The only Altmer here in Balmora are Culumaire at the Lucky Lockup, Estirdalin at the Guild of Mages, Imare at the Hlaalu Council Manor, Nalcarya of White Haven the Alchemist, and Hecerinde and Tyermaillin who both have residences here." It's a matter of some footwork to walk around and talk to each one, but you can eventually find out that Hecerinde is the security master. A Chat with Hecerinde[edit] Hecerinde is at his house in Balmora, on the east bank of the Odai River running through town, up on the north end. Chat with Hecerinde about security and South Wall and he'll admit to having neglected his duties to the Thieves Guild, agreeing to help Habasi with her request. Return to Habasi[edit] Return to Habasi with the news to complete the quest. If you have any bounties on your head at this time, she will reset your bounty back to zero. At this point, she will have no further jobs for you in the Thieves Guild, and will refer you to Aengoth the Jeweler in Ald'ruhn or Big Helende in Sadrith Mora for further Thieves Guild jobs.

Quick Walkthrough: Return to Caius in Balmora for your orders. Meet with the informants in Vivec. Huleeya Informant Meet with Huleeya at the Black Shalk Cornerclub in the Foreign Quarter. Calm the locals and escort Huleeya to Jobasha's Bookshop to receive his notes. Addhiranirr Informant Meet with Addhiranirr in the Underworks of the St. Olms Canton. Find and tell the excise agent Duvianus Platorius that Addhiranirr has left for the mainland. Receive the information from Addhiranirr. Meet Mehra Milo Meet with Mehra Milo at the Library of Vivec in the Temple Canton. Steal or buy the book Progress of Truth. Return to Caius in Balmora.
Detailed Walkthrough: Huleeya Addhiranirr Mehra Milo Orders from Caius[edit] After the last errand, Caius tells you to train for a while and come back to him later. Specifically, your character needs to be at least level 3 before Caius will give you the next assignment. At that point, he sends you on a fact-finding mission to the city of Vivec. Your mission is to track down and rendezvous with three people: Addhiranirr, a Khajiit Thieves Guild member in St. Olms, Huleeya, an Argonian Morag Tong assassin at the Black Shalk Cornerclub in the Foreign Quarter, and Mehra Milo, a Tribunal Temple priestess in the Hall of Wisdom of the Temple Canton. Caius is once again looking for any Sixth House or Nerevarine Cult information and he gives you 200 gold for expenses. The quickest way is to take the Silt Strider or the Mages Guild Guide, but feel free to take the scenic route. Huleeya Informant[edit] Huleeya is in the Black Shalk Cornerclub, in the Foreign Quarter Lower Waistworks. He should be easy to find, as he is the only Argonian in the room. Unfortunately, Huleeya seems to be having trouble with the locals, who will not let him pass. Talk with the Dark Elf, Ethys Savil, or one of his two friends, and persuade him to leave the Argonian alone. Raising his disposition a bit will work, but so will homicide. If you try to leave with Huleeya without talking to one of the thugs, they will attack and you will have to protect Huleeya. Attacking the thugs first will result in Huleeya refusing to talk to you. Once you've solved this, you may escort Huleeya unhindered to Jobasha's Rare Books. Jobasha's bookshop is on the same level as the cornerclub, in the Foreign Quarter Lower Waistworks, just on the opposite side. Once you're inside the bookshop with Huleeya, you will receive one Reputation point for your help and he will give you some notes to take to Caius. Also while at the bookshop, pick up the book Progress of Truth on the second floor far left bookcase as you will be needing it later in this quest. You can steal it when the Ordinator patrols elsewhere, or just buy it. Addhiranirr Informant[edit] Addhiranirr is the next closest contact in the St. Olms Canton, southeast of the Foreign Quarter (past the Redoran and next to the St. Delyn cantons). It turns out Addhiranirr is difficult to find as almost no one in St. Olms knows where she is. With enough exploration and questions, you do eventually find her all alone in the northeast Underworks, hiding from a Census and Excise agent. In order to get anything out of her, the agent must be taken care of. The agent in question is Duvianus Platorius, who can be found in St. Olms Waistworks. As usual, you can either kill him or persuade him that Addhiranirr has fled. Note that if you happen to accidentally tell him where Addhiranirr is, you can still get the information Caius wants by raising Addhiranirr's disposition until she will talk to you. Also, if you tell Duvianus Platorius where Addhiranirr is and come back later to talk about the topic 'Addhiranirr', he will give you the response normally given if you had chosen to lie to him. Anyway, once the agent is out of the way, Addhiranirr will let you know that the Sixth House is into smuggling, but no one knows what due to intense secrecy. Meet Mehra Milo[edit] The last of the contacts is Mehra Milo. She may be found in the Library of Vivec, located in the Hall of Wisdom in the Temple Canton at the southern end of Vivec. Once you find her and follow her to the back of the library, she will tell you what she knows about the Nerevarine cult. She'll also suggest that you obtain a copy of the book Progress of Truth for Caius. Although the library has a copy of the book, it is under guard, so she suggests trying the local bookshops, even though the book is officially banned by the Tribunal Temple. The copy in the library is the tall book on top of the bookshelf in the southwest corner. Alternatively, you can just buy a copy from Jobasha's Rare Books in the Lower Waistworks of the Foreign Quarter for 150 gold. Other copies can be found at: Tel Uvirith, Arelas' House Vivec, Hall of Justice Secret Library Vivec, Telvanni Tower Return to Caius[edit] Return the information to Caius, who will promote you to Journeyman and suggest you take more time to train and do some other guild work to keep your cover up. Come back for the next part of the quest in a few days.

Quick Walkthrough: Return to Caius in Balmora to receive your orders. Travel up to the Urshilaku Camp, east of Khuul. Meet with Zabamund and then Sul-Matuul. Retrieve the Bonebiter Bow for Sul-Matuul from the Urshilaku Burial Caverns. Return to Sul-Matuul and receive permission to speak with Nibani Maesa. Meet with Nibani Maesa for her opinions on the Nerevarine Prophecies.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders from Caius[edit] The proverbial plot has thickened significantly by this point as Caius gives you a decoded copy of the original package you delivered to him, revealing that the Emperor intends to use you to fulfill the Nerevarine Prophecies, ensuring that things go his way. Caius will give you 200 gold and promote you to Finder of the Blades. He will instruct you to see Somutis Vunnis and Crulius Pontanian at Moonmoth Legion Fort (the fort is just east of Balmora, near the path to Arkngthand; Vunnis and Pontanian are in the chapel and the services hall, respectively) before heading up to see the leaders of the Nerevarine Cult at Urshilaku Camp, Sul-Matuul and Nibani Maesa. You can skip the visit to Moonmoth Legion Fort if you don't need any useful scrolls and potions, but they can be very handy at low levels; talk to Crulius and Somutis about essential supplies to receive the items. Visit the Urshilaku Camp[edit] The camp is quite far, up on the northern coast of Vvardenfell (it should be marked on your in-game map at this point). You could just walk north through the foyadas, but the journey may be dangerous due to, among other things, large numbers of cliff racers. It is not too far depending on how many dungeons and towns you stop at along the way (of course, this is half the fun, or perhaps more). The quickest way is to take the silt strider or the guild guide from Balmora to Ald'ruhn, and, from there, take the silt strider to either Khuul or Maar Gan. The camp is a little way east from Khuul and north from Maar Gan. The journey from Khuul is shorter and safer, though there are almost no places of interest along the way. The camp is small, so be careful not to miss it. The Ashlanders are not particularly friendly but if you remember what Hassour told you about giving thoughtful gifts (items, bribes), you will make inroads into Urshilaku society easily. The hunters outside the yurts (huts) accept Trama Root, while Tussurradad accepts kwama eggs, both large and small. Alternatively, a simple Charm spell or a bribe of 100 gold will work on anybody (depending on your Speechcraft skill, 10 gold might work as well). If you are able to raise their disposition enough just via persuasion then you won't need to worry about gifts or bribes at all. In any case, once you have impressed one of residents, they will direct you to speak with Zabamund, Sul-Matuul's second, in his yurt. Meet with Zabamund[edit] To speak with Zabamund, you must raise your disposition with him to around 70 or higher first. Zabamund will then ask you to give him a reason to let you meet with the Ashkhan. A variety of answers are at your disposal: Offer to fight a duel to the death under the condition that your level is at 6 or above Boast of your deeds if either your Speechcraft level is 30 or above or if your Reputation meets or exceeds a value of 20 State all that you have learned of the Sixth House and the Nerevarine, provided your Speechcraft is at or above 30 Offer a tribute of 200 gold pieces, without needing to raise Zabamund's disposition or possess any other skills As a result of any successful approach, Zabamund next sends you to the Ashkhan's yurt. Urshilaku Burial Caverns map Meet with Sul-Matuul[edit] If you have not first received permission from Zabamund, Sul-Matuul may immediately attack you. Once you have permission, however, there is no need to raise Sul-Matuul's disposition when meeting with him - he will speak to you straight away. As you are an outlander, Sul-Matuul is unsure of your intentions, and requires you to pass an initiation rite in order to be adopted into the Urshilaku Tribe as a Clanfriend. You are asked to travel to the tribal burial site and retrieve the Bonebiter Bow of Sul-Senipul, the weapon of his father. Upon returning with the bow, you will have proven your worth to the tribe. Urshilaku Burial Caverns[edit] Directions to the Urshilaku Burial Caverns are given, but can be rather confusing, and take you there via a pointlessly long route. Ignore them, and head south-southeast from the camp for a short distance; if you reach Abinabi cave, go east. Note that the actual map name of the site is Urshilaku, Astral Burial (the chamber where you enter the caverns). The caverns are larger than most of the tombs scattered throughout the island, and filled with skeletons and cave rats. Go through the Astral Burial chamber (the entrance area) into the Karma Burial, and then enter the Laterus Burial. You may visit the various chambers at each stage, but your goal lies within the Juno Burial, found at the top of the spiral. At the far end of this chamber you encounter the Wraith of Sul-Senipul who carries (but for some reason doesn't use) the Bonebiter Bow of Sul-Senipul, which you must retrieve. Return to Sul-Matuul[edit] Upon your return with the bow to Sul-Matuul at the Urshilaku Camp, he congratulates you on completing the initiation rite and names you Clanfriend of the Ashlanders, thereby permitting you to talk to Nibani Maesa. As a bonus, you get to keep the bow and rest in any bed in the camp, although he prohibits you from stealing from any other member of your new faction. Meet with Nibani Maesa[edit] Maesa is in the Wise Woman's Yurt and has lots of very important answers regarding the prophecy. When she has finished, ask her if you pass the test. (You must ask at this question, whether early or late, to get quest stage 60 in your Journal, or the quest will not be completed.)  It seems that although you are not the Nerevarine, you are one who may become the Nerevarine. In order to know more, Maesa asks you to find the Lost Prophecies and bring them to her, so that she may guide you better. She also gives you a copy of The Stranger and The Seven Visions relating to the Nerevarine Prophecy. This extended conversation with Maesa produces many dialogue topics; you should probably explore all of them as they are more relevant than average to the main quest's plot and what is coming up in your adventures. When you have the required Journal entry, which ends with "Now it's time to report back to Caius", you may do so for your next assignment and a reward of 400 gold.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Skink-in-Tree's-Shade to get your new assignment. Travel to the Ahemmusa Camp and speak to Sinnammu Mirpal to arrange a meeting. You are forwarded to Minabibi Assardarainat at the Favel Ancestral Tomb. Kill the ghost of Kanit Ashurnisammis to have Minabibi agree to the meeting. Return to the Ahemmusa Camp and ask Sinnammu for permission. Return to Wolverine Hall.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Skink-in-Tree's-Shade in the Wolverine Hall Mage's Guild asks you to arrange a meeting with a wise woman of one of the four Ashlander tribes: Urshilaku, Zainab, Erabenimsun, or the Ahemmusa. Skink doubts that the Erabenimsun will agree and suggests to start with the Ahemmusa. For the record, none of the other Ashlander Wise Women will agree to meet with him (and the Wise Women of outcast Ashlander tribes don't get arrange a meeting as a conversation topic). At the Ahemmusa Camp[edit] If you've gotten far in the Main Quest, you should know the location to all four camps (and they will be marked on your map). The Ahemmusa Camp is on the far northeast corner of the island, north of Tel Vos (northwest of Tel Mora). When you talk to the Wise Woman of the camp, Sinnammu Mirpal, she refuses to meet with Skink, but suggests her apprentice, Minabibi Assardarainat. She is in the Favel Ancestral Tomb, west of the camp, past the Daedric ruins. Arranging the Meeting[edit] When you find Minabibi Assardarainat just inside the tomb, she agrees to meet with Skink but you must first kill the spirit of the tomb for her, the spirit of Kanit Ashurnisammis. You can trap the 280 point grand soul of Kanit with no penalty, so make sure to bring a grand soul gem! Once you get rid of the spirit, Minabibi tells you to return to Sinnammu to get permission for her to meet with Skink. Do so, noting that no matter what you say to Sinnammu, she will let Minabibi go.  If you take credit for calming the spirit, her Disposition will increase by 20 points; lying and telling her that Minabibi was responsible will get you a ten point disposition penalty instead. When you return to the guild hall, Minabibi is already there waiting for you. Talk to Skink to finish the quest and receive the usual increase in Disposition, as well as +2 Reputation. Speak with Minabibi afterwards to receive an Ancestor's Ring.

Quick Walkthrough: Return to Caius in Balmora to receive your last orders from him. Travel to Vivec and look for Mehra Milo in the Library of Vivec and her quarters. Visit the Ministry of Truth and have the guard Alvela Saram let you in. Find the prison cells and Milo, giving her a Scroll of Divine Intervention for her escape. Travel to Holamayan to meet up with Mehra Milo and the Dissident Priests. Talk with Gilvas Barelo in Holamayan to receive the lost prophecies.
Detailed Walkthrough: Milo's note on the dresser in her private quarters Orders from Caius[edit] Return to Caius Cosades in Balmora after being cured of Corprus over in Tel Fyr. Once again you are promoted, this time to Operative. Caius informs you that, for various reasons, he is being recalled to the Imperial City, which actually makes you head of the Blades in Vvardenfell. Talk to Caius about your new promotion to get some handy items as well as use of his house. His last orders to you before he leaves are to continue to investigate the lost prophecies, and to bring them to Nibani Maesa in the Urshilaku Camp once you find them. The first step is to meet Mehra Milo again in the Hall of Wisdom in Vivec's Temple Canton, and tell her what you have learned from the Urshilaku. Milo was being watched and left a message in her private quarters under the code word AMAYA. Looking for Milo[edit] Get to the Hall of Wisdom in Vivec to look for Milo. If you search the library, you will discover that she is no longer there. Ask the other librarians about her and they will tell you that her private quarters are opposite the Canon Offices in the Hall of Wisdom. Her quarters are locked (level 20) but by this point you should have spells, scrolls or picks to gain entry. The key can even be found behind a drape near the door. Milo is not in, but there is a Note to Amaya on the dresser. The note says that Milo is visiting the Inquisitor at the Ministry of Truth and that you should bring two Divine Intervention scrolls. She goes on to mention that the guard, Alvela Saram, will let you past if you mention you are looking for her and that she has left two levitation potions for you to use. Clearly, Milo has been imprisoned by the Ordinators and has left this coded message in the hope that you would find it. The Ministry of Truth Ministry of Truth[edit] The Ministry of Truth is the large meteor floating over the Temple Canton, which can only be reached using levitation. You can use a levitation potion or spell, or instead you can make an offering to the Shrine to Stop the Moon, located below the ministry. You will need to donate a potion of rising force (a bargain, cheap, standard, quality, or exclusive potion will work, but not a custom potion). In exchange for your donation, you are blessed with a powerful levitation spell (100 points for 1440 seconds). Make sure you remember the two Divine Intervention scrolls. You can buy them from Janand Maulinie in the Mages Guild in the Foreign Quarter. Outside the top entrance to the ministry you will find the guard Alvela Saram. Talking with Alvela reveals that Milo is a prisoner and you are tasked with breaking her out. She gives you the main key and suggests to enter using the back door, which is the door furthest from Alvela. There are many locked doors inside the Ministry. They can be opened either by finding their respective keys or by lock picking them. Once you enter the Ministry using the back door, immediately go right. Do not let anyone see you as they will attack and call the guards. The guards here are well armored and hit hard, so unless you're prepared, a stealthy approach may be best (any form of invisibility or chameleon helps). The Prison Keep is at the top of the Ministry and has only a level 20 lock guarding it. The Ministry of Truth Sector Key unlocks this door and is to the right of the upper entrance in the Grand Inquisitor's desk. Once you enter the Prison Keep, you may be attacked by a few guards, so be careful. Mehra is located in the rightmost holding cell and there are a few ways to go about reaching her, none of which are any more correct than the other.  You may use levitation to fly over the guards and reach Mehra's cell.  Make your way to her however you can and don't worry if you are backed into a corner and forced to fight: you will not incur a bounty for killing any of the Ordinators. Bluffing your way through the Ministry[edit] If you have a Temple rank of less than level 5 (Adept), or are not a Temple member at all, your disposition with the Inquisitor is at least 70 (this can be achieved with a charm spell, if necessary), and you are not of a beast race, you can bluff your way past the Grand Inquisitor and the other guards by donning an Indoril helmet, cuirass, and pauldrons, and then talking to the Grand Inquisitor and  telling him that you have "proper authorization". He will give you his key and the guards will refuse to attack you. Alternatively, if you are at least Adept rank in the Temple, or have a disposition of 100 with the guards prior to speaking to them the guards will not attack you unless you talk to them twice (they give you a "leave or die" warning the first time) or enter the prison area. Be warned, however, that once any guard attacks you, whatever the reason, all ministry guards in the area will then attack you on sight, and once this happens, they will behave like enemies, not normal guards, that is, they will forever try to kill you unless you kill them, or temporarily stop the fight with a calm spell (and even then, they will refuse to speak to you normally). Also note that if you have the Morrowind Patch Project installed, and you are Patriarch of the Temple, most of the guards in the Ministry will not only allow you to pass, but if spoken to, will give you helpful advice regarding the acquisition of keys and avoidance of potential hostiles. They will, however, protest the irregularity of your demands for access to the Ministry. Milo in her cell Escaping with Milo[edit] Once you find Mehra, she outlines the escape plan. You are to give her one Divine Intervention scroll for her to make her escape, and you escape the same way or another, as you like. Using the other Divine Intervention scroll teleports you Ebonheart. You are to meet each other at the secret Dissident Priests Monastery of Holamayan. You are to meet a woman on the east docks of Ebonheart (just southwest of Vivec) named Blatta Hateria. Tell Blatta that Mehra sent you and that you want to go fishing. Blatta will then bring you to Holamayan where you and Milo will meet up. Once there, you'll receive the lost prophecies from the Dissident Priests' leader Gilvas Barelo. Additionally, the entrance to Holamayan is concealed with magic. Speak to Vevrana Aryon, a monk on the dock at Holamayan about it. Traveling to Holamayan[edit] You can leave the Ministry however you wish, although teleporting out via Recall or intervention is obviously the easiest way. If you use a Divine Intervention scroll as suggested, you'll end up in the middle of Ebonheart, which is rather convenient. Blatta is on the left side of the docks, and will ask if she knows you. Once you mention you want to go fishing, the option to travel to Holamayan will be added to her destination list (labeled as Azura's Coast Region). You will have to pay her for the trip. Vevrana is on the docks across from you when you arrive, and she will tell you that the magical shield guarding Holamayan opens only at dusk and dawn, meaning you will probably have to rest until the proper time. She also can arrange your trip back to Vivec when you choose. Dusk and dawn times are 6pm to 8pm and 6am to 8am, respectively. You are able to rest on the grass outside the entrance, instead of waiting. Mehra Milo and Gilvas Barelo in the Holamayan Monastery Dissident Priests and Lost Prophecies[edit] You can find Mehra with Gilvas Barelo just off to the right in the library when you enter Holamayan. Gilvas has some information on Dagoth Ur, among other things, as well as the lost prophecies that you have been looking for. You receive three notes from him relating to the prophecies: The Lost Prophecy, The Seven Curses and Kagrenac's Tools. Talking to him about Nerevar also nets you three more books. Make sure you exhaust all dialogue possibilities with Gilvas to get all the information that you can. By all accounts, you are becoming closer and closer to being the true Nerevarine. Now that Caius is gone, you have no one to report to, but don't forget that Nibani Maesa in the Urshilaku Camp wanted to speak with you again once you've found the lost prophecies.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Archcanon Tholer Saryoni at the High Fane in the Vivec, Temple Canton for your duties. Travel to Ald Sotha to visit the Statue of Mehrunes Dagon as part of the Pilgrimages of the Four Corners. Find the statue in the Shrine and activate it to receive the poem Four Corners of the House of Troubles and the Blessings of the Second Corner.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Archcanon Tholer Saryoni in his quarters in the Crosier of the High Fane in the Vivec's Temple Canton tells you that the Second Corner of the House of Troubles is Mehrunes Dagon. His shrine is in Ald Sotha, northeast of Vivec. Mehrunes Dagon of the House of Troubles[edit] This simple trip requires that you find and activate the shrine (get close and click when shrine name appears) for your poem and the Blessings of the Second Corner   - Fortify Destruction 10 pts for 48 mins on Touch, Fortify Axe 10 pts for 48 mins on Touch, Fortify Attack 10 pts for 48 mins on Touch. Actually surviving to reach the shrine is left as an exercise for the reader, since it has been taken over by the Dark Brotherhood, and you also risk meeting Daedra on the grounds - with any luck, they will already have been taken care of on a previous visit to retrieve the Shoes of St. Rilms. Return to Archcanon Saryoni in Vivec for instructions on the next Corner of the House of Troubles.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to the statue of Mehrunes Dagon in Yasammidan. Travel to Alas Ancestral Tomb to pick up A Rusty Dagger. Return to the statue of Mehrunes Dagon and receive Mehrunes' Razor.
Detailed Walkthrough: Mehrunes Dagon's Request[edit] Varner Hleras' remains Mehrunes Dagon's shrine lies in Yasammidan, just west of the Dwemer ruin of Arkngthunch-Sturdumz, west of Ald Velothi on the coast north of Gnisis. Mehrunes Dagon is one of the four "bad" Daedric Princes, which becomes clear once you activate his statue to talk to him. He finally decides that to prove your worth, you are to retrieve Mehrunes' Razor from Alas Ancestral Tomb. Finding the Razor[edit] The tomb can be found in the center of the Molag Amur mountain range, north of Molag Mar and south of the Erabenimsun Camp. The tomb is small and you should quickly discover that there is no razor to be found. All your attempts bring up is A Rusty Dagger on the body of Varner Hleras on the altar. If you return to Mehrunes Dagon with this dagger, he will transform it into the Mehrunes' Razor for you.

Altar to Mephala[edit] The Altar to Mephala is not in a likely setting for a Daedric Shrine. It is hidden in the secret Morag Tong Guildhall in Vivec's Arena Canton, specifically the Storage Area of the Canalworks. It is also the only Daedra shrine that does not feature a statue of a Daedra Lord, but rather one that is similar to an Imperial Cult altar. Sensitive Matters[edit] Speak to Taros Dral about sensitive matters. He will not say much up front, just something about Mephala giving him information which must be acted upon. If you inquire further, you'll learn that Mephala wishes you to poison Balyn Omavel, an important member of the Morag Tong who has been performing assassinations without writs. Dral will supply Treated Bittergreen Petals to put in Balyn's Cauldron. Balyn Omavel's House[edit] Balyn Omavel's House can be found in Balmora, south of the eastern guard tower. Balyn is wandering around the front, and if he sees you, the quest will be ruined. In order to sneak into his house unseen, use the trapdoor found on the roof of the house. Once inside, interact with the cauldron on the west wall. Answer "yes" when asked "Would you like to place the poison in the pot?" Escape the same way you entered, making sure not to be spotted by Balyn. Reward[edit] Return to Taros Dral and he'll tell you to speak to the altar. Do so and you will receive the Ring of Khajiit as a reward. If you return to Balyn Omavel's house you'll find him dead on the floor.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Faral Retheran in the Treasury in the Vivec's Redoran canton for duties. Go to the Eight Plates in Balmora. Use either persuasion or force to end Meril Hlaano's slanders. Report back to Faral Retheran.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Faral Retheran in the Redoran Treasury in Vivec's Redoran canton will ask you to convince a Hlaalu noble, Meril Hlaano, to stop slandering House Redoran. Meril Hlaano[edit] Hlaano can be found at the Eight Plates in Balmora and only requires that you persuade him sufficiently (75 disposition). This can be done quite easily with a bribe or other forms of persuasion, or by using a Fortify Personality or Charm spell. You can kill him but you'll receive no reward and Faral Retheran's disposition will drop by 15, even if you taunted him into attacking first. Return to Retheran in Vivec to complete the quest and receive a Holy Shield.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Miner Arobar in his manor in Ald'ruhn to learn he won't give you his support on the Council. Talk to Athyn Sarethi to learn that Arobar might be influenced by the Telvanni. Travel to Sadrith Mora, and talk with people to learn that Master Neloth is holding Arobar's daughter hostage in Tel Naga. Rescue Arobar's daughter, Nartise, who is held on the lower levels of the tower. Escort Nartise to the docks. Return to Arobar to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Miner Arobar in his manor in Ald'ruhn will initially refuse to talk with you and give you his support. Return to Athyn Sarethi to learn that Arobar might be influenced by the Telvanni, and you are to find out how it's being done and remove it. Nartise Arobar in Neloth's dungeon Telvanni Influences[edit] Travel to Sadrith Mora, and talk with people in the town to learn that the Telvanni councilor Master Neloth is holding Arobar's daughter hostage in Tel Naga, in the center of town. Arobar's daughter, Nartise, is held in the Tel Naga Great Hall and is well guarded (the guards will attack you as soon as you free her). Nartise will follow you to the docks in town and will continue on her own from there. Return to Arobar to get his support on the Council, his enchanted amulet and a Redoran Master Helm.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Kaye at Ebonheart's Imperial Chapels for a new shrine sergeant mission: recovering a stolen Chapel Limeware Bowl from Caryarel. Learn that Caryarel lives in Gnaar Mok from any High Elf; the closest are Landorume and Fanildil in the Hawkmoth Legion Garrison. Travel to Gnaar Mok and steal the bowl from Caryarel's shack. Return to Kaye to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Shrine Sergeant Mission[edit] At Ebonheart's Imperial Chapels, Kaye will ask you to recover a stolen Chapel Limeware Bowl from Caryarel, a High Elf who left the chapel's care at the same time the bowl disappeared. Kaye believes Caryarel lives along the coasts, but he suggests asking other High Elves if they can pinpoint his location. Missing Limeware[edit] You can hear of Caryarel's whereabouts from any High Elf. The closest are Landorume and Fanildil in the Hawkmoth Legion Garrison. Another option is Fainertil, down by the docks. They tell you he lives in Gnaar Mok, a small village on the coast west of Caldera. To get there, take a ship from the docks to Hla Oad and then straight on to Gnaar Mok. In Gnaar Mok, Caryarel wanders the docks outside his shack, which is to your left if you arrived by ship. Talking to him is useless, as he plays innocent at all stages of the quest. Despite his denial, the limeware bowl is indeed stashed within the shack, inside a barrel between the hammock and table. To get past the locked shack door, your options are to kill him and loot his key, try to pickpocket the key, or break into the shack (discreetly). Return to Kaye with the Chapel Limeware Bowl to receive 200 gold and three Scrolls of Divine Intervention.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Brara Morvayn. Go to the Morvayn Manor and retrieve an ash statue. Take the statue to Lloros Sarano. Report back to Brara Morvayn.
Detailed Walkthrough: Morvayn Manor Duties[edit] Once you've completed The Mad Lord of Milk quest, Brara Morvayn in her quarters in the Redoran Council Hall will ask you to retrieve an ash statue from her house which has been overrun by Corprus creatures attracted by the statue. The Ash Statue[edit] Morvayn Manor is next to the Skar (giant shell) on the eastern side in Ald'ruhn (note that the journal entry incorrectly informs you to travel west from Skar). Kill or avoid the creatures inside and recover the statue from upstairs. Take the statue to Lloros Sarano at the Ald'ruhn Tribunal Temple for it to be destroyed and return to Morvayn to complete the quest. She'll give you her support on the council and an Amulet of Mighty Blows (Fortify Strength 5-20 pts for 30 secs).

Quick Walkthrough: Nchuleft Talk to Mallam Ryon at the Telvanni Council House in Sadrith Mora for chores. Travel to the Dwemer ruins of Nchuleft to recover some plans. Get the Dwemer plans from a bookcase. Return to Mallam to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Mallam Ryon in the Telvanni Council House in Sadrith Mora will ask you to recover some plans in the Dwemer ruins of Nchuleft. Dwemer Plans in Nchuleft[edit] Nchuleft is located north-northwest of the Zainab Camp and west of Vos. The Dwemer Scarab Schematics are on the bottom shelf on the bookcase in the first room to your left. Don't forget to check the ruins for any loot. Return to Mallam with the plans to complete the quest and receive Gothren's Cephalopod Helm as a reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Archcanon Tholer Saryoni at the High Fane in the Vivec, Temple Canton for your duties.
