Travel to Bal Ur to visit the Statue of Molag Bal as part of the Pilgrimages of the Four Corners. Find the statue in the Underground and activate it to receive the poem Four Corners of the House of Troubles and the Blessings of the Third Corner.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Archcanon Tholer Saryoni in his quarters in the Crosier of the High Fane in the Vivec, Temple Canton tells you that the Third Corner of the House of Troubles is Molag Bal. His shrine is in Bal Ur, north of Suran on the east side of the river. Molag Bal of the House of Troubles[edit] The shrine has two entrances and you'll want the lower access to the shrine. Like most shrines, the people here will not take kindly to your intrusion. There are several tough opponents here and lava provides an additional challenge. Being able to levitate certainly helps. Once you've taken care of the opposition, activate the Statue of Molag Bal to receive the Blessings of the Third Corner   - Fortify Speechcraft 5 pts for 24 mins on Touch and the spell Command of the Third Corner   - Command Humanoid 5-25 pts for 30 secs on Touch, which costs 30 magicka. Also, help yourself to the loot around the now-abandoned shrine. Return to Archcanon Saryoni in Vivec for instructions on the last Corner of the House of Troubles.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the statue of Molag Bal in Yansirramus. Travel to Kora-Dur. Slay the Daedroth Menta Na. Return to Yansirramus for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Finding the shrine[edit] Molag Bal's shrine can be found in the ruins of Yansirramus, two islands west of Tel Aruhn. Note that you may be able to access the shrine safely, but exploring any of the side chambers will likely get you attacked. Menta Na needs to be banished from Tamriel. The God is displeased[edit] Molag Bal complains about one of his servants, a lazy Daedroth named Menta Na who has retreated into the caves of Kora-Dur instead of creating the usual havoc and terror. Molag Bal gives you a key and asks you to kill Menta Na to obtain his favor and a reward. Travel to Kora-Dur[edit] Kora-Dur can be found east of the stronghold of Kogoruhn, far north of the Red Mountain Crater. It is located high up on a hillside, and is rather easy to miss. The door is heavily locked (95) but fortunately you have a key. Slay Menta Na[edit] You'll find Menta Na in the innermost chamber. Among the loot you'll find here is a Daedric Staff. Return to the shrine to receive your reward, the Mace of Molag Bal.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Raven Omayn in the Telvanni Council House in Sadrith Mora for chores. Find five pieces of muck. Return to Raven to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Raven Omayn in the Telvanni Council House in Sadrith Mora will ask you to retrieve five pieces of muck for some potion making. Finding Some Muck[edit] The surest route is to buy the muck from Anis Seloth's Alchemy shop in town. Alternatively, one may harvest it from the wild in the Azura's Coast and West Gash regions. Several muckspunge plants can be found just north of Sadrith Mora, a short distance from the Telvanni Council House. Return to Raven with the five pieces of muck to complete the quest and she will offer to teach you the Cure Common Disease spell. If you tell her that you already know the spell, you will not get any reward for the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Master Aryon in the Upper Tower in Tel Vos for chores. Travel to Mudan-Mul Egg Mine to cure the blighted Kwama Queen. Cure the queen using a Cure Blight Disease on Target spell or scroll. Return to Aryon to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] After recruiting Baladas Demnevanni to House Telvanni, Councilor Aryon in the Upper Tower of Tel Vos will ask you to cure the blighted Kwama Queen in the Mudan-Mul Egg Mine as your next chore. Mudan-Mul Egg Mine[edit] The mine is found due west of the tower, east of the Nerano Ancestral Tomb. Aryon will offer to teach you the Cure Blight Disease spell if you don't already know it, or you can simply buy some Cure Blight scrolls from Hetman Abelmawia in Gnisis. Return to Aryon once the queen is cured to complete the quest and receive the Alteration skill book Breathing Water as a reward. You may not be able to complete the quest without using the console if you kill the queen before receiving the quest. Aryon will simply state when inquiring about the egg mine, "You have killed the queen? That is unfortunate. Wait a few days and return to the mind to see if a new queen has been born If not, the mine is lost forever and I will be somewhat disappointed."

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Neminda in the Redoran Council Hall in Ald'ruhn for duties. Go west to Drulene Falen's Hut to deal with the mudcrab pests. Speak to Drulene Falen to learn about the current situation. Travel southwest to find and kill the mudcrabs. Return to Drulene Falen for your reward. Report back to Neminda to officially end the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] In the Redoran Council Hall in Ald'ruhn, Neminda's first duty for you is to take care of some nasty mudcrabs that have attacked Drulene Falen's guar herd. Drulene Falen's Hut[edit] Drulene Falen's Hut and her herd are far to the west of Ald'ruhn, near the coast. It is quite  a walk from Ald'ruhn, so don't be surprised if it takes a little bit of time. Talk with Falen, and she'll tell you that the mudcrabs dragged one of her guars off to the southwest. Dealing with the Pests[edit] Head off in the direction Falen just told you, and you should find a dead guar along with two hyper-aggressive mudcrabs. Kill the crabs and return to Falen for a reward of some Hackle-Lo leaves. Return to Neminda[edit] Report back to Neminda in Ald'ruhn to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak with Raven Omayn at the Council House in Sadrith Mora. Travel to Tel Vos. Slay Rimintil. Return to Raven for the useful Flamemirror Robe.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Mouth speaks[edit] Speak with Raven Omayn, the Mouth for Councilor Dratha, at the Telvanni Council House in Sadrith Mora. Omayn will ask you to kill the Altmer Rimintil in the Central Tower of Tel Vos. Murder Rimintil[edit] Travel there, then find Rimintil on the stairs leading up to the tower's second floor. He sports a good collection of Dwemer armor which you may wish to take. There is also a copy of the book Vampires of Vvardenfell, v II in the room, on the desk, which is useful for the vampiric quest A Cure for Vampirism and is needed for the eponymous Mages Guild quest. Once Rimintil is dead, return to Omayn to receive a Flamemirror Robe.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Edryno Arethi for business. Travel to Hla Oad. Speak to Murudius Flaeus to receive a key or find out where the hidden chest is. Get the gold with the key or pick the lock. Return to Edryno Arethi.
Detailed Walkthrough: Business[edit] Edryno Arethi in her house on the Hlaalu Waistworks in Vivec will ask you to collect 800 gold owed by Murudius Flaeus of Hla Oad. Murudius Flaeus[edit] Flaeus can be found at his house in Hla Oad and will give you a key to his hidden money chest if you raise his disposition up to around 90 or perform a successful intimidate (any disposition). Alternatively, you can just find and pick the chest yourself to get the money. In fact, talking to the other townsfolk might subtly point you to the hidden chest. If you still can't find it, it's hidden under Fadila's house, just to the left of Murudius'. The chest contains a little more than the debt requires, 943 gold to be exact. Return to Arethi[edit] Return to Arethi in Vivec with the money to complete the quest. She takes 400 gold for half the debt, and the extra money in the chest is yours to keep.

Quick Walkthrough: Hear latest rumors about Mysterious Killings. Talk to Elam Andas in the Office of the Watch about work. Slay the Dreamer Prophet. Return to Andas for your choice of rewards.
Detailed Walkthrough: Rumors[edit] Speak to people in Vivec about the latest rumors and you're bound to hear of the latest mysterious deaths, including two Ordinators. You will eventually be directed to Elam Andas in the Office of the Watch in Vivec's Hall of Justice, Temple Canton, for more information. Mysterious Killings in Vivec[edit] The murders were strange in that although all the victims were armed, it appears that only one of the seven, a mage, had put up a fight, and nothing was removed from the bodies.  Three victims were found in the Foreign Quarter, one in the water surrounding the Arena, one in the Hlaalu Compound, and the two guards near the Hlaalu victim (the last two are believed to be related). The fact that the two guards did not have their weapons drawn brings the concern that the murderer is incredibly powerful.  Finally, although there are no witnesses, there is a report of someone being threatened by a Dark Elf woman wearing a skirt and Netch armor, and wielding a dagger. More Detective Work[edit] Ask around about the murders and the woman in the Hlaalu Compound, Arena, and Foreign Quarter. From the Foreign Quarter you'll learn that a Dark Elf woman was seen in the underworks of the canton. Still vague, but it is worth checking out. Bring an End to the Murders[edit] Enter the west side of the Underworks in the Foreign Quarter. The woman in question is indeed the culprit, which is basically confirmed when she attacks you on sight (she is a red-haired Dreamer Prophet). She is wielding a Dagoth Dagger, which rapidly drains its victim's fatigue, so beware. This explains why the two dead guards were unable to draw their swords after being surprised. Deliver the Good News[edit] Report back to Andas when she is dead to receive a choice of an Indoril Helm and Cuirass, or the Belt of the Armor of God, a belt that fortifies Willpower while casting Sanctuary and Shield spells. Remember—if you initiate conversation with an Ordinator or vice versa while wearing the helm or cuirass, it will permanently trigger all Ordinators to attack you on sight.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Trebonius Artorius at the Guild of Mages in Vivec for duties. Collect the three books: Hanging Gardens of Wasten Coridale, The Egg of Time, and Divine Metaphysics. Speak to Edwinna Elbert in Ald'ruhn. Speak to Hasphat Antabolis in Balmora. Speak to Baladas Demnevanni in Gnisis. (optional) Speak to Divayth Fyr in Tel Fyr. (optional) Speak to Yagrum Bagarn in the Corprusarium. Return to Trebonius Artorius with the information.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Trebonius Artorius in the Vivec Guild of Mages will first ask you to investigate the disappearance of the Dwemer (also known as Dwarves). He doesn't seem to have a good idea on how to do this, and he doesn't even seem to care very much about how you do this, though he suggests to speak with Edwinna Elbert at the Ald'ruhn guildhall. Gathering the Books[edit] In the last few Mages Guild quests given by Edwinna you may (and should have) picked up three different books related to the Dwemer: Hanging Gardens of Wasten Coridale, The Egg of Time, and Divine Metaphysics. You may have also already talked with Hasphat Antabolis at the bottom of the Balmora Fighters Guild or Senilias Cadiusus in Nchuleftingth who mention that Hanging Gardens of Wasten Coridale seems to be written in both Dwemeris and Aldmeris and may be a key to deciphering the other two books. You need to find someone who can read Aldmeris. Finding a Translator[edit] Since you've done so many Dwemer-related quests for Edwinna, she's the logical starting point for anything further Dwemer-related. After discussing "The Egg of Time" with her, she will point you to a fellow scholar, Hasphat Antabolis, though neither one of them can fully understand the three texts. It seems Aldmeris is over their heads. They don't mention anyone by name but Baladas Demnevanni in Gnisis' Arvs-Drelen is the next stop. If you have joined House Telvanni you may have already encountered him, and will probably be aware that he's also something of a Dwemer historian, and fortunately he's more familiar with Aldmeris. Baladas will give you enough information to report back to Trebonius to finish the quest, but if you want a more complete story, you'll need to speak to someone even older. Possibly the oldest character in Morrowind is in Tel Fyr. Speak with Divayth Fyr and he'll mention that he has the last living Dwemer, by the name of Yagrum Bagarn, living in his Corprusarium. Yagrum, of course, can understand the books written in Dwemeris and will offer overviews of them along with his own theories. Return to Trebonius[edit] Although you don't get any definitive, conclusive answers, discussing the Egg of Time with either Yagrum or Baladas while you also have Divine Metaphysics, constitutes successful completion of the quest (for Baladas you must also have Hanging Gardens). Trebonius will be shocked that someone actually completed one of his missions, and he'll try to play it off like he's not in way over his head. His Disposition will increase, and you'll get +1 Reputation.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Hlaren Ramoran in his manor in Ald'ruhn for duties. Either, try to find his lost love Nalvilie Saren: Ask around Ald'ruhn about the girl. Travel to Vivec and find out she has a shop in St. Olms Canton. Talk to her about Ramoran. Return to Ramoran. Or convince him to forget the past: Talk to one of Ramoran's bodyguards, Nalvyna Sarinith, who will act odd. Speak to Ramoran about her and convince him to forget about the past.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Hlaren Ramoran in his manor in Ald'ruhn will ask you to find out what happened to Nalvilie Saren, a girl he loved in his youth. A Lost Love[edit] In Redoran Council Hall in Goras Andrelo's house, talk to Mivanu Andrelo about the girl, and you'll find out that she is in Vivec. Travel there and ask around until you find out she has a shop in St. Olms Canton and her family is on top of the Redoran Canton. Her shop is on the Canal level of the St. Olms Canton, specifically St. Olms Canal South-One on the outside of the canton. Unfortunately, Saren will refuse to speak with Ramoran, no matter how much you try to persuade her. You can report back to Ramoran to complete the quest. The Obsession[edit] As an alternative, if you talk to one of Ramoran's bodyguards, Nalvyna Sarinith (note the similar names), she will act odd when you mention Ramoran. Speak to Ramoran about her and convince him to forget about the past. He will accept your opinion and give you his support without you having to try and find Saren.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Aengoth the Jeweler at The Rat In The Pot in Ald'ruhn for a new job. Go to Arobar Manor to steal Boethiah's Pillow Book. Find the book in a chest in Gandosa Arobar's bedroom and get it. Return to Aengoth with the book to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] Aengoth the Jeweler at The Rat In The Pot in Ald'ruhn will ask you to steal Boethiah's Pillow Book from Arobar Manor (from Gandosa Arobar). Stealing the Book[edit] In fact, the book is across the hall from the bedroom where you just stole the Redoran Master Helm from. It's in a well locked (75) and trapped chest in a large room with a few guards and witnesses, so the theft is not easy by any chance. In case you forgot the way, go from the entrance through the Guard Quarters, into the Private Quarters, and onto the Manor Bedrooms. It's in the bedroom on the right, behind the screen. Return to Aengoth for a reward of an Amulet of Far Silence and a Chameleon Ring.

Quick Walkthrough: Chat with Edwinna Elbert about duties. Travel to Nchuleftingth to check on Senilias Cadiusus. Turn the east crank in the Test of Pattern section. Find Anes's body in the Lower Levels, loot it for the report and the book. Return to Edwinna.
Detailed Walkthrough: Senilias with his daughter Anes Vendu's fate Duties[edit] Edwinna Elbert in the Ald'ruhn Guild of Mages asks you to check on a colleague, Senilias Cadiusus, in the Dwemer ruin of Nchuleftingth as his last excavation report is long overdue. The ruins can be found far northeast of Suran (which is in turn northeast of Vivec). The Dwemer Ruins of Nchuleftingth[edit] Once you arrive at the ruins, Senilias and his daughter are quickly found just inside. It appears they have been having problems and their guide, Anes Vendu, is missing. Since Anes was writing the report, you'll have to find him before you can return. Enter the Test of Pattern section to find three cranks along the northeastern wall. Using the easternmost one will open a door to the south revealing a door to the Lower Levels (the other ones are a trap and damage you). You'll find the corpse of Anes at the bottom of the Lower Level, next to a disabled Dwemer robot and the book Hanging Gardens of Wasten Coridale. Pick up the book, loot Anes' body for his report, and return to Senilias, who will direct you to take the report back to Edwinna. Back in Ald'ruhn[edit] Upon returning to Edwinna with the report, you are rewarded with an increase in Disposition. If you also picked up Hanging Gardens of Wasten Coridale, Edwinna will mention that she thinks it might be useful, if you can find someone who knows Aldmeris.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Tharer Rotheloth at the Temple in Molag Mar for your duties. Travel to Mawia to take care of the necromancer Delvam Andarys. Find and kill Delvam. Return to Tharer to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Tharer Rotheloth in the Molag Mar Tribunal Temple asks you to take care of the necromancer Delvam Andarys in Mawia, a domed structure on a small island just off the coast, southeast of Molag Mar. Necromancer in Mawia[edit] There may be three or more undead in Mawia (level-dependent), but Delvam is the only person here. He can be found on the top floor in his room, which also holds several alchemical ingredients and valuable books, one related to vampires. The unique shortsword, Shimsil, and the unique ring, Ring of Regeneration, can be found on Delvam's corpse. Return to Tharer for his congratulations once you've slain Delvam.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Percius Mercius for orders. Travel to Vas and meet Ulyne Henim. Help her kill the necromancer Daris Adram. Return to Mercius for payment.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Orders[edit] Percius Mercius in the Ald'ruhn Guild of Fighters asks you to help the Buoyant Armiger Ulyne Henim clean out a den of necromancers in Vas. Journey to Vas[edit] Vas is found far to the north in the Sheogorad Region (when you ask Percius about Vas, it will be marked on your map). The quickest route is to grab a boat to Dagon Fel. An alternative route is to go north to Maar Gan, then farther north along the Foyada Bani-Dad until you reach the coast. Follow the shore eastwards until you reach the Urshilaku Camp, then swim (or waterwalk) northeast. You'll find Ulyne Henim just outside the entrance to Vas. She's clad in the customary chitin armor of the Buoyant Armigers. Talk with Ulyne to join up together and enter the den. She fights with a staff and summons ancestor ghosts to help her in combat. The Necromancer of Vas[edit] In the entryway, there's the usual collection of undead to take care of. You don't need to kill the three people in the large room unless they attack you (Debentien Sylbenitte might). In the first level of the tower, you might meet something more considerable, such as a Dremora or a Daedroth. Be prepared, for this area can be fairly tough, especially if you want to keep Ulyne alive as you may end up against up to three powerful opponents at once. The Necromancer Daris Adram, who casts a few spells when he fights, is on the top floor of the tower. Once Daris is dead, Ulyne will thank you for helping and stop following you. If Ulyne is impressed with your performance (Disposition ≥ 70), then she will give you a glowing recommendation. Unless she is accidentally hit several times in combat, this is the most likely outcome.  Otherwise, she will consider your help to have been adequate, but be less impressed. Return to Percius Mercius, who will reward you with 250/500 drakes and a 10/15 point Disposition boost (depending on whether Ulyne gave you a recommendation or not). If Ulyne is killed, you'll receive no reward and Percius' disposition towards you will drop 10 points.

Meet Nels Llendo[edit] You'll run into the suave Nels Llendo on the road south of Pelagiad. To Kiss or not to Kiss[edit] If you are a male character, Nels will politely ask you for 50 gold. If you refuse to pay his fine, or do not have at least 50 gold, he will attack you. He is rather powerful for a starting character to defeat. If you are a female character, all he requests is a kiss. He will not attack you if you deny him the kiss. Not kissing him results in a 10 point disposition loss, while kissing him gives a 30 point increase. Further Uses[edit] If you do pay him the gold (or if you are female), you will find him later on in the Halfway Tavern in Pelagiad, offering training in Short Blade, Security, and Sneak.

Quick Walkthrough: Chat with Sugar-Lips Habasi about jobs and Nerano Manor. Acquire a key to Nerano Manor from Ondres Nerano or Sovor Trandel. Give the key to Sugar-Lips Habasi to complete the quest and receive your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] Sugar-Lips Habasi in Balmora's South Wall Cornerclub asks you to acquire the key to Nerano Manor. There are two copies, one held by Ondres Nerano in the manor itself (he is downstairs but the key opens the upstairs), and his servant Sovor Trandel, who hangs out at the Council Club (near the Silt Strider). Obtaining the Key[edit] The cleanest (although often hardest) way to acquire the key is to Pickpocket it from one of them. You may want to save so you can reload until you succeed. Alternately, you can kill Sovor (ideally by Taunt or Frenzy to get him to attack you, so you don't get a bounty). He is fully expendable, and if you're also doing Larrius Varro's quest (talk to him at Moonmoth Legion Fort to start it), you're supposed to kill him anyway. If you raise his Disposition to 70 or higher, a Nerano Manor topic will appear; using it will cause him to ask for a little compensation, and it will update your journal. If you successfully bribe again (any amount), he will give you the key. In the unpatched version of the game, another way is to attack Ondres with Hand-to-hand. His skill at it is very low, and he is easily beaten. Once he goes down, you can take the key from him. In the patched game, trying to steal from an unconscious character no longer works. If you kill Ondres, you'll still be able to complete the quest. However, Habasi angrily takes the key without paying you because now the house won't have any new valuables in it for a long, long time. Complete the Quest[edit] Once you have the key be sure to clear out the Manor yourself before returning to Habasi. She'll pay you 500 gold for the key, and that's in addition to anything you already took from the house.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Felisa Ulessen in the Telvanni Council House in Sadrith Mora for chores. Travel to Tel Branora to deliver a skirt to Mistress Therana. Talk to Therana to find out she wants you to wear the skirt first in case it's cursed... Instead, convince the Khajiit slave Ra'Zahr to wear the skirt. Return to Felisa to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Felisa Ulessen in the Telvanni Council House in Sadrith Mora will ask you to deliver a skirt to Mistress Therana in Tel Branora. You can find out from Felisa (or from the Main Quest) that Therana can be difficult to work with and you'll receive two Almsivi Intervention scrolls from Felisa in case difficulties arise. New Clothes[edit] Head to Tel Branora (far island in the southeast of the map, reached by boat) and find Therana in the upper tower (like most Telvanni towers, you'll need a Levitate spell). Try and give the new skirt to Therana, who will be worried that it is cursed and asks you to wear it first. As soon as you do, however, she attacks. Don't bother hanging around, just escape by any means available (such as the intervention scrolls). There is only one way around this, however. Ask the Khajiit slave Ra'Zahr next to Therana to wear the skirt instead (just speak with him). Therana will then attack the Khajiit instead. You can save him if you quickly cast a Calm Humanoid spell on Therana. (Due to a bug, you will only need a single point of Calm Humanoid for this to succeed, so any Calm Humanoid spell will work.) Also note that Therana's Skirt appears to be quite common but has properties like an exquisite skirt for enchanting, and you can retrieve it once the slave is dead. Return to Felisa to complete the quest and receive 500 drakes and the Mark and Recall spells if you choose to learn them. If Therana attacks you and you kill her, you will not be able to complete the quest and Felisa will disappear from the Telvanni Council House.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Master Aryon in the Upper Tower in Tel Vos for chores. Travel to Odirniran to help Milyn Faram defend his home from House Hlaalu. Kill all Hlaalu invaders, including their leader, Remasa Othril. Talk to Faram about his research to receive seven Milyn Faram's Scrolls. Return to Aryon to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Councilor Aryon in the Upper Tower of Tel Vos will ask you to go and help defend the home of necromancer Milyn Faram who is being attacked by House Hlaalu. Stopping a Hlaalu Invasion[edit] Milyn lives in Odirniran which is east of Molag Mar and south of the Dwemer ruins of Nchurdamz. Take care of all the Hlaalu that are just inside the entrance and speak with Faram (don't kill Vedelea Othril, she's a prisoner). He will ask you to be sure and kill the leader of the force, Remasa Othril, if you didn't take care of her on the way in. Once you've killed Othril, speak to Faram again, who will thank you and offer to tell you a little about his research. If you stay and listen to what he has to say, you'll receive seven Milyn Faram's Scrolls as well as a journal entry. Return to Aryon to complete the quest. If you listened to Milyn Faram, Aryon will give you a Silver Staff of Hunger and a copy of Incident in Necrom, an Illusion skill book, as a reward. If you didn't listen to Milyn or you killed him, you will only receive the reputation and disposition increase.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Theldyn Virith for duties. Kill Old Blue Fin at the Ald Velothi docks. Return to Theldyn Virith.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Once you finish Neminda's courier quest, Theldyn Virith in the outpost in Ald Velothi will ask you to kill a dangerous slaughterfish known as Old Blue Fin. The fish is somewhere around the Ald Velothi docks and has been annoying the Dreugh hunters. Go Fishing[edit] Old Blue Fin is quite a bit more powerful than a regular slaughterfish. It has over twice as much health and can cause over four times as much damage as any normal slaughterfish. To find Old Blue Fin, simply head down to the docks and look around. Once the slaughterfish is dead, report back to Theldyn in Ald Velothi to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Athyn Sarethi about duties. Travel to Balmora and enter Nerano Manor. Challenge Ondres Nerano to a duel and defeat him. Return to Sarethi.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Athyn Sarethi in his manor in Ald'ruhn will ask you to defend the House honor by challenging Ondres Nerano to a duel. Nerano is in his manor in Balmora. The Duel[edit] Travel to Balmora. Enter the Nerano Manor and talk to Ondres Nerano about slander and accept his challenge to a duel. You win if you knock him out, his health drops below 50, or he dies. In the event of his death, there will be no bounty as long as Nerano issued the challenge first. Report back to Sarethi in Ald'ruhn to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Meet Hisin Deep-Raed on the road west from Ald'ruhn. Cure the Nord with a Cure Common Disease spell or potion.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Paralyzed Barbarian[edit] On the road west from Ald'ruhn, you should run into Hisin Deep-Raed, a half-naked Nord. Speak with him to learn that he was escorting a witch and, in the process, got himself cursed, paralyzed, and stripped. He might not be telling you the whole story... Helping the Nord[edit] If you have it in your heart, or at least inventory, you can cure him with a regular Cure Common Disease spell or potion. In return, you'll receive the magical helm named The Icecap, which bestows a good frost resistance to the wearer. Unfortunately, you do not appear to be able to give him any clothes though...

Quick Walkthrough: Return to the Urshilaku Camp and speak with Nibani Maesa about the lost prophecies. Learn of the Seven Trials (First and Second have already been completed). Find out about the Third Trial from Sul-Matuul. Obtain some Corprus Weepings, a House Dagoth cup, and the Shadow Shield from the ruins of Kogoruhn, southeast of the camp. Return to Matuul with the items to learn the riddle of the Third Trial. Talk with Ashlanders to decode the riddle and find the location of the Cavern of the Incarnate. Travel to the cavern to meet with Azura and learn of the Fourth and Fifth Trials remaining. (Optional) Report back to Nibani Maesa and Sul-Matuul.
Detailed Walkthrough: Return to the Urshilaku Camp[edit] After successfully rescuing Mehra Milo and learning the lost prophecies from Gilvas Barelo in the secret Holamayan monastery of the Dissident Priests, you should return to Nibani Maesa in the Urshilaku Camp. Again, there's no wrong way to get to the camp, though if you're still in Holamayan, the quickest way would be to use an Intervention scroll/spell to get out and continue on from there. One way to get to the camp is to return to Ebonheart by boat, then speak with the shipmaster Nevosi Hlan to travel to Hla Oad, Gnaar Mok, and finally Khuul, which is the closest to the camp anybody will take you. Learn of the Seven Trials[edit] Once you arrive at the camp, visit Nibani in the Wise Woman's Yurt again and discuss the lost prophecies with her. She says, in a roundabout way, to come back in a day once she has thought about all you have told her. However, you do not actually need to wait a day. Just talk to her again, and she will be ready to give her judgment. It appears you have at least convinced Nibani that you may become the Nerevarine. Your next task, guided by Nibani, is to lift the Seven Curses of Dagoth Ur, walk the path of the Seven Visions, and pass the Seven Trials. The First Trial is simple; you were born on an unknown day to unknown parents. You have also fulfilled the Second Trial by becoming immune to all diseases. For the Third Trial, you must again talk to Sul-Matuul in the camp. Once this trial is fulfilled, return to Nibani for guidance on the remaining trials. Sul-Matuul and the Third Trial[edit] When you ask Sul-Matuul about the Third Trial, he wishes you to first pass a warrior's test by braving the halls of Kogoruhn, an ancient stronghold of the Sixth House. You are to retrieve three tokens from there: Corprus Weepings from a corprus beast, a House Dagoth cup, and the Shadow Shield located in the tomb of Dagoth Morin, deep within the lava tunnels beneath Kogoruhn. If you ask him about Kogoruhn, he will mark its location on your map, southeast of the camp. After completing this mission, Sul-Matuul will disclose the details of the Third Trial to you. Kogoruhn[edit] Kogoruhn is a large structure which is hard to miss and has five different entrances. There is also the corpse of Feril Salmyn on the structure which has some nice Indoril medium armor among other things which could be useful. The Dome of Pollock's Eve, the Dome of Urso, and the Temple of Fey are all small, one-room shrines, each with its own Dagoth. Fey and Urso contain Dagoths Uvil and Reler who are actually quite tough spellcasters, so be careful before you enter these rooms. Pollock has Dagoth Girer, who is not quite as tough as the other two (but no pushover at low levels). The cup and the corprus weepings can both be found in the Dome of Pollock's Eve. The cup is on the table (named as a House Dagoth cup) and the weepings can be found under the urn in the center of the room. You can also find weepings on any random corprus monsters which wander around the other halls. Unfortunately, the Shadow Shield is buried much deeper within Kogoruhn. To reach the shield, you can enter the Hall of the Watchful Touch or the Hall of Phisto sections. Either way, you will need to reach the Bleeding Heart section by passing through the Hall of Phisto, Hall of Maki, Nabith Waterway, Charma's Breath. If you kill Dagoth Ulen (who is actually an ascended sleeper) in the Vault of Aerode, you will get a key to the Nabith Waterway; otherwise you can just pick the lock or use an Open spell. It's quite a walk and there are a number of monsters which you must pass along the way. There is also a good deal of loot along the way, including some ebony weapons and glass armor. The Shadow Shield is lying on a stone near where you encounter Dagoth Elam. There are also some Daedric Gauntlets and an Orc Warhammer in the same area. Once you get all three items, return to Sul-Matuul in the Urshilaku Camp. One item to avoid if you are playing on a pre-1.10 patch version of the game is Fury (found on one of the dead adventurers in the Hall of Maki), as it will cause permanent damage to your armor skills if equipped. (you can fix this by praying at an Imperial Cult Altar or making a Restore Skill spell or potion). Note that you can also enter Kogoruhn from a cave entrance to Charma's Breath near Vemynal inside the ghostfence. This way, you bypass the vast majority of the dungeon. Just be ready to fight the Ash vampire inside. Learn the Third Trial[edit] Sul-Matuul congratulates you on acquiring the three items and rewards you with Malipu-Ataman's Belt. He proceeds to tell you of the Third Trial. The Third Vision states In caverns dark Azura's eye sees/and makes to shine the moon and star. You are to travel to the Cavern of the Incarnate and look for the Moon and Star. The secret of the cavern is set in a riddle: the eye of the needle lies in the teeth of the wind the mouth of the cave lies in the skin of the pearl the dream is the door and the star is the key This riddle is known as Wisdom's Test. You must find the moon and star of the prophecies, and return it to Nibani Maesa. Third Trial Riddle[edit] To solve the riddle, talk to the Ashlanders in the camp as suggested by Matuul. You may need to speak to several people to obtain enough information. If you are carrying Malipu-Ataman's Belt when you speak to them, they will notice it and open up to you. Otherwise you may have to raise their dispositions in order to get information from them. The eye of the needle refers to a tall rock column in the Valley of the Wind. The skin of the pearl refers to a pale rock on the very top of the column. The teeth of the wind refers to Airan's Teeth, two rock spires marking the entrance to the Valley of the Wind. The spires are named after a seer, Airan, who was blessed by Azura. The valley is on the northeast slope of Red Mountain in the center of the island. The mouth to the valley is just east and south of the Daedric Shrine of Zergonipal, which should now be marked on your world map. The last clue refers to the star which is actually Azura's Star that is visible only at dawn and dusk (6-8am and 6-8pm). The riddle tells that a door to the Cave can be found at the base of the needle and will be open only during the dawn and dusk hours. To reach it, start at Falasmaryon and head towards the Daedric Shrine of Zergonipal and just east of it you should find two parallel valleys leading towards the south. Take the one to the east, marked by two tall rock spires (Airan's Teeth). Walk all the way to the end of the valley, and wait for the correct time for the door to open. A quicker and easier way to get there would be to start from Tel Vos and just hike over the mountains to the west. If you go directly west, you should wind up midway through the Valley of the Wind. Simply follow it south the rest of the way. Another quick way is if you have the Propylon Index or the Master Index is to teleport to Rotheran and go due south. Levitation or water walking will help with the first part of this trip. Cavern of the Incarnate[edit] Once you enter the Cavern of the Incarnate, you will see a huge statue of Azura. Pick up the Moon-and-Star in its hands to start a cut-scene. You have now passed the Third Trial and have indeed become the Nerevarine. Don't forget to talk with the ghosts of failed incarnates to obtain some enchanted items (each one has a different phrase that will trigger them to give you the gifts, but usually the phrase is "my story"). Some aren't particularly useful, but if you don't want to use them you can sell them. Report back to Nibani Maesa and Sul-Matuul[edit] It is not necessary to report back to the Urshilaku, but it makes the Fourth and Fifth Trials a little easier. Speaking to Nibani Maesa will create empty topics in your journal for all of the later quests that will allow you to bypass a little dialogue with the later givers. If you do not have the other Ashlander camps on your map, speaking to Sul-Matuul of those camps will add them to your map. Persecution of the Nerevarine[edit] Once you have received Moon-and-Star, you will be subject to The Persecution of the Nerevarine. Both the Tribunal Temple and House Redoran become your enemies (unless you are already a member of the Temple or the House, then the respective faction will not be hostile) and the other factions don't seem to be pleased either. You will not be able to join the Tribunal Temple and, if you are already a member, you will not be able to finish any quests, or receive new ones. Once you have progressed further in the main quest and/or regained the trust of the Houses and the Temple, this lockout will be lifted. Sul-Matuul will kindly warn you of this before he names you Nerevarine of the Urshilaku, but when he tells you to "finish your dealings with the Houses and the Temple", it's actually already too late. The Fourth and Fifth Trials[edit] Your mission now is to be acknowledged by three Great Houses as Hortator (or war leader) and by the four Ashlander tribes as the Nerevarine. These are the Fourth and Fifth Trials, and they can be done in any order or worked on concurrently. Since you're already at the Urshilaku Camp, the Urshilaku Nerevarine quest is the logical first one to complete. After each is complete, you can return to Nibani for more guidance. Bypassing the Fourth and Fifth Trials[edit] If your level is 21 or higher and you have at least 50 Reputation, then you do not have to complete the Fourth and Fifth Trials. Either Nibani Maesa, the Dissident Priests, or the Great House Councilors will tell you that you should see the Archcanon, Tholer Saryoni, in Vivec High Fane right away. This will save a lot of hiking around the various camps and councilors. You can complete these trials anyway, regardless of whether you go to the Archcanon immediately or delay the trip. Doing so will allow you to obtain some rare loot and additional Reputation points. If you do these trials after going to see the Archcanon and receiving the Plan to Defeat Dagoth Ur from Vivec, a few NPCs may express concern that you haven't yet fulfilled the prophecy – haven't faced Dagoth Ur – but that is the only consequence (and a few may repeat that you need to go to the Archcanon despite you already having done so). There is no deadline, and you can put the Main Quest on hold to pursue other aspects of the game, or work on your stats.

Quick Walkthrough: Meet Pemenie on the road northwest of Caldera. (Optional) Escort her to Gnaar Mok.
Detailed Walkthrough: Pemenie needs an escort[edit] Find the trader Pemenie on the road northwest of Caldera on the way to Ald'ruhn. She will ask you to escort her to Gnaar Mok in return for the Boots of Blinding Speed. Your reward has a flaw[edit] Agree to do so and escort her to Gnaar Mok to the west. Either walk directly there, or if you want to avoid fighting any creatures, simply walk back to Caldera and then fast travel via guild guide to Vivec and take the boat from there, and Pemenie will follow the entire way. Once you enter Gnaar Mok, you will be rewarded with the boots. The boots Fortify Speed by 200 points but also have a 100% Blind spell on them, meaning you'll be fast, but unless you have resisted the effect, you'll have no idea where you're going unless you navigate using the minimap in the corner of your screen. Wearing the Boots[edit] The trick to using the boots is to use a Resist Magicka spell or item before equipping them. If you have 50% Resist Magicka, you'll only be 50% blind, meaning that things will be a bit darker and enemies will be tougher to hit (with weapon skills under 30, you may not be able to hit anything at all). The easiest way to get to 100% Resist Magicka is to buy Cheap Resist Magicka potions from Eris Telas in the High Fane (he restocks it, and also sells to anyone regardless of faction rank or membership). Each potion costs around 15 septims, and can be stacked. This even works for races with Magicka Weakness, like Altmer; you just need to buy more potions. You can also cast a Resist Magicka 100% for a couple of seconds (buy a custom spell or a custom enchanted item) and then equip the Boots of Blinding Speed before the time expires to avoid all negative repercussions. Since the spell has such a short time of effect it will be relatively reliable and easy to cast. If however, you are already suffering from Weakness to Magicka, you will be unable to do this with just one spell because the Resist Magicka 100% will be counteracted by your Weakness to Magicka. You can still reach 100% resistance by stacking multiple magical effects from different sources (even just identical custom spells with different names will work, although activated enchanted items may be more effective due to their instant casting.) Night Eye will brighten your vision and help counteract the blinding effect if it cannot be resisted 100%. The Cuirass of the Savior's Hide is very useful with the boots, as it gives you 60% resist magicka. Bretons have a racial ability of 50% resist Magicka, so a Breton equipping the boots will only get a 50% Blind effect, which is quite bearable. If you don't have 100% magicka resistance when equipping the boots, you can simply adjust the brightness of the game in the video options to see better, but a partial Blind will still have a negative effect on your ability to hit enemies. While wearing the boots, a weak 1 point Levitate (as provided by e.g. the Wizard's Staff) will make you fly at a comfortable speed. Beware that the boots have very low durability. If they are broken in a fight, they will be unequipped and you will be slow again.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Tuls Valen in the Ald'ruhn Temple for your duties. Travel to the Maar Gan shrine. Activate the large Magic Rock to learn that it was here where Vivec taunted Mehrunes Dagon. Taunt the Dremora near the rock into attacking you, then activate the rock again to receive a blessing. Return to Tuls for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] When you ask about duties again, Tuls Valen in the Ald'ruhn Temple will ask you to demonstrate your faith and perform a pilgrimage to the shrine in Maar Gan, a town north of Ald'ruhn. Pilgrimage to Maar Gan[edit] Take a silt strider to Maar Gan and enter the shrine at the east end of town. Activate the large Magic Rock just inside the entrance to learn that it was here where Vivec taunted Mehrunes Dagon to throw the rock at him rather than the people. According to Tuls, you are supposed to mimic this event somehow. You must talk to Anhaedra, the Dremora standing near the rock, and taunt him through dialogue. Once he starts attacking you (you don't have to kill him), activate the rock again to receive a blessing of Fortify Speechcraft and Personality 10 pts for 48 min. You may need to activate the shrine several times. To end combat, either kill him or leave the shrine. Return to Tuls for your reward: the Block skill book Death Blow of Abernanit.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Tharer Rotheloth at the Temple in Molag Mar for your duties. Travel to Mount Kand to make the pilgrimage to its shrine. Enter Mount Kand, Cavern and solve the riddles presented by the Flame, Frost and Storm Atronachs. Activate the shrine at the end of the cavern. Return to Tharer to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Tharer Rotheloth in the Molag Mar Tribunal Temple asks you to make the Pilgrimage to Mount Kand shrine. Tharer gives you four Quality Potions of Night-Eye and warns you that you should be good with riddles or find The Yellow Book of Riddles (found randomly at many booksellers like the one in Balmora). Mount Kand should now be marked on your map and is northwest of Molag Mar. Mount Kand Shrine[edit] The Flame Atronach The entrance to the shrine is at the top of the mountain and is simply labeled Mount Kand, Cavern (not the Assu cave entrance, which is nearby). Inside you will encounter a Flame Atronach, which you should not attack but talk to (if you attack and kill it you will have to wait until it respawns which can be a few days). The riddle you receive is: A metal neither black nor red As heavy as man's golden greed What you do to stay ahead With friend or arrow or steed The choices to answer this riddle are: Ebony, Glass, Daedric, Lead and Iron, with the relatively obvious correct choice of lead. If you answer incorrectly you will have to kill the creature and wait until it respawns. The Frost Atronach Continue on to find a Frost Atronach on a frozen pool who again offers you a riddle: If you lie to me I will slay you with my sword. If you tell me the truth, I will slay you with a spell. If you answer that the atronach will kill you with a spell, he will demonstrate that it is indeed the truth by attacking you. If, instead, you say he will slay you with a sword, he is caught in a paradox: unable to prove your statement true (by attacking you with a sword, since he will only do that if you lie to him) or false (by attacking you with a spell, since he will only do that if you tell the truth to him), he can do neither, and therefore must let you pass. The Storm Atronach Continue on to find a Storm Atronach offering the longer riddle: My fellow Atronach, Zedias-soko, was slain. The Altmer claims the Dunmer is guilty. The Dunmer says the Khajiit did it. The Orc swears he didn't kill Zedias-soko. The Khajiit says the Dunmer is lying. If only one of these speaks the truth, who killed Zedias-soko? If the Dunmer is telling the truth, then the Khajiit is lying, but if the Khajiit is telling the truth, then the Dunmer is lying. Either the Dunmer or the Khajiit is telling the truth, and since only one of these suspects speaks the truth, then all the others are lying. This confirms that both the Altmer and Orc are lying, which means the Orc is the murderer. The answer to this riddle is that the Orc did it. Continue past the Storm Atronach to the shrine to finish your pilgrimage. Activate the shrine to receive a Reputation point and a blessing: Mount Kand Shrine   - Fortify Endurance 10 pts for 48 mins on Touch, Fortify Intelligence 10 pts for 48 mins on Touch. Return to Tharer for his blessings.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to any quest giver to learn about the Pilgrimages of the Seven Graces and receive the book The Pilgrim's Path. Visit the seven shrines and receive their blessings, in any order: Go to the Fields of Kummu and donate some muck to the Shrine of Humility. Go to the Temple Canton of Vivec and offer a Rising Force Potion to the Shrine of Daring. Go to the Palace of Vivec and donate 100 gold to the Shrine of Generosity. Go to the center of the Puzzle Canal and try to drown yourself to open the way. Give a silver longsword to the Dremora Krazzt then read the Shrine of Courtesy. Go to the temple in Gnisis and donate a Potion of Cure Common Disease to the Shrine of Justice. Go to Koal Cave and donate some dreugh wax to the Shrine of Valor. Go to Red Mountain via the Ghostgate and donate a soul gem to the Shrine of Pride. Return to any Master of the Tribunal Temple.
Detailed Walkthrough: Pilgrimages of the Seven Graces[edit] Any of the Tribunal Temple quest givers will give you this quest just after you join. In order to receive any more quests from the Temple, you must first perform the Pilgrimages of the Seven Graces, visiting seven shrines across the island. Though none of the quests are particularly difficult, a good deal of traveling throughout the western portion of the map is required. You must visit and activate each shrine, which require you to provide a certain item for each one. You should be given the book The Pilgrim's Path which has a rather thorough description of each shrine. The shrines can be visited in any order and their approximate location should be marked on your map. Grace of Humility, Fields of Kummu[edit] The Shrine of Humility can be found in the Fields of Kummu, on the north shore of Lake Amaya along the road between two trees. You need a portion of muck to activate this shrine (just north of the marker on your map). If you don't have muck, proceed south into the lake until you come across a small island where you can obtain some from a Muckspunge. Once you activate the shrine, you will be blessed with Feather 100 pts for 48 min. The Shrine to Stop the Moon (Grace of Daring) Grace of Daring, Vivec Temple[edit] The Shrine of Daring, a.k.a. the Shrine to Stop the Moon, is one of three shrines in Vivec, found outside in the southwest corner of the Temple Canton. To activate the shrine, you will need a Rising Force Potion, which can be bought from Danso Indules in the Temple tunnel or from other vendors around Vivec (any quality of potion will do, though you cannot use one you made yourself). Once you activate the shrine, you will be blessed with Levitate 100 pts for 24 min. You can receive this high-speed, long-lasting levitation again and again by returning to donate another potion; this is useful for map exploration and semi-fast travel, e.g. to Daedric and Dwemer sites in the Ascadian Isles. Grace of Generosity, Palace of Vivec[edit] The Shrine of Generosity is one of three shrines in Vivec, found outside the entrance to the Palace. With a donation of 100 gold you can activate the shrine and be blessed with Fortify Mercantile and Luck 10 pts for 48 min. Grace of Courtesy, The Puzzle Canal[edit] The Shrine of Courtesy is one of the three shrines in Vivec and its entrance can be found on Level 3 of the Puzzle Canal in the Palace Canton (in the center of the level in the tunnel). Once inside you will find a shrine that will only give you the cryptic message of Breathe the Waters of His Glory and the Way is Made Clear. To "breathe the waters", you must stay underwater until your Breath Bar is depleted, at which point your health will begin to decrease; when your health drops below 10, you will black out for a second and be healed (If you are unable to drown because you have a permanent Water Breathing effect, damage your health to 10 while underwater, or unequip the item providing the effect). Once healed, resurface and head back up the steps and you will find there is now a bridge to a new part of the room. Cross the bridge to the revealed area and talk to the Dremora Krazzt at the top of the stairs beside the shrine. You MUST take a silver long sword out of the chest beside him. That delivers a message about "you having given" a sword to the daedra. After that, you MUST talk to the daedra about that sword you TOOK a moment before from the chest. ONLY THEN you get a dialog option with the daedra. Give him the Silver Longsword via the dialog option. You can now activate the shrine and be blessed with Water Breathing and Swift Swim 25 pts for 48 min. The Ash Mask inside the Temple Grace of Justice, Gnisis[edit] The Shrine of Justice, a.k.a. the Shrine of the Mask, can be found at the top of the Tribunal Temple in Gnisis, next to the Mask of Vivec artifact. You need a Potion of Cure Common Disease to activate the shrine, which can be bought within the Temple (check the rooms near the entrance). Once you activate the shrine, try touching the middle panel again to reveal the true Vivec Ashmask. Touch the mask to be taught the spell Vivec's Touch (cheap but 100% effective Cure Common and Blight Disease on Touch). If you are born under the atronach birthsign, touching the true Vivec Ashmask can be an infinite, though tedious, source of magicka. Grace of Valor, Koal Cave[edit] The Shrine of Valor is a little more difficult to reach, being found inside the Koal Cave just south of Gnisis along the shore (it is marked on your map, under the stone arch). You will need some Dreugh Wax to activate the shrine just inside the entrance. You can buy wax in the Gnisis Temple, or just find and kill the Dreugh Warlord found further inside the cave (the Warlord might be very tough for lower level characters). Activate the shrine to receive the blessing of Fortify Unarmored, Light Armor, Medium Armor, Heavy Armor 10 pts for 48 min. If you have killed the Dreugh Warlord in the cave, you'll also receive an enchanted Dreugh Cuirass. The shrine inside the Ghostfence Grace of Pride, Ghostfence[edit] The Shrine of Pride is the most difficult shrine to visit, mainly due to its remote location. You might want to pick up a Petty Soul Gem before you head out since you need a soul gem to activate the shrine. Any type of soul gem, filled or not, will be acceptable. Head towards the Ghostgate, which should be marked on your map, by traveling roughly southeast of Ald'ruhn or taking a long walk northwards through Foyada Mamaea. Once you reach the Ghostgate, look for the pillars with switches on their sides. You will need to activate two switches to be able to pass northwards through the tunnel. Once inside the Ghostfence, travel north a few paces and then follow the path northeast. You will find the shrine at the end, in the little dip between two trees. Activate the shrine with a soul gem to receive a blessing of Fortify Magicka 50 pts and Shield 25 pts for 48 min. One note of warning: The shrine here will take one of each type of soul gem you have, which might be distressing if you were saving them for your next visit to an enchanter. However, you can prevent this happening by dropping all but the cheapest gem before activating the shrine.  It will not, thankfully, take Azura's Star. Also, in the temple accessed from the two Ghostgate towers, you will find numerous shrines that provide various stat buffs, if you are low-level and uneasy about going inside the Ghostfence, where you may encounter Ash and Corprus Creatures, even not far inside the gate. Completion[edit] Once you visit and activate all seven shrines, return to any Tribunal Temple Master (not necessarily the quest givers) to notify them that you've finished the pilgrimages, selecting the "Seven Graces" conversation topic.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Iulus Truptor at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart for a new almoner mission. Go to the East Empire Company and talk to Canctunian Ponius to retrieve a pledged donation. Canctunian Ponius will instead ask you to track down 3,000 gold of money embezzled from by a clerk, Mossanon. Talk to Shazgob gra-Luzgan to learn that the clerk had been seen using the Guild Guide in the Foreign Quarter. Speak with Flacassia Fauseius in Vivec. Ask around the Sadrith Mora Mages Guild about Mossanon. Talk to any Dark Elf females in Sadrith Mora about Mossanon and find out that he is seeing Volmyni Dral. Find Mossanon in Dral's house and persuade him to return the money. Come back to Canctunian Ponius with the money to receive his pledge. Return to Iulus Truptor to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Almoner Mission[edit] Iulus Truptor at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart will ask you to collect another promised pledge of 1,000 gold from Canctunian Ponius of the East Empire Company (in his office at the company hall). Pledge from Canctunian Ponius[edit] When you ask Canctunian Ponius about his pledge, he'll instead ask you to track down 3,000 gold of money embezzled from the treasury by the clerk Mossanon. Once you recover this money, Canctunian Ponius says he'll pay his pledge. Start right off by asking around the hall about Mossanon and you'll soon talk to Shazgob gra-Luzgan, who will tell you that the clerk had been seen using the Mages Guild Guild Guide in the Vivec guild hall. Okan-Shei in the hall will further tell you that this is because Mossanon has a Telvanni girlfriend. In Search of the Clerk[edit] Travel to the Mages Guild in Vivec and speak with Flacassia Fauseius, who will tell you that Mossanon has traveled frequently to Sadrith Mora, as should you. Many members of the guild there will direct you to a High Elf trader named Sinyaramen at the Gateway Inn in town. Sinyaramen cannot help you but suggests you talk to Dark Elf females if you want info on a Telvanni with a High Elf boyfriend. Confused yet? Alternatively, you can speak to the Sadrith Mora guild guide, Iniel, who will direct you to Volmyni Dral. If you talk to Iniel or any Dark Elf females in Sadrith Mora about Mossanon, they should report having seen a High Elf in the company of Volmyni Dral, who lives near Wolverine Hall in town. Find and enter Dral's house; you'll find Mossanon upstairs. He explains that he did it to impress his girl, but now he knows she doesn't care whether he is rich. If your Speechcraft skill is high enough and his disposition towards you is favorable, he'll trust you and offer to return it on the condition that you don't reveal where he is. At this point you have three options: Promise secrecy: he'll give you 2,500 of it (he spent the rest) and thank you for your help. Demand the gold: if his disposition is high enough, he'll hand it over and beg for mercy. Consider his offer: he'll say goodbye. Nothing will happen other than a journal update, when you talk to him again you'll still have the same three options. Return the Money[edit] If you want to keep the gold, simply return to Iulus Truptor. To do the right thing, return to Canctunian Ponius in the East Empire Company Hall in Ebonheart with the news. You have the option of returning all or only a part of the money, since he has no way of knowing how much you actually recovered. If you got Mossanon's disposition up to have him hand over the money without making any promises then you have the option to tell Canctunian that you found the thief. You can reveal his location or not as you choose. If you do wish to tattle, or just let Canctunian know that you found Mossanon, be sure to talk to him about Mossanon before Embezzled Funds. Once the money is handed over, Canctunian Ponius considers the Mossanon matter closed. Return to Iulus Truptor with the money to receive the Zenithar Whispers, an amulet that casts charm. This is the last almoner mission he has for you. If your rank is high enough he'll say he's given your name to the Oracle, and that you should consider taking some quests from her directly.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk with Edwinna Elbert about duties. Travel to Sadrith Mora and get Edwinna's potion from Skink-in-Tree's-Shade. Return to Edwinna to receive your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] It seems that Edwinna Elbert in the Ald'ruhn Guild of Mages is waiting for a Potion of Detect Creatures from Skink-in-Tree's-Shade in the Sadrith Mora Mage's Guild. Edwinna needs you to go to Sadrith Mora and check on Skink-in-Tree's-Shade's progress for her. Potion Delivery[edit] To do this, you need to travel to Sadrith Mora. The quickest and by far the most convenient method is to grab a Guild Guide over to the Sadrith Mora hall. When you arrive, chat with Skink-in-Tree's-Shade about Detect Creatures Potion and Skink will gladly retrieve it for you. In addition, Skink will increase his Disposition toward you by 5 points, and tells you to come see him when you return for some duties. Return to Ald'ruhn[edit] Return to Ald'ruhn to Edwinna. Upon providing the potion to Edwinna you are rewarded with a 10 point increase in Disposition and an Exclusive Potion of Shadow.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Big Helende at Dirty Muriel's Cornerclub in Wolverine Hall for a new job. Steal the Dispel Potion Formula from Anis Seloth. Deliver the recipe to Tusamircil at the Mages Guild. Return to Big Helende to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] Big Helende at Dirty Muriel's Cornerclub in Wolverine Hall asks you to steal a Dispel Potion Formula from Anis Seloth, the alchemist in town. When you get the recipe, deliver it straight to Tusamircil in Wolverine Hall. Potion Recipe[edit] Anis Seloth can be found on the north side of town. The recipe is in a crate under a plant upstairs (where there are no witnesses fortunately). Tusamircil can be found at the Mage's Guild in Wolverine Hall (the only castle in Sadrith Mora). When you enter Wolverine Hall, look for a stairwell which leads up to a door marked Imperial Shrine, enter this door. Once inside, enter the door on your left marked Wolverine Hall. Proceed up the stairwell and enter the first door you see - Mage's Guild. Give the recipe to Tusamircil. After that, return to Big Helende to finish the quest. Note: If you purchase/steal 4 pieces of Raw Ebony you'll position yourself in the "Wizard For Hire" quest to finish very quickly - that quest comes shortly after.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Mevure Hlen at the Tailors and Dyers Hall in St. Olms. Obtain the Letter From Llaalam Dredil in a locked chest at the East Empire Company Hall in Ebonheart. Return to Hlen for a two point bonus to the Mercantile skill.
Detailed Walkthrough: Spy on the competition[edit] You can only receive this quest after delivering a letter for Llaalam Dredil in Ebonheart. Once this is done, speak with Mevure Hlen at the Tailors and Dyers Hall on the St. Olms Waistworks level who wants to know how the East Empire Company in Ebonheart sets its prices. The Price List[edit] You'll have to return to Ebonheart to seek the letter's contents. J'Zhirr has placed the letter that you seek in a locked chest behind a locked door near where he stands. Unfortunately, this room is well guarded so take your chances and pick the lock, and pay the resulting fine if you are caught (or just kill everyone if that's your thing), or use a chameleon spell to help conceal you. Bring the letter back to Hlen to receive a two point bonus to the Mercantile skill.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Hrundi at the Fighter's Guild in Wolverine Hall for your orders. Travel to Dagon Fel in search of the Seven Eggs of Gold. Search for the Pudai Egg Mine west of Mzuleft. Obtain the seven Golden Eggs in the mine. Return to Hrundi.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Orders[edit] Hrundi in the Wolverine Hall Fighter's Guild asks you recover the Seven Eggs of Gold from the legendary Pudai Egg Mine. The mine is believed to be somewhere on or near the island of Sheogorad (the large island in the north area of the map) but that's all the information he has. Looking for the Mine[edit] The Pudai Egg Mine is on the main island of the Sheogorad region. It is to the far west of Mzuleft, past the inlet (Mzuleft is to the southwest of Dagon Fel). No one on the island knows where the mine is, so there's no use asking around. To find the Pudai Egg Mine, leave the guild and take a boat to Dagon Fel. Exit Dagon Fel to the west. Go south when the path splits. At the next split, go west (passing an Orc named Bulak gra-Murug). Continue west past a few more forks in the road, and the mine will be on the right. If the path ends in water, turn around and walk back east and look to the left; the mine will be very close. Picking up the Eggs[edit] There's nothing of interest in the main section of the mine. The Golden Eggs can be found behind the queen in the Queen's Lair (each egg weighs 30 units). Return to Hrundi for a reward of 10,000 gold.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Volrina Quarra in Druscashti Collect the different ingredients. Return to Quarra to receive the finished Amulet. Slay twelve vampires. Return to Quarra again.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Quarra Amulet[edit] The Quarra Clan leader, Volrina Quarra, at the bottom of Druscashti, will ask you to retrieve for her a number of ingredients for making some magical amulets with. The list includes: 5 extravagant sapphire amulets 2 portions of Void Salts 1 Daedra's Heart 1 portion of Vampire Dust 1 skull Finding the Amulets[edit] Amulet Locations    NPCs Banden Indarys Brara Morvayn Broder Garil Camas Cienne Sintieve Domesea Sarethi Drelse Dralor Dulnea Ralaal Mavis Nadram Miner Arobar Nelos Onmar Neminda    Ondres Nerano Orns Omaren Ralam Vilas Ralen Hlaalo Selkirnemus Tunengore Yngling Half-Troll Containers Closet in Venim Manor Ald'ruhn Corpse in Releth Ancestral Tomb Leveled Lists random_extravagant_de_fclothes1 random_extravagant_de_mclothes1 l_n_amulet Unfortunately, most of the items are rather rare and difficult to get, though you may already have a number of them in whatever hoard you keep. The amulets can be found in a number of places, including crates in smuggler's caves (leveled loot so they are random), such as the cave Yasamsi near Hla Oad. Several NPCs possess an amulet - see the list on the right - including Ralen Hlaalo in Hlaalo Manor, Balmora. Being dead, he won't mind it being taken. Finding the ingredients[edit] The four ingredients are slightly easier to get by visiting Telvanni and Mages Guild alchemy vendors. You may have to visit several to find them all. The skull can be found in a great number of places if you just look for one, including the Caldera Mages Guild, or outside the Arano Ancestral Tomb near Tel Branora. You can buy vampire dust from the alchemist Nalcarya of White Haven in Balmora. Return to Volrina once you have all the items to receive one of her older amulets, allowing you to Recall to the Clan's headquarters at will. But wait, there is more[edit] Volrina Quarra will then tell you that you might find further reward if you kill any 12 vampires from the other clans, Aundae or Berne. Any vampires that you killed previously do not count towards the 12. If you kill any of your own clan during the quest, you will need to kill that many extra from the other clans. Return to Volrina once you've killed 12 vampires to receive permission to use Vampire Touch on the Clan's cattle to heal yourself. Just don't kill them, or this privilege will be revoked.

Quick Walkthrough: Chat with Sugar-Lips Habasi about jobs and Dwemer artifacts. Travel to Hla Oad to recover some Dwemer artifacts stolen by Ra'Zhid. Visit Fatleg's Drop Off to find Ra'Zhid. Recover the artifacts. Return to Sugar-Lips Habasi to complete the quest and receive your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] Sugar-Lips Habasi in the South Wall Cornerclub in Balmora asks you to recover some Dwemer artifacts stolen by Ra'Zhid in Hla Oad (southwest of Balmora on the coast). Find Ra'Zhid[edit] It's a moderate walk from Balmora to Hla Oad through some fairly rugged terrain. Alternatively, you can travel to a port city with a dock (e.g. you can take the Silt Strider to Vivec), and take a transport ship to Hla Oad. Ask around town, and you will be directed to Fatleg's Drop Off, where Ra'Zhid can be found loitering inside. Chat with Ra'Zhid, and he'll play dumb about the artifacts in question, claiming that he hasn't received them yet. Speaking with Ra'Zhid leads nowhere, no matter how much you attempt to persuade him. As is often the case, though, he can be taunted into attacking you fairly easily, removing (some) legal complications. Recover the Artifacts[edit] The artifacts are a Dwemer goblet, bowl and tube. Note that you can return any items that you find (e.g., from any Dwemer ruin, not just the ones in Hla Oad). However, the goblet must have a weight of four units (there is one that weighs three units, and it will not be accepted). The artifacts are in a locked (35) chest behind three barrels left of the front door and Ra'Zhid will likely attack you if he notices you attempting to open it or taking the items. Ra'Zhid has a key to the chest on his person, and you can attempt to pickpocket the key from him.  Even if you taunt Ra'Zhid into attacking you and you subsequently kill him in the battle, the owner of the store, Trasteve, will still report you for robbery if he sees you trying to open the chest, with or without the key that Ra'Zhid is carrying. Conveniently, there is a pillar in the house situated directly between the chest and Trasteve that can block his view of you. Return to Sugar-Lips[edit] Return to Sugar-Lips Habasi for a reward of two Master lockpicks, two Journeyman's probes, and a Journeyman's armorer's hammer.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Relam Arinith at Fatleg's Drop Off in Hla Oad about Rabinna. Lead Rabinna to Vorar Helas in Balmora. Either defend Rabinna or let Vorar Helas kill her.
Detailed Walkthrough: Speak with Relam Arinith in the basement of Fatleg's Drop Off in Hla Oad. He needs a slave named Rabinna delivered to Vorar Helas in Balmora. Evidently the actual slave is not important, but what she carries is... illegal drugs of some form. Along the way to Balmora, you can talk to Rabinna (if you raise her disposition to 50) to determine that you have a choice of what happens in the quest. If you decide to deliver Rabinna to Vorar Helas on the east side of Balmora, he will attack Rabinna immediately (to get the drugs). Once she is dead, you can talk to him to receive a reward of 400 gold and a magic ring. If Rabinna dies on the trip and you rescue the Moon Sugar and deliver that to Vorar Helas, you'll just get 200 gold and no ring. Alternatively, you can help Rabinna kill Vorar Helas (or just avoid him entirely), and deliver her to Im-Kilaya at the Argonian Mission in Ebonheart. The easiest way is to hop on the boat in Hla Oad. Once you have delivered her to the Argonian Mission, you can talk to Im-Kilaya to receive a 400 gold reward and a 10 point boost in disposition with the Twin Lamps. Finally, you can speak with Relam Arinith after freeing Rabinna. If Vorar Helas is dead, he will consider the matter resolved. If Vorar Helas is still alive, then Relam Arinith will attack you.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak with Tarer Braryn in the Office of the Watch in the Hall of Justice. Give Trebonius Artorius the gift and receive a potion for the rash. Return to Tarer with the potion.
Detailed Walkthrough: A Rash of Insults[edit] Speak with Tarer Braryn in the Office of the Watch in the Hall of Justice, Temple Canton in Vivec. You'll learn that he recently ran into the Mages Guild Guildmaster, Trebonius Artorius, while drunk and 'mistakenly' called him 'flat-head'. He now has a mysterious rash that just won't go away...coincidence? Not likely. At any rate, Tarer wants someone eloquent with words to have a chat with Trebonius and have him remove the curse. The Arch-Mage has a Cure...[edit] The Guild of Mages is in the Foreign Quarter Plaza and the Arch-Mage is inside at the bottom of the stairs. Speak with him while you have the copy of Aedra and Daedra that Tarer gave you, and Trebonius will give you a special Cure Disease potion for Tarer and a Levitation potion for you. Return to Tarer to cure him and you'll be rewarded with 100 gold, twice what he promised you.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Lloros Sarano for duties. Travel to Andasreth to find out what happened to some Redoran soldiers. Find the bodies of the Redoran soldiers and get their Redoran Banner Shields back. Report back to Lloros Sarano.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Lloros Sarano in the Ald'ruhn Tribunal Temple will ask you to find out what happened to four Redoran soldiers who were sent to the Andasreth stronghold and have not returned. You must rescue them if they are alive or bring back their Redoran Banner Shields if they are dead. Andasreth[edit] The stronghold is in a caldera northwest of Gnaar Mok near the coastline; the easiest way to get there is to head due west from Drulene's guar farm. Unfortunately, all the soldiers are indeed dead and can be found in a locked room at the bottom level of the stronghold. Good Redorans will undoubtedly hunt down and kill every bandit therein in revenge. Report back to Sarano with the four shields to complete the quest. As a reward you may choose to keep one of the shields. This can affect your disposition bonus received. If you choose to keep the shield the bonus is +15, if you choose to give the shield to Sarano the bonus is +5.

Quick Walkthrough: Meet Hlormar Wine-Sot at the roadside northwest of Caldera. Find the Witch Sosia Caristiana down the road. Decide who to help.
Detailed Walkthrough: A half-naked Barbarian[edit] Northwest of Caldera, you will run into a half-naked Nord on the road. Hlormar Wine-Sot will tell the tale of being seduced by a witch, paralyzed, and robbed of his prized Cloudcleaver axe, and almost all of his clothes. Find the Witch[edit] Hlormar will say that he believes the witch's camp is towards the northwest. Escort Hlormar and follow the road to the northwest, taking the north path at the first intersection. (Strangely enough, she is located not too far away from another witch-troubled barbarian). Find the Witch, Sosia Caristiana, who will tell a different tale. Sosia says that she hired Hlormar as an escort but he became too friendly so she cast a sleep spell on him and took his possessions as a lesson. She believes Hlormar is too angry and decides that she will not give the axe back yet, instead offering that she will meet with Hlormar in three days at the Caldera Mages Guild and give the axe back then. Talk to Hlormar about this offer and he will reject it, forcing you to choose a side in the conflict. Whom to Help?[edit] If you side with Sosia, Hlormar will attack and you will have to kill him. Hlormar is a bare-handed fighter who can quickly knock an unprepared hero with insufficient Fatigue to the ground. Once he is defeated, Sosia will thank you and give you some potions for your troubles (Exclusive Restore Health, Quality Restore Fatigue and Quality Fortify Health). If you side with Hlormar, he will attack Sosia and you can join in to kill her. Note that Sosia attacks with a Steel Staff of Chastening, which damages personality and luck attributes. Loot the axe from her corpse, along with the staff and the potions she'd have given you if you took her side, and Hlormar will notice immediately, giving you the option of giving Cloudcleaver back to Hlormar or not: If you keep the axe for yourself, Hlormar will attack you as mentioned above. If you give Hlormar the axe, he will be happy and offer you some fighting tips that will increase your strength attribute by 2 points. A potential suggestion is to have him raise your strength and then attack him to retrieve Cloudcleaver, thus getting both an increase in strength and Cloudcleaver. You may also pickpocket it from him.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Master Aryon in the Upper Tower in Tel Vos for chores. Speak to Telvanni to learn who to recruit as your Mouth: Edd Theman. Travel to Balmora to recruit Fast Eddie. Give him a Silver Staff of Peace to convince him. Return to Aryon to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Once you reach the rank of Spellwright, Councilor Aryon in the Upper Tower of Tel Vos will ask you to recruit a Mouth in order to be promoted to a Telvanni Wizard. Ask Aryon and he will mention a possible candidate in Balmora. Your Future Mouth[edit] Keep asking around the Telvanni to yield the name Edd Theman (also known as Fast Eddie and Eddie the Rat). Raven Omayn and Enar Releth in the Telvanni Council House in Sadrith Mora will give it to you. If you have already completed the Sixth House Base quest, you can speak with Caius Cosades in his house in northeast Balmora to learn more about Theman. He was a former Telvanni wizard who joined the Mages Guild. Edd is apparently colorful but unreliable, although he is a good source for House Telvanni gossip. Finding Fast Eddie[edit] Edd's house is a little difficult to find, since it doesn't show up on your map. It's on the west side of the river, above Itan's house (near the Eight Plates). The icon on the map will only show Itan's house. Fast Eddie will agree to serve as your Mouth in return for a Silver Staff of Peace. If you still have the one Aryon gave you, you can give that to him. Otherwise you will need to buy a new one. Return to Aryon to complete the quest and receive Aryon's Helper (a glove that summons three Atronachs). Note that after this quest Edd will move to the Telvanni Council House. You will be able to ask him to do some jobs later on.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Ranis Athrys in the Balmora Guild of Mages for duties. Travel to Sulipund, and find Llarar Bereloth. Convince Bereloth to join the Mages Guild, or kill him. Return to Athrys to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] This is one of the first quests offered by Ranis Athrys in the Balmora Guild of Mages once you reach the rank of Journeyman. This and the quest Manwe's Dues are offered at the same time, but are considered separate and will each raise your standing within the Guild. Ranis will ask you to recruit a Telvanni named Llarar Bereloth in Sulipund. Unfortunately, if you cannot convince him, you must kill him. Traveling to Sulipund[edit] Ranis tells you that Sulipund is north of the Dunmer stronghold Marandus, and she marks Marandus on the map. If you have the Master Propylon Index, use the guild guide to Caldera and have Folms Mirel send you straight there. Otherwise, it's more complicated. The overland route doesn't really have a clear path due to mountains that complicate travel. Without levitation, the trip is very difficult, and far from Balmora. The other option is to take a silt strider to Suran, and then swim up the river that runs beside the town to Lake Nabia. Besides the occasional slaughterfish coming from the deep and the occasional cliff racer coming from above, there shouldn't be that much of a problem with creatures. Once you arrive in the lake, just get out on the shore and you'll be very close to Marandus. Then, just follow Ranis' directions to get to Sulipund. Llarar Bereloth[edit] Once you're inside Sulipund, just follow the winding hallway until you meet up with Llarar Bereloth. Talk to him, and at first he'll refuse to join the Mages Guild. At this point, you have three options, you can either kill him, use your Speechcraft skill to increase his disposition, or bribe him. Once his disposition is at 70, he'll join the Guild. Whether he's dead or has consented to join the Mages Guild, head back to Balmora and report to Ranis Athrys. If you were forced to kill him you will receive the lower Disposition award, and only two potions, rather than four.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Faral Retheran in the Treasury in Vivec's Redoran canton for duties. Go to the Redas Ancestral Tomb to collect the Redas Chalice, War Axe, and Robe of Deeds. Report back to Faral Retheran.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Faral Retheran in the Redoran Treasury in Vivec's Redoran canton will ask you to recover several items from the Redas Ancestral Tomb including the Redas Chalice, War Axe, and Robe of Deeds. Redas Ancestral Tomb[edit] The tomb is just south of Molag Mar. You will need to go around the mountains or levitate over them to reach the tomb. The three items to be retrieved are in two places.
