The robe and chalice are close to the entrance, while the axe is in the last room and requires that you swim through a pool. Make sure to bring an enchanted or refined weapon, as the tomb is occupied by several leveled Daedra. Return to Retheran in Vivec and give her the three items to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Big Helende at Dirty Muriel's Cornerclub in Wolverine Hall for a new job. Travel to Ald'ruhn to steal the book Redoran Cooking Secrets from Dinara Othrelas. Either find the book in Dinara's bedroom in the Private Quarters of Llethri Manor and steal it. Or convince Dinara to give you the book. Return to Helende to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Background[edit] Fara, owner of Fara's Hole in the Wall in Sadrith Mora and Dinara Othrelas of Ald'ruhn have an annual cookery contest and it seems Fara wants an edge this year. Big Helende at Dirty Muriel's Cornerclub in Wolverine Hall asks you to steal the book Redoran Cooking Secrets from Dinara Othrelas at the Llethri Manor in Ald'ruhn, Manor District. Stealing the Redoran Cookbook[edit] The book can be found in Dinara's bedroom in the Private Quarters of the Manor (northernmost bedroom), in a locked chest (50). There's no one around so it's a simple matter to steal the book. You can also receive the book by raising Dinara's disposition to 95 or higher and then asking her to give it to you (she's near the entrance). A Recipe For Success[edit] You can either take the cookbook directly to Fara or return to Helende instead. If you go straight to Helende she will reward you with a Quality Potion of Shadow. Either choice gives you the faction reputation and disposition rewards.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Athyn Sarethi in Sarethi Manor (Ald'ruhn, Manor District) to learn about the House Redoran council members. If not a House member, rescue Sarethi's son, Varvur, in Venim Manor, to get his vote for Hortator. Talk to Miner Arobar in Arobar Manor and get his vote for Hortator. Talk to Garisa Llethri in Llethri Manor and get his vote for Hortator. Talk to Hlaren Ramoran in Ramoran Manor and get his vote for Hortator. Talk to Mistress Brara Morvayn in the Redoran Council Hall and get her vote for Hortator. Challenge Bolvyn Venim in Venim Manor to a duel, meeting him in Vivec's Arena. Return to Athyn Sarethi and be named the Hortator for House Redoran.
Detailed Walkthrough: Overview[edit] You have just officially become the Nerevarine and must be acknowledged as the war leader by the four Ashlander tribes (Ahemmusa, Zainab, Urshilaku, and Erabenimsun) and the three Great Houses (Hlaalu, Redoran, and Telvanni). The first step is to become Hortator to the three Great Houses and complete the Fourth Trial, starting with House Redoran (though the actual order of the houses is unimportant). The quest has two different paths, one for members of House Redoran, and one for those who are not. Sarethi Manor[edit] Pay a visit to Athyn Sarethi in the Sarethi Manor in Ald'ruhn (Manor District). If you are a member of House Redoran (but not the Archmaster), Athyn should tell you that all but one council member will support you as Hortator, Bolvyn Venim. If you are the Archmaster, Athyn will make you Hortator immediately. If you're not a member, you'll have to persuade him significantly in order to get him to speak with you. Even then, Athyn will ask you a favor first: to rescue his son Varvur Sarethi from the Venim Manor (first manor on the right in the Manor District). You must be careful when rescuing him not to kill the councilman Bolvyn as the other council members will turn against you. Rescuing Varvur Sarethi[edit] To find Varvur, find the Right Wing of the Venim Manor. In the large room, on a bench, you should find a 'Note to Malsa Ules' and a key. The note says that "a guest" is being held in a hidden room behind the tapestry. You'll find the door and tapestry nearby, and the key on the note opens that door (50 level lock). Remember the nearby guards won't like it if you take the key or note. Once you find Varvur, escort him back to the Sarethi manor and his father. Note that any guards that see him will attack, so planning the fastest route ahead of time might help. You are free to kill the guards, but again be careful not to kill Bolvyn. Once you return Athyn's son, he will give you his vote to be named Redoran Hortator and says that the other council members will concur, except for one. The Other Councilors[edit] From this point, the quest is the same whether you are a House Redoran member or not. Talk to all the councilors in Ald'ruhn in their respective manors: Miner Arobar, Garisa Llethri, Hlaren Ramoran, and Brara Morvayn (see the Red Book of 3E 426, provided by Athyn, for a complete list). Talk to each councilor about the Redoran Hortator and to get their vote. If you are following the Red Book of 3E 426, you will likely visit Morvayn Manor in east Ald'ruhn looking for Remas Morvayn. Unfortunately, he was killed defending the Morvayn Manor from Corprus monsters. His wife Brara Morvayn has taken his seat on the Redoran Council, and you will have to visit her to get the Redoran vote. She can be found in Morvayn Quarters, which can be accessed from the Redoran Council Hall (the door to Morvayn Quarters doesn't appear on the map, since it is directly under the door to Galsa Gindu's House). You will need to duel Bolvyn Venim to the death Bolvyn Venim[edit] The one exception is, of course, Bolvyn Venim, who won't agree with you no matter what. The only option is to have a duel to the death with him to get him out of the way. If you just kill him outright, the other council members will turn against you. Talking with him reveals he wishes to duel you in the Vivec Arena, but he offers a fight only after you have the vote of all the other councilors. If you don't have the votes, his disposition drops by ten points (25 if it was 75+). Take a Guild Guide or Silt Strider over to Vivec, and enter the Arena to find Bolvyn. He is a tough opponent if you attack him in melee as he is heavily armored (ebony) and has a Daedric Dai-katana. He has no ranged weapons or spells however, so feel free to take him out from a distance, but only when standing on the ground floor or within Venim's reach, as spells have been reported to go through his body from the second floor of the Arena. Healing potions and scrolls are helpful of course. Return to Sarethi[edit] Once Bolvyn is out of the way, return to Athyn Sarethi to be named the Redoran Hortator and receive the Ring of the Hortator to identify yourself as such. You also receive a note from the Archcanon saying that should you be named Nerevarine and Hortator of the four tribes and three houses, to present yourself to the Archcanon Saryoni in the High Fane of Vivec. Hold onto this note as you'll need it later.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Aengoth the Jeweler at The Rat In the Pot in Ald'ruhn for a new job. Go to Arobar Manor in the Manor District to steal a Redoran Master Helm. Find the helm in Miner Arobar's bedroom and get it without being detected. Return to Aengoth with the helm to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] Aengoth the Jeweler at The Rat In the Pot in Ald'ruhn will ask you to steal a Redoran Master Helm from Arobar Manor in the Under-Skar Manor District. Stealing the Redoran Master Helm[edit] Arobar Manor is on the right side of the Manor District next to the Redoran Council Hall. The helm is in the Manor Bedrooms, (from the entrance through the Guard Quarters, into the Private Quarters, and onto the Manor Bedrooms, Left Bedroom). The helm is found on top of a closet next to Miner Arobar, so you'll need to sneak in order to get it. If for whatever reason you have trouble stealing the helm because you get caught, it might help if you jump from the bed on top of the closet. This will ensure you are as hidden as possible. To take further advantage of this method, walk near the nearby NPCs and get them to speak to you, then when they're looking at you, move swiftly and position yourself where you would like them to be facing. Note: this only works for a limited time, after which the NPC will change the direction they are looking in. Return to Aengoth with the helm for a reward of 1,000 gold.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Percius Mercius for orders. Travel to Vivec and kill Lorbumol gro-Aglakh. Travel to Balmora and kill Eydis Fire-Eye. Return to Percius to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Orders[edit] After you reach the rank of Guardian, Percius Mercius in the Ald'ruhn Guild of Fighters will ask you to kill Lorbumol gro-Aglakh and Eydis Fire-Eye (unless you previously convinced her to turn against Sjoring Hard-Heart during a Thieves Guild quest), quest givers in the Fighters Guild at Vivec and Balmora respectively. You might have seen this coming if you talked with Percius about some of the seemingly pointless and brutal quests given out by Eydis and Lorbumol. You will not receive a promotion or advancement for this quest and as you'll notice, you are taking an order from Percius who holds the same rank as you (if you ask Percius for advancement, he will in fact refer you to Sjoring). Remove Sjoring's Supporters[edit] Travel to Balmora and head for the Fighters Guild. Eydis Fire-Eye will attack you immediately. Kill her outright. Then travel to Vivec Fighters Guild. Find Lorbumol gro-Aglakh and he will attack you. Kill him. While Sjoring Hard-Heart is obviously your next target, he will not interfere or even notice during dialogue when you talk to him that you've killed his champion, Lorbumol. Return to Percius when you've finished.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Sjoring Hard-Heart for orders. Kill Big Helende in Dirty Muriel's Cornerclub in Sadrith Mora. Kill Sugar-Lips Habasi in the South Wall Cornerclub in Balmora. Kill Aengoth the Jeweler in The Rat in the Pot in Ald'ruhn. Return to Sjoring Hard-Heart to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Orders[edit] Once you reach the rank of Guardian, Sjoring Hard-Heart in the Vivec Guild of Fighters will ask you to kill the three Thieves Guild bosses: Big Helende in Dirty Muriel's Cornerclub in Sadrith Mora, Sugar-Lips Habasi in the South Wall Cornerclub in Balmora and Aengoth the Jeweler in The Rat in the Pot in Ald'ruhn. He even forwards you 5,000 gold to cover any expenses during your murder spree. Remove the Heads of the Thieves Guild[edit] Frenzy Humanoid or Taunt can be used to force a target to strike first, in order to avoid any negative consequences. Command Humanoid or Charm spells can be used to lead a target to an isolated location before attacking. It is also possible to turn into a werewolf (Bloodmoon expansion only), though any witnesses to the transformation will immediately report it to a guard, even if the witness is killed. If the quest is pursued in a straightforward manner by outright attacking a boss, then all of the other thieves in the general vicinity will become hostile. This will incur a large Bounty on your head and the Thieves Guild will very much dislike you. Guards will also accost you on sight. If you wish to join or use the Thieves Guild at some point, this is a bad career move. When all three bosses have been killed, return to Sjoring Hard-Heart to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Odral Helvi to learn your next assignment. Travel to the Ascadian Isles to collect the debt (to complete for Helvi) or Vivec to report this matter (to help Curio). Speak to either the farmers or Crassius Curio/Rovone Arvel Either kill the farmers, take Corky, or get the gold. If you have Corky, sell him to Drulene Falen Return to Odral Helvi.
Detailed Walkthrough: Business[edit] Odral Helvi in the Governor's Hall in Caldera will ask you to collect some rent and taxes from Manat Varnan-Adda and Llovyn Andus, two farmers in the Ascadian Isles. They only owe 50 gold each and Helvi says that you are to kill them if they refuse to pay. Siding with Odral[edit] If you choose to help Odral, or simply don't see a problem with killing people over a 50 gold debt, simply head out to the farms. Neither of the two farmers have the money to pay the rent, but when you speak to Llovyn, you are given the option of taking his Guar, Corky. While this isn't a strictly monetary amount, taking Corky to Drulene Falen's Guar herd at Drulene Falen's Hut allows you to sell him for 200 gold, which covers both farmers' debt. You can also simply kill the farmers. Siding with the farmers[edit] If you feel something is wrong with killing the farmers, speak to either Crassius Curio in Vivec or Rovone Arvel. The former will give you 500 gold to clear up the matter, since he believes Helvi just wants the farmers dead. Rovone Arvel will just give you 100 gold to cover the debt. Of course, if you don't wish to do any of this running around, you can simply pay Helvi 100 gold out of your own pocket. Ending the Quest[edit] Simply return to Helvi with 100 gold from any source. If the farmers are killed, Odral Helvi's disposition with you will increase by 15: if you simply pay the rent, it will drop by 5 points.

Quick Walkthrough: Complete the character creation process by asking Sellus Gravius about your duties. Travel to Balmora by silt strider or on foot. Optional: Go to the South Wall Cornerclub and ask Bacola Closcius for directions to Caius Cosades. Head over to Caius' house. It is in the northeastern section of the town. Deliver the package to the shirtless man, Caius Cosades, inside. Respond "yes" to all of his questions, and he will make you a Novice in the Blades.
Detailed Walkthrough: Seyda Neen[edit] As you awaken, you will find yourself in a boat in Imperial custody. You will be escorted to the Census and Excise Office, and will be released after your character creation is complete. Before you leave, you are given orders to take a Coded Package to Caius Cosades in the town of Balmora, where you will be given further instructions. Sellus Gravius will give you a release fee of 87 gold, the package itself, and more detailed instructions to be used as a reference. He also mentions that someone in the South Wall Cornerclub should know where to locate Cosades. When you are ready to go to Balmora, you can talk to Darvame Hleran, the silt strider operator, and pay her to take you there. Alternatively, Elone in Arrille's Tradehouse can give you directions if you prefer to walk. Balmora[edit] As the instructions mention, head over to the Cornerclub, which is in the southeastern corner of Balmora. After speaking with some of the people there about Cosades, they will refer you to Bacola Closcius, who is upstairs. He will then give you directions on where his house is located, and how to get there. Caius' house is the most northeastern in the town. Alternatively, you can head over to Caius' house directly. There are no repercussions for not speaking to Bacola Closcius. Caius Cosades[edit] Caius will accept the package but tells you very little about its contents or his plans for you. After promising that you will follow his orders, he will name you a Novice of the Blades. If you decline, you can come back at any time. Ask for orders and he will tell you to get some experience under your belt and give you 200 gold if you are level 3 or lower. If you are level 4 or above, he will simply compliment you on your abilities. You do not actually need to gain any experience to proceed at this point, but it is advised as the subsequent quests can be quite challenging for low-level players. Caius suggests you join a guild or a Great House, whose starting quests are easy even for level 1 characters and can help you obtain some gold and better equipment.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak with Radd Hard-Heart in Moonmoth Legion Fort about Orders. Travel to Abernanit. Find Dandsa inside and escort her out. Return to Radd Hard-Heart.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders[edit] After completing the Rescue Jocien Ancois quest, Radd Hard-Heart in the Moonmoth Legion Fort asks you to go to Gnaar Mok to rescue the Imperial citizen Dandsa, who was captured by raiders and is being held in the cavern Abernanit. Finding Abernanit[edit] Once you arrive in Gnaar Mok, head directly east from the boat, across the water. You will find Abernanit in the middle of a small peninsula close by. Rescue Dandsa[edit] Follow the tunnel until you reach a platform with a raider. Go up the ladder and continue in the tunnel. You'll find Dandsa with the lead raider who, like the others, attacks on sight unless your disposition is 90+. Speak with Dandsa and escort her outside the cavern once all the raiders are dealt with. Return to Radd Hard-Heart to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Radd Hard-Heart in Moonmoth Legion Fort about Orders. Travel to the Ashlander Erabenimsun Camp to rescue Jocien Ancois. Head west to the Mabrigash camp and speak with Zennammu. Bring the Ashlander Assaba-Bentus to the Mabrigash camp and free Jocien Ancois. Return to Radd Hard-Heart.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders[edit] Radd Hard-Heart in the Moonmoth Legion Fort asks you to rescue Jocien Ancois, a man attempting to teach Imperial culture to the Ashlanders, who was kidnapped from the Erabenimsun camp by outcast Ashlanders. Travel to the Erabenimsun Camp[edit] Go to the mainland from Tel Fyr and head west-southwest until you find the camp in a small valley. Once you reach the Erabenimsun Camp you will find out that Jocien is being held by a witch-woman, a Mabrigash, called Zennammu found in the Shashurari Camp west of the Erabenimsun Camp. Find The Mabrigash[edit] Head north from the Erabenimsun Camp, then turn west on the next trail.  Start looking for a trail of 18 small pages that fell out of Ancois' book, History of The Empire, near the lava flow found along that trail. Then follow the pages west and then south along the lava flow. Except for a couple of straight runs, each page is visible from the last. The pages will lead you straight to Zennammu's yurt, which is at the foot of the mountains. Zennammu's Request[edit] Zennammu will tell you that she needs another "worthy" man to replace Jocien if you wish to rescue him. She is willing to trade him for the Ashlander hunter Assaba-Bentus. Return to the Erabenimsun Camp and approach Assaba-Bentus, who walks around the outskirts of the camp. To convince him to come with you, accuse him of being afraid to face the witch-woman and he will agree to follow and prove his bravery. Once you and Assaba-Bentus arrive at the yurt, Zennammu will release Jocien. Speak to Jocien and he will thank you, then return to Moonmoth Legion Fort and speak with Radd Hard-Heart to complete the quest. Alternatively, you can kill Zennammu and the other witches, and avoid having to bring Assaba-Bentus. This way you save both men.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Imsin the Dreamer in Buckmoth Legion Fort about Orders. Travel to Ashurnibibi. Make your way through the ruin to find and free Joncis Dalomax. Return to Imsin the Dreamer and report your success.
Detailed Walkthrough: Travel to Ashurnibibi[edit] Imsin the Dreamer in the Buckmoth Legion Fort will ask you to rescue a fellow knight, Joncis Dalomax, who is being held in the Daedric Shrine of Ashurnibibi, found northwest of Hla Oad, on the west coast. The quickest way to get there is to use the Ald'ruhn Guild Guide to travel to Vivec, from there take the boat to Hla Oad and follow the path north until you get to a bridge, after which the shrine should be visible to the west. If you have the Master Index, you can just go to the Dunmer stronghold of Hlormaren and go south until you get to Ashurnibibi. Finding Dalomax[edit] Once you arrive there, enter the ruin. Make your way through to the shrine. There is a small passage that requires you to swim underwater. When arriving at the shrine you will encounter two hostile Orcs. Behind the big statue in the middle of the room there is a locked (45) and trapped door, but one of the Orcs, Durgash gro-Rushub, has an Ancient daedric Key for it. Right behind the door you'll find Dalomax. There is another way to Dalomax that allows you to circumvent the two Orcs. There is a passage behind some rocks to the left of the first pool of water. You must be able to jump high, or use levitation, to get over the rocks. Next follow a long passage underwater until you get to a locked (70) and trapped door. The door can be opened using an Ancient, rusted Daedric Key found in a small stone chest on the landing of the stairs leading to the shrine. After the door it is just a short way to Dalomax. He will not leave with you until his captors are dead though. Once you find Dalomax and his captors are dead, speak to him and he'll thank you and tell you that he can make his way back out. Return to Imsin to receive her congratulations. (You'll get this response from her even if you are not Imperial Legion and happened to liberate Dalomax on your own initiative.)

Quick Walkthrough: Chat with General Darius about Orders and Madura Seran. (Optional) Travel to Ald Velothi to find out more information on the missing pilgrim. Locate Aidanat Camp, south of Ald Velothi, and chat with Abassel Asserbassalit about releasing Madura Seran. Take care of things and secure Madura's release. Escort her back to Ald Velothi. Return to Darius to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: A Kidnapped Pilgrim[edit] General Darius at Madach Tradehouse in Gnisis will ask you to rescue a kidnapped Temple pilgrim named Madura Seran. The Ashlander outcasts are holding her hostage at a camp south of Ald Velothi. Off to Ald Velothi (optional)[edit] Travel to Ald Velothi, which lies north of Gnisis, and ask around about Madura to find out more information on the location of the camp in question. Aidanat Camp, which lies southwest of Ald Velothi, turns out to be the camp in question, and you are instructed that the camp is on the hill, past a lighted tree. Find the Outcast Ashlander Camp[edit] Travel to the camp and you'll encounter two Dark Elves, Kund Assarnibani and Rawia Ashirbibi, staying just outside the only yurt at the camp. They will instruct you to speak to their leader inside. Secure the release of Madura Seran[edit] Enter the yurt of Abassel Asserbassalit, and you will see Abassel and Madura Seran inside. You can persuade Abassel to let Madura go (if his disposition is 60 or above); however, he will demand a fee of 500 gold. You can pay the fee or just kill Abassel and his two lackeys. All three will attack on sight if you try to lead Madura away without paying. Lead Madura back to the safety of Ald Velothi for an increase in reputation, then return to Darius for his congratulations.

Quick Walkthrough: Chat with General Darius to receive new Orders. Travel to the Arvs-Drelen dome. Either speak to Baladas Demnevanni or release Ragash gra-Shuzgub manually. Escort Ragash gra-Shuzgub outside of the tower. Return to Darius to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders[edit] General Darius, at Madach Tradehouse in Gnisis, will ask you to find out what happened to the tax collector, Ragash gra-Shuzgub. She had gone to collect taxes from Baladas Demnevanni and hasn't been seen since. Rescue Ragash[edit] Enter the Arvs-Drelen dome in the northwest area of the town; the entrance is in a hill side. Baladas Demnevanni has locked Ragash gra-Shuzgub in his dungeon. There is a Summoning Room Key, in a bedroom near the dungeon, but it does not open the dungeon's locked (65) and trapped door. The key does opens the locked (50) and trapped door leading to Baladas. Behind this door you'll encounter daeadroth and Shock Centurion, but they don't attack unless provoked. The correct key for dungeon is Arvs-Drelen Cell Key, which Baladas Demnevanni will provide if his disposition is at least 60. It is also possible to lockpick the trapped dungeon cell door, in order to rescue Ragash gra-Shuzgub and escape to town successfully, without speaking to Baladas Demnevanni. Do not let Baladas see Ragash, as he will attack her. Return to Darius[edit] Return to Darius after rescuing Ragash for his congratulations.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak with Athyn Sarethi for duties. Enter Venim Manor in search of Varvur Sarethi, Athyn's son. Go to the Right Wing and search a bench for a note and a key. Look behind the tapestry on the wall and open the hidden door to find Varvur. Talk to Varvur and escort him out of the manor. Return with Varvur to Athyn Sarethi to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Once you've reached the rank of Lawman, Athyn Sarethi in his manor in Ald'ruhn will ask you to rescue his son, Varvur, who has been accused of murder and is being held in Venim Manor. You must be careful when rescuing him not to kill the councilman Bolvyn Venim as the other council members will turn against you (for the Main Quest). Rescuing Varvur[edit] Varvur is in the Right Wing of Venim Manor. In the large room, on a bench, you should find the Note to Malsa Ules and the Venim Manor Key. The note says that the guest is in the room behind the tapestry. You'll find the door and tapestry nearby, and the key on the note opens that door (level 50 lock). Remember, the nearby guards won't like it if you take the key or the note. Once you find Varvur, escort him back to the Sarethi manor and his father. Any guards that see him will attack, so planning the fastest route ahead of time might help. You are free to kill the guards, but again be careful not to kill Bolvyn. The guards are easily distinguished by their Dwemer Armor. There are ten of them to avoid: Private Quarters: Bevadar Bels, Idros Givyn, Nathyne Uvelas, and Nidryne Redas Guard Quarters: Novor Gorvas and Tereri Irethi Right Wing: Malsa Ules and Tidras Deltis Entrance: Velsa Orethi and Vevul Alver Report back to Sarethi with his son to complete the quest. He will reward you with a promotion to the next rank.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Kaye at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart for a new shrine sergeant mission. Travel to Hla Oad to investigate Okur, who claims that she is being visited by the ghost of a murder victim. Talk to Okur to learn that she is being visited by the ghost of Julielle Aumine, who will only be put to rest when the four smugglers who killed her are dead, and when her amulet is returned to her husband. Find the four smugglers, Dudley, Larisus Dergius, Ralos Othrenim, and Thervam Drelas, hiding out in Yasamsi, along the road south of town. Kill the smugglers and return Julielle Aumine's Amulet to Okur. Return to Kaye to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Shrine Sergeant Mission[edit] Kaye at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart will ask you to investigate the Argonian Okur in Hla Oad, who claims that she is being visited by the ghost of a murder victim. The guards can't (or won't) do anything, and you are to see if justice can be served in this case. Restless Spirit[edit] Grab a boat to Hla Oad and find Okur's house in the northeast of town. Okur will tell you that she is being visited by the ghost of a woman, Julielle Aumine, who will only be put to rest when the four smugglers who killed her are dead, and when her amulet is returned to her husband. The four smugglers, Dudley, Larisus Dergius, Ralos Othrenim, and Thervam Drelas, are hiding out in Yasamsi along the road south of town. Ralos Othrenim is the one who has Julielle Aumine's Amulet. They might be a little tougher than the usual cave dweller, so take care. Return the amulet to Okur, who will return it to Julie's husband. Return to Kaye for your reward of a Scroll of Hellfire, a Scroll of Summon Flame Atronach, and a Scroll of The Fifth Barrier. This is the last quest you receive from Kaye.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Aengoth the Jeweler at The Rat In the Pot in Ald'ruhn for a new job. Find four pieces of Scrap Metal at a Dwemer ruin or buy them. Return to Aengoth to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] Aengoth the Jeweler at The Rat In the Pot in Ald'ruhn will ask you to find four pieces of Dwemer Scrap Metal, found in most Dwemer ruins he says. Retrieve the Scrap Metal[edit] Any four will do, so if you happen to have any, just hand those in. If not, the nearest ruin is Bethamez, which contains three pieces. Alternatively, you can simply buy or steal some metal at Cienne Sintieve's alchemist shop in the manor district (lower level on the left). You can also find four pieces at Anis Seloth's shop in Sadrith Mora. Additionally, five units can be found at the Telvanni Monster Lab located in the Telvanni Canalworks in Vivec City, although the area they are in is guarded by several Dwemer constructs. Return to Aengoth for a reward of 1,000 gold. If you go downstairs later, you will find two non-hostile Spider Centurions wandering around.

Quick Walkthrough: Chat with Edwinna Elbert about duties and Chimarvamidium. Take the book back to Sirilonwe in Vivec. Return to Edwinna for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] A chat with Edwinna at the Ald'ruhn Guild of Mages will reveal that Edwinna has completed her study of the book Chimarvamidium, and she now wishes you to return the book to Sirilonwe in Vivec.  She instructs you to return the book to wherever you found it. Return Chimarvamidium[edit] Travel back to the Guild of Mages in Vivec.  You now have two choices:  you can simply waltz into Sirilonwe's quarters and return the book to the chest in her closet, or you can chat with her and give her the book.  If you chat with Sirilonwe, she will express surprise that you have the book and innocently ask you for it.  You'll get a 20 point Disposition bonus with her this way, which you won't get for simply putting it into the chest.  Afterwards, she will feign ignorance if you ask about Chimarvamidium. Return to Ald'ruhn[edit] Return to Edwinna in Ald'ruhn to complete the quest.  In addition to a 10 point increase in Disposition towards you, Edwinna will reward you with an Amulet of Almsivi Intervention and an Amulet of Divine Intervention. At this point, unless you have reached the rank of Conjurer in the Mages Guild, Edwinna will have no more duties for you.  Return to her when you have reached this rank or higher for additional duties.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Lalatia Varian at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart for an Oracle's quest. Talk to a Scout or Savant Dark Elf (the nearest of which is Llaalam Dredil) to learn that the vision refers to the cavern of Nammu. Travel to Nammu and kill Galmis Dren to retrieve the ring. (Optional) Talk to Jon Hawker and give him a Scroll of Divine Intervention for his escape. Return to Lalatia Varian to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Oracle's Quest[edit] Once you reach the rank of Acolyte, Lalatia Varian at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart will ask you to find the legendary Ring of the Wind, which she has seen in a vision. Since this is her first quest she offers, you might need to pledge an oath to serve her first. Rather than offer an exact location, she says that she has "seen the wind upon a dark elf's hand, the fire gleam on the Dwarf's face, and darkness upon the ring of water and heard no name whispered in the mouth of stone". Unfortunately, Varian does not offer to translate this riddle for you, and leaves it up to you. However, she gives you two Scrolls of Divine Intervention, two Scrolls of Vigor, and two Scrolls of Vitality for the quest. Decipher Varian's Vision[edit] To decipher Varian's cryptic message, speak with any Scout or Savant Dark Elf (the closest are Llaalam Dredil, on the second floor of the Grand Council Chambers, and Nalasa Sarothren, in the Hlaalu Canton's plaza inside Elven Nations CornerClub, downstairs, in Vivec). Speaking with any of them you'll quickly find that Varian was probably speaking of the cavern of Nammu, on the mainland coast west of Tel Aruhn (which is the closest fast travel point). Jon Hawker Ring in Darkness[edit] Nammu starts out as a typical, but tough, smugglers cave and the ring can be found on Galmis Dren. You can speak with the other person here, Jon Hawker, to learn that he is/was Dren's prisoner and he will accept a Scroll of Divine Intervention for his escape, leaving you with some powerful magic gloves, Zenithar's Warning and Zenithar's Wiles, and a Reputation point (as it turns out, Jon is a manifestation of the god Zenithar). Return to Lalatia Varian with the ring which you will get to keep. If you mention the story of Hawker you gain an additional point of Reputation.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Edd Theman at the Telvanni Council Chamber in Sadrith Mora for chores. Get the Key to Tel Naga for Eddie to bring you the Ring of Equity. Return to Eddie once he's got the ring to receive it and complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Once you recruit Fast Eddie and he arrives at the Telvanni Council Chamber in Sadrith Mora, you can get him to find the Ring of Equity from its hiding place in Neloth's treasury. All you need to do is bring him the Key to Tel Naga. Ring of Equity[edit] Most of the people in Tel Naga have a copy of the key, such as guards, visitors and Neloth himself. Steal or pickpocket one and return the key to Eddie. You'll receive a journal entry soon afterward when he has the ring. Meet him at the Council Chamber and he'll give it to you.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Eno Hlaalu at the Morag Tong headquarters in the Hidden Area of the Vivec Arena for special duties. Travel to Yasammidan to wrest the Ring of Sanguine Sublime Wisdom from its current owner, Anel Rethelas. Find Anel in the shrine and kill him or rob him. Return to Eno to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Special Duties[edit] Eno Hlaalu at the Morag Tong headquarters in the Hidden Area of the Vivec Arena will send you to the Daedric shrine of Yasammidan, west of Ald Velothi, to wrest the Ring of Sanguine Sublime Wisdom from its current owner, Anel Rethelas. Ring of Sanguine Sublime Wisdom[edit] Yasammidan is on the furthest northwestern coast of Vvardenfell, northwest of Gnisis. Anel can be found inside and you will have to kill him or rob him to retrieve the ring. Return to Eno with the ring to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Aurane Frernis. Travel to Ald Sotha to collect five rare Roland's Tears. Return to Aurane to receive a potion of Luck.
Detailed Walkthrough: Special Flowers for the Lady[edit] Once you've completed the leaflets quest for the alchemist Aurane Frernis, who has a store in the Lower Waistworks level of Vivec's Foreign Quarter, she will ask you to travel to the nearby Daedric shrine of Ald Sotha to collect five rare Roland's Tears. Gold Kanet/Roland's Tear Roland's Tear[edit] The flowers are identical in appearance to the common Gold Kanet, a dark yellow flower with small, rounded petals (so you'll need to activate the plant and hover over or select the contents to determine if it's a normal Gold Kanet plant or a Roland's Tear variety). Collecting the Samples[edit] The shrine is northeast of Vivec and abounds with Gold Kanet, though the Roland's Tears are more difficult to find. In particular, the Tears grow towards the east side of the ruin, though there are several others scattered about as well. Seven flowers are obtainable from a clump growing beneath a tree directly east of the entrance to the shrine—there are four plants, one of which provides three flowers, and one flower lying on the ground between the plants. Return to Frernis with five Roland's Tears to receive a reward of a potion of Luck.

Quick Walkthrough: Find Inwold in Palansour. Give him a Rising Force Potion. Accept your choice of rewards.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Cave of Palansour[edit] This strange quest begins and ends in the smugglers' cave of Palansour, south of Ald Velothi. Once inside, instead of smugglers, you'll find an ogrim, a few scamps and a few dead smugglers. Explore the cave further to find the sorcerer Inwold locked in a cell, along with an explanation. The cell is above the main room with the scamps and the large cauldron. The Sad Sorcerer[edit] Apparently he is to blame for the death of his comrades and wants you to supply him with a rising force potion so that he can escape. In return, he offers to give you the lovely hat and skirt the scamps made him wear. There are a few Levitate potions in the cave itself, so finding one for him shouldn't be too much of a problem. If you refuse to accept both the hat and skirt, you'll receive one point of Reputation.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Frald the White at Hawkmoth Legion Garrison in Ebonheart about Orders. Travel to Arena, Storage area. Rescue Saprius Entius from Ordinators. Escort Entius back to Frald and report your success to receive Helm of Graff the White.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders[edit] Frald the White at Hawkmoth Legion Garrison in Ebonheart tells you that the Imperial Knight Saprius Entius has been accused of murder. Frald doubts that Entius can get a fair trial in Vvardenfell as he believes the Ordinators are too prejudiced. He wants you to help escort Entius to the mainland where he can be tried by an Imperial justice instead. Unfortunately, the knight has gone into hiding and Frald has no idea where except that he is somewhere in Vivec. You cannot have a bounty on your head when you do this quest, so be sure to deal with any legal troubles before you begin. Saprius Entius[edit] Start searching for Entius by asking Vivec's Ordinator guards about him. Eventually, you'll hear that an Imperial Knight has been seen in the Arena Canton. Look in the Arena storage area off the Canalworks level and you should find Entius hiding behind the northwestern door in the main room. Unfortunately, as soon as you find Entius, two Ordinator guards arrive and you'll have to kill them with Entius' help. Once the guards are dead, talk to Entius again and have him follow you (assuming you have an escape route planned) and escort him back to the Hawkmoth Fort. One easy way to avoid more Ordinators is to take the trap door to the Arena Underworks and then exit via the underwater gate in the northwest corner of the underworks. This will put you in the river outside the Arena Canton; it's a short swim to the Vivec dock where you can catch a boat to Ebonheart. Report back to Frald with Entius to finish the quest and receive the Helm of Graff the White as a reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Chat with Edwinna Elbert about duties. Travel to Mzuleft in search of some Dwemer Scarab Plans. Find the plans. Return to Edwinna.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Edwinna Elbert in the Ald'ruhn Guild of Mages asks you to retrieve the Dwemer Scarab Plans at the Dwemer ruin of Mzuleft, southwest of Dagon Fel far to the north. Scarab Plans in Mzuleft[edit] The quickest route is to Guild Guide over to Sadrith Mora and grab a ship up to Dagon Fel. The ruin is just southwest of town and should be marked on your map. There are some tough Orcs guarding the ruins, but the plans are on a shelf (next to the ruin's key) in the room just right of the entrance, there's one Orc, the plans you need, and a key that will open the nearby door. Behind the door and on a table is the book The Egg of Time, which you'll be needing later for the Mystery of the Dwarves. Unfortunately two more Orcs guard it. Back in Ald'ruhn[edit] Upon returning to Edwinna with the report you are rewarded with an increase in Disposition. If you took the Dwemer book as well and mention it to Edwinna, she will tell you to go and talk to Hasphat Antabolis in the bottom of the Guild of Fighters in Balmora. There, he will tell you that you "might want to take it to one of the older Telvanni".

Quick Walkthrough: Meet either Thoronor or Edras Oril on the road north of Lake Amaya, just northeast of Alof's Farmhouse. Deal with the love-maddened Kagouti. Reunite the two Scholars.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Scholars and the Mating Kagouti[edit] West from Suran, on the road north of Lake Amaya, you will find Thoronor who will tell you that he has lost a friend, Edras Oril, who wandered off to check on some strange sounds. Close by you should be able to easily find the source of the sounds, two mating kagouti. Edras should be trapped nearby, east from Thoronor. Dispose of the Threat[edit] You can either kill the kagouti and escort Edras back to his friend, or cast a chameleon or invisibility spell on Edras to avoid detection from the animals. Reunite the two Scholars[edit] Either way, once you return to Thoronor you will receive an Amulet of Slowfalling (it doesn't actually matter who you find first. Finding Edras first will also lead to Thoronor's reward). If Edras is killed, you'll receive a copy of 2920, Second Seed, a Speechcraft skill book, instead.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak with Radd Hard-Heart in Moonmoth Legion Fort about Orders. Obtain one piece of Dwemer Scrap Metal. Return to Radd Hard-Heart with the scrap metal.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders[edit] This quest is offered by Radd Hard-Heart in Moonmoth Legion Fort. The Buoyant Armigers have challenged the Imperial Legion to a hunt. They claim they will bring the skin of a corprus beast, and to best them, Radd wants you to bring the Scrap Metal from a Dwemer Centurion. Obtaining Scrap Metal[edit] Although the Dwemer Ruins of Arkngthand are nearby, any piece of scrap metal will do. Just before you reach the ruins, you have a bridge where you will be attacked by the battlemage Snowy Granius. Once he is dead you can find some scrap metal in a crate. Otherwise you can go halfway up a nearby hill and enter Arkngthand. Scrap Metal can be found throughout the ruin, but beware of the bandits. You can also steal one from the Mages Guild in Balmora, or you can buy scrap metal from certain merchants (such as Nalcarya of White Haven in Balmora). Return to Radd Hard-Heart with your scrap metal to complete the quest. In addition to 500 drakes, you receive five points of Legion faction reputation, and Hard-Heart's disposition towards you increases by ten points.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Lalatia Varian at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart for an Oracle's quest. Travel to Ashalmimilkala to recover the Scroll of Fiercely Roasting, last carried by Urjorad. Kill Carecalmo and his bodyguard, Meryaran. Find the body of Urjorad, and the scroll, by levitating up to a ledge within the ruins. Return to Lalatia to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Oracle's Quest[edit] Lalatia Varian at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart will ask you to recover a powerful artifact, the Scroll of Fiercely Roasting. The scroll was last carried by the healer Urjorad, who went to the Daedric shrine of Ashalmimilkala to avenge his master's death. Lalatia will also ask you to complete the quest that took Urjorad's life if you want: slay Carecalmo, the shrine's ancient High Elf priest, and his powerful bodyguard Meryaran. The Scroll of Fiercely Roasting[edit] Ashalmimilkala is on an island on the west coast, northwest of Hla Oad and west of Balmora.  If you come south from Gnaar Mok along the island chain, you will come to Addadshashanammu first; Ashalmimilkala is farther south. Once inside the shrine, you will have to deal with a daedra and Meryaran.  Past them is a room with a statue of Mehrunes Dagon.  If you want to get the scroll without facing Carecalmo, exit through the tunnel to the right.  This will take you to a pool with a couple of slaughterfish.  From here, you can levitate/jump to another opening leading to Urjorad and the scroll.  If you want to face Carecalmo, you can drop down to the water below or go back the way you came and enter his chamber through the other exit from the room with the statue. Return to Lalatia Varian with the scroll for an increase in Disposition and Reputation. If you killed Carecalmo and Meryaran as well, you'll receive the magical Gauntlets of Glory and be able to keep the scroll.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Odral Helvi to learn your next assignment. Travel to Vivec to deliver the orders. Give the orders to: Tenisi Lladri (to help Odral). Baren Alen, Rovone Arvel, or Crassius Curio (to help the House). Return to Odral Helvi.
Detailed Walkthrough: Business[edit] Odral Helvi in the Governor's Hall in Caldera will ask you to deliver an order to the Treasury Assistant Clerk, Tenisi Lladri in the Hlaalu Vaults in Vivec. He also says "do NOT deliver them to the head of treasury, Baren Alen". It sounds a little like the suspicious activity Crassius Curio warned you about. There are two ways to deal with this: do what Odral asks, or report this suspicious activity. Siding with Odral[edit] Simply take the orders to their intended destination, which is simple enough. Just head to Vivec and the House Hlaalu Canton. The treasury is in the waistworks, and the Treasury Assistant Clerk can be found within. Tenisi will readily accept the orders and give you 100 gold and a +10 disposition increase once the delivery has been completed. Report the Activity[edit] Besides Tenisi, three people will accept the orders: Baren Alen, Rovone Arvel, and Crassius Curio. All three will give you a reward of 500 gold and a personal disposition increase; +10 for Baren, +15 for Crassius and +20 for Rovone. If you give the orders to Baren or Rovone, however, Odral Helvi finds out about it and is furious as a result, costing you a -30 disposition penalty with him. Crassius manages to hide everything from him, though, giving you the normal +15 disposition increase.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Satyana in the Arenim Ancestral Tomb. Defeat a skeleton. Give her Augustus' Amulet or keep it.
Detailed Walkthrough: Search for Her Father's Amulet[edit] This quest actually starts and ends in the Arenim Ancestral Tomb, along the coast east and slightly south of the Erabenimsun Camp. Once you enter the tomb, you'll encounter the woman Satyana. Apparently the tomb is her family's, and she asks you for help finding her father's amulet. Find the Amulet[edit] Accept and she will follow you around the tomb, aiding you in combat. The door to the final room of the tomb is locked; the key can be found in the room on the far side of the tomb from it, laying near the hand of a skeletal corpse along with a low-level helmet and spear. Within the locked room you'll find Augustus' Amulet (and the Sword of Agustas  [sic]) on a skeleton. If you refuse to help her, Satyana will become very upset and attack you. If you collect the amulet before talking to Satyana, she will speak to you automatically upon your return. Deal with the Impostor, One Way or Another[edit] At this point, Satyana will demand the amulet. If you refuse, she will admit that she is not of any relation to the deceased but that she "must have that amulet" and will attack you. If you give her the amulet she will continue to follow you around the tomb, helping you kill and loot; if you change your mind and decide you do want the amulet after all, you can kill her and take it from her corpse, but make sure to do so before you leave the tomb, since once you come back, she will be gone.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Sirilonwe about her need to get someone killed. Travel to the Ald'ruhn's Ald-Skar Inn. Kill Shashev. Return to Sirilonwe with Shashev's key.
Detailed Walkthrough: Mage Business[edit] Speak with Sirilonwe at the Mages Guild in Vivec, Foreign Quarter Plaza, and mention someone killed. Shashev's Key[edit] Sirilonwe will ask you to kill her rival Shashev in Ald'ruhn's Ald-Skar Inn and bring back his key. Kill Shashev and take anything you like from his corpse, including the key and his enchanted ring. To avoid a murder bounty, simply talk to him; like most Dunmer, he will immediately attack due to your vampirism. Return to Sirilonwe with Shashev's key to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Archcanon Tholer Saryoni at the High Fane in the Vivec, Temple Canton for your duties. Travel to Ald Daedroth to visit the Statue of Sheogorath as part of the Pilgrimages of the Four Corners. Find the statue in the Inner Shrine and activate it to receive the poem Four Corners of the House of Troubles and the Blessings of the Fourth Corner.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Archcanon Tholer Saryoni in his quarters in the Crosier of the High Fane in the Vivec, Temple Canton tells you that the Fourth Corner of the House of Troubles is Sheogorath. His shrine is in Ald Daedroth, on the large island east of Dagon Fel. Beware that this shrine requires the magical gauntlet Gambolpuddy in order for you to activate it, which is somewhere in the shrine. Sheogorath of the House of Troubles[edit] You might have already visited Ald Daedroth if you have gone far enough on the Main Quest. It is a large shrine that is currently under siege by Ordinators. The glove can be difficult to find as it is hidden under the pillow of a bedroll (check the uppermost room in the Antechamber area). You can also find out the glove's location by chatting with Ra'Gruzgob, the Orc who says he is a Khajiit. Once you have the glove, find and activate the Statue of Sheogorath in the Inner Shrine to complete the Pilgrimages and receive the Blessings of the Fourth Corner   - Fortify Intelligence 1-25 pts for 24 mins on Touch, Fortify Luck 1-25 pts for 24 mins on Touch, Fortify Personality 1-25 pts for 24 mins on Touch, Fortify Willpower 1-25 pts for 240 mins on Touch, Drain Intelligence 1-25 pts for 24 mins on Touch, Drain Luck 1-25 pts for 24 mins on Touch, Drain Personality 1-25 pts for 24 mins on Touch, Drain Willpower 1-25 pts for 24 mins on Touch. The shrine requires you to "donate" Gambolpuddy so the glove is removed from your inventory and disappears for good. Return to Saryoni in Vivec to receive his acknowledgment of the Pilgrimages and, hopefully, a promotion.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to the statue of Sheogorath at the shrine of Ihinipalit in the St. Delyn Canton. Travel to the far end of the Sheogorad Region and speak to Big Head to receive the Fork of Horripilation. Kill a Giant Bull Netch with the Fork of Horripilation. Return to the shrine to receive your reward of the Spear of Bitter Mercy.
Detailed Walkthrough: Sheogorath's Request[edit] Sheogorath's shrine is easier than most to find, being in the Ihinipalit shrine in the Underworks of Vivec's St. Delyn Canton. You may need to take care of the current occupants to ensure that you have the privacy you need. Activate the shrine to speak to Sheogorath who wants you to recover the Fork of Horripilation from a mad hermit near Ald Redaynia, on the long island north of the main land, and use it to kill a Giant Bull Netch that lives on the island that is directly east of Big Head's Shack, where Nelas Ancestral Tomb is. Getting the Fork[edit] The hermit, Big Head, is found in his shack, which is on the island Northeast of Ald Redaynia. Though the hermit is indeed mad, he is not dangerous, (and his head is no larger than any other Argonian's) and you can ask him about the Fork and he'll let you take it. He doesn't say where it is, but you can find it on the table looking like a large barbecue fork. Killing the Netch[edit] Now, off to kill this giant netch (which is also no larger than any other netch) with a large fork... and you wonder why they call Sheogorath the mad one? The trick is that Sheogorath just said you had to kill the netch with it, so just use whatever weapon to beat the netch down and use the Fork to finish it off (much easier in the latest patch that shows the creature's health). An even easier way to do this is to kill the bull netch and then switch to the fork as the death animation plays and before your journal updates.  You can also cast a spell that does damage over time, and draw the fork as it dies. Once you kill the netch, return to the shrine. You'll receive your reward, the Spear of Bitter Mercy.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Odral Helvi to learn your next assignment. Travel to Ald'ruhn to deliver the ebony (to complete for Helvi) or Vivec to report the smuggling (to help Curio). If you traveled to Ald'ruhn: Give the ebony to Drinar Varyon. Return to Odral Helvi. If you went to Vivec. Speak to Crassius Curio. Go to Buckmoth Legion Fort and give the ebony to Segunivus Mantedius. Return to Curio.
Detailed Walkthrough: Business[edit] Odral Helvi in the Governor's Hall in Caldera will ask you to take five pieces of raw ebony to Drinar Varyon in Ald'ruhn. Helping Odral[edit] If you don't already know him, Drinar Varyon is a smuggler and smuggling raw ebony is illegal. If you choose this route, travel to Ald'ruhn and find Varyon in his house to deliver the ebony for 500 gold. Afterwards, return to Helvi to finish this final quest with him. Catching Odral[edit] If you don't wish to become part of an illegal ebony ring, take a side trip to see Crassius Curio, who will tell you to take the ebony to Segunivus Mantedius at Buckmoth Legion Fort instead. To convict Odral and his fence, you have to convince Segunivus first. If you lie and say you are a licensed trader then he will tell you to go about your business. If you say Odral Helvi made you deliver it and then lie about who you are delivering to, he will not believe you. If you tell the truth and hand over the ebony, both Varyon and Helvi will be taken care of. Return to Curio who will give you two enchanted rings, a Dire Shardbolt Ring and an Eye-Maze Ring, for doing the right thing.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Edryno Arethi for business. Travel to the Prelude Shipwreck to recover a Daedric Wakizashi. Find the wakizashi in a locked chest. Return to Edryno Arethi.
Detailed Walkthrough: Business[edit] Edryno Arethi  in her house on the Hlaalu Waistworks in Vivec will ask you to recover a Daedric Wakizashi from the sunken Prelude Shipwreck, east of Bal Fell. Finding the Blade[edit] The wreck is on the third island due east of Bal Fell. The blade can be found on its lower level in a locked chest. Don't forget to check the rest of the wreck for loot, which you can keep. Return to Vivec[edit] Return to Arethi in Vivec with the blade to complete the quest and receive 500 gold.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Iulus Truptor at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart for a new almoner mission. Travel to Vivec's Foreign Quarter, Balmora, Caldera, or Pelagiad to find a red shirt and black vest for the upcoming Harvest's End festival. Persuade Falanaamo in Caldera to donate a shirt and vest. Return to Iulus to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Almoner Mission[edit] Iulus Truptor at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart will ask you to find a red shirt and black vest for the upcoming Harvest's End festival. The shirt and vest together are what is called a common shirt, and the color combination has special significance for the winter season. Given that this is a Western garment, Iulus will suggest that you look for it in Vivec's Foreign Quarter, Balmora, Caldera, or Pelagiad. Shirt and Vest for Harvest's End[edit] If you pay attention, you may notice that Frik in the chapel wears a shirt similar to the one described by Iulus. If you ask him about it, he will tell you that he bought it in Caldera, but he does not remember the name of the owner. Asking the clothiers in any of the other towns will get no results, as they do not have any. However, they will point you toward Falanaamo in Caldera, although Agrippina in Vivec will warn you that he is not a generous man. You can either buy it from Falanaamo or persuade him to donate it if his disposition is high enough (80 or higher). If you manage to persuade him, he will give you an additional common shirt and a pair of tailored trousers as well. Return to Iulus with the shirt to receive a copy of A Dance in Fire, Chapter 7, a Mercantile skill book, as a reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Meet Rasha on the road to Caldera. Deliver the shirts to Bivale Teneran in Ald'ruhn.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Shirt Off His Back[edit] West from Ald'ruhn, along the westernmost of the two roads heading south to Caldera, you'll come across the Argonian, Rasha, who wants you to deliver five Exquisite Shirts to Bivale Teneran in the Ald'ruhn Manor District. He asks you to swear on Zenithar that you will make the delivery. While this oath may not seem important, you will not be able to conduct business in Ald'ruhn until you make the delivery. Deliver the Shirts[edit] Give the shirts to Teneran and receive an enchanted Belt of Iron Will, which has a Fortify Willpower enchantment on it, as your reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Master Aryon in the Upper Tower in Tel Vos for chores. Travel to Shishi to rescue Faves Andas from a Redoran attack. Kill all the Redoran forces, including their leader Brerama Selas. Talk to Faves for his gratitude. Return to Aryon to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: A Breton Skull Chores[edit] Councilor Aryon in the Upper Tower of Tel Vos will ask you to rescue Faves Andas, who is under attack from a Redoran force. Redoran Invasion[edit] Faves is found in the Telvanni base of Shishi, northwest of Maar Gan. Upon entry to the base, be sure to kill the Redoran force at the entrance. At first glance, Faves is nowhere to be found. A careful search, however, reveals him in a secret room accessed by touching the Breton skull on the table on the upper floor. Talk with Faves who will ask you to kill the Redoran leader, Brerama Selas, if you haven't already done so. You'll receive the Alteration book, The Lunar Lorkhan, and the Destruction skill book, A Hypothetical Treachery. Return to Aryon to complete the quest and receive a Silver Staff of War as a reward, unless Faves is dead, in which case you will receive only the Telvanni reputation boost.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Theldyn Virith for duties. Travel to Shishi to check on some soldiers. Speak with Brerama Selas to obtain a report on the situation. Talk to Temis Romavel about some remaining Telvanni. Find and kill Faves Andas. Return to Theldyn Virith.
Detailed Walkthrough: A Breton Skull Duties[edit] Theldyn Virith in the outpost at Ald Velothi will ask you to go and check on some soldiers he sent to reclaim Shishi, a Velothi tower where the Telvanni have set up a base. Traveling[edit] Shishi is northwest of Maar Gan, across the mountains. The quickest way is to use either Divine or Almsivi Intervention to Gnisis and take a silt strider to Maar Gan. Alternatively, you can travel to Khuul and take the silt strider from there. Either way, from Maar Gan, follow Foyada Bani-Dad to the northwest until you see the entrance. Shishi[edit] Once you're in Shishi, talk with Brerama Selas in the outpost, and he'll give you the report. At this point, you can either return to Virith with the report, or stay and help root out the last of the Telvanni. Turning back will net +5 disposition and faction reputation, while helping out will give +15 disposition and +10 faction reputation. If you speak to Temis Romavel, you'll learn that they haven't killed all the Telvanni, as they keep hearing sounds from below. However, they cannot find a way down. Near Temis, there is a Breton skull on a table, which uncovers a trapdoor on the level below. Use it to go downstairs, then kill Faves Andas, the Telvanni wizard, inside. Report to Theldyn back in Ald Velothi to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Endryn Llethan at the High Fane in the Vivec, Temple Canton for your duties. Travel to Ald Sotha to retrieve the Shoes of St. Rilms. Find the shoes in a locked chest under the statue in the Inner Shrine. Return to Endryn to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Once you achieve the rank of Curate, Endryn Llethan at the High Fane in Vivec, Temple Canton, asks you to retrieve a precious artifact of the Tribunal Temple, the Shoes of St. Rilms. Apparently, a priest had a dream about the shoes and saw them in the depths of Ald Sotha, a Daedric Shrine northeast of Vivec. The shoes were in a chest behind a statue of Mehrunes Dagon. Llethan warns you that it may be difficult but provides several good potions to help, notably a potion of heroism. Ald Sotha[edit] The shrine is to the northeast of the Vivec Telvanni canton, and can be entered through an entrance along the water. The shrine has three areas with a good number of tough opponents. Most can be encountered one at a time if you are careful, or not at all if you would prefer the stealth method. The shoes are in a locked (50) chest under the statue in the well-guarded Inner Shrine (the mage here has the key if you need it, as well as several Sanguine items). Return to Endryn and give back the shoes.

Quick Walkthrough: (Optional) Hear rumors about a Skooma Eater gone missing. Kill the Corprus Stalker in The Underworks. Return Danar's Ring to Moroni Uvelas.
Detailed Walkthrough: Moroni is devastated... The Skooma Eater[edit] The quest starts at the Brewers and Fishmongers Hall in the St. Olms Canton of Vivec. Talk to the ladies inside and ask for local rumors to hear that one of the ladies' husband has gone missing. Ask Moroni Uvelas, also found in the hall, and you'll find out he's a skooma addict who used to loiter in the Underworks. The Flesh Eater[edit] Go to the Underworks and in one of the connecting tunnels you'll see (or be attacked by) a Corprus Stalker. There is no way to rid him of the disease, so kill him and loot the corpse to find her husband's ring. Take the ring back to Moroni Uvelas to complete the quest and receive three potions of cure common disease.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak with Athyn Sarethi for duties. Travel to Shurinbaal to deal with some smugglers. Kill Daroder Helni and Enjine. Return to Athyn Sarethi.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Athyn Sarethi in his manor in Ald'ruhn will ask you to take care of some smugglers in the cave of Shurinbaal by killing their leaders. Getting to Shurinbaal[edit] The cave is just southwest of Gnaar Mok on the coast. Getting there directly from Ald'ruhn is an impossibility, since no Silt Strider exists in Gnaar Mok, but fast travel can still be done relatively easy if you take a Silt Strider to Khuul, and then charter a boat to Gnaar Mok. From there, just head southwest into the swamp to find Shurinbaal. Dealing with the Smugglers[edit] Once you find the cave, you must kill the two leaders, Daroder Helni and Enjine, but feel free to kill anyone else you find there. Report back to Sarethi in Ald'ruhn once the two smugglers are dead to complete the quest.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Garisa Llethri in his manor in Ald'ruhn for duties. Either organize a slave revolt: Talk to people around Caldera to learn that if Dahleena were freed, the slaves might revolt. Find a slave key in the guard tower and free Dahleena. Or kill the mine operators: Kill Odral Helvi and Stlennius Vibato. Return to Llethri to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Once you complete the Evidence of Corruption quest for him, Garisa Llethri in his manor in Ald'ruhn will ask you to go and shut down the Caldera Mine for him. Disrupting the Mine[edit] Talk to people around Caldera to learn that if Dahleena were freed (or killed), the slaves might revolt, causing the mine to close. Choose either method and report back to Llethri to complete the quest. He will reward you with a pair of ebony boots and a reputation point. An alternative way of closing the mine is to kill the mine operators Odral Helvi and Stlennius Vibato. If you take this route, Llethri tells you that you have caused "political problems" and you will receive only 10 Disposition with him and you will receive neither the ebony boots nor the reputation point.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Lorbumol gro-Aglakh at the Guild of Fighters in Vivec for your orders. Travel to Ald'ruhn to silence Tongue-Toad in The Rat In the Pot. Either kill him, or let him go and report that he fled. Return to Lorbumol to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders[edit] Lorbumol gro-Aglakh in the Vivec Guild of Fighters asks you to silence the Argonian Tongue-Toad in The Rat In the Pot in Ald'ruhn for 500 septims. Silence Tongue-Toad[edit] When you approach Tongue-Toad and talk to him, he seems surprised that anyone would want him dead. He also suggests that you let him go and report that he fled. The only other option is to kill him. Return to Lorbumol for your 500 gold reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Endryn Llethan at the High Fane in the Vivec, Temple Canton for your duties. Take a vow of silence and travel to the Sanctus Shrine to perform a silent pilgrimage. Activate the shrine to complete the pilgrimage and lift the vow of silence. Return to Endryn to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Endryn Llethan at the High Fane in the Vivec, Temple Canton asks you prove your wisdom and patience by performing the pilgrimage to the Sanctus Shrine, west of Dagon Fel. First, you must take a vow of silence and promise not to talk to anyone before you reach the shrine. This means no dialogue with anyone, including bartering, travelling, etc... (though you can deal with the guards if you are charged with a crime); you must make the long trip under your own power. The shrine is on an island west of Dagon Fel and he'll mark it on your map. Silent Pilgrimage[edit] There is no easy way to travel to the shrine since you cannot speak with anyone, ruling out any form of fast travel. However, you have several options available to you: Use Mark and Recall - Delay the pilgrimage, travel to the shrine and use Mark. Return to Llethan to accept the pilgrimage and use Recall. Use Divine and Almsivi Intervention effects to make the journey a little shorter (see Notes). Donate a Rising Force Potion (any quality, just not a self-made potion) at the Shrine to Stop the Moon outside the High Fane.  This will provide you with a day's worth of Levitation, more than enough to make a bee-line straight for the shrine. You can fly high enough that even the Cliff Racers won't bother you. Use the Propylon Chambers, provided you have found enough indices to make the cycle around the strongholds. Note that if you have completed the quest from the Master Index plugin, this technique will only get you as far as Caldera. At that point, you must talk to Folms Mirel to go anywhere else, breaking the vow of silence. Use the Scrolls of Icarian Flight—if you have them—and you could Jump there. The shrine is outside at the top of the island marked on your map. Activate it to complete the pilgrimage and lift the vow of silence. Return to Endryn for your reward of four books: Silence, The Four Suitors of Benitah, 36 Lessons of Vivec, Sermon 9 and Sermon 27, which increase your skill in Illusion, Restoration, Blunt Weapon, and Speechcraft, respectively. If you broke the vow of silence by talking with someone but still visited the shrine, you will still receive credit for completing the pilgrimage, but will not receive the books or reputation reward, and Endryn Llethan's disposition will decrease by 5.

Quick Walkthrough: Find Beluelle's Silver bowl in Ulummusa. Travel to Piernette's Farmhouse. Return the bowl to Piernette Beluelle.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Silver Bowl[edit] This is one of the rare quests that doesn't begin with a person, but with an item. In the smugglers' cave of Ulummusa northwest of Pelagiad, you may come across an ordinary silver bowl named Beluelle's Silver bowl. If you've already found it, you may have suspected it was involved in a quest of some sort, and hopefully have it safely stashed away somewhere. If not, the bowl can be found on top of the chest at the end of the cave. Once you take the bowl, you should receive a journal entry about the bowl's inscription. Although the inscription mentions the East Empire Company, nobody there will give you any information about the bowl or Armond Beluelle. Detective Work[edit] Ask around Pelagiad about the bowl to learn that there is a Piernette Beluelle on a farm to the east. You will be directed to the healer at Fort Pelagiad, Ygfa, for further directions. Return the Bowl to Piernette[edit] The farm is east of Pelagiad, north of Vivec, and southwest of Suran. The bridge leading to the farmhouse which Ygfa mentions in her directions is just north of the silt strider platform at Vivec. Speak with Piernette to learn that the bowl was her husband's and was stolen. Return the bowl to her without asking for any reward to receive a 1-point Mercantile boost. If you acted honorably and returned the bowl, you can talk to people about the bowl in Pelagiad to receive a boost in disposition. Ygfa will also allow you to join the Imperial Cult for free. If you refuse to hand over the bowl, Ygfa's disposition will drop 20 points, and a further 20 if you talk to her again. Other Pelagiad residents' dispositions will drop by ten.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Kaye at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart for a new shrine sergeant mission. Travel to Mount Kand to recover a Silver Staff of Shaming, which vanished several years ago along with its owner, acolyte Linus Iulus. Find the corpse of Iulus, along with the staff, just west of the Cavern at the top of Mount Kand. Return to Kaye to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Shrine Sergeant Mission[edit] Kaye at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart will ask you to try and recover a Silver Staff of Shaming, which vanished several years ago along with its owner, acolyte Linus Iulus. The Oracle apparently had a dream in which she saw the staff lying in a land of burning rock in the shadow of the Mountain of Fear, otherwise known as Mount Kand, north of Molag Mar. You are to find the staff and Linus's gear if you can. Kaye will give you a Detect Enchantment Ring to help you find the staff and 100 gold for expenses. The Silver Staff of Shaming[edit] This quest is misleading because the actual location of the staff is the exact opposite of the vision given by the oracle. Your discussions and journal will indicate that you should search in the rising and setting shadows of Mount Kand (i.e., below the peak. Except not really since the only commonality found among the rising and setting shadows of the mountain that would be on opposite ends depending on the orientation of the sun would be the peak itself.)  However, Iulus' corpse and the staff are actually found at the peak, west of the Cavern, behind some rocks. The easiest way to find the corpse is to stand in front of the door to the cavern, cast levitate and look straight up. Fly over the top of the pillar and look down. The corpse should be clearly visible on the little plateau below you. Return to Kaye with the staff to receive a Restoration Shirt. If you also return Linus Iulus' Stendarran Belt and Maran Amulet, you can keep the staff as a reward (note that you'll eventually be given your own belt and amulet, so their loss is only temporary).

Quick Walkthrough: Receive orders from Caius in Balmora to wipe out a Sixth House base in Gnaar Mok. Visit Raesa Pullia in Buckmoth Legion Fort to receive a report of the scouting party. Travel to Gnaar Mok and talk to the locals to find the location of the Sixth House base. Enter the Ilunibi caverns and fight your way to the shrine. Fight and slay Dagoth Gares. Return to Caius.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders from Caius[edit] After your meeting with  Nibani Maesa, return to Caius for your next assignment. He will warn you that the next assignment is very tough and advises you to make sure you're ready for it. Apparently, a Legion patrol stumbled across a Sixth House base near Gnaar Mok. Your orders are to find the base and kill the priest Dagoth Gares. Since Caius doesn't know the exact location of the base, you are to report to Raesa Pullia in Buckmoth Legion Fort. Report from Raesa[edit] Buckmoth Legion Fort is just south of Ald'ruhn and due north of Caldera. The quickest way to get there is to take a Silt Strider or Guild Guide to Ald'ruhn and then cast Divine Intervention or hike south to the fort. Raesa is just inside the main fort interior entrance. She gives you the report on the Sixth House base they discovered. Apparently, out of the original scouting party, only one person returned. He died shortly thereafter from the dreaded Corprus disease, but first mentioned a cavern on the coast named Ilunibi. Though Raesa is not familiar with it, she suggests asking the locals in Gnaar Mok about it. If you haven't been to Gnaar Mok yet, it's on the west coast of the island, southwest of Ald'ruhn. Raesa gives you directions to walk there, but the fastest method is to take the Ald'ruhn Silt Strider to Khuul, then take the local boat to Gnaar Mok. Rumors in Gnaar Mok[edit] Once you get to Gnaar Mok, talk to just about anyone to find out information on the Ilunibi cavern (you will need to raise their disposition to 50 or higher to get the information). You find out that the caverns are located on the north end of the island, on Khartag Point. You should have Khartag Point marked on your map when you ask about it, just a little northwest of the village. You should find the caverns named as Ilunibi, Carcass of the Saint. Ilunibi Caverns[edit] Just inside the entrance to Ilunibi you'll find a very nice little waterfall. It gets much worse just farther in, however.  Most of the monsters are random, but depend on your level: lower-level characters are most likely to encounter Skeletons, Ash Slaves, Ash Zombies and Scamps, higher-level characters more likely to have a chance of seeing Bonewalkers, Ash Ghouls, Ascended Sleepers, Atronachs and Golden Saints.  There's also a fair number of Dreamers around. Once you get into the final section of the caverns, Soul's Rattle, you should encounter Dagoth Gares, a unique Ash Ghoul.  He will initiate conversation with you and you should try and get as much information as you can before you exit: he can tell you some pretty interesting things about the history of Nerevar and Dagoth Ur, at least as seen from Dagoth's insane corrupted perspective. Once you exit the conversation he will immediately attack you. Gares is tough, casts spells, and hits pretty hard, but doesn't take too many big hits before he goes down. When he dies, however, he curses you with Corprus disease. After killing Gares, don't forget to loot the bell chamber nearby as it has some excellent loot (including the Fists of Randagulf). At this point in the Main Quest you'll start seeing several barely dressed Dark Elves standing still on the roads. They call themselves Dreamers and are people who have fallen under the influence of Dagoth Ur's growing powers.  They're the same Dreamers that you may have already been seeing in other Sixth House caves and they will attack on sight. Return to Caius[edit] Once you've finished in the caverns, head back to Caius in Balmora (walk to Caldera, east of Gnaar Mok, and use a Guild Guide, or walk a little farther to Balmora southeast of Gnaar Mok - or simply cast Almsivi Intervention from the cave.)  Upon your return, you will be promoted to Traveller. Caius is concerned that you have corprus, but has been gathering some information of his own and has found someone who is doing research into Corprus Disease with a view to finding a cure: the Telvanni wizard, Divayth Fyr. He suggests you visit Fyr on the grounds that if he can't help you, nobody else can.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Lalatia Varian at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart for an Oracle's quest. Talk to a Scout and a Savant Dark Elf to decipher Varian's vision. Travel to Omaren Ancestral Tomb to recover the Skull Crusher. Enter the Forgotten Vaults of Anudnabia and find the warhammer in a chest suspended over a forge. Return to Lalatia to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Skull Crusher Oracle's Quest[edit] Lalatia Varian at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart will ask you to recover the powerful warhammer named Skull Crusher, which was stolen way back in the First Era. Varian will relate to you another strange vision which might reveal the location of the item. She saw a Daedric ruin with a forge of molten stone, sealed by fallen rocks, though the forge can still be accessed through the Halls of the Dead. Varian suggests that you talk to a Dark Elf Scout to find out the meaning of her vision. Varian's Vision[edit] Find any Dark Elf scout, such as Nalasa Sarothren at the Elven Nations Cornerclub in Vivec's Hlaalu Canton. If you you ask about "sealed Daedric ruin", Nalasa will suggest that you try the ruins of Anudnabia (east of Sadrith Mora). You can also talk to any Dark Elf Savant, such as Llaalam Dredil at the Grand Council Chambers, who will equate the Halls of the Dead with any Dunmer ancestral tomb. Putting the two together yields that you are looking for an ancestral tomb near to Anudnabia. Skull Crusher[edit] The nearest tomb to Anudnabia (which you cannot actually enter) is actually visible (barely) from the shrine: the Omaren Ancestral Tomb (should be on one of the most eastern islands east of Sadrith Mora). From within the tomb, you can access the shrine and reach the Forgotten Vaults of Anudnabia. Jump onto the anvil to reach the Skull Crusher, which is in a chest suspended over the forge. Return to Lalatia Varian with the warhammer, which you will get to keep.  In addition, if your Blunt Weapon skill is less than 40, you'll receive the magical ring Foe-Grinder. If it is greater than 40 you will receive the less powerful Foe-Quern. This is the last quest you'll receive from Varian.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Felisa Ulessen in the Telvanni Council House in Sadrith Mora for chores. Travel to Abebaal Egg Mine to end a slave revolt. Either kill the slaves' leader, the Argonian Eleedal-Lei, Or find the slave key and free him. Return to Felisa to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Felisa Ulessen in the Telvanni Council House in Sadrith Mora will ask you to stop the rebellion of slaves in the Abebaal Egg Mine, northwest of Tel Branora. Stop the Slave Rebellion[edit] Once inside the mine, the rebellious slaves will direct you towards their leader, the Argonian Eleedal-Lei. You can talk to him about the rebellion, in which case he will explain that Therana keeps demanding more and more eggs despite the fact that the mine is empty. He is also shocked by the fact that she just uses them to decorate her tower, rather than eating them. Regardless of whether you hear him out or not, you have only two options. You can kill Eleedal-Lei, in which case you will have to fight your way through the rest of the slaves in order to leave the mine. Alternatively, you can find his slave key and free him. There are three copies of the key, each in a different location: one is held by Therana. Another is on the main level of Tel Branora's Lower Tower, on a table next to a bowl with three Small Kwama Eggs. The third is in a container within the mine, near the Kwama Queen. If you choose to free him, he tells you he will free the rest of the slaves and organize their escape to Black Marsh. Return to Felisa to complete the quest. If you killed Eleedal-Lei, you'll receive a Ring of Fire Storm. If you also killed the rest of the slaves, you'll receive a Ring of Toxic Cloud as well. If you freed Eleedal-Lei instead, you'll receive two Command spells. No matter how you complete the quest, you will always receive the reputation bonuses.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Faral Retheran for duties. Travel to Falasmaryon. Slay Dagoth Tanis. Locate the body of Irer Nervion, and get his Ancestor Ring. Report back to Faral Retheran.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Faral Retheran in the Redoran Treasury in Vivec's Redoran canton will ask you to kill Dagoth Tanis, an Ascended Sleeper of the Sixth House who can be found in the Falasmaryon stronghold. She will also ask you to find a fallen Buoyant Armiger named Irer Nervion in the stronghold. Dagoth Tanis[edit] Falasmaryon is northeast of Maar Gan, near the Ghostfence. The Dagoth can be found at the bottom of the stronghold near the altar.
