If you are a member of either House Hlaalu or House Telvanni you will eventually be tasked to go to Odirniran to handle some business with the Telvanni necromancer Milyn Faram. In the same room as Milyn, there is a bookshelf on the far wall on the right side of the entrance. Both volumes of Vampires of Vvardenfell are located on the bottom shelf. Whatever the method, locate a copy of the book and return it to Skink. Skink's gratitude[edit] When you return to Skink with the requested volume, he is most pleased. Give him the book, and you are rewarded with a substantial increase in Disposition (+15 points) and 1,000 septims.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Lorbumol gro-Aglakh at the Guild of Fighters in Vivec for your orders. Travel to Seyda Neen to collect a bounty on Adraria Vandacia. Find the tax agent at the Census and Excise Warehouse and kill her. Return to Lorbumol to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders[edit] Once you reach the rank of Protector in the Guild, Lorbumol gro-Aglakh in the Vivec Guild of Fighters will ask you to collect a bounty on Adraria Vandacia, in one of the Census and Excise buildings in Seyda Neen. Vandacia's Bounty[edit] Just take a Silt Strider to Seyda Neen and kill the tax agent at the Census and Excise Warehouse. You could try taunting before attacking; after five successful taunts or so at 0/100 disposition Adraria Vandacia starts attacking you. She can be found on the top floor of the warehouse, so you will either have to unlock the ground floor door (opposite the building where you can find Sellus Gravius) or levitate/jump from the dock area to the door on the top floor, which deposits you right next to her. You can also find the key to the warehouse next to Sellus Gravius on the bookshelf. Return to Lorbumol for your 500 gold reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Rediscover the Vassir-Didanat Cave south of Balmora by simply entering the cave. This opens a dialogue option with three House Hlaalu councilors. Choose who you'd like to speak to and claim your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Vassir-Didanat Cave[edit] Rather than beginning with a particular person, this quest actually begins at a location. You can find the Vassir-Didanat Cave to the south of Balmora on the other side of the river. If you have done the Fighters Guild quest to eliminate the egg poachers from Shulk Egg Mine, you may have seen the bridge across the river just to the south of the egg mine. Cross the bridge and keep going east, and you should see the cave on the hillside. The cave was actually a former ebony mine that was lost after one of the miners apparently summoned a Daedra that killed everybody inside the mine. Once you enter the cave, you've essentially 'rediscovered' it and open up the dialogue option Vassir-Didanat Mine with three Hlaalu councilors. Of course, feel free to take any ebony that you like for a good amount of gold as they're 200 gold each. However, even though you will still be able to take it after the completion of the quest (as no guards will appear in the mine), you might rather want to leave it if you are not strong enough to face the atronachs inside. Finder's Fee[edit] You can reveal the location to one of the following: Nevena Ules (Ules Manor near Suran), who will not give you anything. Velanda Omani (Omani Manor east of Vivec, St. Olms Canton), who will offer you 2,000 gold. Dram Bero (The Haunted Manor in the Plaza of St. Olms), who will offer you a choice of Daedric weapons: a katana, a bow, a staff, a wakizashi, a spear or a battleaxe, depending on which weapon skill you tell him you prefer. Be aware that you cannot collect more than one reward. Once you have revealed the location of the mine to one of the councilors, the others will only express disappointment that you did not speak with them first. This means that if you reveal the location to Nevena Ules, you will receive nothing for your efforts. You may also report it to Crassius Curio in Vivec's Hlaalu canton and to Serjo Avon Oran in Suran. Both will advise you to speak to either Dram Bero or Velanda Omani; neither will mention Nevena Ules.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Crassius Curio to learn your next assignment. Travel to Hla Oad and find Velfred the Outlaw. Either kill Velfred or convince him to pay House Hlaalu. Return to Crassius Curio.
Detailed Walkthrough: Business[edit] Once you've reached the rank of Lawman in House Hlaalu and completed some of the quests for Odral Helvi, you can start receiving quests from good old Crassius Curio in his Manor in Vivec's Hlaalu Plaza. Curio will ask you to get the outlaw Velfred to pay some smuggling fees to House Hlaalu. Curio does not say where you can find the outlaw, but suggests that you try asking around Hla Oad. Finding Velfred[edit] Travel to Hla Oad, southwest of Balmora (the quickest way is by boat from Vivec). The people there will tell you that Velfred and his ship are at a secret dock to the southwest of town. Once you find the outlaw, either convince him to pay the fee (raise his disposition to around 75) or simply kill him. Return to Vivec[edit] Then return to Curio in Vivec to complete the quest and receive 500 gold if you killed the outlaw, or 1000 gold if you persuaded him. Curio's disposition increases by ten and you receive five points of Hlaalu faction reputation either way.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Eydis Fire-Eye in the Balmora Guild of Fighters for orders. Go to Mannammu and kill the leader of the Verethi Gang, Dovres Verethi. Return to Eydis Fire-Eye for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders[edit] Once you reach the rank of Protector, Eydis Fire-Eye in the Balmora Guild of Fighters will ask you to kill the leader of the Verethi Gang, Dovres Verethi. The Verethi Gang[edit] The Gang are smugglers based in Mannammu, just a little southeast of Pelagiad. Though you only have to kill Dovres, you'll have to go through a half-dozen of his friends to get to him at the very end of the caves. You can skip a couple of his goons, since there is a way directly to him via an aquatic passage. Alternatively, you can simply sneak past all of them using stealth or magic. Return to Eydis for your 1000 Drake reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Meet Viatrix Petilia on the road southwest of Ald'ruhn. Escort her to the Shrine of Pride, Ghostgate.
Detailed Walkthrough: Viatrix, The Annoying Pilgrim[edit] Southwest of Ald'ruhn (northwest of Buckmoth Legion Fort), you may run into Viatrix Petilia. Speak to her to learn that she needs someone to escort her to the Ghostgate within two days. Agree to get her to follow you (though you might regret it as she can be rather annoying). Are we there yet?[edit] The trip, if you haven't made it before, can be quite difficult with reduced visibility and the tough blighted creatures. In addition, you'll pass nearby to one or two Daedric Shrines and might attract the attention of some of the inhabitants. Make sure that Petilia doesn't take too much damage from attackers, or that you don't lose  her in the low visibility of an ash storm. It is a good idea to stop by in Ghostgate before continuing. You must lead her to the shrine inside the Ghostgate, up the path and to the east slightly. You will receive payment of 100 gold once she approaches the shrine. She is very impatient and will bug you several times along the trip about how long it's taking. If you take longer than two days to reach the shrine, you will fail the quest. The reward is meager for the long trip, but then she only promises a "tip".  Or, you could just lead her into the wilderness and kill her (or simply "fail" to protect her from marauding creatures) for an easy 500 gold, but no weapons or armor.  Note that killing her yourself may get you kicked out of the Tribunal Temple if you are a member of that faction.

Quick Walkthrough: Chat with Sugar-Lips Habasi about jobs and Vintage Brandy. Steal some Vintage Brandy from the recently deceased Ralen Hlaalo, in the Hlaalo Manor, or acquire a bottle in any way. Return to Sugar-Lips to complete the quest and receive your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] Sugar-Lips Habasi in the South Wall Cornerclub in Balmora asks you to steal some Vintage Brandy from the recently deceased Ralen Hlaalo, in the Hlaalo Manor (not the Hlaalu Council Manor, which is different). Again, any Vintage Brandy should work. Hlaalo Manor[edit] Hlaalo manor is across the river and has two locked entrances, the front door (30) and the balcony door (40). Be careful of the guard patrols when you pick the lock so you aren't noticed. Getting into the Manor is easier from the balcony, since the guards won't notice you easily. To get on the balcony, simply jump from the staircase of the bordering guard tower. Locating the Brandy[edit] There are two locations for the Brandy you are seeking. One is upstairs in Ralen Hlaalo's dresser and the other is on the top center shelf near the body of Ralen. Return to Habasi with the Brandy she's seeking for a reward of 1,000 gold.

Quick Walkthrough: Return to Caius in Balmora for your orders. Meet with the informants in Vivec. Huleeya Informant Meet with Huleeya at the Black Shalk Cornerclub in the Foreign Quarter. Calm the locals and escort Huleeya to Jobasha's Bookshop to receive his notes. Addhiranirr Informant Meet with Addhiranirr in the Underworks of the St. Olms Canton. Find and tell the excise agent Duvianus Platorius that Addhiranirr has left for the mainland. Receive the information from Addhiranirr. Meet Mehra Milo Meet with Mehra Milo at the Library of Vivec in the Temple Canton. Steal or buy the book Progress of Truth. Return to Caius in Balmora.
Detailed Walkthrough: Huleeya Addhiranirr Mehra Milo Orders from Caius[edit] After the last errand, Caius tells you to train for a while and come back to him later. Specifically, your character needs to be at least level 3 before Caius will give you the next assignment. At that point, he sends you on a fact-finding mission to the city of Vivec. Your mission is to track down and rendezvous with three people: Addhiranirr, a Khajiit Thieves Guild member in St. Olms, Huleeya, an Argonian Morag Tong assassin at the Black Shalk Cornerclub in the Foreign Quarter, and Mehra Milo, a Tribunal Temple priestess in the Hall of Wisdom of the Temple Canton. Caius is once again looking for any Sixth House or Nerevarine Cult information and he gives you 200 gold for expenses. The quickest way is to take the Silt Strider or the Mages Guild Guide, but feel free to take the scenic route. Huleeya Informant[edit] Huleeya is in the Black Shalk Cornerclub, in the Foreign Quarter Lower Waistworks. He should be easy to find, as he is the only Argonian in the room. Unfortunately, Huleeya seems to be having trouble with the locals, who will not let him pass. Talk with the Dark Elf, Ethys Savil, or one of his two friends, and persuade him to leave the Argonian alone. Raising his disposition a bit will work, but so will homicide. If you try to leave with Huleeya without talking to one of the thugs, they will attack and you will have to protect Huleeya. Attacking the thugs first will result in Huleeya refusing to talk to you. Once you've solved this, you may escort Huleeya unhindered to Jobasha's Rare Books. Jobasha's bookshop is on the same level as the cornerclub, in the Foreign Quarter Lower Waistworks, just on the opposite side. Once you're inside the bookshop with Huleeya, you will receive one Reputation point for your help and he will give you some notes to take to Caius. Also while at the bookshop, pick up the book Progress of Truth on the second floor far left bookcase as you will be needing it later in this quest. You can steal it when the Ordinator patrols elsewhere, or just buy it. Addhiranirr Informant[edit] Addhiranirr is the next closest contact in the St. Olms Canton, southeast of the Foreign Quarter (past the Redoran and next to the St. Delyn cantons). It turns out Addhiranirr is difficult to find as almost no one in St. Olms knows where she is. With enough exploration and questions, you do eventually find her all alone in the northeast Underworks, hiding from a Census and Excise agent. In order to get anything out of her, the agent must be taken care of. The agent in question is Duvianus Platorius, who can be found in St. Olms Waistworks. As usual, you can either kill him or persuade him that Addhiranirr has fled. Note that if you happen to accidentally tell him where Addhiranirr is, you can still get the information Caius wants by raising Addhiranirr's disposition until she will talk to you. Also, if you tell Duvianus Platorius where Addhiranirr is and come back later to talk about the topic 'Addhiranirr', he will give you the response normally given if you had chosen to lie to him. Anyway, once the agent is out of the way, Addhiranirr will let you know that the Sixth House is into smuggling, but no one knows what due to intense secrecy. Meet Mehra Milo[edit] The last of the contacts is Mehra Milo. She may be found in the Library of Vivec, located in the Hall of Wisdom in the Temple Canton at the southern end of Vivec. Once you find her and follow her to the back of the library, she will tell you what she knows about the Nerevarine cult. She'll also suggest that you obtain a copy of the book Progress of Truth for Caius. Although the library has a copy of the book, it is under guard, so she suggests trying the local bookshops, even though the book is officially banned by the Tribunal Temple. The copy in the library is the tall book on top of the bookshelf in the southwest corner. Alternatively, you can just buy a copy from Jobasha's Rare Books in the Lower Waistworks of the Foreign Quarter for 150 gold. Other copies can be found at: Tel Uvirith, Arelas' House Vivec, Hall of Justice Secret Library Vivec, Telvanni Tower Return to Caius[edit] Return the information to Caius, who will promote you to Journeyman and suggest you take more time to train and do some other guild work to keep your cover up. Come back for the next part of the quest in a few days.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak with Vodunius Nuccius about a little advice. Speak with Darvame Hleran about Vodunius Nuccius. Speak with Vodunius and purchase his ring.
Detailed Walkthrough: Vodunius Nuccius[edit] Speak with Vodunius Nuccius in Seyda Neen and choose the dialogue option little advice. He will suggest that you use the Silt Strider for traveling, and directs you to the town's Silt Strider operator, Darvame Hleran, while telling you to mention that he sent you. A Little Business Arrangement[edit] Speak with Darvame Hleran and mention Vodunius Nuccius to learn that the two have a business arrangement. Furthermore, she shares with you her belief that Vodunius Nuccius is unhappy in Vvardenfell. I Wanna Go Home[edit] Return to Vodunius with this information and he will tell you that, indeed, he is not happy. The only reason he's not on the next boat to Narsis is a lack of funds; he doesn't have the money to leave. He offers to sell you his cursed ring for 100 gold; if you turn down the offer or don't have the funds for the purchase, you can return at a later point. If you buy the ring, leave, and then return to Seyda Neen, Vodunius Nuccius will be gone, presumably traveling to Narsis. You can use the bed in his house if you can get past the level 30 lock, although anything you take and anything you put in his containers will be marked as stolen.

Quick Walkthrough: Ajira tells you you can recover the Warlock's Ring from the Ashirbadon cave. Travel to the cave, and fight your way through to the last mage, Vindamea Drethan. Defeat Vindamea Drethan, and recover the artifact from her corpse. Return the ring to Ajira, and she will let you keep it.
Detailed Walkthrough: Duties[edit] Once you've reached the rank of Warlock, Ajira in the Balmora Guild of Mages will tell you about the Warlock's Ring after you've found the Staff of Magnus. This isn't a quest per se, but merely a chance to acquire a powerful magical item for your arsenal. Warlock's Ring[edit] The ring is currently held by Vindamea Drethan in Ashirbadon, a cave on a small island east of the ruins of Bal Fell, just east of the city of Vivec at the bottom of the map. Indeed, just head directly east from the ruins and it is on the first island you reach. The cave is small though filled with several tough creatures possibly including atronachs, dremora, and daedroth. Vindamea is again a high level mage wielding the Warlock's Ring and can be tough to take out. Don't forget to check for treasure once you've killed her.

Quick Walkthrough: Meet Lucan Ostorius on the road northwest of Ald'ruhn Deliver the shipment to Yak gro-Skandar
Detailed Walkthrough: Help a Trader[edit] If you are lucky, looking for the younger Zainsubani, or quite thorough in your exploration, you may come across Lucan Ostorius to the northwest of Ald'ruhn, very much in the middle of nowhere (west of the Dushariran Shrine). Apparently, he has been waiting to meet someone there and they have not yet shown up, and he asks you for a favor. The Weapon Delivery[edit] You are to deliver four weapons (a Steel Shortsword, a Silver Flameblade, a Steel Staff and a Silver War Axe) to Yak gro-Skandar at the Rat in the Pot club in Ald'ruhn. You'll receive a whole 100 gold for the delivery and, if you are a Thieves Guild member, a faction increase as well. If you decide to keep the weapons instead of delivering them, know that the first time you leave Ald'ruhn, Lucan will appear and attack you. Unfortunately, once you're in this position, there's no way to fix it in game since Yak won't accept the weapons anymore and Lucan won't calm down. You can either kill him or lead him out to the wilderness and then lose him. It should also be noted that this fail-safe can trigger while you're still in the vicinity of Ald'ruhn, so it's quite easy to unintentionally fail this quest because of this oversight.

Quick Walkthrough: (Optional) Hear Rumors about a weary vampire. Travel to the Drethan Ancestral Tomb, southwest of Ald Daedroth. Slay the vampire Marara and take her ring.
Detailed Walkthrough: Rumors[edit] Ask around Tel Mora for rumors to learn that a powerful vampire named Marara has been killing people lately. Find Marara in the Drethan Ancestral Tomb, southwest of Ald Daedroth, to learn more. The Weary Vampire[edit] It seems that this vampire has become tired of life (or undeath to be more accurate) which explains her recent murders. In order to end it all, she wishes to be killed by one of her own kind... which would be you. A useful ring[edit] At her death, you'll receive the useful Marara's Ring. This quest can only be completed if you are a vampire. However, if you aren't a vampire, you can still kill her to get the ring, but you just miss out on her speech about unlife and the journal entries.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Darius in Gnisis for Orders. Go west to Widow Vabdas' hut and talk to her. Enter the Gnisis Eggmine. Find the Ghost of Vabas's husband, and take Lugrub's Axe. Return to Darius in Gnisis and report your findings. Head back to the egg mine and kill Lugrub gro-Ogdum. Report back to Darius.
Detailed Walkthrough: General Darius at the Madach Tradehouse in Gnisis will ask you to retrieve a land deed from the Widow Vabdas, whose husband died recently in the Gnisis Eggmine. The General wants Vabdas' land for a new dock and tells you not to take 'no' for an answer. Check around town to learn that the widow Vabdas lives in a hut west of town. If you talk to her about the deed she will refuse to give it to you. Instead, she says that her husband was murdered by a legionnaire when he went to the closed mine and she wants you to find out what happened. Head for the mine on the east side of town on the hill and speak to the guard Vatollia Apo about the "Eggmine" topic. Since you're in the Legion he will give you a key to the mine without the need for a high disposition or carrying of Miner's Pick. Note that you must be wearing Imperial armor for this, otherwise talking to him just lowers his disposition by 5. The first area of the mine doesn't have much to it, though you'll find an aggressive Orc (Lugrub gro-Ogdum) in the Lower area who will attack unless you leave the area quickly enough. Also in this area, you will see a Kwama Queen. Be careful not to kill her as she needs to be alive for Darius' next quest. Explore the lower mines until you find the ghost of Mansilamat Vabdas in the underground stream. It will tell you that Lugrub killed him to hide the fact that he was sleeping on the job when Vabdas entered. As evidence, he directs you to the broken axe (Lugrub's Axe) at the bottom of the pool nearby. Return to Darius with the proof of the murder. Give him the axe and his disposition will increase by 3 and he will tell you to go and kill Lugrub. Do so and report back to Darius. His disposition will increase by 20 and he will reward you with an Imperial Broadsword. If you talk to Darius about the deed afterwards, it will turn out that the Legion has started a donation fund for the widow, to which you can contribute if you want. Alternatively, the investigation can be skipped by stealing the land deed, which is found in a locked (40) chest on your right as you enter Widow Vabdas' house. The widow holds its key. If you present the stolen deed to Darius you still receive the sword and reputation award, but his disposition increase is only 10.

Quick Walkthrough: Meet the half-naked Barbarian Botrir west of Indoranyon, south-southeast of Vos. Find and kill the witch Iveri Llothri. Decide what to do with the axe.
Detailed Walkthrough: A Naked Man?[edit] Botrir stands on the path just outside Hanud, south-southeast of Vos. Like Hlormar Wine-Sot and Hisin Deep-Raed, he has had a run-in with a witch. He was escorting Iveri Llothri to Tel Aruhn when she turned on him, placed him under a curse, and stole his clothing and gold. Most importantly, she also stole his ancestral axe, Widowmaker. He asks you for your help in the matter, saying the witch ran off to the northwest. Finding the Witch[edit] The witch's campsite is not too far in that direction, but beyond Andalor Ancestral Tomb and an encampment of rogue Ashlanders. (With Botrir in tow, you may want to tend to the encampment and tomb at some other time.) If you arrive without Botrir, and have adequate Personality, you can discuss most anything other than Widowmaker or Botrir with Iveri, but she otherwise leaves you little choice in your options: She attacks you, if you and Botrir approach together. Botrir will likewise attack her and you can aid him, take the brunt of her attack while he kills her, or watch Iveri kill him if you can avoid her detecting your presence. Widowmaker[edit] Once the witch is dead, loot her corpse to find the axe. If you give the axe to the barbarian you will receive a bonus to your Axe skill. If you decide to keep the axe, Botrir will attack you. You could hand the axe over for the skill bonus and then kill him to take back the weapon. Alternatively, just pick his pocket and take the axe right back. The skill lesson won't increase your axe skill level over 100.

Quick Walkthrough: Speak to Aengoth the Jeweler at The Rat In the Pot in Ald'ruhn for a new job. Travel to Maar Gan to steal a copy of Withershins. Steal the book from Miles Gloriosus at the Andus Tradehouse. Return to Aengoth the Jeweler to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] Aengoth the Jeweler at The Rat In the Pot in Ald'ruhn will ask you to steal another book, Withershins, from Miles Gloriosus over in Maar Gan in the Andus Tradehouse. Stealing Withershins[edit] The fastest route is to grab a Silt Strider from Ald'ruhn to Maar Gan. The Tradehouse is north of the Silt Strider ramp in Maar Gan and Miles can be found in a room downstairs. The book is in a locked (70) crate by the desk (again, use Sneak and Chameleon to prevent him from attacking). Alternatively, you can simply leave the door open, wait for him to leave, and then close the door. You are then free to loot whatever you can find. Return to Aengoth for a reward of 1,000 gold.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Big Helende in Dirty Muriel's Cornerclub in Wolverine Hall for a new job. Visit the Mage's Guild in Wolverine Hall to hire a wizard for defense purposes. Ask Arielle Phiencel about hiring a wizard. Gather four pieces of Raw Ebony as payment. Return to Arielle and she'll dispatch a guard. Return to Helende to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] Big Helende at Dirty Muriel's Cornerclub in Wolverine Hall asks you to visit the Mage's Guild to hire a wizard for defense purposes (for protection from the Camonna Tong). Wizard For Hire[edit] When you get there, members of the Mages Guild will direct you to speak with Arielle Phiencel and ask her about hiring a wizard: hire a wizard "You want to hire a wizard as a guard? Talk to Arielle Phiencel." Arielle will request four pieces of Raw Ebony as payment. Again, any four pieces will do, from a mine or elsewhere. Once Arielle receives the ebony she will send the Battlemage Natalinus Flavonius over to Dirty Muriel's. Return to Helende for your reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Master Aryon in the Upper Tower in Tel Vos for chores. Learn the three basic wizard spells: Levitate, Recall and Fire Damage. Return to Aryon to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Chores[edit] Councilor Aryon in the Upper Tower of Tel Vos will ask you to learn the three basic wizard spells: Levitate, Recall and Fire Damage. Aryon says he will accept Levitate, Great Levitate, and Wild Levitate, and for fire damage, he will suggest Fireball, Greater Fireball, and Fire Storm. Custom spells are not acceptable. Wizard Spells[edit] If you already know these spells, the quest should be quite easy. If not, the spells can be bought from merchants listed in the spell pages. Urtiso Faryon and Arielle Phiencel sell Fire Storm and Wild Levitate respectively and are both in Sadrith Mora. They offer easy access to two of the three spells you need. Return to Aryon once you have learned the spells to complete the quest and receive the Destruction skill book; The Art of War Magic as a reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to any Mages Guild member ranked Wizard or higher about advancement. Learn that you need a Wizard's Staff before you can be promoted to Wizard. Either buy a staff for 5,000 gold... ...or learn that the renegade Anirne has one: Travel to Sud, on the west coast of Sheogorad, west of Dagon Fel. Defeat Anirne and obtain a Wizard's Staff. Return for your promotion.
Detailed Walkthrough: A Wizard's Staff[edit] This isn't a quest per se, but rather a requirement. To reach the rank of Wizard, you first need a Wizard's staff (all guild quest givers should tell you the same information). You can either buy one for 5,000 gold (it's worth 10,000), or ask about the former guild member Anirne, who can be found in Sud, a cavern on the west coast of Sheogorad, west of Dagon Fel. Sud[edit] The caverns are pretty empty until you reach a point where you must levitate onto some stone towers oddly placed in the middle of nowhere. You'll encounter a variety of creatures including some skeleton archers, and leveled daedra. Anirne can be found in a room reached by levitation or some clever jumping just west of the entrance. There is a sunken treasure chest nearby with two cheap potions of rising force and two standard potions of jump if you lack the spell or jumping ability. She will have the staff on her body when you kill her. Don't forget to look around for loot. Once you have the staff, you can return to any Mages Guild hall for advancement to Wizard.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls for a new writ. Go to Gnisis to execute Baladas Demnevanni. Find Baladas in Arvs-Drelen and kill him. Return to any of the Masters to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Writ[edit] Once Dagoth Ur is dead, you've been named Grandmaster of the Guild and have completed the Mathyn Bemis, Navil/Ranes Ienith, and Brilnosu Llarys writs, return to any of the Masters to receive the writ for Baladas Demnevanni. Baladas Demnevanni[edit] Baladas lives in Arvs-Drelen in Gnisis and is a powerful spellcaster. Return to any quest giver once he is dead for a 5,000 gold reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls for a new writ. Go to the Hlormaren stronghold to execute Brilnosu Llarys. Find Brilnosu on the roof and kill her. Return to any of the Masters to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Writ[edit] Any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls will give you a writ for Brilnosu Llarys, who can be found in the Hlormaren stronghold. Brilnosu Llarys[edit] Brilnosu can be found on the roof of the Hlormaren stronghold, on the coast west of Balmora. Return to a quest giver to receive 1,000 gold for the writ.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls for a new writ. Go to Vivec, St. Olms Canton to execute Dram Bero. Find Bero in the bottom of the Haunted Manor on the Plaza and kill him. Return to any of the Masters to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Writ[edit] Once Dagoth Ur is dead, you've been named Grandmaster of the Guild and have completed the Writ for Mathyn Bemis, Navil/Ranes Ienith, and Brilnosu Llarys quests, return to any of the Masters to receive the writ for Dram Bero. Dram Bero[edit] He is found in the bottom of the Haunted Manor on the Plaza of St. Olms Canton in Vivec. Return to any quest giver for your 3,000 gold reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls for a new writ. Go to the Telvanni Canton to execute Ethal Seloth and Idroso Vendu. Find Ethal and Idroso in the Temporary Housing on the Telvanni Plaza and kill them. Return to any of the Masters to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Writ[edit] Any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls will give you a writ for Ethal Seloth and Idroso Vendu, who can be found in the Telvanni Canton of Vivec. Ethal Seloth and Idroso Vendu[edit] Ethal and Idroso live together in the Temporary Housing on the Telvanni Plaza level. Find them and execute them honorably. Stealing a random item will make both targets attack you, without alerting the two other present occupants. Return to a quest giver to receive 1,000 gold for the writs.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Eno Hlaalu at the Morag Tong headquarters in the Storage Area of the Vivec Arena for a new writ. Go to the Hlaalu Canton to execute Feruren Oran. Find Feruren on the Plaza and kill him. Return to Eno to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Writ[edit] Once you find Eno Hlaalu at the Morag Tong headquarters in the Storage Area of the Vivec Arena, he will ask you to prove your worth by performing the execution of Feruren Oran. Eno will give you a writ for Oran's murder, which you can present to the guards after the murder in case you need to clear your bounty. Feruren Oran[edit] Oran can be found in the Elven Nations Cornerclub in the Hlaalu canton plaza. There is a difficulty, namely that he is non-hostile and refuses to talk even enough for you to Taunt him. There are several solutions. If you remove all your clothes, Oran will be shocked into talking to you, allowing you to taunt him. Casting frenzy on him until he attacks you will also incur no bounty. You can also pick his pocket or steal the bottle in front of him and he will attack you. You can opt to command him out of the club and into a place with no eye witnesses. Hiding (either with Chameleon 100% or by sneaking) and shooting him from a distance also works. Lastly, you can simply attack him and present your writ to the Ordinators to remove your bounty. Report back to Eno once Oran is dead to be admitted into the Guild.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls for a new writ. Go to the Hlaalu Canton to execute Galasa Uvayn. Find Galasa in the Hlaalu Treasury and kill her. Return to any of the Masters to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Writ[edit] Any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls will give you a writ for Galasa Uvayn, who can be found in the Hlaalu Canton of Vivec. Galasa Uvayn[edit] Uvayn is in the Hlaalu Treasury just outside the entrance to Hlaalu records and is a capable spellcaster. She is lightly armored with a boiled netch leather cuirass and has a dire flameblade. Attacking her will not incur bounty. Return to a quest giver to receive 1,000 gold for the writ.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls for a new writ. Go to the Redoran Canton to execute Guril Retheran. Find Guril in the Flowers of Gold Cornerclub and kill him. Return to any of the Masters to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Writ[edit] Any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls will give you a writ for Guril Retheran, who can be found in the Redoran Canton of Vivec. Guril Retheran[edit] Retheran is located on the bottom level of the Flowers of Gold Cornerclub on the  Waistworks Level. Slay him and return to a quest giver to receive 1,000 gold for the writ.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls for a new writ. Go to Moonmoth Legion Fort to execute Larrius Varro. Find Larrius in the barracks and kill him. Return to any of the Masters to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Writ[edit] Once Dagoth Ur is dead, you've been named Grandmaster of the Guild and have completed the Mathyn Bemis, Navil/Ranes Ienith, and Brilnosu Llarys writs, return to any of the Masters to receive the writ of Larrius Varro. Larrius Varro[edit] Varro is the head of the Imperial Legion at Moonmoth Legion Fort and can be found in the barracks there. He is a tough cookie, despite his regular armor, and wields a nice weapon: Temreki, Shackler of Souls. Return to any quest giver once he is dead for a 4,000 gold reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls for a new writ. Go to the Hlaalu Canton to execute Mathyn Bemis. Find Mathyn in the Hlaalu Ancestral Vaults in the Canalworks and kill him. Return to any of the Masters to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Writ[edit] Any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls will give you a writ for Mathyn Bemis, who can be found in the Hlaalu Canton in Vivec. Mathyn Bemis[edit] Bemis leads a gang of thieves in the Hlaalu Ancestral Vaults, accessed from the Canalworks of the Hlaalu Canton. Three of the four thieves are together and provide a good challenge (and good loot). Return to a quest giver to receive 1,000 gold for the writ.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls for a new writ. Go to the Telvanni Canton to execute Mavon Drenim. Find Mavon in the Telvanni Tower and kill him. Return to any of the Masters to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Writ[edit] Any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls will give you a writ for Mavon Drenim, who can be found in the Telvanni Canton of Vivec. Mavon Drenim[edit] Mavon is the ranking Telvanni noble in Vivec and can be found in his tower, accessible from the plaza of the Telvanni Canton. He is a powerful spellcaster and will attack you on sight, as will the two mages beside him. Return to a quest giver to receive 1,000 gold for the writ.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls for a new writ. Go to Tel Branora to execute Therana. Find Therana in the Upper Tower and kill her. Return to any of the Masters to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Writ[edit] Once Dagoth Ur is dead, you've been named Grandmaster of the Guild and have completed the Mathyn Bemis, Navil/Ranes Ienith, and Brilnosu Llarys writs, return to any of the Masters to receive the writ for Therana. Mistress Therana[edit] This Telvanni council member may already be dead since this is one option during the Main Quest when you are named Telvanni Hortator. You also may have taken her out as part of the last quest for the Mages Guild. If not, you can find her in the Upper Tower in Tel Branora (southeast corner of the map) where she is accompanied by her bodyguard and one unfreeable slave. The slave will not attempt to protect Therana. Return to any quest giver once she is dead for a 10,000 gold reward.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls for a new writ. Go to the Dren Plantation to execute Ranes and Navil Ienith. Find the brothers in the basement of the Villa and kill them. Return to any of the Masters to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Writ[edit] Any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls will give you a writ for Ranes and Navil Ienith, who can be found in the Dren Plantation. Navil and Ranes Ienith[edit] Both brothers can be found in the basement of the Dren Plantation Villa, behind two locked doors (Ranes doesn't exist until you attack Navil or Galos Farethi and will appear behind you once you do). Be careful, these two are powerful and can be a tough fight, especially with their paralyzing daggers. Return to a quest giver to receive 2,000 gold for the writ.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls for a new writ. Go to the Bensiberib Camp to execute Odaishah Yasalmibaal. Find Odaishah in his yurt and kill him. Return to any of the Masters to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Writ[edit] Any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls will give you a writ for Odaishah Yasalmibaal, who has taken up hiding within the Bensiberib Camp, northwest of Tel Fyr and southwest of Tel Aruhn, on the mainland on Azura's Coast. Odaishah Yasalmibaal[edit] Yasalmibaal, the sole occupant of the yurt in which he resides, is a Dark Elf Barbarian armed with a Chitin War Axe, and bereft of both armor and spells. After honorably slaying him, return to a Morag Tong quest-giver to receive your contract fee of 500 drakes for successful completion of the writ.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls for a new writ. Go to Zaintirari to execute Sarayn Sadus. Find Sarayn in the cave and kill him. Return to any of the Masters to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Writ[edit] Any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls will give you a writ for Sarayn Sadus, who can be found in a cave named Zaintirari, west of Tel Fyr, and north of the Erabenimsun Camp. Sarayn Sadus[edit] Zaintirari is a comparatively small cave, so it should be easy to find Sadus. However, he is guarded by four of his bandit friends. Return to a quest giver to receive 500 gold for the writ.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls for a new writ. Go to Shara to execute Tirer Belvayn. Find Tirer in the tower and kill him. Return to any of the Masters to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Writ Any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls will give you a writ for Tirer Belvayn, who can be found in the tower of Shara. Tirer Belvayn Shara is on the southwest coast of the island of Dagon Fel, north of Vvardenfell. Belvayn can be found inside, guarded by three skeleton champions and a dremora or daedroth, and he is a powerful mage. Return to a quest giver to receive 1,000 gold for the writ.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls for a new writ. Go to the Redoran Plaza in Vivec to execute Toris Saren. Find Toris in his manor and kill him. Return to any of the Masters to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Writ[edit] Any of the Morag Tong Masters at the guildhalls will give you a writ for Toris Saren, who can be found in the Saren Manor on the Redoran Plaza in Vivec. Toris Saren[edit] The people in Saren Manor know of you and why you have come, so speaking with them will cause them to attack (they fight only with fists, though). Likewise with Saren himself (though in some cases he may draw a Wild Shardblade). Return to any quest-giver to receive 500 gold for the writ.

Quick Walkthrough: Kill Vivec, and retrieve the Unique Dwemer Artifact from his corpse. Take it to Yagrum Bagarn in the Corprusarium in Tel Fyr. Find Kagrenac's Journal and Planbook in Endusal and Tureynulal. Bring the books to Yagrum, and wait a day while he studies them in order to harmonize Wraithguard to your magicka signature. Equip Wraithguard, and be prepared to lose 200-225 Health, permanently.
Detailed Walkthrough: God-Killer[edit] So, you killed Vivec, and you still want to complete the Main Quest?  Don't worry, all is not lost.  The Back-Path is much more difficult, but still possible.  First you must retrieve the Unique Dwemer Artifact from his divine corpse.  Nobody will tell you what to do with it.  You must find out on your own.  It might help to look at the scrolls found in the alcoves inside Vivec's Palace. The Last Living Dwarf[edit] Yagrum Bagarn is the last of the Dwemer, and he can be found in the Corprusarium in Tel Fyr.  If you have done much of the Main Quest, you would have met him during the Corprus Cure quest.  If you speak to him with the Unique Dwemer Artifact in your possession, he will recognize it as Wraithguard, and offer to help you activate it.  Ask him about "mythopoeic enchantments" to hear his advice on the matter.  Note that in order to receive his aid you must either have a Reputation of at least 20 or be able to show him Dagoth Ur's Plans and the Plan to Defeat Dagoth Ur, both found in Vivec's Palace. Kagrenac's Books[edit] Yagrum will ask you to retrieve two books written by Kagrenac, who helped to construct Wraithguard.  They can be found in Endusal and Tureynulal, respectively.  These two ancient Dwemer Ruins are located on either side of the Dagoth Ur Facility in the Red Mountain region.  They are home to many powerful Ash Creatures, including the Ash Vampires Dagoth Endus and Dagoth Tureynul.  Once you have found the Journal and Planbook, return to Tel Fyr and present them to Yagrum Bagarn. Harmonizing Wraithguard[edit] When you show him the books, Yagrum will ask you to give him a day to study them.  Return in 24 hours (or just wait), and speak to him again.  He will have Wraithguard ready for you, but he will give you a strong warning.  Equipping the artifact will cause a permanent loss of 200-225 maximum Health.  He will recommend that you use a Fortify Health; however, this is not practical. Fortifying your health only fortifies your *current* health and doing this will not avoid the loss to your *maximum* health. Once the spell or potion wears off, your health will then be reduced by however much you fortified it, and if this brings you below 0 you will die.  Likewise for wearing Constant Effect enchanted items.  If you remove them, or if they are damaged to the point of breaking, you may find yourself dead rather quickly.  The safest thing is to have more than 230 health to begin with, and probably a lot more, as wandering around Red Mountain with only 20 maximum health is likely to be somewhat hazardous.  Fortunately, this loss of health is one-time only, and if you survive, you may equip and unequip the Wraithguard as many times as you wish without worry.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Jim Stacey about Bal Molagmer. Go to the Yngling Manor in the St. Olms Plaza to find proof of Yngling Half-Troll's corruption. Find Yngling's Ledger in the basement. Return to Jim to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Job[edit] For the second quest in this series, Jim Stacey asks you to find proof of Yngling Half-Troll's corruption by retrieving a ledger in the Yngling Manor, on the plaza of the St. Olms canton in Vivec. Yngling's Ledger[edit] The ledger can be found downstairs by some game rats. The basement door is locked (85) and there is a guard at the top of the stairs. Apparently, Yngling has been using money from the Tribunal Temple for his own endeavors. Return the ledger to Jim for his congratulations.

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Sonummu Zabamat and Kaushad at the Zainab Camp. Kill the vampire Calvario for Kaushad in Nerano Ancestral Tomb. Return to Kaushad to learn he wants a Telvanni bride. Talk with Sonummu about it. Travel to Tel Aruhn to buy a slave girl from Savile Imayn. Buy exquisite shirt, skirt, and shoes, and Telvanni Bug Musk. Escort the slave girl back to Kaushad's Yurt. Be named as the Nerevarine of the Zainab Tribe.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Zainab Camp[edit] If you haven't found out the location of the Zainab Camp yet, return to the Urshilaku Camp and find out from the Ashlanders. The quickest route from the Zainab Camp back to the Urshilaku Camp is to grab a ship from Tel Mora to Dagon Fel and onto Khuul. The Zainab Camp is located southwest of Vos and southeast from the Cavern of the Incarnate. The camp is again out in the wilderness and the nearest city is Tel Mora, which can be reached by boat. From Tel Mora, head southwest to reach the camp (check your in-game world map). The shrewd Ashkhan of the Zainab Sonummu Zabamat[edit] Once you reach the Zainab Camp, go to the Wise Woman's Yurt and talk to Sonummu Zabamat to show her your proofs to fulfill the Nerevarine Prophecies. She tells you to talk to Ashkhan Kaushad. In order to get him to talk to you about the Prophecies, you will need to raise his disposition to around 70 by the usual means, or by giving him a gift of exquisite shoes. Still, Kaushad is just a little wary of your claims. If you ask him to set you a task to prove yourself, he lets you know of a vampire named Calvario in Nerano Ancestral Tomb which needs to be taken care of. The man certainly is a shrewd negotiator, a true specimen of his tribe. Nerano Ancestral Tomb[edit] The tomb is north and slightly west of the camp (west of Vos, Tel Vos, and Tel Mora) and will not be marked on your map. Kaushad says it is "nearby", but it is rather far. Talk to him about Nerano Ancestral Tomb before leaving and he'll give you directions.  If you previously found this tomb while wandering or from clues in other locations, and killed Calvario, this dialogue topic will update your journal without you having to go to the tomb again. The tomb is a small one, and you should quickly find Calvario, but watch out for other undead populating the tomb. Calvario is not too tough, but his health-absorbing ability might make the fight last longer than usual. Returning to Kaushad, he congratulates you on your accomplishment, but there's just one more thing he wants you to do ....  Falura Llervu before...    ...and after her transformation Bride for Kaushad[edit] The ashkhan wants you find him a bride, and not just any bride, but a high-born Telvanni; pretty, plump, with big hips. He suggests talking to Zabamat for more information.  Sonummu Zabamat suggests that you buy a slave girl from Savile Imayn in Tel Aruhn, dress her up as a Telvanni lady and bring her to Kaushad, who won't know the difference. If you ask Zabamat about Tel Aruhn she will mark the village on your map, far southeast of the Zainab Camp. There's no real quick way but to just walk there, although by using Divine Intervention, you can fast travel to Wolverine Hall, and take a boat or a shorter walk to Tel Aruhn. Savile is standing outside Tel Aruhn by the northern Underground entrance. Once you mention that you are looking for something special, she says she has just the girl but needs an exquisite shirt, skirt, and shoes first. She says that Elegnan, the clothier in Tel Mora far to the north, probably sells such items. Fortunately, you can get a boat between Tel Aruhn and Tel Mora; Elegnan is easily found on the south side of town near the boats. Of course, once you return to Savile, there's just one more thing you need, a bottle of Telvanni Bug Musk. If you don't have any, you can buy some from Bildren the apothecary in town (though you may buy some from Jolda as well; another option is, of course, theft). Once you have the musk, you can buy the slave Falura Llervu from her for 1200 gold (though depending on your Mercantile skill and disposition, you can get away with as little as 600). Named as the Nerevarine[edit] Unlock the door next to Savile to free Falura and talk to her to give her the clothes and musk and then get her to follow you. As with all escorts, ensure that you don't run too far ahead of her and be careful of any creatures, especially in the water. The easiest way is to take a boat back to Vos and walk from there. If you run too far ahead there is a good chance you'll lose her, temporarily at least. Once you arrive in the Ashkhan's Yurt and talk with him, he will thank you for the bride and name you the Zainab Nerevarine, giving you the Thong of Zainab as proof of your title. After you've delivered Falura to Kaushad, if you talk to the Ashkhan about Telvanni bride after you've talked to Falura about my bridegroom, he tells you he knows perfectly well you tricked him. But he's not angry, in fact, he's somewhat impressed with your cunning and he likes the girl more than he would a real Telvanni lady. You even get a wedding gift (an Exquisite Shirt).

Quick Walkthrough: Return to Caius in Balmora for your orders. Meet with Hassour Zainsubani in the Ald Skar Inn in Ald'ruhn. Visit the nearby bookseller, Codus Callonus, and buy a book as a gift for Hassour. Give the gift to Hassour and receive the note for Caius in return. Return to Caius in Balmora.
Detailed Walkthrough: Orders from Caius[edit] Caius Cosades' next task is to try to establish an Ashlander informant. He has heard rumors that Hassour Zainsubani, an Ashlander who is now a wealthy trader, is staying in Ald'ruhn. Caius gives you 100 gold and asks you to try and find out what he likes and buy him a present in the hopes of persuading him to talk about the Ashlanders tribes and their relationship to the Nerevarine Cult. Although Caius says he's not sure where to find this gentleman, he suggests the Ald Skar Inn. If you haven't been to Ald'ruhn before, it's basically far north of Balmora, past Caldera. The quickest way is to grab a Silt Strider from Balmora, although Mages Guild members might prefer to use the Guild Guide instead. Meet with Hassour Zainsubani[edit] The Ald Skar Inn is just southwest of the big Manor District building in Ald'ruhn and Hassour is on the middle level (there are stairs right of the bar leading to the area). First thing to do when you talk with Hassour Zainsubani is ask about business and that will bring up the topic about gifts. Chatting with him you indeed find out that it is an Ashlander custom to give gifts and that Hassour's passion happens to include poetry. So, just give him that book of poetry you've been reading and... what, you don't have one? Well, time to visit the local bookshops to see what books they have in stock. Note that you can also talk to other people to get this info, or explore his room in the other, larger downstairs part of the Inn to see what sort of books he has. Just as luck would have it, Codus Callonus' bookstore is located nearby, and Codus actually suggests a few selections when you mention Hassour (Words of the Wind 45 gold, Ashland Hymns 35 gold, or The Five Far Stars 25 gold). Now, if you have explored Hassour's room, you'll know he already has all three of them but he'll accept any as a gift. If you're really tricky (and cheap) you can steal one of his own books from his room and give it back to him (he shouldn't notice). Alternatively, if you raise his disposition to 80 or higher, you can discuss the Ashlander gift-giving customs, and he will take your "thought and effort" as a gift. Return to Caius[edit] Once you get Hassour to talk with you about the Ashlanders and Nerevarine Cult, you'll receive his notes for Caius. Return to Caius, and he again promotes you and suggests you keep the notes, as he is sending you to the Urshilaku Ashlander Camp that Hassour mentioned. He also goes on to explain things a bit. It appears that you were released and recruited on the Emperor's orders.  The Emperor believes that you may fit the Nerevarine prophecies. Caius gives you a decoded copy of the original package you delivered to him along with 200 gold and instructions to see Somutis Vunnis and Crulius Pontanian at the Moonmoth Legion Fort before heading up to see the heads of the Nerevarine Cult at the Urshilaku Camp.
